review: We actually had a good experience flying from Busan, S Korea to Osaka, Japan!  First, we were blessed with an angel customer service agent at Busan Airport.  The security lines at Busan are disorganized and inefficient.  I was in a wheelchair, and this angel took it upon herself to find us and escort us to the handicapped security entrance. (Which was not well marked.). Instead of waiting a very long time, and possibly missing our flight, we breezed through.  Thank you!  (Advice - Arrive WAY more than 2 hours in advance of your flight.) The flight itself was comfortable, although no frills.  They did not even serve water.  I believe the flight was actually Air Busan, in a partnership with Asiana.  They DID provide a snack.  No wifi.   No movies.  Still it was a fairly short flight, and there were no issues.

My brand new checked suitcase was damaged during my trip with Asiana.  From my perspective, the large rip was caused by something sharp that ran through my suitcase.  I considered it was resulted from rough baggage handling by Asiana.  I filed a compliant with them.  They have denied my claim twice based on their policy that they won't replace or repair the damage because they expect this kind of damage with normal luggage handling.   I disagree their assessment and decision.  
Asiana is putting the full burden on its customers when Asiana is at fault.  I was a new customer of Asiana and I will not fly Asiana again.

Asiana is a primitive airline that does not take any accountability or priority for customer service. We booked a return flight from Tokyo to San Francisco in advance and there was a connection in Seoul, South Korea.

Admittedly, we assumed the connecting flight was at the same airport but Asiana sold us a flight from Haneda to Gimpo, with our transfer to San Francisco being at Incheon.

This is an illogical travel itinerary that no one would willingly book because this requires you to claim your luggage, leave customs, travel to another airport at least one hour away, and reenter security again. Asiana should not be offering such a flight on their booking system. I have never experienced this with any other airline or country.

The Asiana staff at Haneda guaranteed that despite the airport transfer inconvenience, there is at least free shuttle from Gimpo to Incheon that takes 1.5 hours.

Upon our arrival at Gimpo, we learned there was no such shuttle and the Asiana staff at Gimpo advised us to either take the city bus or a taxi. They offered no reimbursements or complimentary vouchers of any sort and suggested we complain on their website.

Since we had to pick up 4 checked-in luggage to leave Gimpo, a city bus was not feasible for us because of our baggage so we paid for a $100 taxi to Incheon.

Upon arrival at Incheon, we were told one of our boarding passes was missing information so we had to go to a special desk to get our boarding pass. We had no issue getting our boarding pass from Haneda to Gimpo so this surprised us.

When we expressed our frustration to Asiana at Incheon, the staff said it’s not them, “it’s America.” I’m not sure what that means.

Additionally, when we booked our tickets, we had assigned seats next to each other but the clerk said seats were sold out and had us separated. The ticket that was “missing information” was also flagged for a required additional security interview.

We are waiting in line at security as we are writing this. This whole fiasco cost us way more time and energy than traveling should require. We will not be flying with Asiana again.

I could understand that the current snow situation at South Korea is unexpected but if Asiana flew my family from Singapore to Incheon, then they should know that there is a connecting flight from Incheon to Fukuoka since both flights are from the same airline and they should plan for it and not allow them stranded at Incheon airport without any lodging and food and ask them to find their ways to fly out of Incheon themselves. Where is their responsibility? You seriously allowing your reputation going down the drain. For info, the tickets are booked directly from Asiana App and not through a third party. No more Asiana.
When you call customer service they often are too busy to take your call and just hang up. A really horrible airline that doesn't care about it's customers
Good experience. Good legroom, check-in was smooth and prompt, friendly service in and off the plane. Plenty of meals and filling.

We flew on Asiana's Airbus A380-800 on the upper deck economy class to and from Incheon Airport.  The seats were very, very hard on both flights.  We had to put a pillow on top of our seats to make them more comfortable to sit on.  Still didn't help.  The seats on their 777-200ERs are much more thicker and much more comfortable. 

We have flown the same route several times but it appears that they have cut down on their meal service.  The gap between meals was about 10 hours and nothing was served in between.  No mid-flight snacks given.  In addition, on our previous flights with Asiana, flight attendants walked around the cabin for water and coffee service throughout the flight.  They were working nonstop to keep passengers comfortable. 
This time, we only saw them do that a few times.  It seems that Asiana Airlines have also cut down on coffee service and drinking water service as well.  Now, you have to request to get water on the flight. 

Their A380-800 is aging and needs some upgrades, especially the seats.  Flight attendants now are not as friendly as before.  Seats on the A380 are worn out and dirty. 

The boarding process both from LAX and ICN are very chaotic.  After Business Class passengers boarded, they let everyone in Economy Class board all at the same time. It would be more organized if they board the people in the back first and work towards the front of the plane.  As a result, boarding was very stressful because a lot of people ahead of us were blocking the aisle to store their luggages on the bins so it took longer to get to our seats.  Asiana has to find a better way to board passengers.

I hope Asiana reads this review.   I don't believe we will fly Asiana again in the near future because of our ""not so pleasant"" flight experience.

Flew on the A350 Business class to Seoul.  The product is old with one small storage space inside the armrest.  The food was ordinary and not what should be expected in business class.  The flight crew was gracious and attentive, but again, not exceptional.

The Asiana lounge had limited and I highlight ""limited"" selection of food and beverages.   The lounge was a disappointment.

The only great part was the flat bed for a long haul flight.

Im planning a trip w my family and my infant niece. As i hold star alliance gold status. I decide to fly asiana which is part of star alliance, even though Korea Air is a few dollars cheaper.
But the booking experience is a nightmare. I key in all my family details and the baby details, but is unable to submit the details.
Ive tried multiple times and its so annoying till im thinking of using Korea Air instead.

We had so much room and the high ceiling was so much better than what we are used to. The food was excellent and flight attendants were the hardest working people I have ever seen. The seats layed down flat and everything worked, which was refreshing. It will be hard to fly our usual airlines after experiencing such incredible service. We have questioed if business class was even worth it on most airlines we fly but it certainly was on this airline.
It was horrible changed our seats from 10 to last row. They  said it wasn't  they fault for changing our seats first time this has happened I recommend not going on this airline

It is a short flight just over 2 hours, but we were delayed 30 minutes which obviously could not be helped, the inflight entertainment was not working, I could not watch a movie to pass the time, the onboard meal was a take it or leave it dish, there was no choice, I left it as it was disgusting, many people left it. Drinks choice was fruit juice, water or coke, no alcohol or hot drinks

The trip from Seoul to New York was long, but I'd read your reviews and decided the business class product was worth the fare, which was more than competitive. I'd been looking forward to the Korean ""lunch"" (at 10:30 am local time) for nearly a year. When the FA came back to tell me they had run out of that choice, I shared my considerable disappointment. She recommended another choice, which she brought, that was composed of food that had been set aside for the crew. It was the best meal I have ever had on any airline. I am nearly a Million Miler on United and am grateful that I chose to fly on Asiana. I would highly recommend Asiana to anyone flying a long-haul from the far east to the USA.

They broke my Rimowa suitcase, and then told me they will not pay a compensation as it was my own fault, because the bag was 30kg. First of all, the official weight limit is 32kg and secondly, nobody at check-in told me it's too heavy! Wrote customer service, but they just answer they won't pay anything! NEVER AGAIN!

Purchased this ticket from this airline because i had such a great experience flying with Korean Airlines.  I was very wrong. Even though Asiana is currently owned by a korean company, it was like night and day.  First the plane was full.. of korean and chinese passenger and they were up all night and day talking, singing and walking around with raised voices.  I couldnt understand any of the announcement made over the PA system if anything was happening.  The passengers were out of control and rude.  The seat was very hard and very little leg room. After two hours i couldnt sit in my seat anymore.   The food was medicre and it was a mix of korean and american.  I will never fly this airline again. I would gladly pay extra and fly Korean Airlines.

Business class Seoul to Seattle. Disappointing seats, no comforter only pillow and blanket. Young flight attendants do a good job while older ones look around and do nothing. The meal service was so rushed. They throw the plates on the tray instead of politely laying it down. Then they disappear until breakfast time. And by the way no champagne on the ground? What? Then what’s the point of business class? Make your wholw aircraft economy class then!

This flight was amazing, The cabin crew was so nice, and provided me good service, the legroom was a pretty nice fit for me as a 5'8 person. The meal was awesome i was served a chicken a very nice hot meal

Dear Asiana Airlines,

I am writing to express my dissatisfaction with a recent flight experience and to seek appropriate remediation. My travel involved seats 12J and 12K, which unfortunately were located directly in front of passengers in 13J and 13K who were visibly and severely ill, including a child who was incessantly coughing and playing with the seat table. I want to be clear, this is not on the child but the parent and your associates who failed to enforce, what I believe, are basic health guidelines.

Despite the expectation that individuals in such poor health would not be allowed to fly, it was evident that this was not the case. The constant noise and illness from behind made the flight highly uncomfortable, despite using headphones to block out the sound. The only relief was when this person was sound asleep.

It was so bad that my spouse alerted a stewardess. That stewardess let us know that they already offered a mask. This signifies to us that they were well aware this person was very sick and allowed them to fly regardless.

Here are my concerns and suggestions for improvement:

1. **Online Check-In**: I would appreciate it if online check-in were available for international passengers with passports. This would streamline the process, especially for those traveling from abroad.

2. **Seat Assignments**: When passengers pay extra for seats together, it should be standard practice to ensure those seats are assigned together. It would greatly enhance the passenger experience.

3. **Health Declarations**: I believe the health declaration process needs to be enforced more rigorously. If passengers appear to be significantly ill, appropriate actions should be taken to maintain the health and safety of all travelers. If there is no current health declaration policy, implementing one would be beneficial.

4. **Health and Safety Protocols**: Clear and enforced health protocols are essential. Knowing that the airline prioritizes health and safety would allow passengers to travel with greater confidence.

The discomfort and potential health risks I experienced due to the poorly managed situation are unacceptable. I trust you will take this feedback seriously and make the necessary changes to improve the travel experience for future passengers. 

I think, with all the many health concerns going on, this airline would do better

Sincerely,

jermaine.reynolds@richmond.edu

I travelled to New York on the 21st July, Sydney to Seoul and then from Seoul to New York. Then I returned 31st August. JFK to Inheon Seoul, Seoul to Sydney. It was a great experience, ASIANA AIRLINE is great way to fly. On time arrival, on Time departure. Smooth Flight, Super friendly Staff. Food top class. I could not find any faults. I will only travel with ASIANA AIRLINE where ever and when ever I get the chance.
The after-sales service attitude is very bad, and they have no patience to take the cases reported by customers seriously.

Waste time and unethical approach!
We end up paying extra legroom fee for nothing and need to waste a lot of time tring to request for refund, which at this point still can not contact airline at all.

we booked for a extra legroom with additional fee. However, during our online check in process, the system forced me to normal seat and unable to select extra legroom as those seats are fully occupied.

At check-in counter, i raised the my problem to the staff. At first they just refuse the fact that we paid for extra fee. But after we showed some proof of documents, they paid more attention to their system and confirmed that we booked and paid for extra legroom, however they can not arrange the seat for us as the plane model has been change from Airbus to Boeing and no seat is available. The staff told that they can not do anything and will need us to contract customer service ourself.

we tried to call customer service USA and the system kept us waiting for more than 15 mins where we can not further effor the wait and decide to contact the customer service again in Thailand. We called to Thailand customer service also no reply. We tried to contact the airline via email, no email avaialble but only chatbot. however, chatbot basically can't support our case. Even when we tried to select the refund option in system, the system required us to input departure date which is in past month but force us to select only current month or future so basically we can not contact the airline no matter how hard I try.

The fact that the airline can not honour the prebooked extra legroom without any timely notification is bad enough but now I have to feel upset wasting a lot of time trying to contact airline for such amount of fee. very questionable way of doing businesss.

New A350 planes on all 4 legs from Sydney to Paris and return. Good leg room, friendly service. Entertainment options okay. But the food, Bipimbap and especially the Ssampab was really excellent. You'll get the Ssambap (make your own lettuce leaf wraps with beef, rice, kimchi, beancurd) on the flights departing Seoul. The hosties may call it ""beef with rice"" and its great. Website is tricky to manage your bookings. When it says ""First Name"" it may actually need your first and second names joined together (no space). And you shouldn't need to remember a pin number to change seats. Big tip for Australian travellers, you can get a free overnight hotel stopover by emailling the Sydney office in advance if you have a long layover.

My experience with Asiana Airlines was less than adequate. While I, as a customer, could complain about a variety of issues I had, I would like to speak for the elderly woman beside me who could not speak for herself. During our 11 hour flight from Incheon to San Francisco she tried for several hours to sleep. However, when she would slump forward the touch screens would be activated and the light would shine in her face. When I asked a stewardess to help her, the stewardess laughed. I asked if the screen could be disconnected, or if the woman could be moved to a more comfortable seat. The stewardess and her co-worker laughed at this. Is it common practice for Asiana Airlines to mock their customers? Is it typical of Korean people to find the pain of others amusing? I admit i don't know very many, and this interaction made a poor impression. Needless to say, the poor woman was tortured for the rest of the flight, and no doubt, exhausted from lack of sleep. I didn't speak her language, but I understood her pain, and did my best to accommodate her.

Needless to say I will not be flying with Asiana Airlines again, and I would encourage other travelers to find alternative accommodations.

3 hour delays half in the terminal half sitting on the actual plane. For such a long flight the selection of movies was minimal. My partner and I felt starved of water and everytime we asked for more we just got sass and attitude. At one point I just asked if I could fill my personal thermal water bottle up in which they filled it half way up with hot water. Also paid an additional $33 AUD for unlimited wifi which could not even load basic web pages. We did however mange to get a refund on this but again took a lot of back and forth emailing and even more sass. Still waiting for the funds to come through.

Initially a 50-minute lay over in Incheon. Our flight was delayed, leaving barely 20 minutes to get through security. We actually made it on to our connecting flight, but our luggage did not. 2 days waiting for the suitcases to be forwarded to us. Stressful and unnecessary. Will not be using Asiana again.

Asiana used to be good but now only aging and outdated airplane and cabin. Traveling with Pet is a nightmare compared to Korean air
Asiana being acquired by Korean air I hope to see upgrade in airplane and cabin and also policies . Unless korean air keep Asiana as a low end

This was my 2nd time flying business class with Asiana. It’s a more affordable business class so even though the seats were old and very tight, I still thought it was good value and decided to fly with them again.

They terribly damaged my baby’s stroller at gate check. It was placed in a padded stroller bag. The bag was ripped on one side, stroller seat connector broken indicating very rough handling — it literally says on the bag “stroller handle with care”.. This is an uppababy stroller so also very solid and sturdy. My baby was 15 months old then, so having a broken stroller the moment we landed in a foreign country for our vacation was not easy to deal with.

We immediately notified the staff when we received the stroller at our gate. They took a lot of pictures, reported everything and then I never got any resolution. The office in Japan passed to the office in America. The office in America never picked up the phone and never responded to voicemail.

I was very disappointed and I will never fly Asiana again.

My flight from ICN to LAX would have been great if they didn't put a 400+ pound passenger next to me. It was pretty obvious that this person could not sit in a seat and overlap into both the aisle and the seat next to them. We were in the middle rows, my family of 3 in the A380. Everything was going fine until I saw the person who would sit next to me try to squeeze into their chair. From that point forward, this plus sized person was bumping their elbows into me, sleeping and snoring and ended up falling over onto me which was a horrific situation. Staff on the plane saw how uncomfortable I was but couldn't do anything about it. During meals this person would order extra beer, extra food, even asked for some food from my leftovers. Most uncomfortable flight ever!
Asiana’s staff was okay but the whole flight itself was absolutely poor. The plane was shaking and the descent was pathetic. I would fly again with A350 instead of B777.

The staff's service has no attitude to help customers. There is absolutely no attitude of helping customers first.
Not recommend.
The seats were very hard and uncomfortable and it get impossible to sleep on them with your body aching the whole time from it.

Nice staff but outdated aircraft, obsolete entertainment system. Also please note if you travel with in cabin pet, Asiana is the only aiiine forcing you to put the pet in the upper bin for take off and landing==> I think it is against all animal welfare laws.
Hopefully Korean air will take over and we can expect better policies and upgraded services

Flew with them twice. Once to Korea, and another time to Japan. 

Business class both times, and their staff in Incheon and in Narita were rude, judgmental and incompetent.

I was wearing a t shirt, jeans, and Rolex. At Incheon I was singled out and told that the line was for business, and then she gave a look of surprise.

They forgot our vegan meals both times. 

At Narita, the same thing happened.

I’m not white. Perhaps it’s a different experience if you’re a desirable race.
I was on this flight on June 17, 2024. It was scheduled to take off at midnight, but was delayed to 2:30 Am due to a flat tire. The experience was good, and the staff was friendly.

My family of 3 adults had a great experience flying Asiana Airlines, round trip from JFK to Seoul. We did pay a bit extra for the extra legroom in Economy class and it was worth it. A 15 hour flight is always going to be tough, but the professionalism of the staff and attention to detail made it so much easier. The food was amazing from the variety to the coffee/tea service afterwards. On the flight back we were served two full meals, a pizza snack, and multiple opportunities for juice and water. What really impressed me as someone who works in a service position was how hard the staff worked through the whole flight with turbulence, multiple meals and clean up, as well as a poor child who became ill and threw up. All of the flight attendants jumped into action to clean up the situation quickly and with little embarrassment for the child and mother. I don't think many even realized what had happened. They were polite, kind, and hardworking. I would definitely fly Asiana again!

Had a wonderful experience on a ~3 hours flight from HK to Seoul. 

The plane was very old; no wifi, and it had one of those seat-back screens with terrible picture quality and a remote that pulls out from the armrest that I thought had been left in the 2010s. But this was not a problem for me, and aside from those things, I wouldn’t have guessed the plane’s age. The plane was in great shape, and the seats were very comfortable. The pillow and blanket provided were much nicer than any US airline, so I fell asleep almost instantly.

The provided meal shocked me, and is the reason why I’m writing this review. Firstly, to get a meal on such a short flight is in itself a rarity nowadays, but this meal was delicious and plentiful! I had bibimbap, a pretty big portion, and it came with fruit, soup, and coffee. A friend got the other option, a chicken dish, which came with a whole mousse cake-type thing (also delicious). All was served in actual dishes and eaten with metal utensils (a foreign concept to me). It was far and away the best airline food I’ve ever had; felt like a very premium experience.

Tight seat, old equipment, recent delay, rude service, and even I have online checked in, they changed my seat at the gate not giving any reasons. They claimed to be the best airline, but from my experience, some cheaper airlines are even better.

Flew from Seoul to Lax in business class.  

Customer service was mediocre for business class.  What was disappointing was that the korean staff treats different nationalities differently,  regardless how polite you are.  The customer service are good for Koreans or white people.  If you are other nationalities or have darker skin tone,  the customer service will be mediocre at best.

Korea no longer feels welcoming and respectful like before.  If you can understand korean,  you will hear racist jokes often.  What a shame!

It’s a good flight if you need to get from A to B. They have good amenities for every seat (slippers, toothbrush, comfortable seat in “newer” planes). They were on the more affordable side - which makes sense because of all the cons I had. 

I read all the previous reviews before booking and thought people were exaggerating but boy I was wrong.
1: These planes are ANCIENT! Not much air conditioning, flight entertainment was basically nonexistent, and no wifi on board (at least our prehistoric plane didn’t have any). I flew four flights in total with all the layovers and one of our screens looked like I was in the 1950s watching a Godzilla movie. The quality and font was so outdated.
2: Meals… We had a lactose intolerant person on our group so we noted that on our booking. They accommodated the request, but it was probably one of the worst smelling, blandest foods we’ve ever seen. It was salmon and bland potatoes for every. single. course. We had four flights so do the math on that. What’s interesting was the regular food had no lactose included in the meals other than the yogurt so they could’ve just taken that out and served it like other airlines would. Also, the food just was unappetizing in general, so our party just ended up skipping the meals at the end. 
3: Service. The service alone made me never want to book with them again. The flight attendants were a bunch of snooty Korean girls that were so ingenuine. There was a language barrier sometimes which is fine. We went to Vietnam and Japan and there was a language barrier at some points but NO ONE got mad like these Korean flight attendants did. The check in desk lady in Japan was explaining that we were to stop in Korea as a layover but the language barrier made it seem like she was saying something completely different. We were a bit confused and she got pissed off that we weren’t understanding and was snarky about it. All that was done with their fake smile which creeped us out. Also during our flight I got up behind a flight attendant to use the restroom (I’m a woman btw) I had to go really bad but they were still serving food so there was a line to reach the restroom which is fine… no worries about a wait. However, we accidentally bumped into each other at one point and she turned around and SCROWLED at me. It was a genuine accident but it’s like I unleashed her inner fake attitude or something.
Terrible airline, always delayed, been waiting to board and the damn plane hasn't even arrived yet,  avoid this airline at all costs

The flight was comfortable as long haul flights can be. It left on time and arrived a little early. Same with return flight. The seats were roomy and clean. The service was on point, friendly and helpful. The food is better than average for airline food. They could have more inflight entertainment and better wifi. The bathrooms were clean which I really appreciated it. I think its cleaned after few uses. The experience was pleasant and I find no faults with the airline except for the website and the process of booking. Don't expect to find flights with points unless flying economy and even then there were only a few flights open.

If you are taking Asiana, please be reminded that the maximum check-in luggage weight is 23kg. My sister's luggage was 19kgs and mine was 26kgs. We asked Miss Oh Ji Yeon 오지연 to check in our luggage together as a family (total: 45kgs). She refused and said we can only check in 1 by 1. For my own luggage, since it was over the 23kgs limit, I was told to pay 60,000 won for the additional weight. I felt it was unreasonable because the combined luggage weight is less than 46kgs for the bag limit for 2 people.

We decided to repack our luggage, re-weight repeatedly to ensure that both luggage were within the individual limit. I was very upset with this inflexibility and honestly, it is just transferring and balancing the weight of the luggages. While we were packing, she came over and told us to hurry up when we were trying our best to repack the luggage.

When we went back to the counter and placed the luggages onto the conveyor, she rolled her eyes at us and gave a snickering smile to her colleague. It was very disrespectful and I felt very offended. However, I was looking forward to going home and I did not want to pursue any further.

We always love South Korea and met many nice people during our travels. It was absolutely distasteful to end this wonderful trip with the worst customer service at the airport with Asiana Airlines.

I recently had the worst travel experience of my life with Asiana Airlines, and I strongly advise others to avoid flying with them. My journey from Jinan to New Delhi,via seoul  through them, turned into a nightmare due to the airline's incompetence and poor customer service.
Upon arrival at Jinan Airport, the airline staff refused to issue boarding passes for both legs of my journey, citing the short layover time in Seoul. They said they can only provide the boarding pass for the Jinan to Seoul flight and instructed me to obtain the Seoul to Delhi boarding pass upon arrival in Seoul. Additionally, they mentioned that a minimum layover time of 3 hours is required in Seoul while their connecting flight layover time was 1.5 hr, and any delay could result in my deportation back to China. 
This is completely unacceptable, and it raises the question of why the airline would even accept a booking with such a short layover if it is not allowed.
The situation was further exacerbated by the rude and uncooperative behavior of the ground staff. They refused to document our complaint or provide any written confirmation, and they wouldn't share the contact details of senior personnel for escalation. We managed to capture a photo of one of the staff members involved, Ms. Weng Peng, but this did little to alleviate the situation.
This entire ordeal has been incredibly disappointing and frustrating. Asiana Airlines failed to provide even basic customer service, and their handling of the situation was completely unacceptable.
In summary, Asiana Airlines is a company to avoid. Their poor planning, lack of communication, and rude staff make for an utterly terrible travel experience. Save yourself the trouble and choose another airline.

venu kabra
venukabra@gmail.com

Absolutely horrendous experience, some of the worst customer service I’ve ever experienced.  I will never fly with Asiana again.  They lost our bags, falsely claimed the airline that completed the first leg of our trip had the bags when the bags were in their possession, then took the entire week to get the bags to us, and then did not have a courier approved once the bags did finally arrive at the local airport to deliver them to our local address as is always customary with any upstanding airline in these types of situations.

Absolutely tragic for this Asiana Airline experience . Been waiting for 5 hours straight and got cancelled at the end. All my plan are ruined and now I have to stand to queue up for more than hours. This is the worst airline I had ever experience. Been using couple time and the boarding pass are always not on time. Where are all the workers at the counter? And why do we need to line up for more than hours after the flught cancelled just because your airline cancelled the flight. They should have be better prepared. Hope they recruiting someone that can work efficiently in the future.

Had a great experience first time flying with Asiana air. Self check in and self baggage drop off. Staff was nice and efficient . The plane I was on was a big plane so the seating seems more spacious . Flight was smooth. Highly recommend .

Boarding was insane. Everyone got in line without consideration for rows or zones. However, once the line started moving, it went like a factory. There was numerous staff working and they sent people on the flight with the speed of light. It was probably the fastest we’ve ever boarded a plane before.

The staff on board was abrupt, quick, and short. The greeting was delivered matter of factly. Service was very quick with only two words spoken at a time.

The food choices were not explained. They only stated chicken or beef. I ended up with Korean food that I did not understand nor liked. I tried but didn’t eat anything except the rice and beef. I asked for water and received a half full small cup of about 2 oz. 

Movies were very limited. There were very few new releases of between 5-6 months old. They also had a few old movies. We did not received a water bottle for an 11 hour flight. The snacks were very good. I knew from Qatar that if you wanted snacks, you should go and ask for them. They gave me a tender and tasty cake and a thick and soft chocolate chip cookie. Lunch before landing again was announced as chicken or seafood. I should have asked more questions because the seafood was actually shrimp. I ended up with chicken with some fatty parts that I didn’t enjoy a lot.

The seats were comfortable enough and there were no issues.

They forced you to check in your luggage so they can make money. May as well say no chicken luggage. All he can carry on is medium size handbag. This would be my last time. I’m traveling this airline. I’ve been traveling around Asia for 30 years.

Asiana is ripped off airline when you have a luggage that exceeds 2-3 kg, they forced to pay for the whole luggage fee, that cost can be 100$ CDN.  we travel to Asia annually, and we are certainly avoid Asiana Airline as a connection to my selected place.  If you can avoid this airline, then do it, it is unworthy to spend 100$ CDN on extra 2-3 kg.  Again this airline is ripping off passengers obviously.

First of all, many thanks to the entire staff and crew for relaxed, safe flights and good service on site! 

But unfortunately I have to say that either water or food ran out during the flights (non-stop), for example. The crew members often had to apologize to us. Then, on non-stop flights, for example, the headset holders or the slippers/flip-flops were only handed out on request. In the meantime, such things are a matter of course on long non-stop flights. The food is mediocre. Very little fresh fruit on board. Snacks are also not offered. The selection of movies is okay. I must also say that the furnishings show their age (torn upholstery, old blankets). Everything is a bit run-down.

The good: staff were polite and helpful. However, note the plane does get rather cold and you’ll be dehydrated so take plenty of water, as the water they provide is in the smallest of cups. I’m on the smaller side so space and leg room was not a problem. The inflight entertainment was fine with lots of variety.  

The not so good: if you have dietary requirements you have no choice or notice in what you get. I had let the airline know beforehand and thought it to be a simple switch to ensure I didn’t have the meat options. While everyone else got a choice from two meals of a nicely presented platter of meat & vegetables, rice, soup, and cake, I had a pot of fruit with either a bland curry or the saddest looking tomato and cucumber bread roll wrapped in cling film. You’re better off just picking what you want from the main options.

For the first time I was so shocked by a Korean service. Firstly, the plane is old and rattling - probably from the early 2000s, maybe earlier. The screen for viewing content is terrible and old. The service from the flight attendants is poor, the food on board is not tasty - the meat was so tough that we returned the food back. Mold was found on the buns given to eat? The board itself is very worn, the blankets are dirty, most likely they have not been washed for a long time. Almaty-Incheon is not a close distance - it’s  time to change the plane to a more modern one, it was shaking all the time in turbulence till the end of the trip by Inchon. Honestly, it was very scary to fly by Asiana plane.

A mistake was made by the check in agent when she mixed up and assigned baggage to the wrong person causing one of the bags to be held in Tokyo instead of going with the passenger to her destination. We're all human and mistakes happen, that is not the reason for this review. The issues began upon going back to the check in desk afterward when they denied any mistake made (which it was very much obvious their fault) So instead of apologizing or showing any remorse they acted defensively and were trying every angle to blame us. In the end they said ""You're friend can collect their bag next time they come to Tokyo"". I couldn't believe my ears. I offered to help to resolve the issue to attempt to rectify but they continued to point fingers and refused to help. So sad.

I went on 2 flights, London-Incheon and Incheon-Kansai. First, London-Incheon. The flight was really smooth and was not delayed. The seats are so comfortable and there is so much legroom. The food is the best airline food and me and my kids who eat barely any airline food on planes ate the food quickly. Overall one of the best airlines in the world.

Happily i went to check in counter for asiana airline.  The counter staff is a heavy malay or indian lady with thick makeup. Showing me attitute like i own her money and nevrr pay her. Totally spoilt my mood. If she had quarrel with her bf or husband, she can go hide some corner and vent her anger. Vent on customer is really not professional.

Loved this airline. Our departure from Hong Kong was delayed which meant we had just 30 in Seaul to get to our onward flight. We were moved forward so we could be first off. Then met by an airline representative to whisk us to our onward flight. Food was really good. Service excellent. They even held the departure from Seaul until our luggage was on board. 
Thanks you Asiana 😊

Our flight was delayed because they waited to let late travelers get on the flight. This delays made us arive in LAX 1 hour later so we missed our connecting flight.  There was no attempt or communication from the pilots to make up the lost time.  We had to pay additional money to get new flights.  
The seats were not comfortable for an 11 hr flight. Food served was cold and not the best. Very limited drink options. I won't fly with them again.

The employee and her manager working at counter A, at Haneda Airport T3, do not know the simple border control policy in EU which is a EU country residency holder is allowed to travel freely within EU. I was using long term Portuguese resident card, with a non-EU passport, to enter Italy from Tokyo. But neither of them is able to read my Portuguese card, nor understand the basic EU Schengen border rule. It took them 40 mins to get clarified on such a simple matter. Can this airline train better their employees avoir EU border policy please if they need to act immigration police.

I had a beautiful and solemn ride on Asia’s last 747-400 (belonging to a major carrier in regular service) from Incheon to Osaka, just a few months before the aircraft’s retirement. I honestly don’t think my experience on the plane could’ve been any better—it was all just perfect. And my first ever experience on a 747, if I might add!

The views were spectacular throughout the journey, and I absolutely loved watching the thick, massive 747 wing buffet through the choppy winds on final approach into KIX. Well, or should I say TWO final approaches!? The pilots aborted the first landing attempt presumably due to windshear, so I basically got two 747 approaches for the price of one. 

And of course as far as the actual service experience on board, I savored every minute. The flight attendants were very friendly and exhibited that classic Korean hospitality I’ve seen in vlogs on YouTube. Even in economy, I was offered a cup of water right as I sat down. The FAs were always around in the aisles and able to assist with any needs, and they didn’t mind that I walked up and down the cabin a few times to snap some photos of the 74 interior and out the back windows. The seats and IFE (in-flight entertainment) are dated, but I wasn’t here for the IFE…at least in screen form. My version of IFE was gluing my eyes out the window!!

Despite the go-around on final into Osaka, the flight arrived on-time, and my electric wheelchair was handled very efficiently. This flight, OZ114, is probably my very favorite of 2023, if not of all my life. Kudos to Asiana for keeping their 747-400 healthy for so long! Next up, I’ll have to try out their A380s.

Boarded the plane at Narita for a trip to Incheon. Sat on the tarmac for more than an hour thereby missing my connecting flight. Was booked on a new flight leaving 3 hours later, no apologies or explanations. 

During food service the flight attendant said seats needed to be up and proceeded to abruptly adjust the seat with me in the seat. When pouring water, the attendant simply said “cup down”, directing me to take the cup off the stack and placing it on the tray for filling. Very rude demeanor, not nice whatsoever. 

Horrible food as well.

Will never fly this airline again.

Awful In Flight Entertainment…. It’s a tiny blurry screen from the 90’s or early 2000’s. Very few choices of movies to choose from and painful headphones to wear. 

Seats and service was great! But for a 9-12 hr flight you want some good entertainment….

Friendly and polite staff, no delays, delicious Korean foods, clean and convenient. 
It was my first time with this company, I strongly recommend it.
Very rigid. Charge usd $45 for 3kg excess. Only 25kg allowance even though you book from Singapore airline platform . Stay away

The flight on the whole was fine, take a fan with you because it can initially be quite warm. There didn't seem to be a vegetarian option, they naturally presume you are a meat eater, you have to ask for a glass of wine, and then given the smallest amount.
just returned from Seoul. dated aircraft b777 with old blur screens. cabin was warm to & return. only bright spot was the bibimbap dinner serve on return trip. will avoid airline in future.

Don’t use them if you are planning to fly out of JFK or want to speak with a human being at any point in time. And God help you if there are weather or equipment issues. 

It all started when I received an email saying my JFK - ICN leg was delayed by 4 hrs so I’d miss my connection to Hanoi. With a good 12 hrs before the flight, I wanted to use the time to ensure I had new connecting flight scheduled before I left JFK. 

The 800 number is NOT open 24/7. Their hours of operation are 07:00 - 22:00 pm PST and the system literally hangs up on you if their volume is too high. In fact my friend and I both called at the same time to try and get through. The system would even hang up on you after waiting 30 mins. When I finally reached a staff member she told me, they couldn’t do anything over the phone, I had to speak with someone at the desk at JFK and I may just have to figure out the connection to Hanoi when I arrived in Seoul. 

I arrived at JFK only to find out the rescheduled time on the email was wrong so I missed my flight. Their desk was literally a ghost town when I arrived and the monitor showed the flight was gone. As it turns out, the desk at JFK opens 2 hrs before the flight and closes 1 hr before the flight. Essentially there is a one hour window where you can talk to a human being or check in. 

I talked to the Delta ladies next door who were excellent. They told me that the Asiana staff had left for the day but they  helped track down  the line remaining Asiana rep. While I was happy to speak with a representative in the flesh, Deborah Kim, told me there was nothing she could do. She followed up by scolding me for being late. When I asked who could help me, she said she don’t know. When I started pushing back as I couldn’t get a soul to help me, she told me she had to go home and walked away. If I hadn’t have had the email with the proof of the wrong time, they were going to make me pay for another full fair business class ticket.  As you can imagine, getting rebooked felt like an act of God as their customer service was non existent.

In terms of the inflight experience, the chairs were comfortable and the crew kept the bathrooms very clean on all flights. Otherwise it was very mediocre. The in flight entertainment was extremely limited and the food was fair.  Not surprisingly, the Korean menu was definitely better than the US menu.  When I asked for help getting a bag down from the overhead on the JFK - ICN leg as they had repositioned it so I couldn’t reach it, the stewardess said I’d have to wait 3 hrs till we landed. The guy across the aisle thought it was ridiculous too and helped me out. The crew on the ICN - JFK leg was the best. They allowed me to sleep before having my first meal and generally tried to accommodate the passenger.  I slept both ways on the HAN - ICN leg but the head steward was really friendly and offered to feed me towards the tail end of the ICN - HAN leg.

Trying to purchase airlines tickets on Asiana Air...both on the website and the mobile app. After 20+ attempts No joy on either. No assistance from any customer service desks in the Philippines nor Korea. No transfer to the I.T. department to highlight both the mobile and website failures. Looking to fly on another airlines as Asiana cannot seem to find a vehicle to sell tickets from. Sad!

I’m absolutely devastated. We booked our flights to Japan with Asiana Airlines 11 months ago, via Booking dot com. Now 4 weeks from our holiday of a lifetime, the airline has changed its schedule and CANCELLED our flights only offering a refund. (Which has not been confirmed in full!) Their schedule change meant there was not enough time to make the connecting flight home. Despite running multiple flights on the route between Japan and London, we’re told there are no seats available for same dates. We were offered one flight 4 days later for an extra £600.
We’re now left frantically trying to find flights we can afford that work with our hotel bookings. It’s beyond stressful. My son is distraught with disappointment and now I’m not sure if we can go at all or if we’ll lose money. I will never book with Asiana Airlines again. AVOID!!!! AVOID!!!! AVOID!!!
This review is for an employee named Gayeong Choi. I would like to thank her personally with the assistance at LAX. Very helpful and understanding.  Again thank you for your help.
Worst airline of all time. For our $250 flight we had to pay $1000 in bag fees ridiculous. We think it’s because we’re foreigners.

Its my first to flew with Asiana Airlines and it gave me a very good experience. The food was yummy and they’ve got a Korean meal choice. The plane is clean, on the long flight LHR to Incheon they provide pouch amenities for economy which is unusual now for economy class. They got a good technique in serving the food quickly, unlike other airlines the first passengers that were served first finished already their food and you haven’t received yours.  Flight attendants were very energetic in working, nice, approachable and friendly. I would like to mention Ms Park and Ms  Bang, thumbs up to these beautiful ladies. Overall nothing I can complain about, I will give Asiana Airllines 10/10

I don't know if anyone else has had this problem but I have had problems with Asiana website. It took hours to navigate through their website to even book tickets. I booked 4 tickets but had to cancel 2 and although its before the 91 days before the flight and the website states that there would be no penalty I called and they said because it was booked from USA/NYC that there would be a penalty of $200/ticket.
I don't know if its just me although I've had no problem booking on other airlines through their websites. 

I also transferred points from Marriott thinking I could get upgrades but its not available till 3 days before the flight. It was difficult to find this information and when I called them the replay was ""all lines are busy call back later"" I must've called them about 10 times.

We flew Asiana from Sydney to Paris via ICN and the from Rome back to Sydney (also via ICN). We were really happy with the flight. The seats were pretty roomy and comfortable in economy, better than some other airlines. They add nice little extras life slippers and toothbrush which is appreciated and pretty rare these days. The food was quite good, even my son that usually refuses to eat airline food, ate it and said it was good. The bathrooms on board were kept pretty clean. The service was efficient and pretty good. When one of our flights was delayed by a couple of hours were given good communication and they also offered vouchers for a restaurant in the airport without us asking. 
The only thing I didn't like was when they did drink service, if we asked for a soft drink (soda) they would pout half the can into a cup and keep the other half for the next guest instead of giving the whole can. It worked out to be half a cup of liquid so we were always thirsty. (If you asked for beer you got the whole can). Having said that they did bring around trays of water during sleep time which was good. After the first flight we bought drinks in the airport for the next flights so we were more prepared. Other than that it was really good and I would recommend and we will book with them again.

My friends and I flew with Asiana a while back to Korea and they have lost our luggages. So as normal, we made a claim and they said it was back at our connecting flight’s location and will have it delivered to us ASAP. Other customers on this connecting flight also had lost their luggage’s as well. 

We were shocked to find this out as this is our first time in Korea. We landed at night time so we didn’t have time to purchase any necessities except toothbrushes from the downstairs convenience store.  

We also had a wedding two days after our arrival so as you can see, we were frantically trying to find out how we were going to make this work. We cannot speak the language and was still trying to figure out how to navigate through Korea. We somehow managed to find new outfits and new make up but it wasn’t the same. I couldn’t really complain because it was better than nothing and I also had in mind that Asiana was going to compensate for what we went through. 

  Finally the luggages have arrived the same day but after the wedding took place. So It took them 2 days for them to find it and deliver to us.

Our experience started off horrible and didn’t end there. Asiana only wanted to compensate $50 to each of us which in my opinion, was ridiculous!  

For the personal items and clothes itself, this was no where near enough. They have not even thought about the amount of time and stress spent finding everything.  

After a long battle of explaining and a lot of back and forth, they wouldn’t budge. I have accepted the amount of money because it was getting no where.  

To make matters worse, they handed me over to their Seattle branch to deal with the money transfer. I was speaking to someone there and giving my bank wire information but they stopped responding after receiving the information. I have replied to them multiple times asking what was going on but no response. I had to email back the original Asiana Airlines and they again, sent me to their Seattle branch but this time with someone new. After speaking for some time, this person also stopped responding. I don’t know what’s going on but…

  Asiana, your flight was amazing. But please do better with the customer service! I really do hope this does not happen to anyone else!
Asiana airlines provided a great flight experience for me! The accomodations on the flight were good and public spaces were clean.

We did a leg to Seoul for a quick overnight stopover, then carried on to Germany. This was great to eliminate jet lag. We enjoyed the entertainment, food and overall trip, but whats with the staff. We flew 2 daytime flights, but as soon as a meal is finished they dim the lights and expect all the passengers to pull down window shades and go to sleep. Cabin staff were rather insistent despite my need to take some pictures out of window and to assist with any vertigo. I did succeed but was visually stared down by many.
The website was difficult to use, I heard good things about the site but after this experience will be finding a different airline

Not sure if it was the plane or the pilots but in my years of flying these flights with asiana were the worst.

I had 4 flights total for my trip to and from Cambodia. Each one terrified my husband, siblings and I to the point we never want to fly again. We fly all the time and never had flights that affected us this way. Turbulence was one thing, but the entire flight and landing was another. Take off for each flight was fine, but the turns in the air were very harsh. As for during the flight, we kept feeling dips, and mid air decelerations where we felt we were going to fall. During landing we felt even worse dips and acceleration while descending. It felt like the pilots did not care about passenger comfort and did not know how to ease into any movements. Everything they did, from the turns, the movements, the descending, and the landing were all very harsh, sudden and surprising.

Out of four flights, every one of them terrified me greatly. Everyone became silent the whole flight after takeoff and you could feel everyone’s concern for their safety.  

Never again with asiana airlines.

Christmas Day , outstanding service from the cabin crew.  I travelled in business suite , The cabin crew were faultless ,attentive and super friendly for the whole flight.There was a delay leaving Sydney, but that was not their fault. It was due to the inbound Seoul to  Sydney flight arriving on time, but having to wait for a gate, so aircraft the turn around for outbound Sydney to Seoul was delayed. I have never had a bad experience with Asiana from check in to flight.

Dirty seat dnd foot rest in business class. Very inferior service. 
Very very rude checkin staff Lee Sejin shouting at wheelchair passenger who fought help. 
Throughout flight in economy class no one smiled, except ms Park. Purser cannot speak English to save her life

Flew Asiana for the first time.  Usually use a oneworld airline for this routing but Asiana had flights on an A380 (both legs) and I wanted to fly on one before they're relegated to the trash heap of history.

Overall I'd say the flights were mediocre at best.  Business class seats were comfortable though a bit cramped for a western sized person.  Food ranged from bad to very good, depending on the plate being served.  Service was friendly and professional.   Website and associated customer service were awful.  

The biggest complaint I had with the flights were the stinginess with serving water.  For a long haul flight, the flight attendants should serve water every 1-2 hours to keep up with the dehydrating effects of flying.  I don't think I saw a flight attendant in the aisles between the meals.  When water was served, it was in tiny glasses.  Came away very dehydrated despite my best efforts.

A380 review:  Nothing special.  They are very quiet and there's a feeling of lumbering through the air that's different than smaller planes.  That's about it.  No bar, no lounge.   The other downside of an A380 is since it is double decked, being in business class does not offer the advantage of deplaning first to get a jump on immigration.  The lower deck starts emptying at the same time and you're fighting for position with the unwashed masses.

Not good service, I had an operation and asked for help but did not receive any support . I asked if they can arrange for a wheelchair they did absolutely nothing, I also contacted the airline by email before the flight one week before  no response at all

Never thought that I would say this, ""Singapore Airlines has a business class competitor.""  Could not fault the business class staff, comfort, food or beverages. Will be flying with them again next April to Frankfurt via Seoul.

Asiana was an amazing surprise. The onboard service was perfect and the seats were as comfortable as they could be. No wifi, but electronic entertainment system was sufficient. Highly recommend booking seats on the second floor.

My first time flying with Asiana and hopefully will not be my last.

The food on both legs was excellent. It felt like being in a restaurant - seven courses all brought out with perfect presentation. The service was relaxed and the crew so friendly.  Second meals also very good with options for further food between meals times if required.
The wine selection was good, as was the port and champagne.

Seat was comfortable and allowed me to get some sleep when a flat bed.

While not the largest collection of films to watch there was enough for me to be entertained on the long 14.5 hour flight back to London.
The aircraft was clean and the staff were very attentive. The food was good and the inflight entertainment was good.

A last minute choice as there were problems with booking trains and the flight was a time-saving option. I did not regret it. The check-in staff were really nice and arranged for three of us to sit together. Flight was short and sweet. Departure and arrival were on perfect time. Easy transfer from Gimpo Airport to Seoul city centre.

The plane was very outdated. The IFE system was small with a poor screen quality and the headphone jacks barely worked. When they did the volume was very low. This was the same with many people seated around me. The food was below par compared to most asian carriers. Staff were okay, not overly helpful at check in. Would much rather fly Air Canada, EVA , Korea Air or Singapore airlines. Air Canada recently started using Asiana Air for their codeshares and the difference between AC and AA is very noticeable with Asiana coming in far below the Air Canada standards.

Asiana airline business class lounge totally poor in food quantities and quality since long time in all day long 
Also pork meat in every items 
2 kind of juice 
2 fried rice 
2 soups 
2 salad 
6 kind of souse 
Coffee and tea
Also the way of food time in aircraft it's 5 or 6 dishs in half an hour and the thinks people came hungry without food , main dish 
Salad fruits 
Cheese 
Tea abd coffee 
Totally not understand why too hurry even the flight 11 hours

We flew asiana a few years ago and set up a family mileage account which we have never been able to access even though we have nearly 100,000 mls accrued and this company tries its best to avoid letting you access their free flights .
They have now told us our miles will expire soon but won’t allow us to access our accounts .
Beware of this airline …….if they avoid contact it usually means they will leave you stranded when a problem arises !

I’m so impressed by the air Asians staff that I am writing this review as the flight is taxing.. 12.Nov.2023 
I will give a bit of back story. I was coming from the southern part of Jeju after a wonderful week in Jeju. It’s a definite must do if you are visiting South Korea. 
My airport transfer was delayed from the south (which takes about 1hr 20minutes to the airport).

I got the airport at 8:31am and boarding was at 8:35am. 
Self check in was closed at this point. 
I ran to the counter where the lovely lady checked me in, then I had to drop off my luggage at another counter which I ran too as well. A second amazing lady who checked in my luggage, literally walked to the belt to ensure my bag made it to be boarded. I then had to race to get to the foreigner passport check area which had the longest line. I thank God the line was actually moving. 

By the time I got to security I had 9 minutes before the flight departure time. I was certain at this point I wouldn’t be allowed to board the flight.. :(

This is when I saw the lady who had secured my luggage earlier, she was my truly an angel sent. It may seem like she was doing her job, but no! I also work in the tourism industry so I would know..
She didn’t have to, as it wasn’t her fault I hadn’t boarded.  She rushed me through security and “raced” with me to the boarding gate. I’m sorry for all the inconvenience, and that I didn’t get their names to thank them but I hope this review of gratitude is shared with them. Air Asiana should be soooo proud to have such amazing staff. Their service was truly the icing on the already amazing Jeju trip. Thank you once again.

This was my second time flying with Asiana, but my first time in economy. The seats were quite comfortable, with 33"" pitch even for non Smartium section.  However, that's about it. The IFE was quite sad, with only very few movies to watch. Food was okay, and portion was small. You could ask for wine though. The seat features were basic - no cup holder, no coat hook, no foot rest. Nothing to shout home about. The lavatories were clean, but again basic. It wouldn't be my first choice, if not for Star Alliance benefits (which could end soon after merger with KE)

Old plane, no mobile charging facilities on board. Foot space was obstructed by metal box as is common on some of the older style Boeings

In flight entertainment system: very dated user interface and has very limited options for western tastes

Food reasonable no real complaints there though it would be nice if they let you know at the start of the flight what the refreshment schedule would be. In times past there used to be a card in the seat pocket explaining all that but this might be a modern day change everywhere TBF. On the plus side they keep you well hydrated with water and juice, but only OJ which can stick in your throat a bit if you're dehydrated. 

 If you plan an overnight stop at Incheon , don't get too complacent about ""not having to check in again"". It still takes a good hour to get airside again the next day (not including time to walk to gate) because of their  very manual passport checking system and long queues for security.  Surprising for a country I thought would be so tech savvy 

One big plus with Incheon airport is the amazing free showers. Just past the Matina lounge on the same level. Bring your own towel and of course a change of clothes;  

Overall, I'd fly with Asiana again if they were significantly cheaper than the other offerings, but not otherwise.

I enjoyed good service, for the most part. They were efficient and well-organized. The chairs were pretty good and they offered some nice amenities, like blanket. The in-flight wifi was very disappointing. I made the mistake of trying this to Seoul and then again, on the way back. The connection barely enabled me to do anything and it took a while (30-40 minutes) just to create an account and get set up. The food offered some nice choices, but on my return flight, I found the entree to be very rich and salty. The flight attendants were great. The attendants at checkin were a bit rushed. In fact at Incheon, they did not even question the content of my luggage ( like do you have any flammables or batteries?) --as they did on my SFO start). I booked through Travelocity and was able to easily change my ticket through Travelocity, too. I found that to be surprisingly smooth and will stick to booking on Travelocity!

This is the HIGHEST COMPLIMENT I have ever given to any airline staff: I have flown millions of miles in almost half a century, and none are as competent, professional, kind, and most of all, helpful with a warm smile like the Air Hostesses Ms. JUN HYONZJUNG and Ms. PARK BOYOUNG today. My heart is filled with gratitude to them and Asiana Airlines. And by the way, Asiana serves the most amazingly fresh and tasteful meals I have ever had in the air. I am speaking with authority because I am a Chef! God Bless.
Heathrow to Incheon. Great leg room , good food, good screen size but limited movies and shows. Cabin crew were very professional and would recommend economy on their A350.

The Worlds worst airline in my opinion.The planes are old,the entertainment system archaic and hard to work ,the planes extremely cramped,the food terrible and the ground and lounge staff ,arrogant,inflexible and bordering on rude.
Have been flying for 40 years and this is my first complaint.My advice choose another airline or stay home

My wife and I are flying business class with work and kids are in economy (aged 13 and 11 years).  They check in with us and check out with us.  Sitting few feet away.  They made us upgrade the kids tickets at $575 per ticket extra to adult and then charged over $800 so they can travel 'unaccompanied'.  This is just extortion of money.

Correct. Not flying yet but I think the service is lousy. Tried to reschedule my flight, so I started with calling the 1800 number. ""High volume of calls,...please call again later."" Then you're disconnected!
Called other numbers, 213 and 310 area codes, same thing, and one was worse coz you get told you're being connected to an operator, then after 20 seconds, ""No one can answer your call Goodbye.""

Decided to drive to their office in LA only to be told, ""You need to call. We don't do walk-ins.""

Just a terrible airlines.  Some of the flight attendants were rude, never smiled, acted like you were an alcoholic if you asked for a glass of wine (and gave 1/3 of a small plastic cup) and  said they counted how many (small) glasses customers received per administrations directions; food was terrible - the steak was bloody and had to be cooked again, the chicken and fish tasteless, the bread rolls stale and crumbly; the carpet had long tears and was dirty; the plane was old (ash trays?) and rattled - the landing gear sounded like the plane was falling out of the air.  The only thing they did well was get me to my destination earlier than scheduled.  What a stroke of luck - Thank God.

Terrible, Terrible experience with this airline! 
Staff was not helpful, the aircraft is very old and uncomfortable. For an hour, the entertainment system didn’t work and we didn’t receive a good assistance in regards to this matter. We wouldn’t recommend to travel with  them to anyone! It’s not worth the pain.

Red eye on OZ745 from HKG-ICN it was a last minute purchase so the price went skyrocket high
The A333 was even an older version then 5 years ago for some reason the entire ambience didn’t feel fresh and lively. Food was terrible, if KE weren’t full I would’ve not chosen OZ

Staff was arrogant and rude. Bad communication: some crew members do not know basic English and acted annoyed when spoken to. Luggage was delayed for days due to a random search and nobody picked up the phone for an hour when we called to check up on it.

We were desperate go get to a flight out of LA to be with our daughter in Manila, i took o a chance with Asiana Airlines, booked a pair of middle seats for my wife and daughter and a single seat behind them. These are the only seats available that i proffered - booked it 5 days before flying (yes my fault, i extended our vacation).

When we were at the counter this lovely lady - Molly, said that she will try find 3 seats so we can seat together, she said i understand families. She found seats for us! LAX-INCH-MNL all seats together. Thank you so much Molly!!! We really appreciate what appreciate what you did!!! Blessings to you!!

I will NEVER fly with them EVER again. The rep (Jin Young) was very rude, impatient, and nasty on the phone.
I called them to reschedule my flight because of a death in the family and he would not listen to what I had to say. He kept constantly cutting me off, none of us couldn't hear each other. 

I will continue to fly Korean Airlines like I've been doing before I flew with this Airlines. 

The flight experience is better, the food is better. 

The flight attendants are nicer and cleaner. 

More legroom in Korean Airlines as well.

Our first time (2x adults  and 1x 4yo toddler) flying with Asiana (LHR-INC-DLC-INC-LHR) to visit family in China with a stopover both ways in Seoul.

Most airlines we've flown with have arrangements to board those requiring assistance or families with young children first or by sections of the aircraft so that it is orderly.  Not so OZ at LHR,  where no announcements were made. It was managed poorly in our experience meaning customers were held up trying to get to their seats in the plane and took longer than necessary putting hand luggage away.  Gate staff did not show initiative to guide passengers that may need assistance to board first.

- Plane itself was clean and comfortable and toilets were kept clean thoughout the flight.  
- Food was Asian, as you would expect from an Asian airline and of good quality  We even got a hot rice dish for the short one hour flight between INC to DLC (both ways) which was a pleasant surprise. 
- Seats were comfortable and there was plenty of legroom.  My knees didn't kiss the seatback in front of me and I'm 1.85m tall. 
- Amenity kit containing single use slippers and a toothbrush/ toothpaste provided.  Combs and moisturiser available in the toilets.

- IFE was a bit poor though, with limited choice and the earphones were rubbish; couldnt hear the film track despite the volume being at full (on both outbound and inbound legs) and there was no choice for English subtitles on an English movie; so download some good movies/ programmes to your phone/ laptop to keep everyone amused as the flight is long, especially INC to LHR (14 hours).
- The inflight staff provided courteous, professional service but level of English we experienced can only be described as basic.  Bear in mind our flight was from and to an English speaking country so this could be improved upon.

The most disappointing contact that ruined our travel experience with OZ was at Incheon Airport at the check in desk on our way home.  Be aware that  the airline is VERY strict with their check-in baggage policy at INC and problems may arise when you use the self bag drop and then get sent to a ground agent at a counter.  We ended up being presented with a bill for excess baggage after the GA did not communicate to us that we would be charged after she just weighed our bags, labelled them, sent them on their way and attached a bill to our boarding card stubs.  No mention of whether we could repack, or what carry-on we were taking with us (to make more use of our carry-on allowance). It seemed she was more interested in seeing how much she could charge us for our 'excess' baggage.  Although appearing very apologetic at having sent our bags without giving us a choice to decide what to do with the excess, she kept telling us to pay at the excess counter.  

We were told to wait for an hour for the bags to be returned so we could repack/ dispose of items.  Deciding this was not acceptable, we spoke with a more senior staff member, who after various protestations from us, agreed to waive the charges and arrange for the bags to be sent on for loading.  This experience has left a rather sour end to our travel experience with OZ.

So fellow travellers please be reminded to check the exact weight of your bags before check-in at Asiana Incheon, as the ground agents have a totally inflexible common sense approach.
The customer service of the ground personnel in Los Angeles airport was horrible. They have no idea how to respectfully treat their customers.

The duty manager at Incheon airport was very unhelpful and unprofessional in terms of assisting foreign passenger. As the ground staff manager couldn’t even express clearly and assist boarding. Will not recommend taking it ever again.

2 things that really tanked our experience with this trip with Asiana Airline (which used to be among my favorite airlines): 
1) The ""random"" security screening at the boarding gate (at Incheon airport) is crazily thorough (which is completely redundant to the security screening before we went through the security checkpoint before getting into the gate area), and the water was acquired inside of the gate area (from a lounge operated by the Incheon airport).  We were asked to take out *EVERY* single items from the carry-on luggage and open up every containers / bags / packages to inspect. To add to it, there were two inspection workers there (one seemed to be a trainee and the other seemed to be a trainer), and the trainer worker held a very unfriendly / arrogant attitude towards us. As the youngest member (a minor) of my family was being ""screened"", the rest of my family wanted to make sure that no inappropriate actions would happen to her.  That trainer worker yelled at us and attempted to use rude body language (waving her hands) and facial expression to ask us to stay away.

2) The luggage handling at the destination was *REALLY* disappointing. Among my 25+ years of travel experiences, I'm going to have to say that this was the worst luggage experience where we didn't lose our luggage (yes, we lost our luggage once with another airline years ago, and that was THE worst travel experience).  Our flight was scheduled to land 12:45pm, and landed around 1pm. 15mins delay in landing is absolutely normal. Deplane process took a bit longer than usual flight (we waited for around 20mins, after arriving at the gate, before people were able to actually leave the plane). However, the luggage took another *2 HOURS* to arrive at the baggage claim carousel.  Most passengers didn't get their luggage until around 3pm local Seattle time. This is insane. What's worse is, due to the delay in luggage, the flurry of passengers from our flight collided with 3 other incoming flights. The US border / custom line was like the longest Disneyland attraction line winding through the entire arrival hall and around all the baggage claim carousels (like at least a thousand people). I've never seen anything like that at SeaTec airport (US border control), period. 

The luggage claim experience really tanked our trust and overall impression for Asiana Airline's Seattle airport ground operational effectiveness and efficiency. This has to change in order for them to remain relevant / in-business with increased competitions from Korean Air and other Asia-based airlines.

The flight was delayed by Asiana for 4 hours. We called Asiana customer services in north america for assistance to catch our connecting fligh in Seoul. They said the delay is noraml and they can not offer any help. We were asked to cancel our connecting flight. The guy is totally imbecile and should be fired.

So the reviews of Asiana are quite mixed so wanted to share our positive experience - well looked after as a solo female traveller who was unwell. Staff were extremely helpful and supportive so thank you. Easy enough to change return flight.

This is the worst experience I had with the Narita check-in staff for Asiana Airlines, being a Star Alliance Gold member.
The training and the execution are the worst I have ever experienced since flying as A Star Alliance Gold Member.
They have no idea how to treat their customers.
Unfortunately this is what happens when the staff is not properly trained.
Hopefully Asiana Airlines can provide the necessary updated training as to treat their Star Alliance Gold Partner members.
The key issue was the slightly >23 kgs weight.  They told me to remove items so that the weight can be 23 kgs...
Never experienced this before when I flew United Airlines.

I will think twice before flying Asiana Airlines and also flying into Narita Airport again!

My flight from Bangkok Suvarnabhumi International Airport to Lax, it's absolute nightmare. never and ever fly this airline again...
1. Office Asiana in Bangkok very difficult  to contact, no body pick up the phone call at all, when I have the problem seems like we have to go direct to the office and they are very rude   
2. seats cushion in the flight very bad .
3. They have loss one of our baggages, and no responsibility till date. They have ask us to list all the items in the luggage and send in email , but there is no feedback in email since we have send mail.

Asiana's onboard service is almost back to pre-Covid standards. Attentive, efficient and friendly crew and my special meal was of a good size and standard. The in flight entertainment system has never been very good and is quite awful now but I took a tablet with downloaded content and watched that. Leg room is very good on the 777-200.

Trip.com, arranged my multi-flight back to Beijing from Adelaide, and charged me double the price that it was later worth and which I could not cancel at a reasonable price. Two flights with Asiana were scheduled for the end of the trip via Korea. I did a PCR test in Adelaide to get into China, but the Asiana staff lady at check-in in Singapore initially even refused to weigh my bag, before she minutely scanned my $140 PCR test, only to say that it was a few hours out, and denied my boarding! This was because I had manually checked my luggage in Singapore from Malaysia Airlines, so this was considered to be a second flight and not the initial China bound flight the test required. She therefore considered it to be invalid as the test was done 48 hours before the first flight, not the last two flights (where I was regarded as leaving the airport to bring my luggage through to Asiana in T3). There was no remorse, help, or suggestions to re-book the flight or the possibly re-doing a test,  just a cruel callous statement, that I would not be able to fly, and I was left at the airport at my wits end at midnight with no flights or hotel!  I had to rebook the flight myself at my own expense, for a direct flight back to Beijing. The situation was so horrendous, that I don’t even know if I want to travel or fly again. I demanded to talk to the very young inexperienced manager. He was as helpful as he could’ve been, but ultimately of no help as all the staff went home by midnight. As I was in a predicament, and word got around, information desk staff came to assist me in the end and helped me to rebook the flight with Singapore Airlines.
Read the other reviews below, and you’ll get a very good idea as to why you shouldn’t be using this carrier, even if their planes do look quite nice inside!

It's an absolute nightmare booking any international flights that include a transit with a different airline in the same  booking offered via asiana website. You will not be able to make any changes to your flight, including something as simple as a luggage capacity increase.
If you call the secondary airline contact, they are unable to assist as ultimately the flight was booked through asiana and therefore you will have no authority to make any changes.
