If you call Asiana for any changes, they are also unable to increase the luggage capacity and divert any responsibility to the other airline, even though the luggage is passed directly to them during transit.
Overall just a poor experience after many hours wasted on the phone, where the customer service reps could not care any less and will just hang up if they are unable to answer your question.

My flights were changed because of summer time reason which I found weird since there is no surprise when it happens. Then when I asked for a new flight I had to shorten my vacation of 1 day and the transit which became an overnight, wouldn't have payed accomodations. Really bad experience I had to call the swiss office so they push the main office to answer to my emails. 

I really don't wish to any other traveler to have the same experience I had.

Bought tickets  from Almaty To Sydney with stop at Incheon and realized there is no hotel available at the Terminal. The stop is 25 hours and all of the airlines provide some way to get to the hotel.. and arrange it for customers. Not with Asiana though.

We realized the hotel our parents used to stay at is closed and reached out to the airlines for assistance. The response was it was our fault and we had to find out that hotel is no longer operating prior to buying tickets. 

So the long story short if your passport is not allowing you to leave the airport + pay for the transfer to the hotel and hotel separately - avoid Asiana.

Etihad or Emirates are much better option with shorter connection times and properly organized customer service.

Honestly it pains me when perfectly fine service in the air was ruined by the rudest, most incompetent ground staff at check-in in Incheon Airport I have ever experienced. In my 10 years as a star alliance gold member this is the first time dealing such frustration. I felt like the ground staff lady was interrogating me about my travel plans, and when the answer didn't satisfy the lady she threatened that I will not fly until her requirements are met and raised her hand in front of my face when I objected. I get it, she has a job to do and I can respect that. But if her attitude was nicer I'm sure it would've come off better, and the tone in her voice I could only describe as scorn for my being there. During this ordeal I was so flustered I also didn't realize she never applied the star alliance gold tags on my check in bag when she was finally processing me. If it wasn't out of malice, then it was out of incompetence. So not only was she rude, she was incompetent. Really Asiana? This is not a great way for customers to start their journey.

Flight was fine, flight attendant service was fantastic, food was pretty decent. If it wasn't for such abyssmal ground staff service I would not be writing this, and I'd continue to fly with Asiana. I feel so bad for the rest of the crew with exemplary service only to dragged down by garbage experience at the airport. This needs to be fixed.

I sat on Asiana a few years ago and it was great. Come 2023, the service and experience is horrific. We are a part of 4, 2 over 70, 1 80 years old and myself. Both the 80 year old and a 70 year old have back issues. We arranged for 1 wheelchair to assist the 80 year old. The fight attendants made no effort to help the 80 year old with her luggage (I was sitting at the other side of the plane with 2 passengers in between us so it was not possible tor me to always cross over to help). Luckily there was a nice gentleman in front of my aunt. I was carrying luggage for 4 people n they didn’t bother to assist either (plane was only 20% full when we bothered so it’s not like they were busy.) when the plane disembarked, they just took the person on the wheelchair away without letting us know, and when we finally found them we were not allowed to pass through immigration together. As you know, Korea is not really an English speaking party and it can be difficult for elderly to manage on their own yet our party was not allowed to cross together. Asiana fares are a little cheaper than other airlines but I guess you could say you pay for what you get: transport between countries and nothing else as they don’t bother to help you. Would not recommend.
We had a fantastic experience with Asiana! The customer service was excellent and they feed you A LOT on the flight. Some of the planes were a bit older, but very spacious.

Aircraft was an A350 clean and good condition, welcome was friendly and tentative even cabin was full. Departure on time, captain welcomed us and explains the route till the destination. IFE was OK, limited to my taste of movies. I managed to find 2 movies to keep me busy. Service was exceptional,  I had ordered Western menu. Everything was perfect and tasty. Obstacle they do not offer pajamas. You can have WiFi connection but you have to pay even if you are in Business Class.

The amount of ignorance this airline and it's customer service team has is astounding. You can not get in contact with the UK CS team. One number (+44 207 340 1630) is out of service and the other (+44 845 602 9900) is NEVER answered and has a full mailbox (unsurprisingly). I have called over 30 times and there has been no answer and some calls are definitely cancelled on their end as I don't always get the mailbox message.

They have no email address listed, their chatbot is not fully designed and they have no complaints department. As of this review I have even written 3 letters with no reply.

I have to cancel my flight as the airline/airport changed the timings, so I can not make my connecting flight.  Instead of organising this themselves - this happens yearly so they should be used to it - I have to contact them or who I originally ordered with. Which is unhelpful as they also do not take calls/messages from companies.

This is honestly just a mess and very stressful. This has been a month and a half of me trying to deal with this, with no end and no refund in sight.

Worst customer service ever. I called their baggage hotline for days only to find out that they still don't know where my baggage is after 15 days!!! I went to their physical office at LAX airport and still got no definite answers. I asked them, ""How do we go about this?"" They looked at me dumbfounded. This airline lacks training for its ground staff or has non-existent systems for retrieving lost baggage. Don't fly with them if you have important stuff in your luggage.

Asiana brought forward the departure time such that my family can't connect to our flight back to London now. Both flights are with Asiana.  Asiana emailed me saying that I needed to call them to update my booking number 6OROF4 which I have been doing for the past 2 weeks.  Nobody picks up the phone and I have tried all their UK office numbers at different times of the day.  I've even written them multiple emails asking them to call me but absolutely no response.  Their online portal doesn't allow me to change my flights either. 

If they don't have customer service staff then maybe they also don't have cabin crew, pilots, planes???  Is the airline even in business???  They won't be if they continue treating customers like this!

Flew recently with Asiana (a connection booked via Air New Zealand) and tried in advance to order two vegan meals for my wife and I. Tried via the Asiana airlines website well in advance of the flight. The website wouldn't accept our (correct) flight info. Tried with another code, got in and still couldn't request the meals. Did this multiple times. Tried phoning the regional office and any other number we could find and no one picked up after multiple attempts for any of the numbers. Phone inboxes were full and therefore we couldn't even leave a voice mail. Phones must confuse them, poor wee souls. 

Day of the flight, we approach customer service and basically they shrug their shoulders and avoid accountability. No food for us. Awful customer service - clearly they don't care about the art of effective communication. There's more chance of getting in touch with someone via a seance. 

On top of that, the in-flight entertainment was limited and the sound quality so low that we (and most other passengers by the looks of it) just gave up. There was more chance of me hearing someone drop a spoon 39,000 feet below than there was of me hearing the film I was trying to watch. 

We'll be avoiding this airline from now on. Would advise caution.

been trying to call their US Customer Service Center for two days now & constantly get a busy signal...literally thirty plus redials.

when I finally did get someone to help with my existing reservation, they said ""only taking new reservations, can't change existing"" and then hung up.

Thier Chat Bot is a joke and there appears to be no email for Customer Serice

Although we were three travellers, we were not registered next to each other, but at two window seats. Only three European movies on offer, entertainment also otherwise limited.On the flight, which lasted 14.25 h (1, speed only approx. 475 mph) ) due to delays, it was therefore difficult to get up (neighbour was glued to the monitor the whole day and found our twice repeated request to get up an imposition). In addition, the windows were completely closed for more than 12 h, so that we felt like being locked in a prison without daylight. We had the impression that this was done to keep the passengers quiet. Hopefully we will never have to go through such an experience again. Service and the other three flights ok.

if i could give no stars, i would.
there is no excuse for their korean branches and their below standards manners!
i called the gimpo branch, incheon branch and the reservation line and they all picked up , and hung up in less than 5 seconds and the worst is the gimpo!
I asked to inquire about changing my flight to an earlier date so as how i communicate i asked "" i wanted to change my flight schedule,  can you help? "" and the man on the line with the rudest tone said "" i dont know how "" and hung up .

If youre trying to travel and Korean air has like barely any price difference to Asiana, choose korean air. Way better customer service there.

I purchased a return flight ticket from seoul to sydney from Asiana airline. After arrival to sydney I contacted a customer service to ask if I could change the date from sydney to seoul. I was told that I was able to do it without any extra charge as I already paid over $2,000 for a return ticket and the date I want to change has the same price as the original date. So without any hesitation I requested a change and it was all approved on the phone. But when I contacted again prior to departure I was told that the ticket which was reissued was not valid as I need to pay extra money. I told the operator that I was told that there is no need to pay any extra and that’s why I changed the date. If I knew I had to pay extra $200 I would’ve kept the original ticket without changing. And the operator told me it was the previous operator’s mistake but I still have to get charged otherwise I can get a refund of $600 out of $2100. I still don’t understand why i have to pay a consequence if it was their mistake. It is absolutely unfair and unpleasant experience after the operator blamed me on not reading long length agreements but just believing what the other operator said to me.

We recently flew with Asiana in their business class product on an A350 from London to Seoul and then Seoul to Saigon on an A330. Both business class seats were different but were very comfortable. The A350 seat has a lack of storage other than what is effectively a side table. The seat was comfortable for our 12hrs flight offering a fully lay flat bed with good leg room. I’m 6ft 1” and I could stretch out completely. The A330  seat is an older school seat, very wide and extremely comfortable. In flight catering was excellent and the crew were delighted when we chose from the Korea menu as opposed to the Western menu. The cabin crew were engaging and very happy to serve.

Not only did this airline make me pay £114 to check in my hand luggage that was literally 1cm ‘too big’ which is ridiculous as I fly with it all the time, but I choked on a broken piece of plastic that was in my meal on the plane.

This is extremely dangerous and I am considering how to take this further. This ruined the entire flight for me and my wife.

Do not fly Asiana Airlines. Asiana Airlines has refused to refund any portion of my ticket purchased in February 2020 even though I was reassured over the phone that I would ALWAYS be able to rebook my ticket even if at a fee.

Sadly, this is not the case. After numerous phone calls and email messages to Asiana Airlines' customer service, it appears that not only will they not refund my flight, but they will not be honoring ANY of the value when rebooking.

I have tried for weeks now with their customer service for a positive result. I have been told to call back at different hours to speak with higher level assistance (which I did numerous times) and also going through their website to leave a complaint under ""Voice of Customers"".

Under ""Voice of Customers"" I've received 2 different answers in writing:

Answer 1, their COVID rebooking policy to rebook flights ended in October 2022. The odd thing is though, South Korea (my destination) only fully opened up for travel in... you guessed it, October 2022.

Answer 2, my flight could only be rebooked 1 year from the purchase date. So, my rebooking would have expired in February 2021, right in the middle of a pandemic.

I've sadly lost my patience and I can only share that Asiana Airlines is a poor excuse of a business and clearly has shown me that they do not value their customers. For all of you who may be traveling do not fly Asiana Airlines.

Our flight was delayed about 2 hours (due to late arrival into Sydney & turnaround time) but that was the only fault with this flight. The A380 was only half full, so we managed to find a row of 3 seats each for us to lay down & have a decent sleep. Service was outstanding! Crew was genuinely friendly & happy to chat. Both meals were delicious & great quality! Crew also responsive in bringing snacks & wine when requested.

I was Flying from Da Nang Vietnam to PNH Cambodia on 26th of January 2023 at 9:35am Fl no FD 635, I was 2 hours and 35 minutes before at check in counter, the Vietnam air Asia staff asked me addition documents that I had to provide Return Ticket and Hotel booked confirmation, which is I had researched every possible sites and social media which no where stated that Cambodian Immigration requires any. I had to argue for an hour and 30 minutes, then the lady just gave me boarding pass up to Thailand, my connection flight was DAD to DMG then PNH, so I just ran to immigration then security check then I just barely get on board. 

Then as soon as landed in Thailand I went to airasia office and asked them boarding pass for Cambodia. 

When I get into Cambodian Immigration, no one asked me like that additional papers as I aspected. Horrible time ever I faced with Vietnam Air Asia this time..

Everything about this airline is poor. I do not recommend them.

- They forgot to print my sons boarding pass - ensue massive last minute panic at the airport
- They didn't tag one of our bags - then never got back to us about it. It's lost forever, but they haven't had the decency to declare it lost so I can claim on insurance
- Half the plane was empty because you have to pay extra to be in some seats - so you can't lie down if it's not fully booked. The staff are extremely petty.
- The entertainment selection is absolutely rubbish.
- If you want to complain, you can't. They only have sales teams.

The only half decent thing about them was the food - but then I'm partial to greasy asian food.

I will forever regret the day I decided to pay a little less and fly with Air Asiana. They are just awful.

Have been trying now for three days to get a flight changed and have had no response to either the chatbot on the website or any of the phone numbers listed. 
Not impressed at all - travellers beware.

The staff tell a lie with client for hotel.
 I got an cancel flight last night at 7:25 pm -KE469. I got a delay untill 9:10 next day. Very tired for long trip,
They help everybody enter terminal 2, after that they share many small group. I don't know why. I saw some person they had same my flight and they have a room in hotel. I didn't understand what hapen. i had been required an hotel when i saw everyone had a room for stay not me.
They kept my carry on when i enter the hotel and they told me ""they will be call the polish if i enter the hotel"". Omg what happen? They young and very rude.
they treated me like a law-giver for the client. they told me with a strong voice. 
Anyways, I told them if you don't like to give me the room for stay . I need you give me the paper , please sign down your name and reason why you do not have room for me. They told me the hotel have no more room, and one couple check in after they answer me. 
Finally they put me into a room with 2 women.
Thank Asiana airline for teaching me a lesson when choosing you as a companion

Tried over a three day period to setup new membership online or at least talk to Customer Rep to schedule flights. When I did reach a working number I was told they was extremely busy and I was then disconnected.
Almost all AI and if you like talking to a Computer you will be extremely happy with this Company.

RIck Osbourne
Surprised me how they have even existed without being able to do a simple comprehending of basic English very poorly coordinated and terrible at technical skills will never recommend it to anyone

The returning flight from Seoul is largely an unremarkable one. Asiana Airlines Lounge is a typical transit lounge although food selection is lacking. Flight is neat and tidy as always with no delay. Only complaint is on the food.

My partner and I flew with asiania airlines, returning to Australia for a wedding. 
On our way to Sydney, our baggage was lost. Asiana was close to impossible to reach in any way (email, phone, in person at their office). After two days of calling, I eventually went to instagram and starting messaging them. To my surprise this was the most responsive approach. They supplied me with the same non working phone numbers, and an email address. 
After emailing, the airline offered $150 AUD compensation. This is absolutely atrocious, especially considering we arrived for a wedding. To replace the very necessary items needed for the wedding was going to be significantly more than this amount. 
We were left without luggage for 5 days (half of our trip). $150 does not even begin to compensate the stress, wasted time shopping when we could be spending with family. 
And to top it off, our luggage was also lost again on our return. We have yet to hear anything or get any response to our attempts at contact. 
Very poor customer service and compensation policy. 
Will never recommend this airline to anyone or ever fly with them again.

the people I worked with were so slow and stupid. They will do nothing to help whatsoever. They cancelled my flight, extended the transit period to over 20 hours and would do nothing in their capabilities to better my experience. especially miss LEE JIN SON with an orange bang at the Asiana Transfer Desk :) her attitude was horrible and she would make eyes and be annoyed for helping me, her client. Just trying to get some help and maybe put too much expectation on the service of this airlines
first time travelling with Asiana and my companions and I really rated this flight. The food was good and the service was friendly and would fly with them again

Do not recommend flying this airline, EVER. Customer service is terrible. Between unclear transfer rules and long wait times to reach anyone who can help, after finally reaching someone, they were of no help. My 73 year old mother is flying alone and does not have her SIM card in her phone so she has no way of communicating with us if she is able to complete her transfers. I had called ahead of time to set up assistance and have her flagged for wheel chair assistance, but the video I received of her leaving shows no such assistance. I had a terrible experience trying to transfer myself when I reached my destinations so I can only imagine how confusing it is for a 73 year old who does not travel often nor understand how to request services for herself. I am very disappointed in this airline and it’s “customer service.” If my mother goes missing, it will be on Asiana airlines to find her and get her home safely. The amount of negligence they have showed is disturbing.

It’s so frustrating to get in touch with this airline. Web/app services are not complete so you’ll have to reach the hotline to be able to make some changes, but because no one is answering- you’ll be on hold for such a long period of time, after 2 hours of waiting - still nothing! Ugh
I waiting the airline stewardess about a half of hour for a lunch box .iofeiohfeiodghsdfwehioaeghisegshioasghioasghioaeghioaehiefwhiwefhipwghpwegwegweweghiweghi;hiahipgaehipaegwhio
Over 50 attempts in the course of 4 days trying to reach a customer service agent. Are you guys really trying to run a business or do you just not care?

We traveled on a new Asiana Airbus to Inchon, Korea (long flight). Three hours later we continued on a different Asiana Airbus to Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam.  Checked luggage was promptly transferred over to new flight and waiting for us in after we deplaned. Staff and Crews extended every courtesy and consideration to us. The food was excellent and beverages were available entire time of flight. This was an economy flight - worth every penny we spent -  will pay extra to fly with them again.

On our return flight two passengers got into a verbal and later physical altercation over use of an empty seat in-between them which was promptly dealt with by flight crew.
i have ever best experience with this flight .100% recommended. my choice is always is asiana airline .always happy with him.

Flew JFK-ICN-BKK on to totally full A350 (and a A380 to BKK which is a much better plane) On the plus side: Asiana website is good, telephone support is also good. Flight to ICN was average, the crew were very nice. Flights to ICN now last an average of 1 H 30M longer due to avoiding Russian airspace (why ? Korean is not forbidden from using it)? with strong winds in winter it can be almost 16 hrs to ICN. Anyway, flight experience was good if you compare if to an EU or US carrier but very average if you compare it with other ME or Asian carriers such as Emirates, Qatar or Singapore. Very limited IFE. And mostly in Koran language. Food was just ok. No snacks in between. I think that was the only flight that i as left hungry.  western option on food, well.....i have had much better......
And lastly, get rid of the masks  like most airlines have done already (i am sure though this has to do with Korean Government)

THIS COMPANY SCAMMED ME! I went through the process to purchase an international ticket, saved up in order to afford a ticket over 1200USD. Very excited to secure my flight, but then I get an error message at the end: ""Ticket has not been issued correctly."" That's it, that's all the message says.
So I think, fine, I'll just go back and redo the process. Inconvenient, but not a big deal. Only to find that my account was charged! Now I am missing over 1200USD without receiving what I paid for, without even an explanation of what's going on.
I have been trying to get in contact with customer support for several hours now. I am convinced they do not even have anyone working there to take these calls, because all I get is robots that hang up on me instantly. No getting put on hold, no scheduled callback, nothing. Just hang up.
They took my money and now they are running with it. I have to go through the lengthy process of disputing the charge with my bank. Insane that there is a company allowed to operate this way. How can a system be built to charge me after telling me that my order failed? Ridiculous.
Find someone else to fly with. These people are thieves.

I have flown with Asiana Airlines previously and always had a great experience and positive memories. Unfortunately my experience in June 2022 was really terrible and left a very negative impression.

I bought tickets through the United Airlines website from Saipan to Sydney, and back. This involved a flight on Asiana Airlines from Saipan to Seoul, and Seoul to Taipei. About 4 hours before departure from Saipan, I received a call from Asiana Airlines saying that I will not be allowed to board because the flight involved a short transit in Taipei and Asiana Airlines said that is not allowed. They suggested that I call United Airlines to sort this out. It didn’t get sorted. 

The issue I have with Asiana Airlines is that as a matter of professionalism, courtesy and good customer service, it should have given me more notice. I purchased the ticket on May 11 but was informed only 4 hours before departure. I complained and they said “It is a courtesy and not the responsibility of Asiana Airlines to advise passengers upon checking in at the counter on any irregularities that might arise in their travel.”

That is troublesome. I wrote that they do not have an obligation but if they decide to give advise, they relinquish their obligation and need to ensure that the advise they give is reasonable and practical. Either they should have told me just before boarding that I cannot board or inform me well in advance. Four hours is not sufficient. They failed. Either give adequate advice, or don’t give advice. There is no half way mark. 

It seems another issue is the ground staff. When I spoke with the United customer service staff in Saipan, she said she knew about this issue because apparently the United Airlines and Asiana Airlines ground staff work for the same company. My guess is that certain functions are not carried out by Asiana Airlines staff but rather it is outsourced. I know of another Northern Pacific Island that has a similar arrangement. In that instance the airline acknowledged that not having their own staff on the ground did affect customer service. Perhaps this is the case with Asiana Airlines, a 5-star airline. As a customer, I am utterly disappointed. I will be flying soon again with Asiana due to limited choices.

I've flown with asiana 6 times over the past 3 months and whilst I generally like the company with friendly crew and decent food and a competitive pricing I have to say that the in-flight entertainment absolutely lacks variety and updates. I've seen literally every movie on that system by now and they barely change. 

(Unrelated photo because I love the alps)

I went to the airport 2 hours ahead of my flight.  I had everything ready to go.  

I had my negative COVID-19 test results, my passport, my Q-Code, my flight itinerary, and excited to checkin.  However, the woman helping me asked for my K-ETA and I had no idea what she was talking about.  I later found out this was an entry authorization that was similar to a Visa.  

Thankfully, she helped me download the app and I was able to submit the application in about 15 minutes.  However, we had to wait for the approval. 

It was about an hour til the flight was going to take off and the woman told me that she will have to close down all the kiosks.  

Having pity on me, she stayed open for another 10 minutes and BOOM!  I got the approval and was able to board.

Due to the amazing staff and especially this angel of a woman, I was able to board my flight. 

The angel's name is:  Sun Hea Min

Thank you and everyone working that day for your efforts, it is so appreciated.

Best,
Laurie T.

You’d think that flying abroad would be a leisurely experience. Well it is until you board Asiana airlines. I had a flight from JFK to Hanoi and missed my flight because of a one hour overlay time and the flight attendants not being present for more than an hour to check in (they were only there from 11-12 what a joke). Once my flight took off without me, the phone line to get to management was unreachable and I was unable to book another flight to Hanoi . Thank god for American Airlines the staff there helped me book another flight and I was all set to go home. I was stuck at the airport for 4 days and the flight attendants refused to accommodate me in anyway.  

You’d think that was bad enough but no. I went online to check into my flight from Hanoi back to JFK airport to change my seating to a better one. I did and the process went smoothly. Until I checked the next day and saw that my seats had been swapped yet again to terrible seats out of nowhere that I did not choose. I am beyond disappointed  and will NEVER use Asiana Airline’s services again. If you want to be treated with hospitality and kindness this airlines is not it.

My husband and I were traveling from New York to Seoul and we have all the documents needed, a printed boarding pass, all we need is board the plane, however, one check in supervisor in JFK decided to give us a hard time. We were asked not to board our flight and so we booked a new flight that cost us a lot of money (American Airlines, which is way better, we were even upgraded) 

Even with Asiana’s fault and greediness, we were denied of a refund and made us skeptical on flying international. So stay away with this airline! It is bad enough that they gave us false of flying as we were waiting at the boarding gate with our boarding pass, they even misplaced oir bag!

Perhaps I was incorrectly expecting a Korean Emirates or Qatar but Asiana we're truly awful.
Delayed departure, a website/app that simply doesn't function, terrible (and limited choice of) food, poor drinks selection, rude crew, and - worst of all - the most pathetic excuse for inflight entertainment. About a dozen EN-language movies. That's it. Mostly unheard or unknown movies as well. Virtually no TV shows - inexcusable for a 13 hour flight. The boredom is beyond belief. So download as much Netflix as you can or bring as many books to read.
Can't believe I've a 14 hour flight back with them to Europe tomorrow. Have never dreaded any flight as much in my life (I fly about 8 times a month).
Please, take my advice , avoid, avoid, avoid.

Horrible. The stewardess insisted on putting my purse on the overhead bin and when we landed in Manila, my cell phone is gone and some items from my purse. Thieves. Of course my phone can't be tracked because they turned it off.

Asiana Airlines lost the suitcase I checked in from Paris to Seoul. I spent a month in Korea and had to buy clothes, toiletries and a new suitcase for the entire month, without receiving any financial compensation from the airline. I emailed and called dozens of times, and they only updated me three weeks in to tell me that they still had not found my suitcase. I had urgent medication in my suitcase and had to go to the international hospital in Seoul to get a new prescription - Asiana did not cover these medical costs.
The financial compensation is only 100USD for the delay in receiving the suitcase, and since they actually lost it, only 20 USD per kilo (which amounts to about 400USD, a lot less than the content of the suitcase was worth). Even these meager compensations I still haven’t received a month later.
On my flight back to Paris, I asked if I could be given a seat with extra leg room as a compensation. They told me yes, then proceeded to give me a regular seat instead without any explanation.
I will be traveling with Korean Air next time for sure.

Booked tickets 3 months in advance but when we got the boarding passes for all legs  of the journey the checkin agent put us in scattered seats for the second leg, an 11 hr flight. She didn’t bother to tell us or try to do a better job. At the second leg the agent said there was nothing to be done.  Among other disappointing details, I will avoid this airline in the future.

I typically don’t write a review about anything but this airline is the worst ever on how they handle the customer. I couldn’t even get hold of any agent until Expedia helps to get me connected. It sucks. My  flight got  cancelled involuntarily during pandemic and I never got the  notification about credit or refund. Now it has been expired and they don’t want to give me credit or refund at all.  Not even trying to help me in anyway. Terrible! Poor business ethics!

This Airline is the worst! They cancelled my booking without notice, I missed my flight and now the price of my booking tripled the original price that I booked 2months ago! I've been calling them so many times and finally they were able to tell me I can get rebook but wait until Monday for the confirmation. I waited til Monday but still no update! I called then again and waited for over 30mins and they told me I'm on a waitlist! Imagine! I am hanging in the air as if I dont have a life to do, waiting for their confirmation! I always wait for over 30mins just to get a hold of their customer service and when they cannot help me, THEY DROPPED MY CALL!!!! HORRIBLE HORRIBLE AIRLINE! HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE! Beware of this Airline! It's better to book with other Airline, Japan Airlines is WAY WAY BETTER than this Asiana Airlines!!!!!!!! I will never ever book my ticket in this Airline ever again! Horrible Experience, my worst stress this year!

I had to cancel my flight as my schedule changed(LAX to ICN -> JFK to ICN). But their website/app say u can only cancel it via a phone call. 

But they NEVER pick up the phone. All I can hear is a horrible automated message saying, “we are experiencing high volume right now, please call back us later”, and phone call automatically hanged up. Tried calling them multiple times throughout the day, but didn’t work out.

So on today, when checking in JFK, I explained about this to staff, but she said I have to try again contacting customer service center.

What😤????. Seems like my $2200 gonna just vanish. 

U can never get a refund.

I recently purchased a ticket from Sydney to Rome which I was charged double the price. The second transaction was put on hold for 6 days leaving me with a negative balance in my account. It’s disgusting they did not warn me about this to prepare as I desperately needed this money to live. I contacted Asiana multiple times with no response after my bank had confirmed my initial transaction had been confirmed. Horrible system and the customer service system needs to be looked at, especially in Sydney.

Good experience overall. Very friendly and efficient crew. ""Light"" level of the A350, similar to the LH I flew before, with no crystal-technology windows and general equipment, including less overhead lockers (I admit that this gives more space and that in general in business their might even be ""too"" much space). Good set-up of the chairs in view of privacy. Very good sleeping conditions.

I tried calling customer service about my Diamond class expiration and miles need to keep it active. I waited for 43 minutes after following all touchtone commands for the Asiana Club. When someone finally answered I was told to contact the Asiana Club, which is where I was at, and then switched me over once again to the same automated touchtone directory. I gave up. It was a horrible low class operation. Shall I go back to EVA? Time will tell...........................

How would you expect an airline will scam you when you purchase 2 x USD 7.5k tickets ?

Me and my wife bought 2 business class tickets from HKG and JFK ticket on Feb 11 with the outbound trip being a saver (cheapest Class U) and the return trip to be a Business Suite Class (Class C - double the price of Class U). The fare rule for class C clearly stated that :

Refund
HKD200 per ticket
* After departure, deducted oneway applicable fare + Refund penalty
* Refund requests are permitted up to 30 days from the ticket's expiration date.

We already confirmed the fare rules for the RETURN TICKET before we made a booking. 

For family reason we have to cancel the return flight (Class C) and Asiana want to charge us HKD 2400 each which is for Class U  ! Their argument is because our outbound flight is Class U then the return flight fare rule should follow Class U despite we paid Class C. 

If this is not a scam what is a scam ?
I have been had a terrible chance to fly with asiana airlines. They have bad customer services, terrible foods and always delay.

this is my first time i flew with Asiana and I say Asiana has very bad customer service. I talked with team who did check in process in Seattle, WA. They are unprofessional, dishonest, and terrible. They treat customer like trash. Stay away from this airline!
This was a busy flight which I think was full, however the staff were very prompt with boarding and disembarking
The flight was full.  The service was adequate.  We were an hour late due to de-icing.  Nothing special.  An average flight with a safe arrival.  So we were happy.
Both of my flights were excellent. The staff were extremely friendly during my long flight. The aircraft was kept very clean. Entertainment was also great. Very good service for a very good price.

Bought a ticket online, but the site said the purchase failed. I didn't get a confirmation or verification of the reservation because it failed to go through. Checked my bank and the charge had gone through. Had to call and stay on hold with an agent who couldn't fix the problem because I hadn't used a Korean card...when asking for help the agent sighed OH MY GOD! I can't help you - she was frustrated, but she's an agent - literal job - I know it's a rough situation I mean I got charged for a ticket and didn't even get a reservation - nothing -

A very average airline, check in ground staff had limited knowledge of the Covid regulations of my final destination Manila. Fortunately I had done my own research and was able to correct them, regardless they still insisted upon me signing a declaration waver. Turns out I was correct and the paperwork I had prepared for my arrival was indeed the right updated version. Preflight communications from Asiana were also poor, at check in they only accept a PCR test from specific hospitals and would have refused me boarding if I had simply used the PCR testing facilities at Jakarta airport. This information WAS NOT volunteered by them and had I not specifically asked in advance, I would have used the convenience of the T3 test facilities and not been able to travel.
The aircraft was old and the business class seating not very comfortable. The seat does not go fully flat, and is unsuitable for a 7  hour flight. The crew are very stingy with the drinks and I had to constantly ask for a fill up. I have never seen such a small wine glass and they only half filled it each time..... 3 times (I got tired of asking).

You get what you pay for and Asiana are in my humble opinion a poor airline, I have more than 20 years of flying experience, taking approx 16 flights a year with my line of work and I still find Singapore, Qatar and Emirates amongst the best. In fact Philippine airlines os better than Asiana and thats saying something.

Very good Airlines! Flight attendants are very nice and super polite, respectful. Foods are delicious! It was so great to do business with. I will do it again.
Thanks your team!  Wishing all of you luck, healthy and the best.

Asiana cancelled our return flight 2 days before our scheduled return flight on March 9th, 2020.  Because we had a stopover in Korea.  They are refusing to return our money.  We had to buy tickets on another airline.

Second year in a row that they canceled one leg of my flight. Granted last year It was understandable. Even though the reason given was BS a seasonal schedule change, you think they would know that they would be changing schedules.
But this year I got a cancelation email again with the same reason ""Winter schedule change"". You call them up to see about a refund but they tell you that they only do those through email. So I start the process and I get an email back saying it could take up to 8 weeks.
Anyways I'm still waiting for my refund a week later and just because I'm curious I look at their website and they have the same flight they cancelled on me available to book. So why did they cancel my flight?

My wife was left stranded in Manila at 11:45 pm Dec 28/20 after and Asiana agent took her covid test from her (she was alone) and stopped her from boarding her flight. He then gave her a list of hospitals that she must get her test from. The list had an Asiana Airlines letter head.
My wife had to rent a hotel room dor 3 days, get another covid test (24 wait for results). SO NOT FLY WITH ASIANA Airlines those who work there still exibit third world attitudes for women flying alone

B. Guthrie NACE CIP level 3/ 7628
Horrible Customer Service for English speaking and no notice of cancellation not even an email. Had to call myself and facilitate booking a new flight!!!

I will start by saying I have flown to Asia and the same route with other airlines multiple times, primarily with a layover and change of planes at Narita, Japan.
This time, flying with Asiana, the trip was not nearly as enjoyable for several reasons.
First, Asiana is using all Airbus equipment.  For the long haul from Seattle to Seoul,
not nearly as nice as flying a Boeing Dreamliner.  Much noiser aircraft, no matter where you are in the cabin.  The English entertainment choices are highly limited and seem focused on small children -not good.  The crew hide inside the galleys and make zero effort to assist passengers outside of the scheduled service times.
I stood up to stretch my legs after 12 hrs and they had a fit.

For the leg from Incheon to BKK, the Airbus 330 has miserable seats that are hard as rocks.  A normal sized passenger will not be comfortable.  Food quality also leaves a lot to be desired- not so good.   Maybe Asiana is not a budget airline, but in my experience there is better service and comfort to be found on other airlines.
If you are flying Asiana Airlines, I highly recommend their transit zone. Especially much needed shower faculties. All free with your Asiana Airlines boarding pass

Asiana business suite OZ601 January 6th  2020  ICN-SYD .
It has been a while now to fly due to COVID, I want to commend Asiana Airlines from my last flight from Korea.
Asiana business suite OZ601 January 6th 2020  ICN-SYD seat  3A.
I have flown with Asiana several times, usually business class, I don’t mind paying for the privilege , as it is value for money and if you’re a tall person the thought of more than 4  hours on any airline’s economy, especially overnight is motivation enough to avoid.
Check- in was easy and flawless, no line or stress at all.
I was lucky enough to travel in Business Suite for the second time on a full revenue ticket, I was the only passenger in the cabin, so a wonderful experience. The flight attendants were very kind and attentive and said I could sit in any of the 12 seats available, but I was happy with 3A  from my original booking. Dinner was served essentially straight after climbing to cruise height, as this is an overnight flight of 10 hours I was able to sleep very well as the star mood lighting was lowered. 
I awoke 2 hours before landing just as the sun was rising at 5:30 and was immediately offered coffee and the breakfast. I am saving all my pennies and praying for full air travel to resume soon so I can return to Korea on Asiana. On a ""larger"" note arriving  into Sydney Airport with its surly faced, smart ass Border staff and run down  "" near enough , is good enough""  arrivals areas  from a real airport like Seoul ICN is a whole different world, another planet even.

I have travelled on Asiana many times, and the results are almost always the same: Excellent service, friendly staff, quality in-flight entertainment, and great food. 
On the outbound flight (HKG - ICN) my suitcase was damaged, and one of the wheels seemed to have been broken off.  I reported it to Asiana bag service (which comprised of two very helpful Asiana staff members only 50 ft away, and they gave me a new suitcase on the spot.  Only took 5-10 minutes!
One of the other reviews (Barbro N) makes absolutely no sense. Of course they all speak English - most with high or native-like fluency.

The Tom Bradly Terminal at LAX was crazy empty. I was the only one in the check-in line: was done in less than 5 minutes. Only one at security: again about 5 minutes. 
On the flight, the crew was so friendly and helpful you never would have thought about covid, except for the mask on your face. 

I love Asian Airlines. 😆

I have been flying on Asiana for 6 years and I have yet to have a bad experience. The customer service, flight crews, food, drinks, in flight services, in flight entertainment and seats were great as usual. 
In the past the check in team have always been Asiana staff. On this trip they had a local team that was supervised by Asiana and the rep that assisted me was friendly and professional. Asiana also added a flight with an adjusted flight schedule that had a late night departure. This schedule was better for me and my plans. I hope they are able to keep it.
The only negative about Asiana is the change to their frequent flyer program which reduces the amount of miles that are awarded for economy seats. 
Aside from that they ar great airline that I am happy to recommend to others.
I took for an emergency the flight Manila to Seoul but the airplane was hugely full and no space between passengers, not even 30 cm between. Very unsafe and risky flight

Flew on their new A350s which were quite comfortable (much better than the A330s they previously used to Singapore).

Don’t eat the western meal option though, just stick to the Bibimbap.

The stretching video at the end of the flight was quite amusing, especially seeing the other passengers join in!

While we had our temperature taken when we arrived at the Bangkok airport, that was the only concessiion to the virus.  They sat us three next to each other.  Plane was 50% full.  Slept mostof the trip

This is the second time we have used this airline to travel to Sydney. We were recommended to use them by our Trailfinders representative in the Newcastle office. Although this means flying from Heathrow rather than Newcastle it is worth it as the price of a Business Class seat is almost half the price of the Emirates flight from Newcastle.
The aeroplanes are clean and the staff are so friendly and helpful. The food and drink are substantial although the film selection is a little limited. The business class seating is spacious and comfortable.
Due to the Coronavirus pandemic our return flight at the beginning of April was cancelled. However, Trailfinders organised another flight for us.
We will certainly use this airline again for our next Australian trip.

We just flew from Thailand-Seoul-LAX on Asiana. First time with this airline. My family and I were all very pleasantly surprised to the level of service, food quality, attention to details such as tooth brush and personal kit even in Economy. The flight attendant were all incredibly kind and helpful. Unlimited drinks and the food was delicious.  

My original business class AC flight was cancelled due to Covid 19. I had not flown in economy overseas in over a decade and was very apprehensive with the long distance. Not that I would fly economy again but if I had to, Asiana would be my first choice. 

Thank you for making this trip more pleasant.

I booked an itinerary that involved a JetBlue flight from Syracuse to JFK, then an Asiana flight from JFK to Seoul. HOWEVER, with less than 48 hours left until the start of the trip, JetBlue cancelled its flight. Trying to be flexible, especially during a situation of a global pandemic, I booked a cab service that would bring me to JFK on time for my second flight. 
WHEN I CALLED ASIANA AIRLINES TO CONFIRM THE STATUS OF MY FLIGHT (after waiting on the phone for a very long time), they told me that because I couldn't follow the ORDER of the itinerary (as in take the JetBlue flight FIRST), they could NOT let me on the plane, even though I had PAID for my ticket in full. They even had the audacity to say that even if I had arrived at the airport on time, they would DENY me a seat on the plane that, just to repeat for emphasis, I had PAID FOR. EVEN AFTER I had explained that my JetBlue flight was modified and thereby it was IMPOSSIBLE for me to follow the order of the itinerary, the customer service representatives (I spent hours on the phone taking to more than one) kept repeating that this is was company policy and that I could NOT be on the plane. HOW IS THIS KIND OF BLATANTLY EXPLOITATIVE, UNETHICAL PRACTICE ALLOWED? THIS AIRLINE IS COMPLETELY SHAMELESS, TRYING TO MAKE MONEY OFF OF ITS CUSTOMERS AT A TIME WHEN CANCELLATIONS AND MODIFICATIONS OF FLIGHTS ARE FREQUENT DUE TO COVID-19. THEY ARE COMPLETELY REFUSING TO BE FLEXIBLE AND EVEN ARE DENYING MY REQUEST FOR A REFUND.
DEAR ASIANA AIRLINES, PLEASE UNDERSTAND THAT I WILL MOST CERTAINLY USE LEGAL MEANS IF NECESSARY TO ADDRESS THIS ISSUE IF IT IS NOT RESOLVED.

My wife and I went to Japan for a short vacation last February 5-10, 2020.  We flew Asiana business class and the in-flight services especially the kind of service provided by the flight attendants were excellent.  The selection of wines is not as good as European airlines but the inflight food was great.  Their business class lounge at Incheon Airport is one of the best in the industry.  Cathay Pacific business class lounge at the Hongkong Airport is still the best for me.  The only thing I didn't like is that in Narita, on our way back to Manila, their check-in counter opened 2 hours before the flight.  We were there 3 hours before the flight because we wanted to enjoy the business class lounge but we have to wait for 1 hour for their check-in counter to open.  And we didn't have a lot of time to enjoy the lounge.  We don't experience this with other airlines.  With other airlines, if the flight is middle of the day, their check-in counter is already open from the earliest flight on that day so even if we are at the airport 5 hours before the flight, we can already check-in and stay at the business class lounge.

The title says it all. This airline is ethically and morally not considerate of its passengers, specifcally regarding the COVID-19 situation. If they do not cancel flights, they expect you to risk your health to take the flight if you do not want to lose your money. My other flights that I booked through other airlines understood that currently there is a global PANDEMIC and unsterood its customers decision to not travel to curb the spread of the disease, but it seems that this airline only cares about its own profits and disregards the health of its customers. Airlines should be promoting less non-essential travel to help curb the spread of COVID but clearly they don't care. What was even more frustrating was that while I was still on the phone trying to explain my situation and my frustration, the MANAGER that I was referred to HUNG UP on me. That is probably the worst customer service I have ever received. 

If you are looking for an airline that only cares about its own profits and disregards its customers, this place is definitely for you.

** I have yet to travel as I was trying to get a refund for my flight
This, fairly new airline is the best I have ever travelled on for comfort, service and the food was excellent.

Functional for short trips.  Disappointed in their handling of COVID-19.   We were allowed to board the plane and then the hostess came up to us just before the plane was ready for take off, meaning it was already full and requested for our passports and took our temperatures. Firstly,  I believe if they suspected we were carrying the virus, we should not have been allowed to board in order to safe guard all passengers.  Secondly, we felt targeted and embarrassed because we were addressed and tested in full view of a plane full of people.
We recently flew business class on 2 flights with Asiana Airlines.  The service was great and the food was above average.  Plane was cleaner than most.

Employees are friendly, but their response to the coronavirus is terrible. Rebookings are limited up to August 31. No refunds unless flights are cancelled. My flight was finally cancelled last week, but they ignored multiple emails requesting a refund.

Phone agents have zero power, so don't waste your time. I had to file a dispute with my credit card. Hours wasted out of my day.

This flight was a trouble free experience. We had a noon flight from Manila and got to the airport 4 hours before our flight. Check in was not open so we had to wait 15 mins in line but the line was short. When it opened it took us 30 minutes to get to the front. We requested for aisle seats and got it. All our checked in luggage was under the limit except for one but they did not make us remove stuff probably because It averages out. Once at the gate our temperature was checked and allowed to seat at a cordoned off area for security. Boarding started a little chaotic because the seat number range to board first was not clearly communicated to the passengers but other than that it was smooth. Food was good so was the crew. We arrived on time.

Food service was very good. In flight movies were free and recent releases. The only complaint was an unexpected one hour delay in a connecting flight to Chang Mai. Actually had plenty of room in overhead bins. Connecting flight in Seoul required a second unnecessary trip through security.

The service was fine. Legroom was an issue, and you were not able to purchase economy plus as on certain other airlines. Our flight from Seoul to Bangkok was delayed almost 2 hours because some idiot checked baggage , then did not board the plane, so they had to unload all the bags to get his/hers off.

Bread and food were delicious, space was okay, facilities including in-flight entertainment were great even though the entertainment options were limited, service was helpful yet some of the stewardess only spoke in Korean no matter where you are from and therefore you can only rely on body language by pointing things.

Our first time using this Korean airline for travel to the Philippines. We are glad to say our experience was very good. Our experience from check in to the 10 hour flight to our stopover and 3 hour last leg was as comfortable as I can experience.
We came back on a night on empty air craft,the standard economy seats were good for leg room,but because the plane was nearly empty we were told that we can sit where we liked

We tried to get a refund on a ticket due to the Coronavirus situation.

Asiana were NO help at all. I will never deal with this Airline again.

Asian have lost my business and my families business for life - hope they are happy!

Because I'm NOT !

Awful airline, will never book Asiana again. Even with this global pandemic, level 3 alert In South Korea, event shut downs and school cancellations in japan, Asiana refuses to rightly refund money. My flight had a layover in South Korea where the situation is “grave” and they dont want to do anything to help. Want to charge 80% in cancellation fees leaving me with a refund of around 20%. Scummy business practice garbage airline. Screw Asiana

I was really dissapointed with this airline. The flight was indirect and I had to transfer in Incheon, Seoul. From Frankfurt to Seoul, almost all passengers were Korean, so maybe that's why the attendants didn't speak English when they served food/drinks or gave some live instructions during the flight, which I found very uncomfortable because I don't speak any Korean and thus didn't understand what they were saying. THAT WAS AN INTERNATIONAL FLIGHT, not a domestic one! Until one attendant came and asked what I wanted for my dinner in Korean (I guess), I asked her to speak English to me, she started to communicate with me in English. But then some other attendants came and spoke Korean until I asked them to speak English to me. The food served was ok, in-flight service was not too bad. Each passenger will be given a pair of cloth slippers which are very pleasant for your feet in a long flight.

However the drama began when they suddenly changed my return flight from Vietnam to Germany halfway. I said ""halfway"" because they shifted the flight from Nha Trang to Seoul one day back while keeping the date unchanged for the flight from Seoul to Frankfurt, which means if I followed the schedule, I would miss the flight back to Germany. It was completely their fault. When I called the reservation center in Korea and required them to put both flights from Nha Trang to Seoul and from Seoul to Frankfurt on the same date, they agreed. Yet when I checked my email for the new ticket, the flight from Seoul to Frankfurt was set on a different date than what had been discussed on the phone. I had to call the center again and asked them to change and check carefully before they send me the ticket. That was very uncomfortable and time-consuming. Regarding the reservation center, even though I did as guided to get through to English-speaking assistants, I still had to speak with two Korean-speaking only operators until I could talk to an English-speaking assistant, which made me extremely confused and annoyed.

Last but not least, Incheon International Airport barely gives new instructions or notice (spoken and written) in English, but in Korean (of course) and in Chinese, as if they only considered Chinese passengers their international guests. This made my experience with Asiana Airlines even worse.

I will never fly with Asiana Airlines again.

Dear Asiana Team,

I am writing this letter today, after having spent my first 2 months in Sydney and settled enough to take the time to do this properly:
 I travelled from Seoul to Sydney on the 30th of December 2019, and I was lucky enough to have my first flight with Asiana airlines! My journey had started the day before; I went from Paris to Frankfurt on the 29th, and from Frankfurt to Seoul. I still had an 8hours layover in Incheon before the last flight that would take me to my destination: Sydney. I was exhausted during my South Korean layover; I was carrying quite a few pieces of luggage with me, and I fell asleep on a couch in the airport.   When the time came to board into my OZ 0601 flight, I grabbed my stuff (or so I thought..) and boarded. About a second before the airplane’s doors were closed, I realised I had forgotten some of my stuff under the seat I had fallen asleep on, inside the airport. And crazily enough, that precise stuff was actually the most precious to me: my laptop and external hard drives. Although I need the laptop to work on a daily basis, my external hard drives contained my whole personal AND professional life of the past 10 years, and I was absolutely hopeless. The crew told me that there was no way I could go get my belongings back because the plane had to take off very soon. I saw those airplane doors closing right in front of me, and I felt completely lost, angry at myself, and helpless.. Very soon after that and a bit before taking off, a very nice flight attendant (H.E Jeon) came to me and told me that they would do their very best to help me. A very kind man (whom I think was the cabine crew manager), C.W.Sung came to speak to me shortly after to ask me more details about my belongings and their whereabouts, and assured me they were doing everything they could. He came back to me a couple of times to ask for more details and follow up on what was going on: if I understood well, one of their staff at Incheon airport (Ms. Ham) went to the place I had forgotten my belongings and retrieved it before handing it to her boss, Mr.Shin. C.W Sung explained me that one of their team members would take it with them on the next flight from Seoul to Sydney, and that I should get everything back within 48hours.Obviously, while feeling truly relieved that my stuff was found by Asiana Airlines employees, I was still pretty shaken up and I knew I wouldn’t feel absolutely serene until I could physically retrieve it, in Sydney. Mr. Sung and his team were very, very kind at all stages though, and as a matter of fact, within 48 hours, after a few phone calls and an extra round trip to Sydney airport, I did retrieve everything at Asiana Airlines’ offices at Sydney’s airport.  It is the first time I go live somewhere that far away from home, and it was also the first time I lost something that I held so close to my heart. So I guess the reason I am writing today is to let you know that your Asiana Airlines team did an amazing job in terms of client services that day, and I will not forget it. I truly wanted to thank them again for everything they did, for their professionalism and kindness, and also for having been top notch human beings!

Thanks again Asiana Airlines, can’t wait to fly with you again!

Kindest regards,

Lauren

Despite so many trips to Asia, I had never flown Asiana, surprisingly.  I didn't know much about them, but maybe due to bad marketing, for some reason had the impression they were an inferior airline.  Boy, I was WRONG.  Their customer service was great, I was able to do seat selections online (which I usually can't do with other Asian airlines - usually I have to call and request or get to the airport super early). The planes were exceptionally clean and what I think surprised me even more was that the food was amazing. They actually served bibimbap and it tasted awesome. Unlike China Easter or Southern, the air hostesses were very friendly.  I would definitely put this on par with ANA airlines if not even better.

By the way, Asiana has amazing business lounges at Incheon Airport in Korea.  Highly recommend!

The only thing i would say is this and the airline should take much better action in the future:  on my flight from Seoul to Cebu City, some dumb, loud-mouthed American guy started screaming and cursing at the top of his lungs. The cabin lights were on while the plane was taking off.  Suddenly, about three rows behind me, this American guy starts screaming at the top of his lungs ""TURN THE F'N LIGHTS OFF!!!!!!  WHY ARE THE LIGHTS ON?!?!  I'M TRYING TO SLEEP!!! FFFFF"" - He kept doing this for about twenty minutes. People on the plane were scared out of their mind and started moving to the front part of the plane since they were scared of this passenger and his violent screaming and cursing.  If this were a flight in the USA, the plane would have landed and he would have been removed from the flight and put in jail.

actually took an Asiana flight up from Sydney to Seoul ( 2 nights ) and then onto London. while the attendants are not experienced and service is average at best. the food ( especially the Bibimbap) was good.  all way in economy but the seats are not too bad and wasn't uncomfortable. the movie selection was okay as well with some great Korean movies ( subtitles)

Flight itself was as good as emirates or etihad. I prefer everybody in business getting there food service at the same time unlike the big players were it’s dine anytime. There is always somebody clinking glasses and cutlery. The seat was comfy although a mattress would have been good. The thing letting this airline down for me is the entertainment. When you have a long flight each segment has the same videos and on the return it was again the same videos. Staff were accommodating and best of all they served Drambuie my tipple. Had a stop over in Incheon and I wish I could say it was good but the premier best western was cold and the food poor.

We flew a return flight in business class from London Heathrow to Sydney, Australia via Seoul on Asiana airlines.  We flew on an A350 aircraft from London to Seoul that had 28 seats in business class in a 1-2-1 configuration with all seats having aisle access.  Check in was efficient and we were invited to use the United Airlines lounge in Terminal 2 prior to departure.  The lounge provided comfortable seating and a good range of food & beverages, but was about 20 minutes walk after passing through airport security,  but close to our flight departure gate.  The service and comfort of the plane was excellent.  There was a good choice of tasty food (both Western and Korean) and a selection of fine wines and champagne, as well as soft drinks and tea/coffee.  We had a 4 hour stopover in Seoul on the outward trip and went to the Asiana lounge. The lounge had plenty of seats and offered a limited selection of food and beverages. All of our flights ran to schedule and in fact typically landed early with luggage promptly deivered at final destinations. The second leg of our outward journey was on an A380 with 64 seats on the upper deck in business class in a 1-2-1 configuration with all seats having direct aisle access.  There was a reasonable choice of movies and TV channels to watch on each sector of our return journey.  Food & beverages throughout the journey were good, with reasonable choice and excellent service. On the return journey from Sydney, we had a 19 hour connection time in Seoul. We could check our luggage in at Stdney all the way back to UK so you needed an overnight bag.  As part of our ticket, we were provided with transfers to/from an airport hotel and also provided with vouchers for the room, dinner and breakfast before being taken back to the airport at noon the next day for our onward flight to Heathrow.  The cost of two return business class tickets with Asiana airline was the same as ONE return ticket with Emirates airline.  Asiana is rated as a 5 star airline and we would cetainly recommend them and fly with them again.  They are a member of Star Alliance so you can get your air miles awards either with Asiana or another member of Star Alliance.

Asiana Airlines delayed 1 hr 20 min for departure, but they provide excellent services the whole way through tasty meals, good quality real stainless silverware, and friendly smiling faces.  I pre-ordered seafood meals, and they served very good various seafood dishes.  I highly recommend to pre-order seafood meals!  There is good legroom for economy class for my long legs. The only thing I can complain here is the Entertainment for foreign movies without English subtitles so I could not understand them at all.

We were attending a wedding and visiting family in the Philippines last December. Since having lived in Korea for several years, we always flew Asiana Airlines after trying Korean Air and a few other American carriers. The American carriers were a nowhere near the level of service that most Asian carriers provide. Korean Air was a very good airline. But Asiana somehow just felt a lot better.  Their new planes, the food, the entertainment, the flight attendant's demeanor and care all made you feel like you wanted to fly a few hourse more, even if you were alreayd flying the long haul!
Even Economy had sufficient leg room, good meals, free slippers and great service!  I'd fly with them again.

I flew to Seoul from London for a conference and was extremely impressed by the standard of the airline and quality of service. It was a direct flight and the seat I had with extra leg room made the long journey less of an ordeal. The food was very good and the airline crew were attentive and courteous. I will certainly fly on Asiana again if the opportunity arises.

I hadn't heard much about Asiana until my travel agent booked it for my dive holiday to Palau and I'm VERY glad I travelled with them. The condition and space even in economy was amazing and well the slippers....nice touch. Great food and fantastic service and USB port for charging phones etc and great entertainment on a very reliable system. Connected in Seoul to Koror, Palau and was kept up to date with any gate or flight departure changes. Also part of the Star Alliance Network so was able to accrue Air-miles to my Lufthansa Miles & More account.
Amazing Airline, Amazing Service......AMAZING ASIANA AIRWAYS!

ディナーのフライトミールが韓国食と洋食から選べて、韓国料理は凄く満足でした。ロングフライトにはエコノミークラスでは機内用スリッパと歯ブラシが配られ、個人的に歯ブラシの毛質が柔らかく好印象！韓国料理ではセルフでコチュジャンを入れるので辛さの調節もできます。勿論食後は少しニンニクの臭いが…でも美味しいのでok。食後、韓国の方はすぐに歯を磨きにトイレが混み合います。笑。沢山の方がフライト中トイレ前でストレッチをされるのでトイレ周りの席は人で混み合います。CCのアテンドはあっさりしています。簡単な日本語対応可能なCCも見受けられました。往復共に凄く良いフライトでした。
It was comfortable flight for me. You can select from 2 kind of flight meal. Korean or Western style. On my pictures were Korean style. They serve flight slippers and toothbrush set as an amenity set.

This trip was arranged by ASAP tickets and ASAP gets a C+ since they didn't jive with Asiana. 
Food and drink service surpassed my expectations. Large variety and quick athletic stewards and stewardess help.
3 flight segments over with United and 3 flight segments back supposedly were seat assigned.

The first United segment was late leaving San Diego and created a time problem for the next Asiana segment to Korea. We don’t recommend San Diego to LAX Flight; better to drive than wait for delayed departures.
We ran thru LAX trying to find and then catch our Asiana flight. A map of LAX and Inchon,
Korea airport gates would have helped. We were delayed leaving LAX then arriving at Inchon, South Korea. I didn’t get an aisle seat as expected far from the 
3 older passengers. (Wife,  Brother and Sister in Law)
I had cramps cooped up in the small inside seat for 6000 miles so I had to stretch 
for hours when I could. Inchon arrival required running for the next flight. 
Another delay leaving Inchon and subsequent arrival in PI. No bags at Manila,PI so 
3 hour delay for bag delivery arrangement the next day to our destination in 
Dagupan. 
Asiana airlines 24 hour Confirmation was impeded by the lack of a correct browser on our iPhone After 4 hours attempting to confirm our next day flight Using a Safari browser, I asked my frequent flyer friend in PI to help. Google Crome is the only browser that works with Asiana Airlines she found out for us. Then we had to regurgitate the birthdates, full names and Passport information already provided to ASAP tickets before we could ALMOST complete the confirmation. My brother Mark was  NOT confirmed beyond S Korea. Upon arrival there he was interrogated and triple checked for whatever then finally processed confirmed.
Returning 3 segments were much less hurried and better seats were given after my wife complained about the hassles to the Asiana rep in Manila.
SUMMARIZATIONS and RECOMMENDATIONS:
1. Recommend NO to Air travel from San Diego to Los Angeles. 
2.Take terminal maps.
3. TELL your Asiana airline customers GOOGLE CROME is the ONLY BROWSER
     that works on their Confirmation system.
4. Asiana Airlines needs to coordinate better with ticketing agents IRT seat assignments 
     taken by ASAP TICKETS and NOT require regurgitation of Passenger names,                          
     birthdays and Passport numbers. 

On the positive side, our ASAP ticketing agent, Artemis was extremely patient with us.

Archie Stagg

They are making so many delays.

One hour delay this time.

Only their giving info. ASAP was good.

Poor entertainment, poor food.

We flew from round trip from Seattle to Bangkok in Dec 19/Jan 20. The airline did not offer economy plus or extended seating, so those of us who have long legs had to be be very patient. The flight attendants did a good job of taking care of the passengers. Food was interesting. Pilots did a nice job of landing. Would rate this higher if they offered more leg room.
Comfortable Economy seats, good service and food, Fares on the Australia to Korea route are not as competitive as Australia to Europe or America, but the service with Asiana is great.

No more flying Asiana for me. The lost one of check in again with perishable goods inside so it's no good even if they find it later. They boarded us 30 minutes late in Saigon. Then we got stuck in traffic for another 20 minutes before we took off. It took us another 20 minutes to taxi to our gate and another 10 minutes to deplane. Another 20 minutes to get through screening even though we were transferring. I got on my connecting flight to SFO and everybody was seated and I had this feeling like everybody was waiting on me and that I caused the connecting flight to be delayed. I felt bad about that but it wasn't my fault. It was Asians's fault. I seated then the cabin crew announced that they would like to apologize for the delay due to late arrival of passengers. Was it really my fault? That the origin flight was late? No!
Luggage  was delayed due to taal volcano was moved from oz701 to oz707  and had to pay for double  transportation

The Asiana personnel on the ground and on the plane were super friendly and helpful.  The flight was very smooth and the food was great too.  The other passengers were probably some of the nicest most understanding passengers I’ve ever been near.  This was a 16 hour flight and I didn’t hear any complaining even though there were several crying babies on the flight.  I’ve been on shorter flights within th US where the passengers have been disturbingly rude over the slightest inconvenience, so this was a pleasant surprise.  I traveled with a teenager and an eleven year old and everyone survived and enjoyed the flight as much as one can on an overnight flight.
Incheon Airport is great. Wish they had more of the beds to lay down on. The flight was comfortable especially with the foot rests available. The food is always great with Asiana.

There was a lot of legroom for an economy seat. Usually my knees touch the back of the seat in front of me but not on this flight. Also the food was not bad. There was a choice of pasta and a Korean dish. I chose the Korean dish. And staff were helpful and accommodating. Didn’t mind the inflight entertainment but could do with more movies. Easy check in at Seoul.

Very long flight, 13.5 hours in the air. Good, attentive service with variety of food and drinks. Strangely, no korean food on the outbound trip. Great entertainment choices, plenty of movies from top Hollywood choices to many European and Asian ones. Seats were OK, as always, could be bigger. Only airline providing nonstop service between South Korea and Portugal. Keep in mind, that depending on your booking, you may only get some part of full frequent flier milage.

Had 2 flights with Asiana Airlines on same day, both were great. Excellent airplane service with friendly staffs plus in flight meals were tasty.The most importantly flight tickets were quite cheap compared to the other Korean airlines. I would be happy to recommend Asiana Airlines to my friends and hope to choose Asiana for my next flights in the future as well.

I got confused with my flights and needed to rebook. The service was really nice and put me directly on the waiting list at the airport and explained everything very well. I made a very cheap rebooking ensurance before and so i didnt need to pay extra. Was totaly worth it.
Unfortunately the flight has a delay but we war getting free food and regular updates due to the status. Still i am very happy with the service and looking forward having bibimbap on the plane which i always have when i fly with asiana air.

Seats were old and entertainment screen was very small. Food was quite disappointing. Had fried rice and the ingredients were very limited.

Only 4 Hollywood movies to choose from!

The airline feels very “Budget”. Only saving grace was the Stewardesses and the pilot. Take off and landing were smooth. Stewardesses were polite and professional.

Flight has no USB for charging.

They refused to print my ticket after keeping me on the phone for over 35min asking me to prove my flight information. They asked me different question that required me to show evidence of purchased tickets and boarding passes, and visa stamps and I answer everything. I was very cooperative. I provided them with everything they asked of me and at the end of the 35min I was told they couldn’t do anything to help me and that they could not print my boarding pass. Why on Earth did you waste 35 min of my time? I bet they were expecting me to not have any documentations but I did. They are the reason why I’m in this mess. They delayed the flight by 2 hours in Dec 2019 causing me to miss two flights. Then they provided me with no solution other than taking a flight the next day and have to pay for a hotel and two other flights. So I took the cheapest route and NOW that I’m at the airport they are telling me I cannot board the plane for the flight from Hong Kong to JFK and they cannot do anything about it. 

I want my money back. When I booked the flight months ago I booked for a specific time. And they delayed it by 2 hours. That’s not what I agreed to. So I have to accommodate their mistake and now they won’t help me. They have left me stranded in another country.

I’m overall impressed with Asians except the checkin process.

They have limited counters open to handle the masses of customers.

I had an early flight, and arrived at six am in the morning. There were literally more than two to three hundred passengers waiting in line with six counters opened for check in.

No matter where you are flying , you have to wait in the same line of six counters .

Before they let you checkin with three hundred people , you have to line up to self checkin with passport !? Many were anxious not to miss their flight.

I cannot imagine how busy it would be if not during early morning and holiday season.

While saying that , the flight was comfortable and the food was satisfactory. They serve traditional bimbimbap for meals, with authentic hot sauce :)

As everyone knows, the flights between Seoul and Beijing have one of the most strange  kind of experience of the world. You can see lots of Chinese taking over the ground of the waiting area of the gate, packing up there luggages. And they will carry their huge bags on the plane, and spend ages on the passages, step on the seats to put them into the cabin. If this is an airline from China, you can see the stewardess shouting rudely to them all the time, and they take it so easy.

But, fortunately, it was an Asiana flight. The crew always deal with them very politely and effectively. I took the first two Asiana flights this time for Korea trip. they kept their high quality service from the first minute to the end. And the food is definitely one of the best in the world. Air food you know. The space between Economy class seats is obviously bigger than others. All the things shows that this airline is very happy to give the passengers a better experience. Ok, I get it, and I will choose it next time.

Firstly, the staff are great, really friendly and I had no issue with their service.
