The food is not great, the entertainment is atrocious with minimal selection and the business class lounge at Fiumicino is absolutely disgusting for what you pay for a business class experience. The staff all do their best with the product they are paid to sell. I won’t fly them again as there are much better carriers for Business class, we just tried them given their ‘5 star’ rating, which should be downgraded.

Just flew Sydney/Paris with Asiana Airlines which provides a hotel stay in Seoul mid trip.  Flying daytime to Seoul, overnight in a comfortable hotel bed, then flying daytime to Paris, helped reduce the jet lag normally experienced on this route.  Asiana Business Class has exceptional and attentive service. The flatbeds are well designed and very comfortable.  The entertainment has less variety than most airlines - but still adequate to ensure an enjoyable flight. The Korean food during the flight is fresh, well prepared and of a high quality.  Highly recommended, especially for those prone to jet lag and love Korean food!

We used Life Miles to book a reward ticket from Nagoya to Incheon on Asiana Airlines.  It was our first time flying them and we were able to use the priority check in lanes due to our Star Alliance Gold status.  Also used the Star Alliance Gold Lounge at NGO airport.

The plane was not full so there were quite a few empty seats.  Between the 2 of us, we got an empty seat between us.  The flight time was a little less than 2 hours and they served a hot meal with non alcoholic drinks.  Our baggage came out really quickly.  It was on the baggage carousel by the time we finished with immigration.  Asiana handed out immigration cards on the plane to complete for entry into Korea.

Once in ICN airport, we used the convenient Airport Bus to get to our hotel.

In general the First Class lounge is ok, staff are super attentive . The First Class lounge though is much the same in terms of food and drink as Asiana’s two business lounges at the same location. It is much quieter and less busy which is nice, on my visit there were young child running around like is was some type of play area , was not impressed  with that, especially when trying to get some rest or do some work in the private booth seating.
On my visit there was only one toilet cubicle working, the other was out of order.

Our family of 4 just completed a trip with Asiana, and overall, we were very happy with the experience. Almost all 4 of our flights were delayed, but we traveled during the holidays, so that easily could have been caused by increased air traffic. 
All food served was absolutely delicious. Even our kids loved everything!
We appreciate that they include one free checked bag per person, and that they did their best to sit us next to each other, without charging an extra fee for seat assignment.

A great flight that I wouldn't hesitate to take again. It left on time, the food was good, the inflight entertainment was great and the flight attendants did a great job. It was a full flight and they were always available when needed. After a bad experience flying Cathay Pacific long haul in business class, this was a refreshing change. Well done Asiana!

There are many airlines that you can use to get to Asia but when you want to fly a very comfortable and not terribly expensive route you can choose either Asiana, Korean air or one of the American carriers that services Asia from America.

Asiana airlines has very beautiful, accommodating and friendly staff. They’re new or airplanes such as the A380-800 are very comfortable, very spacious and very quiet for the long flight. Asiana also operates the 747 which is not as luxurious as the A380.

I flew economy on a Asiana and business class.

What I like most is that easy Asiana is less expensive than some of the direct, non-stop flights that you might take on Singapore airlines or Philippine Airlines to go to Singapore or the Philippines. Unfortunately this means that you will have to stop in South Korea which will add at least two hours to your journey.

Asiana should change their color scheme because their interiors look drab and boring despite the cleanliness. They need brighter, more welcoming colors.

Surprisingly clean aircraft. Service was good throughout flight and attendants quite alert to demands from various passengers.
Announcements in English, Korean and Chinese - to cater for diverse passengers on board.
Food was also good

I fly this airline frequently and am always impressed with the service. The flight attendants are always attentive, pleasant and professional. Seems all their flights go through Incheon so there some layover but the airport is nice with facilities like showers (no charge) and sleeping areas.

Family travelling with teenage kids. Love the ease of their website from tickets booking to online checkin. The flight itself was smooth, the flight attendants attentive. Food was v good. We had salmon. Good overall experience overall.
Worst airline I have ever booked. Messed up customer's information and cancelled the flight on us like it was our fault. Don't recommend this airline at all.
Comfortable seats, good service, friendly staff. In flight toothbrush. Meal is ok. Definitely fly with Asiana again

Started off with a delay which totally sucked but what can you do when it snows? The in flight slippers and toothbrush are great. Meals are served 1-2 hours after lift off and before landing. The bathrooms were always clean. Seat reclines more than other airlines I've been on. Leg room was average. Selection of movies was actually pretty good! There was Hollywood, family, Korean and Asian movies and TV shows. 
The food was average. Definitely choose the western option and it's always beef (from what I've ate). They do have snacks (rice crackers, whipped cream sandwich, cookies) but you have to ask or go find them in the back. 
Service was average. Not ignored but not overly serviced either. 
Got my luggage in a timely manner and check in was always pleasant.

Do not use this airline. This airline has no ability to change seats even when you check in online. Compared to other airlines the seat assignments are pretty flexible. The layover is way too long. 

Stay away from Asiana!!!
Comfortable seats, good movies, friendly staff & short layover in Seoul Korea. Far better than US carriers that have gone down in quality lately.

The layover at Incheon airport are overly long. 12 hours out bound and 14 hours inbound. But this was mitigated by a Free City Tour if the layover occurs in the daytime. Night time you have a choice of checking into the Transit Hotel or sleeping in the roomy and well appointed travelers lounge and Nap Zone if you don't mind lying down among total strangers and occasional loud snorers!  A free Shower Room with towels is also available but the towel supply runs out fast and are replenished only on a set schedule -- not as they are used up.  All the free facilities are of course available on a first come first served basis. The down side is the food shops close at 9:30 pm and do not open until 6:30 or 7:00 am.  There are also no vending machines available even for drinks.

Took Asiana because of limited availability at other airlines to fly from Singapore to Seoul. It was a night flight, that took off with a 45min delay, at 02:30 am. The flight time is about 6 hours. The ticket was relatively expensive at around US$1000 for an economy seat. 
I was hoping to get some sleep, as I was supposed to arrive early Monday morning. The service was limited. I was offered a drink only once, perhaps because the cabin crew expected everyone to sleep anyway. 
The most disappointing of all was the legroom of the seats. I am 182cm tall, and there was no way I could sit, without having my knees press against the seat in front of me. After takeoff, the chair in front of me reclined. After that, it became impossible to sit, sleep, or do some work. The flight became an endurance test. 
I still have to fly back to Singapore later today and, I am not looking forward to that. Let's hope it is not too bad. Otherwise, it will be my last time with Asiana.

Asiana Airlines treated me not in the best way that they could. Inspite of seeing that we were traveling as a couple they mentioned that they can give us seats together only if we paid 50,000 KR W per person. This clearly showed that they had options of givings us seats together but they wanted to MAKE MONEY by giving us seats together. Its shocking that we had one TICKET and they wanted to make money out just issuing boarding passes together. 

In the airline, their service was equally bad, per my request for a Hindu meal, the quality of the meal was EXTREMELY POOR. In snacks round they gave just a BUN and when I said, its not a eatable snack, they mentioned ""I can return it to them"".

One of the WORST flight experience I have had in the recent times.

Never going back again.
Comfortable business class flight without any problems. On time. Well trained staff. Nothing to criticise.
Fantastic crew. Great food. Great interior design and seats. Very nice journey. It went to fast. Didn't have time to look at the inflight entertainment.
Flying from Seattle to Manila with a layover in Seoul.. Flight was very smooth...we didn't experience turbulence.  Flight attendants are very professional.

flew as a family. 2 adults and 2 kids, didnt have all 4 seats together but we able to sit in pairs right behind each other. Worked just fine, we have older kids, 6 and 8 years old. ordered kids meals before the flights. they were great. there is an in flight entertainment, even on shorter flights between Tokyo and Seoul

It was a bliss flying from Manila - Incheon - Barcelona even though I had long layover in Seoul. Incheon Airport was fantastic for transient passengers. 
Airline service was very good Manila - Seoul friendly crew nice service although there was a leak from my seat mates carry on luggage.  
Seoul - Barrcelona was good but crew was not as friendly as Manila / Seoul. Food was okay, plane was clean.  Inflight entertainment was good. Could use a charger though.  
Flight was on time no hazzle. Ground crew was okay except the Barcelona return flight. Overall the flight service is recommendable.

Outstanding customer service.  I left a bag in the overhead compartment and did not realize until I was home.  I left it on my connecting flight in Seoul.  However, Asiana placed the bag on a flight to LAX and I had a friend retrieve it for me.  Asiana representatives were very responsive and the attendants on the flight were warm and friendly.

I went as part of a group and had no choice in airline class.  The service was pretty good for economy class, as was the food.  The seats were comfortable and the entertainment options were great on the way there.  The same choices being the same options on the way back was a drag.  But the flight on the way back was less congested and was much more pleasant.  There you are.
Good service and cosy airplane.I like the movie lists.It was just the food served didnt really tasty and didnt really have much to offer

I was flying from Seoul to Jakarta. The flight was a bit delayed for taking off due to air traffic. The service was ok. The flight attendant was not deft enough. The food was delicious. I chose chicken pasta. Unfortunately there was not many variety of beverages. They don't have apple juice.

This flight was in the afternoon time, however the weather was not good at all. It was drizzling in Jeju and also raining in Seoul. However, the flight was not delayed and it still flight at the arranged time. In the middle of the flight, the turbulence were quite bad, but the pilot were professional to handle it. Even, we experienced a thunderbolt beside our plane but the plane was still good. It's really a shocking experience. Overall, this airline is really good

Asiana is a very pleasant airline to fly with. The economy seat pitch is quite decent, food is reasonable and staff are lovely.
Asiana offers a free hotel stay in Seoul if you buy a return ticket from Sydney to Europe with them. But be warned, the process can be a nightmare. I forgot to ask in sydney about the process so perhaps I missed an information sheet. Ground staff at Incheon were not especially helpful and kept sending me to various location around the airport. I managed to rack up 2.5kms of walking!

If you have a hotel as part of your ticket, do NOT go through the transfers section of the airport. Instead go through immigration, writing ‘Asiana hotel transit’ in the address field. 
Your bag should be checked through to your final destination (check your luggage tag) so proceed with your hand luggage through customs.
Once through customs, walk left to the very far end of the terminal. You will eventually arrive at an Asiana service desk where they will hand you a voucher for a hotel.
A shuttle bus will transfer you to the hotel. I stayed at the howard johnson hotel (15minutes drive) which was very comfortable. They do give you a dinner and breakfast voucher however with all the frigging around at the airport we arrived just as the hotel dinner service was closing. We were served a big plate of fried chicken and rice when all I really felt like was a salad.
Fortunately the shower was great and the big bed was a pleasure to stretch out in.
Breakfast was a hearty affair. And the airport shuttle the next morning departed on time. (Unlike my connecting flight to Istanbul...).

I might fly Asiana again and will do the stopover now that I’ve worked out the process. Hopefully this post might prevent some weary travellers from my exhausting experience when transitting through Incheon. Asiana could have made the whole process a lot easier by having an information sheet readily available however I’m starting to think that they want people to give up and just crash out in the airport...

I loved this airlines.  The ride was smooth.  It was an 1 1/2 hr. long, smooth.  We were served lunch a few minutes after the plane reached it's altitude.  The food was tasty, warm and filling.  It was pretty quiet.  The crew was friendly.
I also took this airline on the return to ICN.
Great flight!!

Booked 'red eye' flight 23:55 on Asiana, arrived at airport & viewed monitor & flight delayed for hour, no real reason explained until asked at gate & was informed due to plane change > flight was packed, did not see any empty seats > it appeared Asiana Airlines decided at last minutes to change planes to pack more passengers onto flight (due to code share flight with many airlines) > if airlines is to make a plane change they should change on time, should not delay passengers for airline reasons. Foods was very poor, recommend avoiding the fish meal, wonder if people who prepared food taste the meals they prepare, if they did they would not serve it. Coffee was so weak & not hot therefore also should be avoided. Do not recommend this flight.

I was torn between good and average.
My JFK leg my special meal was still frozen. I actually think they mixed up meals at the caterer. I know its not all airlines fault but they had better provider my previous flights. The crew constantly comes thru cabin with refreshments and snacks on demand. The wifi on the A350 is awesome was only 25usd for the whole flight. 
On the ICN to MNL they need update planes entertainment system is old and outdated and no powerports.

Delayed flight as normal , aircraft 330 old style 2-4-2 config, no frills service , night time flight and was pleasantly surprised at choice of meal which included fresh fruits which I selected and was happy with. Not a bad airline to travel with but would suggest they get their arrivals and departures sorted as in leaving on time. 4 times I have now traveled with them and while this delay was of 30 mins which was not bad compared to the previous ones on 90 mins up due 2.5 hrs

I took Asiana 3 times this year to fly to Asia, never been disappointed.  They are prompt, on time, efficient in off-boarding and on-boarding all passengers (exactly 30 minutes from start of boarding this big airplane, A350-900, to pushing off the gate).  Service in Business class is superb, far exceeds United's, Air France, Delta, and Lufthansa.  The seats were very comfortable, can lie flat, and I got a good night sleep each time. All flights from and to west coast take off in the late evening, which is good timing.  Food was hit or miss; had one Korean meal which was fantastic, while a more recent beef stew which was very mediocre.  Last trip was delayed at SFO because of weather, missed my connection flight in ICN, Asiana agent met us at the gate, directed us to the right place where we got a bus ticket to transfer to another airport in Seoul where our tickets were booked by Asiana on their partner airline.  Only thing is that the espresso machine was broken on half my flights, very disappointing.  Overall, excellent experience, I would take Asiana to Asia every time.
This is the first time I travel by using this airline.  Over my expectation.  Cabin were clean and services was good
Not bad . No frills like small snacks. I guess you get what you pay for . I guess no extra effort from flight attendants? Since economy 🤔

Flying business class on this long flight was really nice. We got to lay flat and sleep. There was plenty of space in the seat. The food and drinks were good. We did not use their entertainment system since we brought our own so cannot comment on that.

Flight attendants were very polite, helpful, space b/w seats seemed average (well it is an economy) but a bit too tight, the individual screen for flight entertainment was not a bit not bright, I believe that Lufthansa and Air Astana have better ones...

Been flying this airlines for many years. Never had a problem that the can not remedy.   
 The Cabin crew is always nice and courteous The meals have always been good. I will fly on this airlines again

I had travelled Toronto to Incheon on an Air Canada flight, uncomfortable, cramped and largely ignored by cabin staff. After a short break in Korea, I boarded a flight in Incheon - and contrary to expectations, has an extra 4 inches of leg room (in regular economy class) lots of attention and a fine meal. 
Don's hesitate to fly Asiana, you might be pleasantly surprised.

The plane is a bit old, so the interior was a bit worn, however, overall clean and tidy. I liked how the restroom was stocked with toiletries that you might need to use and restroom always smelled fresh. The staff predominately speaks Korean so some of their English is not that great. I believe Korean patrons could expect the best service because the attendants are a lot more amicable and friendly toward them. Regardless, good flight experience and we paid a reasonable fare for business which is why we flew with them.

Hkg to Seoul is mid night meal prawn is good but rest not really good, champagne is nice seat is very good and lay down for sleep . Seoul to Nagoya is morning flight but the salmon very delicious and my mum order the beef , she love it specially the sauce ,we surprise we can have this breakfast meal in the Plane we will choose this again

Such a long flight. Asiana was nice enough. Seats were decent for economy. Attendants were very nice. They were constantly feeding us airplane food. I'm always shocked when a plane offers food. Bathrooms were clean for a 13 hour flight. It was as a good a flight as you can have in economy.

Very nice airline, complimentary slippers and earphones.  good recline on seats and leg room for me (I am short).  Food is Korean, a western choice would have been nice, a good introduction to Korean food.  pillow and blanket also provided
Asiana is always one of my go-to airlines for business travel especially destinations off the beaten path.  Everything is good about this airlines, no complaints!

The aircraft operated was A380 and I was assigned to sit on the upper deck where you could find extra space for storage next to yr seat. The seat was as the picture shown and it could be transformed to be 180° flat bed which was super nice for a short haul flight. 

In terms of inflight cuisine, i went for Korean one and it was tasty. The presentation and tasty were amazing, but you may be let down by not offering the bun. Haha. However, the inflight entertainment was disappointing as they didn’t offer a variety of films for non Korean and no English subtitles for most of the vdos.

My wife was pregnant and asked for a seat upgrade from economy to business. We told them we are going to pay for it but they were just too lazy to upgrade for us and lied that there were no more seats left. We got on a plane saw empty seats and asked again to the stewardess. They lied to us again. A long story short Asiana is a trashy ass airline company that i will never consider again. FU

Never ever fly with this airline! My original layover was just under 2 hours, arriving me at my destination on the same day. Airline changed layover, dumping me at an airport in a country I did not plan for 49 hours (in the middle of winter in Seoul). Destroyed my non refundable bookings. Destroyed my accommodation bookings. My 6 months of planning my itinerary and everything I wanted to see in my chosen city. Has put me out about 1000.00 - 2000.00 New Zealand dollars. This review might change if anything actually gets reviewed by them. Until then, I fly out in 10 days and am screening all the inflated airline prices for alternative flights across the internet.

Having taken several flights to Seattle via Asiana , I have to say I’m very satisfied !

Food is good , as example coach meal of steak and potato and mixed vegetables very good. 

Drink and meal selections vs flying a American Carrier so much better with flight crews that care and really want to please their customers .

Asiana also now participates in TSA pre check in the USA and that is a great added plus in travelling convenience.  

Thumbs up for the preferred seating with much more leg room and seating up front which is very nice for the extra $ 150.00 when booking an economy  booking. 

Thumbs up for a really nice service related carrier under the Asiana Brand.

First time fly business class with Asiana airline from my hometown to Seoul on the date 4/11/19 flight OZ742.Everything was perfect especially the staff name 'Kwan Mijin' who really take a good care of me.She is very nice and professional. Next time if I have a chance to get back to Seoul .Never hesitate to choose Asiana airline.

Comparing apples to apples with Korean, Korean wins on minor things. The ottoman in business prevents me from moving my feet when the seat is flat. The other issue is the temperature in the A380 was kept fairly high, and the aircraft doesn’t have individual vents. Great service otherwise.

First flight with Asiana. Very impressed with the layout of the business class cabin, the space available and the service on board. Flight left on time and arrived as per schedule. In flight team very friendly and helpful and a good choice of food offered even though this was a very short flight.

I lost my Phone on the plane and luckily the staff at Asiana was able to find my brand new Samsung Note9. Also, my luggage ended up being delayed because my flight on Alaska airlines left late due to snow and Asiana was nice enough to get my delayed 2x checked Bags, along with my Phone and got all  everything delivered to my Hotel at no extra charge! I rarely review anything but I had to give you guys a big thanks.

Fly from Incheon to Narita, the aircraft was old, but clean, spacious and super comfortable chairs. The flight assistants very professional, the food OK. 1 hour delay for a 2.5h flight. After landing, we skating for about 15m before we reach the gate.

Ms. H.J. Yang, if you have to pick a fight with a passenger on board during a 2 hour flight, maybe you shouldn’t be a flight attendant.

I normally don’t review flights, especially those less than three hours. It takes a lot for me to give a thumbs down here but please do not treat customers like your friends or subordinates. My friend flew on a different flight ( both Asiana, separate route), and we both vowed to never fly it again.

I bypassed the meal, my previous meal was stale and made me sick. I guess for a two hour flight for those who doze off the entire trip, it’ll alright.

Due to a Lufthansa strike, my flight LH786 from Frankfurt to Qingdao was replaced by OZ542 + OZ319 - same route, via Seoul. Never used Asiana Airlines before, it was a very good surprise.
The ""Business Suite"" seat on the Frankfurt - Seoul route was extremely comfortable - I could sleep over 6 hours. 
And on-board service was remarkable on both flights. On the Seoul - Qingdao route, just slightly more than one hour flight - they served in Business a full hot meal, with several servings of drinks -  a good French wine. Very unusual nowadays on such short flights. 
Only the entertainment system was not 100% - not very friendly to use and limited choice of movies.
Check in went very well extremely fast and very pleasant, food on board was excellent, cabin crew were very polite and helpful, seating was very comfortable, very enjoyable long haul flight.
Outstanding flight! The crew was extremely helpful and courteous! I look forward to my next flight with them!
I have been flying with and to date I still haven't any negative to say about mt experience flying with Asiana.  Flight attendant service, punctuality, tasty food, value all A++

Great airline with excellent service. Well maintained restrooms at all times. Flight attendants very friendly and helpful. Confortable seats that fully recline for a nice sleep. 
Movies selection could be better (more selections needed)

I was a bit disappointed with the Airport lounge in O'Hare.  Since my flight is red eye, I was looking forward to resting when I got to the airport early, only to realize that the lounge was packed and so small!  Snacks were so limited at the lounge.  My consolation was that in-flight food was at least better.   I will have second thoughts flying this airline again especially if its a long haul.  I've had better experience with other Asian Airlines.  The staff was naturally very courteous and accommodating to passengers.  In-flight entertainment sucks!  Very few movies and TV shows to choose from.

A pleasant airlines to fly with. I was flying for the first time during my vacation going to Seoul, Korea. They are serving good choices of meal, including Korean meal which was for me tasty. The seat is quite spacious for economy compared to most of the other airlines I fly with. One of the nice things they provide for long flights is a slipper and toothbrush for the passengers.

A long day since you gain a day coming home. Still went fast enough because of the comfort of Business class. Had a window so single seat that lies flat. Food choices were a mixture of western ad Korean - all good.
Early morning flight and arrived at airport with lots of time. Desk spoke English fine. Trip was uneventful and arrived with plenty of time to get to Incheon.
This is just a short flight but it was comfortable enough and the flight attendants were certainly looking after my comfort and pretty much anything I requested.
Very comfortable travel. Flight attendants look after you well. Meals excellent. Seats lie flat and was able to arrive well rested.

I had complained to Asiana but there is still no feedback so I have no choice to post it here. I am Asiana Diamond member; I do love flying with Asiana and I fly almost 100,000 miles with Asiana and Star alliance this year. But there is one problem that Asiana has never tried to fix it. It’s about passenger’s security and privacy.

I always book business class with Asiana but I found out that my bookings have been changed several times without my permission via online and Asiana Region Office. 

The latest time I took a flight from Japan to Korea late October 2019, someone was changing my seat assignment and another passenger in the same booking as me. They changed it twice within 4 hours so I called Asiana Call Center. But unfortunately, the period that I made a call is LUNCH TIME so they cannot do anything and said that I have to call them again after lunch break. This is ridiculous as other 5 stars Airlines I have flew with never have this excuse to customer. I called them back as they had advised but the answer was the same saying they don’t know. So, I asked the operator that who made a change on my booking then they said it was Asiana Region Office. I just landed in Japan that morning and I didn’t make a call so it was very weird that Asiana Region Office changed it by themselves. My seat wasn’t priority seating and there were some seats available so why my seats were changed? At the end call center said they will check what happened and call us back but I never get the call. I decided to ask check-in counter at the Airport on departure date instead of calling call center again because if I make a call they won’t do anything.  

On departure date I was at check-in counter when the check-in counter is opened. I was asking is it possible to get my seat back? But the staff said they can do nothing. They were talking in Japanese among their staff and mentioned that I’m neither Korean nor Japanese so they didn’t even try to help but asking us to accept the situation and write complaints letter to Head Office in Korea. They kept saying that they don’t know anything but actually they’d already checked the system and they knew that my booking was changed by Haneda Center in the evening of the day before departure date. During the time I asked for explanation Asiana Staff at the Airport also said that my booking was changed by another passenger but they cannot do anything. He even told other staff to not telling any information and keep saying they don’t know. Isn’t ridiculous? Why anyone can do whatever they want with my booking easily but Asiana themselves cannot do anything? 

I am really disappointed the way they were working and handling the situation. Is this Asiana service standard? The staff treated me like I’m stupid. I talked to them in English doesn’t mean I don’t understand their language. Why they were hiding the truth? It’s not only me but all the passenger shouldn’t get any treat like this.      

Many people saying that Asiana will never react or have any feedback to any issues that passenger had complained. Now I believe it may be true because none of their staff are trying to solve the problem. Even I sent complaints letter to Asiana I still don’t get any feedback. Is this really 5-star airline? Are you always ignore passenger’s security and privacy like this? 

I hope my experience is useful for you who are reading this.

Firstly, English is not the first language of the flight crew or ground staff in Incheon, which made the experience worse. The inflight entertainment was poor as well, with only a few movies. Seating was cramped and pre-assigned seats for me and my travel partner for our flight back to Singapore were not together but far apart. I’ve only experienced this when booking with budget airlines, because they want you to pay to reserve a seat. Upon reaching the bag drop counter, we requested to change seats only to learn we needed to top up 50,000 won to do so. Overall a subpar experience and will not fly with asiana again.

Asiana is a premier airline. The seats are a bit larger than most US airlines so even the economy seats feel very comfy. Attentive flight attendant staff. Check in and boarding are generally a breeze.
Our expectation was a bit high since we had to pay 5x the price from competitors. Plane is very spacious but very disappointed with the food. Staff was a bit arrogant as well.
The check in service was friendly and efficient but the boarding service was a little haphazard. The onborrd service was professional and efficient with a good meal service.

My wife and I recently flew to and from Seoul on Asiana Airlines.  The women at the ticket counters on both sides could not have been more accommodating.  The service on the plane was pretty uninterested both ways.  They have a tough job and there are lots of people they are serving.  But the stewardesses don't seem to care about you at all.  On the flight over, my wife was so thirsty at one point she was upset, as she could not get any of their attention.  hen she pressed the service button, she was told they would do a drink service within an hour.  We made sure to bring water on the plane on the way back, which was a less crowded and more pleasant flight.  They serve 3 meals, but the food is just ok. They have a pretty good movie selection, though the majority are poor commercial films.  Their audio can only be accessed with the old school two prong airline plug.  I'm sure it is much better in business and first class.  We were on a tour and could not upgrade our seats.  Could not pay for extra leg room or early boarding. I would only fly on this line again if I was going business class or above.

Pro:
* Lovely service.
* Delicious food.
* Decent drinks.
* Very comfortable seat with aisle access.
* Absurdly well-stocked on-board bathrooms.
* Free wifi.

Neutral:
* Lounge food was meh.

I caught a business class between Seoul and SF. This was the last of a string of flights, during which I flew from SF to Seoul to Delhi to Bangkok to Seoul back to SF. So, please pardon me if some details are fuzzy.

Anyhow, when I read online reviews for Asiana business class, the near total agreement is that the cabin is dab and the food is merely OK (as opposed to China Airlines, who supposedly had beautiful cabin and awesome food and service). My experience was the reverse, for both airlines cited.

First, about the cabin, I found Asiana cabin to be quite bright and nice. I don't know, maybe lack of sleep for 3 days dim my expectation?, but the color tone felt bright and happy.

The seat was excellent! I was in 6A, which was one of the window seat on the window. There was no door, but I had a giant table separating me from the aisle. Privacy was never an issue. The seat was completely lie-flat, and was very *very* comfy. I slept for about 5h straight and woke up quite rested. I can't fault the hard product in anyway.

The onboard food, again contrary to online reviews, was very good. I chose Korean for dinner and western (beef stew) for lunch. The ssambap was an interesting style of the well-trodded bimbimbap. The rolling was fun (I bet I would have had more fun if I had not been so tired), and the fermented beans gave quite a delicious edge to the food. The dessert was interesting. The beef stew was soft and flavorful, although I would have appreciated more sauces.

Drinks were good. They served me (at my request, of course) one delicious champagne, one disgusting aperitif (to be fair, all aperitif suck; I just forgot that), one strangely average scotch (they said it's Lasanta from Glenmorangie, but it tasted different from my regularly favorite scotch; maybe they had a 2nd choice that I didn't notice), one delicious rice wine, and one out-of-this-world icewine. Yes, I overdrank a bit to catch some eyeshut. Either way, as you can see, the menu was quite extensive with some good choices. After nappy (as pointed out, 5h of bliss), I asked for a cappuccino, but apparently the milk froster was out. Instead, I got an Americano instead, which was OK (not the best espresso).

I quite love the amenity kit, which was from L'Occitan, my favorite brand for hand cream. They covered all the basics: handcream, lotion, lip balm, etc. They also provided the slippers, which were sturdy and usable.

The service was lovely. The cabin manager, Kim, took her time greeting everyone. Everyone was super friendly and attentive. Lovely service, really.

The only thing I disliked was the food at the lounge. Now, the lounge was not bad. They have some nice lie-back seats, and their showers were quite good. They even provided hair gel and shaving kits there. However, the food at the lounge was really meh. This is especially glaring in ICN, whose Priority Pass lounges give excellent food.

Conclusion? One of the best flights in my life.

11hours long trip.
small monitor. / old flight/ Chinese sub only.
This is second worst ever last 10yrs flight.

Take new flight when you consider. Asiana Air has good service but flight is too old.

Not sure how people consider Asiana on par with EVA.. Flew Seattle - Phnom Penh and Bangkok - Seattle with layovers in Incheon. Maybe we just had the older planes but the seats were narrow and very unfriendly to the back. Legroom was fine. For a long haul, we found these seats to be very uncomfortable. 

Service in economy was a little strange. On the Seattle - Korea flight we were offered a small cup of water only four times, no water bottles available for purchase either. Food was okay. Staff was fine, at certain points service seemed very chaotic and rushed. Perhaps flight attendants are understaffed and overworked but they seemed to show very little interest in being helpful. First flight, there were small shrimps in multiple dishes. I’m allergic but have never encountered this issue on a flight, food options are not printed so I did not make a special request. Beware if you have a shrimp allergy. There were also some instances where we were completely skipped over during beverage service as the attendants didn’t even stop to ask us. When given meal options on one flight, I asked what the Ssambap was and received the curt reply of, “It’s Korean food.” When i asked what was in it, the attendant said “It’s made with rice” ...all unhelpful and I didn’t pursue a further exchange because it was apparent she did not care about answering my simple questions. 

Nothing terrible but I almost always fly with EVA in Asia and I didn’t find this to be up to the same standard.

The flight itself and the service provided was fine. However, we had an issue with our booking and tried to contact Asiana but this proved impossible. Called in two different countries but could not get through to Asiana customer service. All I got was a US toll-free number which I could not call from abroad.

The only assistance I got was from an automated web site which to this date (a week after the flight) keeps asking me whether my issue was resolved (without anyone ever looking into it!!!!!)

Asiana Airlines is the no.1 airline of South Korea which is provide the best services for their customer. Actually, I Book Asiana Airlines on 19 Sep 2019. But I am facing lots of problems to get the tickets confirmation for my hand after that I am trying Asiana Airlines manage my booking customer service phone number and talk to Asiana customer executives and told them all problems. The Executive gives me an instant solution on my handset & also provides all details related to ticket confirmation on my handset. I am very happy to take assistance from Asiana Airlines. If Anybody face the same problem & don't be able to find any solution then Dial 1-888-498-3449 this tollfree number.
This was a short travel airline ,so not so big,but flight services were good.crew was good and breakfast also good.Its cheap also.
Fantastic service and comfort, crew could not have been more helpful. Had a free stopover in Seoul which was great. Couldn’t fault this airline.

Flew Asiana for the first time and I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of their business class product on the A380-800. I flew roundtrip JFK to ICN and on both flights the crew were very courteous and attentive (response time to crew call button was about a minute). The suites with flat bed seats were spacious and I specifically like the compartments between the seat and the window as it allowed me to declutter my suite. For my in-flight meals, I chose the Korean dishes which I thought  were decent although it was my first time to eat Bibimbap and Ssambap so no point of comparison for me. I did enjoy the Shin Ramyun (ramen) snack in between meals. The wine selection was good although it was interesting when they didn’t offer champagne as pre-departure drink at JFK but did in ICN. I read somewhere that Asiana didn’t want to pay for the NYC alcohol tax. As for the inflight entertainment, the selection was limited although I rarely watch movies when flying so it didn’t matter much for me. Restrooms were clean and well stocked. The biggest surprise was being told I was only limited to one bottle of water the entire flight...the flight attendant did offer to refill my bottle. Overall it was a pleasant experience and considering the ticket price, I will surely fly Asiana again.

I was really impressed by Asiana!  The plane was a bit of a tired wide body A330.  But it was clean and very comfortable.  The cabin crew were just delightful.  They couldn’t do enough and greeted us with welcoming smiles.  We even got a substantial complimentary meal,  followed by tea or coffee.  Given this was only a ninety minute flight, it was an amazing service.  Toilets were immaculate and the leg room was better then most European carriers long haul product. The flight was on the stand five minutes early and Inchon airport was amazingly efficient.  It only took 35 minutes to clear immigration and customs and was out the other side.  Would recommend!

This is my first time to fly Asiana and  all I can say is that everything is sooo good. From the warmth and hospitality of the crew and ground staff (except for one rude male ground crew), everyone was all smiles and accomodating ,  to the food served in flight which are generously large compared to other airlines in business class. The lounge though needs to be improved. Overall very good!

Our family flew with Asiana from Frankfurt to Seoul and back.
The flight was in general OK & reasonable appart of seating issue.

We booked 4 seats: 2 adults + 2 very small kinds.

During web check-in (40 hours ahead) we were offered seats randomly spread over the entire plane and even on two decks (A380).
I called hotline in Germany and in Korea - no help (similar seating issues with other airlines were always positevely processed by hotline).
On the airport after really neasty and long escalation we were offered 3 seats together but one completly far away. Or for 500€ (!) preffered seating in economy!
At the gate - no help to improve our seating.
In the plane - again no help and an advice to talk to passangers directly and arrange ourselves.
BTW a little better seating, they tried to sell us for 500€ was flying empty - 4 seats together!
On the fly to Seoul we got 2+2 seats, so also no 4 seats together.

I can not simply understand, how the airline can randomly generate a seating for the traveling family with kids and are not able & willing to fix it.
We fly a lot with other airlines and had never, ever such issues.
Boarding was painless and smooth. The entire crew was very professional and provided outstanding service. Meals were good.

.....the catering had been better.
Agreed, you do not take a flight for the food; however, Asiana should take into account that korean/chinese food needs not necessarily be everybody's favorite.
I was having high hopes that on the flight originating from Italy there would have been Italian catering: unfortunately that was not the case. Good that I had with me some homemade raw parma ham sandwiches.
The meals served on the entire flights (Tokyo to Venice and return) were - to my palate - disappointing.

The direct flight from London to Seoul is operated by a brand new A359 with very nice leg rooms. The tip is to do online check-in as early as you can then you might be able to be assigned an economy plus seat. The food is above average with choices including Korean BBQ and spicy chicken rice. I am a star alliance gold member, however, the ground staff at ICN airport told me when I try to use fast boarding: ""Sorry, economy that way."" I had to call her supervisor and asked her: ""Can't you see the *G sign here? Can you teach your staff what does it mean?"".

Great flight.  The meals were only good and rushed  us when we wanted to have a drink.  They did not serve drinks and then offer the meals.  The meal was only average if that.  They were attentive to my wife who needed a wheel chair.

This was a short flight that left on time and arrived on time. Check in was orderly and managed well as was the boarding process.  The food service was basic  and the staff did a good job.Overall it worked.The aircraft was an older Boeing 767 and was fine.

The plane left on time and arrived early although the check-in and boarding was a little 'rougher'than what you might expect in Korea. The plane was an older A 321 and the seats were as bad and small as they get which did not make a comfortable flight which was essentially full. Food was basic and not eaten. The staff seemed cold and disinterested and did their duties without a smile. I was happy to leave the plane.
First time flying with Asiana and we had a great experience. Economy has a lot of space in comparison with another companies. Service excellent and the plane modern and clean.

We had had quite a long wait between flights. Tired and dispirited, we did not really take full advantage of the excellent facilities of Incheon Airport, what we needed was a smooth, relaxing flight. That's exactly what we got.

Orderly boarding, on-time departure. Not a lot of legroom or edible food in the in-flight ""refreshment"" but nobody takes this flight for the joy of flying. We take it to get there safely, and that's what we did.

Pleasant flight crew but not much chance to get to know them on such a short flight.

I don't normally write reviews but as the service I received from Asiana Airlines was exceptional, here goes!
My experience from check-in to baggage claim was always polite and professional,  the food and service was fine. 
What has set Asiana Airlines apart on this occasion was their attention to detail when I had to make a connecting flight at Tokyo Narita Airport to proceed onto London Heathrow with only one and a half hours between landing and taking off again.
I was met by a member of the Asiana ground staff as I left the aircraft and given priority assistance through Security. She then ran with me through the airport for about 5 to 10 minutes to a vehicle which was waiting for me 'air-side'. I was then transported to the correct Terminal for my flight departure. And my checked luggage was also transferred, which I successfully collected at Heathrow. 
Thank you Asiana Airlines. I will definitely fly with you again!

We were at our gate in good time but there was no-one to through check our luggage. When we finally met up with the person responsible, she was kindness and understanding itself. Boarding was delayed and delayed again.

Once on board, though, everything was fine. Friendly welcome, comfortable seats (with almost enough legroom), wide choice of entertainment, reasonably digestible meals.

It's a long flight, and we used the time to make up most of the delay incuureed by our late departure. The pilot gave us several reports on how we were doing with that.

Pleasant, comfortable. A nice way to fly.
I would have given this five stars except that when it came time for dinner I was told they had run out of Korean food and I would have to take a western option. Seems a bit odd for a Korean airline.

Was pleasantly surprised, very clean and the seats were good. Even for the short haul flight we were offered drinks which was nice as we were not expecting it! Service was very pleasant. First time flying Asiana, would definitely fly with them again.

Refurbished older Boeing 767. Stopover was okay - there was a very basic airport hotel for under $ 20. The one-way ticket was only about $ 330 and I would book them again!

Good pilots, friendly hostesses (not sure - no one was dour, sour and hostile to me).

This was the first longer haul flight on Asiana Air and it was a good flight  in a packed A321 in economy. There were no negatives with the flight departing late (a passenger issue not related to the airline) and arrived close to the scheduled arrival time. Food was basic but that is standard on airlines and the seats were fairly uncomfortable and upright, pretty much the usual with all airlines in economy.Check in was good and was boarding.
Very good flight with excellent and professional staff. The food was very good, we had filet of beef and halibut and both were cooked to perfection. The seats were comfortable.

I have a few rules when flying to Asia I try to follow. 
1. I’m a star alliance member and whenever I can, I try to fly a partner. I find it just helps if there are problems along the way. 
2. I always shop for a deal on a business class flight. I find I’m way more functional after arrival going that way.
3. Never ever make a connection through China. Especially if the connection is either a code share or between alliance partners. The success rate is poor at best of making it to your destination. 
So, that brings me to Asiana. It’s one of a few routes I take regularly. Of course, you’re going to fly through Inchon no matter what. Asiana has a good selection of connections in Asia to make it a good choice. 
Business class is nice. Seats are quite comfortable, service is good, food and drinks are what you’d expect. Relatively, it’s still nicer than the new Polaris class from UA most flights. 
The airport itself is new, fresh, modern. One of the nicer terminals in Asia. The lounge is quite nice. I usually spend time taking a shower ( ask when you enter the lounge) and eating.  The only problems are.... if there’s a problem, getting to who can fix it can be a task. There are a couple of ticket desks up stairs you’ll need to find to get things fixed. Lounge level. Asking anyone in say the lounge is a waste of time, 
An issue you’ll run into depending on which connection you’re taking is a long long layover. For that, find the transit hotel. It can be hard to find online. If I’m there for more than 5-6 hours, I’ll try to book a room to sleep a bit. The transit hotel is quite nice. And you don’t have to exit the terminal. 
Asiana.... newer planes are nice. I find A380, A350, or 787 are a huge improvement in comfort and jet lag reduction. Has to do with the cabin pressurization being like 5000 ft and cabin humidity of 30%. 
This particular flight.... went off without any glitches. Boarded early, carry on luggage, nice seated and entertainment selection. Arrived a bit early. 
Overall, it’s not a bad alternative for flying Asia. Always less expensive than SingaporeAir or United. Excellent connections to smaller cities in China ( to avoid PEK or PDG). I prefer Asiana or ANA.

Check in was without issues and so too boarding which was orderly and managed.The aircraft was clean (A321) and the service fairly standard on a short flight. Overall fairly basic short flight without issues.

Arrive early at Kingsford Smith because it’s gate 63 - the farthest gate taking 20 minutes from Customs.
The flight left exactly on time - even though it was a full flight!
The aircraft was a Boeing 777-200 - a little old, with old style seat back entertainment screens. The entertainment was limited so load up your phone or take a book.
The configuration was 3 + 3 + 3.
Why it was civilized was that almost no-one pushed their seats back - My theory is that the pilot did not say ‘sit back and enjoy the flight. It made for a very pleasant flight.
Meals were served punctually - we took off at 9:30am, lunch was at 11:00, the lights were dimmed after lunch, there was a ham and cheese roll snack at 2:30 pm, and dinner at 6:00 pm. 
Lunch was beef with rice, smoked salmon salad and an apple crumble.
Dinner was chicken with mushrooms, a carrot and pea salad and fresh fruit.
We arrived on time after a 10 and one half hour flight. The baggage was slightly delayed but it arrived! Customs took almost no time to clear.
Caught the bus into the city - it’s more than one hour from the airport.
I am looking forward to the return flight. 
See the photos.

Rarely do one find an Airline or business that lives up to their word without a fight. This was no exception, I would have rated them ""excellent"" if not for the jumping through hoops to get the compensation room for the extended layover, Originally, it was stated that the hotel would be compensated if the layover was over a certain amount of hours, which mine was. However; when I inquired about the room , they stipulated that the layover had to be due to something that the airline caused. Fortunately, they had previously changed the my return date. I had to make several phone calls, once  to the office in Los Angeles, which told me it was okay (approved). Later I was informed that it was an error and I did not have the room. I was directed to call still another office in Korea and explain for about the fifth time why I should get the room per their policy. At that time I was informed that it had to be due to the airline's action that caused my date changes, Once I informed them that they had in fact changed my return date, they approved the room. (overnight stay). Once there on the return trip; I was directed to go to a desk located from the gate in the airport in Korea, which was sort of difficult to find; since there were no signs directing us to it. But once we arrived at the desk, they checked on the computer and called a shuttle which took us to the hotel and pick us up the next morning
Some sort of beef dish was served and it was inedible - gristle and a thick sauce. Return flight was better

We were eager to get to the US, maybe that is what made the flight seem so long. It certainly wasn't the airline's fault. Everything was smooth, from the orderly boarding, through the timely distribution of food, drinks, and immigration forms, to the carefully choreographed de-planing. Efficient, thoughtful, well-executed.

In-flight entertainment was limited but enjoyable. Food was far better than most airlines I've travelled in the last few years. Flight crew were available and efficient. There are better carriers across the Pacific, who manage to add a certain star quality to every step of the journey, but for the price we paid, this is as good as it gets.

With Asiana I can always be reassured that my vacation begins and ends on a comfortable note. There is never an issue with anything, from check in to the flight services until the moment you land. Will definitely recommend this to everyone I know. Thank you Asiana! 😊😊👍👍

The staff at the check in counter and lounge are friendly and helpful. The staff on board are also pleasant.

The quality of attention to customer service is as bad as a low cost carrier.

Traveling in Business class I would expect an offer of at least water perhaps juice or a cocktail upon boarding, like most other air carriers around the world. NOTHING  was offered. Even the US carriers, who are no noted for poor service do a better job than this.

My years of travel and experience tell me this is a corporate culture problem. 

As I said, the staff was friendly and appeared professional so I can only deduce that the middle and upper management do not value customer service or the “first impression” on gets when flying on Asiana.

There’s a reason they number 2 and United  Airline should potentially reconsider their affiliation.

I have flown in over 20 airlines and this is the first time I flew this airlines.  The planes were neat and clean, granted it was a new Airbus 350.  The crew was very friendly.  They all greeted the passengers in unison just right after the doors were closed.  The food was excellent.  The portion size and the flavors were fantastic.  It may not be for all as the food was Korean, but I took a chance with a new type of food and was not disappointed.  Even the greens and lettuce were actually nice and crunchy and not soggy as in many airlines.  If that airlines flew out of Houston, I will definitely consider it over United for long distance flights.

We started our journey to the US by flying from Kansai to Incheon. This is a bit counter-intuitive as it is exactly the wrong direction, but this was the least expensive ticket on offer, though certainly not the lowest quality of service. Kind and friendly aircrew made the experience more or less pleasant.

Check-in was noisy, sticky and pretty much chaotic. Whoever thought that electronic check in machines made life simpler for anybody. The staff looked confused, frustrated and overwhelmed. Lack of a clear queuing system meant that we, the passengers, were literally falling over each other in what felt like the survival of the fittest as we jostled for face time with a machine.

Finally getting boarding passes and handing over our suitcases (to a human being!) was a true relief. Security and immigration were also overcrowded, but not quite as chaotic as check in. We certainly had not expected this on a weekday in February.

Compared to all this, actually getting on the plane was bliss. Friendly smiles, welcoming seats, even the air felt less stale. Smooth take off landing, and the bit in between, which really didn't take long. No real entertainment, but not much needed on such a short, serviceable hop. Food, predictably, was more or less indistinguishable from the layers of plastic that it came wrapped in, but it was served so gracefully.

Good airline functioning on a difficult day.

We flew Asiana twice -- from Hong Kong to Seoul and from Seoul to Taipei and both flights were outstanding. Though the flight attendants were not fluent in English, they were professional, friendly, warm and anxious to please. The food served on both flights was exceptional -- and I am one who normally does not like airline food. In addition, the flight check-in and baggage claim were excellent.

Been using them almost 2 decades the airline staff is excellent, their Korean airport staff is offensive and come across a racist(at the very least xenophobic). It is why I went with another airlines this trip. The air service is exceptional,  I like the food, it's fun coming from the West to try everything. The stewardess are beautiful and experts at their jobs. I flew my cat back from Thailand they were exceptional with helping me through customs. The entertainment systems on the long leg flights are getting dated but short leg flight Airbus planes are comfortable.
Excellent Service Comfortable area and great food. Wifi a plus. Top quality service. On time departure and arrival

We flew First Class from JFK to ICN 8/30 then Bus class from ICN to JFK on 9/09. We loved the service and amenities on both. I have flown over 3,000,000 miles. Their first class cabin was one of the nicest experiences I have had. ‬The flight attendants were very helpful and provided great service. The food was excellent.

The A350 of Asiana Airlines was equiped with wifi and a nice and cool screen with multiple features to enjoy.  However some of the functions did not work which was surprising considering that it was quite a new plane.

I had a good flight and sold service , the plane was a nice A350 .
I just bought extra some more legroom .
Everything was fine

Recently went on a trip to Seoul. Breakfast (Jakarta-Seoul) was good - they served porridge. Dinner (Seoul-Jakarta) was GREAT - they served bibimbap with a side of kimchi. In-flight entertainment was not so good though, minimal selection and only few interesting movies I think. 
Service was smooth and staff were friendly and accommodating. There was a crying baby behind me and they gave out ear plugs so that we can sleep peacefully.

I enjoyed my flight on the A380 J class Smartium seat, the seating and service is better than what passes for first class on other airlines. I have travelled this route several tines. My only issue is economy passengers entering the business cabin during the flight and availing themselves to the facilities. Especially when it is dark and people sleeping  they fumble their way through the cabin bumping into seats and walk  through two galleys with closed curtains to do so, the crew do nothing to stop them.They fiddle around with curtains and wake people uo. It is also not a good feeling when you have your belongings store where people who shouldn’t be there in the first place are hanging around.  I work and save very hard to fly business, i can’t recall the last time i saw anyone from business class decide to stroll around the economy section in the dark.

I paid an extra $150 for 'smartium' extra legroom so that I could get some sleep and get some work done. I got neither since they actually set it up so that your legroom is a very thin walkway. Every 2-3 minutes people are crossing over my legs and kicking my things.  The pouch for storage is on the wall and people walk across my legs but to avoid me they kick the pouch and crushed my glasses.  That is when I began to ask the staff to help.  After 4 hours they could not really stop people or redirect them to the obvious crossover area (2 meters further ahead on the plane).   

I am only writing this review because I told Asiana it ruined my flight and was worse than regular economy. I only asked for the Smartium fee of $150 back and they refused to help.  Thus, I consider that money scammed and stolen from me.  

Do not use Asiana Airlines Smartium at all or you can end up with people walking all over you. The company will not protect you or care.  You will not get the benefits and it will be worse than a regular economy seat. I did not get sleep and thus my work was significantly affected.  I paid that money to improve my life, and it made it far worse.  The company owes me the money back but they refused so I am writing this review.

My Asiana flight from Phuket was delayed due to an inbound flight weather stop - Asiana re-booked me on another airline at no charge so I wouldn't miss my connection in Seoul.  I didn't have to do anything. This was exceptional customer service and would NEVER happen on a US based airline. Thank you Asiana for getting me home on time and making me feel like a TRULY valued customer! You provided an awesome experience and I cannot thank you enough!

First: they wouldn't allow me to take my backpacking guitar(tiny, hollow body, weighs nothing) as carry on (they actually took out a tape measure and found it to be a few cm longer than their supposedly limitations...instead they made me check it in..had to pay to wrap it in a box..then it's
110,000 won (about 100 bucks)for each additional checked in item...

Over the last 30 years I've flown with my backpacking guitar many times on Asiana(as well as Korean, Cathay, Singapore, ANA). Never have I been forced to check it in..
The plane was 1/3 empty, yet they were pinching for more pennies anyway they felt they could get away with..

In addition:
OZ741 did take off at 7:30 pm September 3 from Incheon...we were well on our way when the plane had engine problems and returned to Incheon...then they made us wait..total 4 hour delay...no coupons for food, no coffee..nothing, except for numerous fake 'I am sorry' BS ..
saying sorry; but never doing anything for us...only Loterria(a fast food burger joint) was open in the airport that late.

When we did finally take off again they served us a horrible meal.

If you have a choice in Korea, may I suggest taking Korean Air. It is way way better...and the staff seem to enjoy their job better.

I used Korean Air aweek before:They never mentioned anything about me carrying on my backbacking guitar...
They are always ready to offer water, coffee and (and this is big) allow 2 pieces of luggage for check in...Asiana allows 1 then 100 bucks for an additional bag.

Do not fly Asiana(used to be good)..flew with them 30 years but the management seems to have changed...and appears the owner is some kind of schmuck trying to save money at each corner..

My return flight from CJU to GMP also use old Boeing 767, I checked it was 22 years+ served Asiana.
Little bit nervous for 1 hours flight and gratefully we landed safely.
Again, better Asiana rejuvenate this aircraft for safety and passenger comfortable.

Quite old aircraft B767 use more than 20 years, for heavy traffic GMP-CJU.
Little bit afraid because very clear that this old style cabin design.
Anyway, we can safely arrived at Jeju.
Better have to rejuvenate into new aircraft for safety and comfortable.

My return flight have much better seat comfortable rather than the depart one.
Meal also much better.
Much more can enjoy for another 7 hours flight, even we reached at evening in Jakarta, I was felt not too tired and could little bit asleep.

My First experience to Korea with Asiana Airlines (OZ762), depart time close to midnight, to chase early morning to Seoul.
Meal was acceptable, but seat not so comfortable for 7 hours flight and for sleep.
I try hard to sleep and lack of sleep made me not so good in the early next morning.
Anyway, my return flight OZ761 was better seat comfortable.

I took this 11 hours long flight from Seoul to London operated by OZ. Ground transport and airport service are very pleasant. I was impressed by the Korean culture show right underneath the ASIANA lounge. However, as a star alliance gold member, OZ didn't give me a front-row seat, and I was assigned to 17G. The legroom is just okay based on my height (6""2). There were three meals on board, including a Korean BBQ, a Chicken warp and a Kimchi rice. There is only a small selection of films, and the Korean sub-titles are always there. The flight arrived in LHR on time.

Flew business on A330-300 for flights 231 and 577.  Despite dated interior and seating, I found the earth tone color scheme soothing to the eye.  Cabin was clean, IFE adequate though not up to par with top international carriers.

Seats were roomy - not 180 degree lie-flat - and not Asiana's newest Smartium class.  I could never never find a comfortable position despite the numerous seat adjustments. Luggage has to be stored in the overhead bins, there's virtually no storage space around seats.

Food, both Korean ""bibinbap"" and a western beef stroganoff were well plated, tasty with crunchy fresh vegetables.  The ""kim chi"" accompanying the Korean main course was full bodied unlike store bought offerings

Where Asiana shines is in their in-flight service.  Flight attendant jobs on Korean air carriers are highly sought after.  There are even special training classes geared for  aspiring applicants.  And the quality shows in Asiana's attentive cabin service always presented with a smile and the high degree of English proficiency.
It was a comfortable flight, legroom was fair, the food was fine and I managed to sleep a bit. The timing of the flights is perfect so I will use again.

First experience with the asiana airlines in buisness class, had a wonderful experience starting from the airport, all the way thorough the hole trip. The dininning expeience on board was fantastic. Allthough the trip was short, but I enjoyed the every second on the plane.

첫번째 아시아나 항공의 비즈니스 경험을 해보았는데, 너무나 좋은 경험을 하고 갑니다. 음식과 서비스 모두 개인의 취향에 너무 부합하였고, 다음기회에도 위 항공사와 여정을 함께하고 싶습니다.

We got the economy plus seats ( a tad bit more leg room vs. economy).  Service was great.  Food was delicious (they really keep you well fed and hydrated) - our flight left 11pm and we got dinner and breakfast.  Great flight!
I can't recommend Asiana enough, despite being in an economy seat I had ample legroom, a tasty meal and excellent service.

I’ve flown this route so many times since when using Asiana for Tokyo -LA flight, there’s no direct route and you have to transfer via Incheon. 

Lounge options:
NRT: United club or ANA business

ICN: 3 Asiana lounges, East, Central, West (previously the original location)

Inflight service is average, though the meal options lacked quality. If the main options do not suffice, they offer fruit plates, ramen, or simple sandwiches. I ended up bypassing main meals and stuck with fruits and garlic toast...

Depends on which airlines you’re used to flying, so definitely will be better than any US based ones... but I’d prefer Singapore or ANA for a direct flight option with better meal quality.

I have flown on many international airlines and this one is the worst ever! They are very unprofessional and not helpful at all. The staff at the airport were unresponsive and not cooperating. Save your money and fly with another airline! They will try to scheme you and look for fees to make you pay.

if you want to travel with this company keep in mind that you could end up stuck with no ticket, no money and no answer from their customer service, that's what happened to me. I made a booking for a trip from tokyo to paris (obviously it cost a lot)  and they basically took my money and did not give me a ticket nor any kind of explanation... In my case this company behaved like scammers. I wrote an email to their customer service last week they told me that they need more information and that this kind of thing can happen when people use foreign cards and that's all. I sent them more information like they requested and then they stopped answering. Fortunately i had enough money to buy another ticket but for someone travelling on a budget this could be really catastrophic.

First, I talk about service at airport. My wife and 2 children (3 year old and 1 year old) check in LAX. We have 2 carry on luggage but my wife just only carry one luggage to airplane because she have stroller to carry 2 children . So we want check in 1 carry on luggage but the service person refuse this ( we can do it in Eva Air or China Airline, not in Asiana Airline). Second, we buy ticket in Agency and we request the Bassinet for one year old girl and we don’t have anything about Bassinet until we come in Airplane and find out we don’t have it. Wow so “good” service right?. Third, my 3 year old girl doesn’t have kid mead. This is my false because i forget to order it for her. But I so surprise because the airplane don’t have any kid meal reserve. Even though my wife request snack but she get nothing. With all poor service like that, we never go with Asiana Airline again and highly not recommend for family with children and infant.

Had never heard of Asiana Airlines until Korean Air bumped us off our reservation and put us on this one. It was a good move for us as we really enjoyed the flight, and found the bibimbap on Asiana was better than Korean Air’s! The food was very good, the plane was a new Airbus 350 with a smart cabin layout and the side by side seats offset so access was easy. Service was excellent and we could find zero to complain about.
Japanese airlines are punctual and well serviced, on this trip was no exception, easy boarding, balanced costs and a first class reception, a luxury travel on these aircraft.

I booked my flights long before my actual flight which was June 9 to Barcelona via Seoul. Manila to Seoul was better than Seoul to Barcelona particularly the plane has internet and charging outlet on the seat. On my return Barcelona - Seoul - Manila the plane was good but lack of modern communication outlets. The airplane was clean though specially the loo which was just behind my seat. I like being seated away from the crowd specially from the obnoxious passengers because when I fly I read, watch movies and sleep so I hate rowdy passengers. Movies nothing's special just old reruns. Food was okay, no complaints on that. 
Some of the crews were friendly others passive or just don't care. 
Pilots in my opinion were very good though the bumps for almost 4 hours each way was horrible.  The pilots landed the airplane quite smoothly.

This was my first A380 ride and was very excited. Unfortunately, the ride was very bumpy!  We took the seats at the upper deck and we were seated in the far end.  Must have been a wrong decision, because it was very shaky!!!  The good side is they have very good food! I was excited to have the Bibimbap on board, but my companion got the best deal, he had a Steak!  The seats are quite spacious.

We couldn’t of been happier with our first leg of our journey to Australia.  We stopped in Seoul to break up the very long flight for our child.  This was first class all the way.  From the Porcelain China, silver service, to the fine linens.  Every time a stewardess came to talk to you, she knelt down so she was below eye level to you and asked about menu and preferences.  The seats were comfortable and very adequate for a long journey to sleep.  The toiletry bags we amazing:  Le Occtaine.  And even in the clean restrooms.   Flight times were punctual and easy to find gates and helpful crew while boarding.  It was just a delight.

The flight was very good. My only issue was the 4-hour 40-minute layover between flights, but that really is not a reflection on the airline. The on-board service was friendly. I think that Asian does not offer premium economy on this flight. So I flew n the more crowded, less-spacious, economy class.

I had a comfortable and punctual flights to and from my destination. Cabin crew took care of their passengers by giving drinks now and then, food, etc. Available music and movies were satisfactory. They cleaned the washrooms now and then although their drainage basin system should improve.

I had a very bad experience with Asiana Airlines that I will share with you and also will put on other sites. Flew back from Incheon (ICN) airport (Korea) to Tokyo (Narita). Flight No. OZ108 (Dept. time: 19:05) on July 05, 2019. I bought 2 duty free items during flight in the plane for my wife and daughter worth about 15,000 Yen (about 150 USD) (however value is not a main question here!). At the time of arrival, as was in a bit hurry, forgot the package on my seat. Two of my colleagues were also travelling with me who were sitting on the last seats of the plane. They also confirmed that they saw the package on the seat without knowing that it belonged to me and of course there were no other passengers behind them. I realized about missing package after reaching at the parking lot of airport, went back to airport but was told that the Asiana airlines counter and phone line are already closed as it was already around 10:00PM. I phoned Asiana Airlines customer service first thing in the morning and was told that they did not find any package on the seat! I phoned them 2-3 times to emphasize that package cannot go anywhere else than lying on the seat and it was also confirmed by my colleagues that no other passenger took it as they were the last ones to get off the plane and they clearly saw the package on the seat. It was clearly taken by either one of the crew members or the cleaning staff. THIS IS REALLY DISSAPOINTING AND HAS NEVER HAPPENED TO ME EVER! I WILL NEVER TRAVEL BY ASIANA AIRLINES AGAIN AND WILL SPREAD THIS MESSAGE ALL OVER THE WORLD.

I booked because it was cheap... but didn't expect it to be this bad.  
Asiana uses the ""new"" Jakarta T3 which unfortunately has only temporary business class lounge and no air conditioning.  
The flight had flat but angled seats which are small and uncomfortable.  I fell asleep on takeoff but woke up due to extreme heat and sweating...  When I checked with the crew, they had the cabin temperature set to 26.5 degrees C!  Incredibly uncomfortable.  The entire crew should be sacked for their ignorance.
Food was also bad.

overall pleasant.  1-2-1 seat plan was great, colour scheme could be improved.  f&b was ok, but no mix and match, ie either korean menu all the way through or western.  i wanted ice cream for dessert but there was none left ... strange.  service was strictly business, didn’t feel personal.

The first leg of my flight was from Paris to Seoul. It was a very comfortable flight. Everything was of a high standard starting with the efficient  check-in, in-flight service, food and entertainment. The second leg of my trip was from Seoul to Sydney. The plane was older and I was disappointed with their entertainment system. The screen was just a little bit bigger than my phone screen! After a few hours into the flight  they announced a sangria tasting experience at the back of the plane. The crew provided the recipe for sangria and made a few jugs of sangria for the excited passengers. They continued with explaining the wine decanting process. It was done in Korean (would have been nice if it was translated in English). The entertainment finished  with the lucky draw prize. The best asset of Asiana Airlines is the cabin crew- they are gorgeous, friendly and deliver a great customer service

We flew Asiana airlines for the 1st time from LAX to BKK and then back to LAX. The flight attendants were nice and very beautiful. Food was okay. I am not a big fan of airlines food. They tasted ok, just average. The service was great. I wish they have a self service snacks available so we can just grab them whenever needed. We flew A380 for the 1st time, and chose upper because there is an empty compartment on windows side and it is huge, you can put your accessories in there and i think the seats on upper deck is bigger than down lower deck. I think most people do not know this. On the return flight, we flew A350 which was okay.

It was a direct flight from Chicago to Seoul that took 12 and half hours straight. It took shorter than I expected. The food was good and the attendants were kind. However, the only one thing I have a complaint about is the fact that an attendant had to wake up my 2 kids in the middle of their deep sleep when they warned us about using a leg room filler. If they don't allow it, they should have let us know before we fell a deep sleep.

Very comfortable Airbuses from Tokyo to Seoul and transferring from Seoul to Heathrow.  The stopover was 3 hours and transfer was in the same Terminal 1 and was easy and efficiently done. The in-flight service was of a high standard - slippers and toothbrushes.  The food was of a very good standard of a popular Korean dish - bulgogi - complete with instructions on how to eat it. The flight attendants were very attentive and efficient.  The seats were roomy and comfortable with lots of leg room.  On the whole a very pleasant flight and would recommend to anyone.

Flight attendants appearance very professional and if I may say....very attractive, nothing like AA or United.  Their service demeanor is absolutely customer-oriented top notch.  Majority American airliners cannot come close.

Flew in economy. Found the seats on the smallish side (and I am only 160 cm and slim), and not as comfortable as flying with Qantas for example. Food was ok, but again very standard airline fare which is bearable at the best of times. They do not really offer any alcoholic beverages unless you ask for them. Staff was friendly at all times and flights were on time.
First time flying with Asiana. Good Korean food and attentive crew. Punctual flights and friendly service. Will fly with them again

My family and I purchased our air tickets via Asiana due to their lower rates. We were pleasantly surprised to know that even at economy class, service was topnotch.
