As we were seated near the washrooms, they gave us earplugs and eye masks so we will not be disturbed by other passengers walking back and forth. The food was excellent as well.

As Diamond Member of ASIANA and flying since 4-5 years, more than 140k Mil registered and more than 40k unregistered before I became an ASIANA Club member, I surely noticed any change in the service concerning food and every small things. Like other companies, ASIANA trying to cut the cost in reducing the quality. In Business Class still ok, but not in Economy class. If not because of my Diamond Status, I would back to SIA, Emirate or Qatar which I used in the past. It happened to SIA in the past, but SIA is improving (I can judge SIA within ASIA countries). I would actually rate with 3.5*, not 4*, but not possible.

Very good and attentive customer service by the cabin crews. This is the second time we are flying with Asiana. The airline need to improve on its in-flight entertainment (not many movie options) and revise their meal menu (not appetitzing; depends on individual preference) in order to stay ahead of competition. However, despite these flaws,  it is still a good airline to travel with. I'll fly with them again in the future for my trips to Korea.

My impression is the quality of services is going down. The air hostesses used to be super-attentive, super-polite, ... almost close to the level of Singapore airline. Now the inflight service seems to be heading toward the direction of American Airlines. I truly hope that I'm wrong.
I really liked the professional attitude of the cabin crew - every single request was promptly taken care of. I also like teh Bimbimbap served as dinner with all the fixins .

It’s ok but no way you can’t compare it to Korean Airlines. It’s just better than Cathay and of course United :)))) 
The toilet is decent, hostesses are nice but not as good as KA. Food is so so. Most important thing is they didn’t tell yelling kids and noisy passengers to keep it down during the sleeping time. 
The rep in Vietnam told me to take out 3kg out of only 1 check in, which I had to get a backpack and put a small item into it for check in.
First time to flies with this airline, it was great. Nice attendants, Much better than CX. Good job.

I fly a lot of international business class and am very price sensitive.  Asiana was the cheapest for this flight and I gave them another try.  In the past the service has been weak.  This trip I found the service and food has improved remarkably and the business class lie flat seat was private and very nice.  The wines were weak but there was a nice single malt scotch available so I was happy.
This was one of the most comfortable flights to Korea that I have ever taken. The flight attendants were very friendly and kind.

I was pleasantly surprised that Asiana Airlines didn't charge me for baggage since I was economy, and it was only a short trip.  I was thankful. They also served a meal in that short 1 hour and 10 minute flight. Those attendants worked fast and furious, and never skipped a beat.  I was so impressed with this airline.  Thank you for making my experience so good.

Let me start by saying that the system that this airlines has is terrible. I booked a multi cities flight from LAX to ICN then to NRT and then return to LAX with my husband. We had the same booking number and we checked in together. We asked to sit together and they said the flight is fully booked and they cannot accommodate that. What kind of bs is this? From LAX to ICN they sit us on a different floor so of course who would want to switch with us. I was on the second floor and was asked to switch because he wanted to sit next to his wife. So I was nice to agreed because I know how he felt. And it seemed that several more other people switch their seats because the airlines just cannot seat a family together. So on our way to LAX, there we go again. They sit us separately and they continue to say the flight is fully booked and they cannot switch our seats. That whole bs again. So I thought well this time at least we sit on the same floor and we can just asked others to switch. Turned out both of us got sit in the middle seats. So when we asked the aisle and window passengers to switch they said no because who wanted to sit in the middle and be sandwiched by two strangers. The flight attendant is not that nice either. They barely smile and only friendly with Korean people because this airline Is Korean. I was very frustrated by this situation and will never ever flight with this airlines again. If you fly solo go ahead because like I said this airline just cannot sit a family together on a very long flight.

I got back to the UK last night.   I was very impressed with Asiana . The seats (row 38) were spacious and comfortable which is essential on such a long non stop flight.  The in flight catering was excellent.  Three meals and plenty of soft drinks . A limited range of alcohol but this is sensible.  The Korean food was fun although trying to assemble leaves meat and rice in the palm of your hand during turbulence was a little challenging.  The crew were amazing. They looked smart and were 100 percent attentive. And this was in economy so well done

I have been flying with Asiana Airlines for quite sometime and don’t have any complaints with the aircraft, flight attendants and food ( though maybe a change of food choices could be done). The 350 airline is great, with smooth take off and landing by the pilot.

This is our first time travelling with Asiana Airlines. I have always wanted to travel with Asiana Airlines as I am told that flight meal they serves in economy class is delicious. Then both my boyfriend and I got upgraded, so I cant complain about the flight. LOL

The flight was decent, and the price was extremely cheap compared with all the Japanese airlines. The CA brought us drinks and snacks all the time and the food was very good as well. It would be better if they prepared a bottle of water during the flight, but next time, I will just buy it before boarding so no problem.

We decided to fly business class on this airline, as economy is really bare bones. The first surprise was how bad the lounge was. Then, when we got into the air, I asked for a rum and coke. Nope. Not on this airline. If you want enjoy flying, avoid Asiana.

It was a good value for money airlines.
Flight attendants were attentive.
Good in-flight entertainment, quite up-to-date movies, though the sound system was not very good.
Only thing I was not really happy about is the food. There were limited selections for some meals on a long flight, contained beef and vegetarian food which i noticed the difference in quality (eg, beef bulgogi and kimchi fried rice with tiny bits of cabbage)

Despite been considered just slightly below in terms of quality the much better Korean Air. I strongly believe that Asian is actually avarage if compared to Korean Air, the plane was old  with a very poor entratteinement offering and system ( 6 very old moovies options). At the check in the staff was quite rude and not friendly, however the onboard team was much better and was very helpful and professional. I would reccomend this airlain only  if you find a very good price, if the difference with Korean Air is not to much, than go for Korean air.

I had to turn around and fly back to Seoul so I was really happy to get pulled aside from boarding queue and handed a replacement ticket to Business Class.  It was such nice difference since I normally only get to book coach.  

Service was awesome with all the attendants very polite and helpful.  Seat comfort was nice with lots of adjustable options.  The entertainment system was ok with a large screen and a good selection of shows but a good set of headphones made up.  A small toiletry kit and comfy pillow and blanket rounded out the amenities.

They served a lot of food on this flight.  More than I expected and all very good quality and taste.  When an airline can deliver a moist flaky salmon then it says something about their execution.

It was a relatively smooth flight back to Seoul and I enjoyed the entire flight.  

Landing in Seoul and disembarking was quick and luggage was already on the carousel.

Looking forward to a future upgrade!
Superb service, excellent meal, comfortable seat, convenient schedule, good range of in-flight entertainmen - what more could you want?

Our favourite airline for flights between Korea and Europe. Cabin staff are always polite and helpful. Planes are clean, also the toilets. On the downside, room for improvement re. food selection at the business lounge at Incheon (Seoul) Airport.

Not very long flight, but the experience it was very good. Economy class very good, very clean and nice smell, attention during the flight very nice, good entertainment menu and I found a lot of tranquility in the flignt. I recommend Asiana.

First time flying with Asiana, and we will do more of it as son as possible. Charming and extremely attentive staff, comfortable flat beds and excellent meals and snacks. We had filet steak and it was a generous portion and cooked to perfection. Could hardly be better.

If you're looking to fly from Shanghai to Seoul there is no better option, in my opinion, than Asiana.  it goes between Hongqiao (T1 old terminal made new) and Gimpo - these are two wonderfully located city airports reducing a lot of time wasted in transit.  also there are two very small airports which are not as busy as their larger counterparts and its a breeze to get to/ from the gate.  they booth have much better food options than their larger counterparts AND despite the short flight Asiana provides excellent service with a full meal.  VIP service for ECO price.

I go to the Philippines every year , sometimes twice a year and have tried many airlines. 
Asiana to date has been the best airline to travel on. The seats are wider, the food good and the service very good ! 
The airport in Seoul is excellent with a place to rest, take a shower , sleep or just hang out and relax. 
There are also Seoul free tours if you have a long layover.

Asiana airline has a great service throughout journey. Especially on board meals are really good! Also flight attendants are very kind and professional mannered. I fly with Asiana 3 times in the past and all of the flight are very satisfactory. I strongly recommend.

Again the Asian airlines win my approval hands down. Modern clean airline,,very nice accommodating flight crew, okay leg room if you know which seats to ask for, in flight-entertainment good, do like some of the Korean crime movies, the food was very good and again for 11 hours in air,,happy and comfortable.  If you ask for a snack or cup of noodles,,they will bring it to you with a smile.  No complaints here! Had to transfer to go to Pusan so to spend sometime in the Seoul airport is fine with me,, they like Hong Kong have great shopping  in the terminals, lots of food choices but they could use some more chairs for transits.flyers with time to spare.

The flight was a long flight. But the staff worked very hard at keeping passengers comfortable and respected. I was extremely pleased with the service offered even for those of us in economy. I highly recommend Asiana Airlines!

If you want to fly on a new plane with all the amenities, definitely pick this airline. 
The first class cabin is luxurious. The seats have a large TV screen with many movies to pick from, sliding panels to the corridor for privacy and of course, the full lay down bed. The food is either the Korean menu or an American style. I picked Korean... ""when in Rome...""...right? It was excellent. The crew are delightful and always ready to help. 
At night, the ceiling has lights to give the illusion of stars...it's delightful. The bathrooms are...amazing...so much room, so simple and clean.

Long flight 11 hours from Seoul South Korea to London Heathrow
Good flight, Got look after by flight attendants 
Food also good.
Service thru out the flight very good.
Need more movies on flight like other airlines
Comfortable seats but the inflight entertainment system was outdated. The flight attendants were all very accommodating; the meal was fine; and the flight was on time.

Flew with Asiana Airlines from Incheon ICN (Seoul) to Seattle SEA in flight OZ272 on June 6, 2019,  and from San Francisco SFO to Incheon ICN (Seoul) in flight OZ211 on June 28, 2019. Rode Business Class. Departures from the terminals were managed well, the flight attendants were courteous, the food was very good, and the full-reclining seats (but no massager) were within normal expectations. However, the in-flight free items were lesser, and the Asiana business lounges (it has two) in Incheon Airport provided lesser food and drink choices, and were closed 12:00am to 5:00am. Nevertheless, I am giving a rating of 4 stars or very good because these faults were compensated by a lower fare fee.
Very nice flight, due primarily to the attentive crew.  Food was 'interesting' and I thought a cut above normal airline fare.

I wanted to give Asiana 4 stars because it upgraded me to business on my way back, which I really appreciated but service has gone down so much it’s borderline traditional airline, feel like a discount airline with free luggage and meal.

Flight was delayed for almost an hour, but there was no explanation at all. The ground crew kept saying boarding would begin soon which was obviously wrong

Movie and TV selection was very limited and flight attendants quite insisted on speaking Korean to every clients, I had to keep explaining that I didn’t speak Korean...Food was so-so, even on business class if I compared it to business class of other airline.

After having a wonderful time in Seoul and experiencing everything so perfectly the final stopover was at the Incheon Airport before getting back home. I was humiliated by the staff as they charged me exorbitant money for excess baggage whereas I am  a Star Alliance Member and entitled to additional baggage. The same status was honored by the Asiana Airlines Staff on my journey from New Delhi to Seoul where they allowed me additional 7 kg of excess baggage allowance. When I tried to reason the same at Incheon Airport , they did no want to listen to anything and charged me for additional baggage.

In the course of all this I wasted more then a hour and missed on the opportunity to do Duty free Shopping for which I waited  all the time during my stay at Seoul.

Asiana Airlines should not be that ruthless and focus on providing better customer experience.
Very friendly, organised well the found of the missing luggage, let me fly without Visa for Korea, quick procedure of printing necessary Boarding Passes.

Crew were  (as always) friendly and helpful to everyone. Western food was of near restaurant quality- I usually  go for the Korean but this time changed my choice. Certainly above BA business class food. And during the ""night"" the cabin crew passed around offering snacks, drinks etc, although the bottle of water kept me going. 
Noticed Economy Smartium pax boarding along with C pax, but not sure if this is all they actually get. Flight on time, and comfortable.

Contrary to what is written below I had a terrible experience using Asiana, first you cannot do the online check in because they block the seat and let their preferred agencies get advantage, no way you can book it in advance I am Asiana Gold member and my wife is Asiana Diamond member and none of us could do the reservation, we even called the costumer service line where a agent confirmed to us, they block the seats and give preference to agencies, second the meal service is good if you enjoy Korean Food only, what isn’t either bibimbab or lettuce wraps is horrible and inedible, they check in process at the airport any of them is terrible again only for Koreans “you foreigner go to electronic check in” I want to highlight racism all around in the plane, my wife is Korean and she gets a different experience then me foreigner, even the describe ina racist way all foreigners as “fat, black, and dirty” just they do it in Korean believing we foreigners don’t understand, I don’t suggest any ASIANA flight to foreigners unless you enjoy racism!!

I like Asiana Airlines because they let you pick your seat several months in advance when you book your flight not like most airlines ware you have to wait until yo check in at the airline counter, their flights are conferrable and smooth flying, yes you may have a lay over in south Korea but they offer free tours of the Soul South Korea which is outstanding.

This was my first time flying Asiana and I loved it.  I bought economy class on my flight from Denver to Seoul.  I upgraded to Economy Smartium and it was a good choice.  The seat size was great and I was able to lie down and take a nap.  The fruit platter was good.  The staff spoke English and were really nice.  Due to the long trip we got access to the business Lou he for free and it was amazing.  I would reccomend them again!

We recently flew Manila to Lax. Via Soul. Both the airplanes were new & comfortable. The crew were welcoming & efficient. Meals and service were excellent. The lay down beds were very good. We will definitely fly this airline again.

I paid a bit more compared to other airlines flying from Jeju to Seoul and happy with it. Being a non-Korean, the whole process from booking, check-in, boarding was easy and smooth. Very happy with ground staff and cabin crew. They were polite and efficient. The seat is comfortable for me, being over 6ft tall on a normal seat. Light refreshments / drinks were served on board although its a short flight. My flight was on schedule. Koreans definitely knows how to be respectful to customers or other people.

Seoul (ICN) to Da Nang (DAD) was the third segment of my trip from Toronto, Canada to Da Nang, Vietnam. The 4-hour 45-minute flight was on a Boeing 747. I selected this flight based on the overall low airfare and past experience. The flight was bumpy due to two prolonged areas of turbulence. Flight crew members were friendly, efficient, and polite.The announcement languages included English.

We were impressed with the amount of leg room, the seats were quite comfortable and the plane and toilets clean.   the plane on our return journey was much older and the inflight screen was very small but at least they still had the full gamut of movies etc.  The food was good with a choice of 2 dishes and wine was served with dinner.  The hostesses brought round trays of water and juice constantly on the outward journey and on the return we had to ask for it but came quickly.

The plane had comfy seats and we were given slippers to use on board.  There were amenities in the toilets (tootbrush sets, comb, lotion, etc.) that were made available to passengers.  The food was really good - the choices were a korean meal OR a regular meal.  I always made sure to choose the korean meal because they were really good and healthy (lots of vegetables).  There was a TV where you could watch shows or movies and play games.  This helped pass the time for such a long haul flight.

Sadly, 40 minutes before landing, a lady fainted and was unconscious the entire time.  We could hear the attendants trying to revive her.  We landed in Chicago and the medical personnel entered the plane.  We were made to wait a few minutes and then allowed to disembark.  The passengers were not given an update on what happened but I saw that the medics and the police were left behind inside the plane.

The flight crew was excellent the entire time - polite, dedicated to providing good service, and exceptionally hospitable. Food was OK but not remarkable. The problem I had with the flight was an incredibly uncomfortable seat. It does not fully recline (A330) and if you are over 5'10"" the ergonomics of the design make it very difficult to find a comfortable position for resting or sleeping. Very little lower back support. I got almost no sleep and quite a backache on the flight. The plane was also quite warm but I have come to expect that from Asian carriers (then again, why do they provide blankets if the cabin is going to be hot?). Movie selection not particularly good. I enjoy flying Asiana for the quality of service but will not take this plane again for a long flight. The need a serious seat upgrade.

Flew this airline based on rating I reviewed.  During our 12 1/2 hour flight we had 2 meals ( supper and breakfast ) as the flight started 11 pm PST.  We were given slippers and toothbrush with toothpaste.  Pilot kept us informed during the flight on turbulence, location and time.  Steward and Stewardess were helpful and readily available for anyone that needed assistance.   During long flight in middle of flight/meals offered water and other drinks.  New to this airline so I am learning how there website works as they offer upgrade flight options.  This airline is part of Star Alliance.  It does offer mileage program.  Economy seat were comfortable, head rests adjusted for getting some sleep but keep in mind it is economy so I would suggest bringing a pillow or something to allow you to get some rest.   Since airline is Korean , there announcements were in Korean but they do have working knowledge of English.  I would recommend trying this airline.  Prices were comparable to most airlines with similar rating.   For this flight most economy seats had 3 seats in each section totaling to 9 seats across.
The aircraft was new and clean. Touch screen monitor was very impressive with good selection of shows. Food was great and service was efficient :) Would travel with Asiana again.

I checked reviews of the airline and all that before I left. All seemed pretty good. However, when getting on the plane I almost cried. The planes are so old! Terrible entertainment system with a teeny tiny horrible screen, and worst of all no charging station for my phone! 10 hours with no decent entertainment. I know it's first world problems but I paid a lot of money for that trip It's fair to expect a certain standard of international travel these days. Everything else was fine. Food was great. Staff etc, but I'll never fly with them again.

Red Eye out of BKK, long overlay at Incheon airport.  Business class flatbed seats are very narrow (compared to ANA or JL) makes it a bit uncomfortable. Service is good, special requests are mostly granted. Flights were on time.
Very easy check in process, comfortable  seats opens to full flat bed and excellent meals for the long flight. The service with Korean airlines is always exceptionally great.
ASIANA is one of the best airlines in the world. The food is so good, and the service is the best, and entertainment is good too. I would definitely recommend this airline to others.

When Asiana Airlines break your luggage and decided to not compensate - they call and give you all sorts of reasons but a resolution, make you angry, and leaves you such a worst flying experience you will ever remember that you regret giving them another opportunity...

Submitted the request to remove them as an option for business travels and the travel team shared that many had asked already

asiana is the worst airline possible. they delayed 2 of my flights, one was 1 hour delay and the other was 30 mins. both delays caused immense trouble to my schedule. not only that when i asked to talk to someone who speaks english when i was checking the last leg of the flight, the stewardess who checked me in was extremely rude and ignored my request. she didnt even tell me to wait 5-10 mins after i check in my luggage as it passes inspection. furthermore they lied and sold a different airline (much smaller plane and an unknown airline company which i did not feel safe flying). i only found this out when i got to the airport. I WILL NEVER FLY ASIANA AGAIN. THEIR CUSTOMER SERVICE SUCKS AND THEY LIE TO THEIR CUSTOMERS. FLY KOREAN AIR INSTEAD!!!!!

On such a long flight for 12 hours, it is always nice to have staff who are friendly and helpful.

This was my 7th time with them, 3rd on the long flight, and I am sure I will be flying with them again.

Comfortable seat and food is fine enough (I am Japanese, but I find Asiana’s food better than Japanese airlines’ food.). 

It was always a bit of a hassle flying long distance, but I actually do enjoy the travel when flying with Asiana.
Although it was a very short trip, it was nice flying with Asiana.  Business class on this route is not a full-flat seat, but comfortable enough for under 2 hours flight :)

I had a 2 hour layover in Korea. Both planes were spacious.. free movies and a total of 2 meals and a snack.. and the snack was delicious. The meals were great. The stewards were elegant and extremely professional.. I can’t put in words how impressed I was.

There are 2 options from LAX to ICN. Mid day and just after midnight. One is on an A380, the other an A350. I prefer the midnight flight as it gets  you to your destination during the daytime, rather than midnight. And, makes it easier to get to sleep on the long flight. 

Checkin is a snap. I make a connection into LAX and use the kiosk as you near the international terminal. The other alternative is to use the star alliance lounge. 

Flight... make sure you get one of the seats where you are not right on the aisle, exposed to people passing by. Seats are great. Entertainment is good. Food service and selection is good, accommodating asian and western tastes. Drink selection is very good. Either plane is great. Both are pressurized to a lower altitude and allow for increased humidity, making for less jetlag. 

Arrival and connection in ICN. Its a huge airport. The connection process is pretty simple, just follow signs to go through security and back to the departure hall. The Asiana Lounge is pretty good. I typically take a shower as part of the wait. If you need help with your ticket, upstairs there's a small ticket office where they can help you. The lounge isnt so helpful. 

Onward connections are often less impressive than the long over water flights. By then, Im just ready to arrive and get to sleep. 

Asiana is often one of the cheaper, non mainland chinese choices. One good thing is their reach into china. If you need to fly to a smaller city in china, a connection in ICN is often an easier alternative than a connection in PEK or PVG.
Not bad for a long flight. I'm 6 foot 4, and luckily had an empty seat next to me. Flight attendants were really nice. No real complaints.
We took Asiana Airlines and the inflight service was excellent as far as food and beverages. TV and activity looks very oul and must change or update to today's market.

The Korean flight attendants are professionals, attentive to your needs, patient with customers trying to speak Korean with them. They are on point and their situational awareness is great. it was an economy seat, so seat comfort is what it is. I don,t think any economy seat for a 12h flight will feel great! But they are honestly comfortable.
The flight leaves midnight and arriverat Seoul before lunch. When boarding you only get a sandwich on this lång flight. Really old plane. Would not take this again.

Food was terrible
Bags got dammaged
No compansation
Not adviseble
Ground staff was very lazy n rude 
Never travel again
We flew to Phnom City and back from Hanoi. Its better than Air China (which I don't recommend at all). I would call it an above average Airline.

Lots of room. Comfy seats. Wonderful service. 
You will need to let them know ahead of time if you're vegetarian. All meals have meat.

Enjoyed an excellent return flight, very comfortable seating with plenty of leg room which surprised me in economy. The food was delicious, I opted for the Western dish on the way there, it didn't look great but it was so tasty. On the way home I had the Korean food and I seriously recommend you opt for it too - delicious and so healthy. Cabin staff were very attentive, good selection of drinks etc. Honestly can't fault it.

I didn't expect this flight to be as great as it was. It was a relatively short flight so I didn't expect to get a meal but they served dinner and drinks and the food tasted nice. The entertainment system worked perfectly and there were a lot of options to chose from. The staff was very friendly.

One uncoordinated aspect of the flights affects the entire experience negatively.  Airport staff of Asiana did not inform passengers that our baggage were taken off the conveyor and placed on the floor.

That’s what we remember from the two flights.  The Asiana business class lounge in Incheon does not serve good food.  Muni Croissants, mini chicken sausages and diced ripe mangoes were good.  The rest were not.  The spread does not look appetizing.

Our experience would have been better if the cabin crew speaks English fluently.  However, they are courteous, food choices are not bad, there are different kinds of tea to choose from which describes its benefits and hot towels were given four times throughout the flights.

Asiana deserves an excellent rating for placing cutlery wrapped in fabric napkin, salt and pepper, drinking glass, saucer for bread, etc. on our pullout tables one at a time instead of on a tray.  Bread is best when served warm and Asiana did!

Asiana also has an added security belt that crosses from one shoulder to the hip.

Baggage come out timely.

The business smartium class, one from icn to sfo is awesome. Comes in 1-2-1 configuration so all seata have access to the aisle. Nice bubby as welcome drink. Head of attendants personally greets passengers. Nice meal services. Comfortable lay flat beds with hefty music and movies to choose from the IFE.

At last we've gone back to a multiple choice menu ex ICN. Not just Western or Korean.
A350 was quiet and smooth. Crew good- only thing was a request for what we wanted for our snack (end of flight meal) just after dinner.
Half way through the 11 hour flight crew wandered round offering yet more food- we both had fresh fruit, very welcome. A friend in Y also got amid flight snack.
Aircraft was- unusually- nice and cool. IFE was good and enjoyed by both of us. Good new films and good classic movies. Fast track invite for immigration at LHR.

This airline puts United to shame! The sparkling A380 double decker was an experience in itself.  Service was impeccable and was anticipatory...namely never have to look for an arttendant when you wanted or needed one.  The food choices were ""Western"" or ""Asian"". Cocktails were available and you could stroll to the bar and hangout.  Asiana is a United Star Alliance member and I would surely fly them again to the far east.

I bought the cheapest tickets half a year ago to fly from Hong Kong to Seoul.  It was a red eye flight. Since my bf and I bought separate flight tickets, we couldn't checkin online 48 hours before hand, so we got to the international airport 2 hours in advance and there was already a line.  We requested if we could be seated together, but the flight was full and the assistant told us it was not possible after checking.  Suddenly he told us to wait for a bit and then arranged us to be seated in the same cabin, which was the business class.  Though the service and food was not business class, at least the hard ware was and we get to rest well through the night with reclining seats that laid flat and had sufficient leg room.  The trip inbound was regular economy class though the service was also excellent.  Food wise was just so so, like regular airline meals.  There were not many movies to choose from though.

We sat on 1F & 1D seats for the longer flight from Los Angeles to Incheon & though I don’t recommend sitting on these seats, it was the only ones available for a couple when we booked. The food selection was good: there was always a Western meal then a Korean meal & service is impeccable. Hospitality for Asiana always impressed me. 
We had L’Occitane travel amenities which had a sleeping mask, toothbrush kit, L’Occitane lip balm, hand lotion & light cream, then earplugs and facial tissues. 

From Incheon to Manila, we boarded a small Boeing 747 plane in which the first class cabin was converted to the business class premium called “business smartium”. I was not impressed by this cabin at all—it was very obvious that the 747 fleet should be grounded forever due to its old age and heavy wear/tear. Service was of course excellent but comfort was bleh. Here are some pictures of my husband & I. Third photo would be the plane from Incheon to Manila.

Check out my Asiana Airlines business lounge review in Incheon, Korea on my next post. Happy travels!

Bullet points:
* Brand new A350 craft with generous leg space.
* Traditional Korean dinner and breakfast experience.
* Seats allocation need to be noticed ( as details below).

Reviews:

Airport services
Asiana has its own service team at the check-in point with both English and Korean languages. The lounge was offered by UA at another terminal where you have to take a train to the boarding one. Food at lounge was just-ok and personally I suggest guests to leave room for dinning on board.

Cabin Services-equipments
This A350 craft is super new and everything was coloured as Asiana tradition beige. The good side for people tall as me is the leg room. I fell asleep for more than 5hours during the cross pacific flight with no table hitting my kneels nor did I feel difficult to move within the leg room. However, there's no box-like storage space except for a magazine cabinet. 
The poor side is the seat map and entertainment system. There are two seats on the middle of the cabin with one row of a side to side seats and next row of a separate seat pair. So if you traveled with your partner please be sure to notice this difference. What's more the window side seats also distinguished as one row close to window and next row near the aisle( with your storage side near window). In terms of the entertainment, the headset is simple-designed and the movie menu was less attractive than other competitors.

Cabin services-F&B
This flight offers two meals with traditional idea of Korean cuisine. If you are not a spicy lover please just add a little gochu jang. If you are, I will recommend korean Ramen as a choice during the flight.
I would like to highly rank the cabin crew team. By knowing that both the Korean and Japanese airlines offering great services, the Korean Asiana not only gave their hospitality to me, but also surprised me by their language skills. English Japanese Korean and Chinese could be used in the cabin, amazingly.

Flew from LAX to Seoul, Seoul to Osaka, then Fukuoka to LAX, all separate legs over 6 weeks. Service was outstanding. So we’re the meals. Aircraft used on our flights seemed new and very modern. Would absolutely have no hesitation to fly on Asiana again.

I had a round trip to Fukuoka from Inchon. The flight is short, but they serve a meal for lunch. It was light. The luggage limit was 50 lb, which was great. The plane was old, but it kept it in good shape. I had noticed the prep in the plane was not perfect: noticed the refill on papers was not neat. They were pushed and not easy to use it. I was a first user of that rest room. It looks like they miss the quality control.
Been fly with them many times too !! Love the service!!! And the aircraft very nice too love the airbus they have

I bought return flights from London to Japan with Asiana airlines with a stopover in South Korea (Seoul) for a trip during the highest season of the year in Japan, and the price I got was excellent compared to other airlines.

The check-in process was smooth (loved the auto-check-in system they have!), and on the airport the luggage check-in was easy and quick. 

Boarding was smooth and all the staff was very nice and friendly.

The food provided in the plane was particularly good and there is a broad selection of drinks in offer.

On the way back we had an issue on the flight from Tokyo to South Korea, and after talking with the hostesses and some managers at the Seoul airport I was offered a free upgrade to premium economy as compensation, which was great considering it was going to be for the longest leg of the trip.

Flights were on time and it felt very safe. I would recommend this airline.

Excellent service: friendly ground crew and flight attendants, some of the FAs didn't speak great English but they were very helpful, water was brought around on a regular basis, responded to call button quickly. Food was excellent - bibimbap for lunch and spicy octopus for dinner. Wow - the octopus was so tender and flavoursome. Have to rate these amongst the best Economy meals I have ever had. Lots of drinks: beer, wine, spirits, and good quality too (eg, Chivas Regal whisky).

Plane was an old B777 but has been very well maintained, little sign of any wear and tear. Comfortable seats. Just the IFE was a bit dated (smaller screen) and not a huge range of English language movies (good but not great). They do provide movies in four languages so that is probably a factor. I watched a couple of Korean language movies (Eng subtitles), and they were very entertaining.

Toilets kept very clean the whole flight and kept stocked with excellent quality toothbrush/paste kits. Little details like the excellent quality paper towels in the toilets shows great attention to detail by Asiana. So, overall, a very enjoyable and comfortable flight in Economy.

Returned to Hong Kong from Los Angelas with Asiana recently and had a nice flight, very good value for money based on the very low economy class tickets we had booked 9 months before our trip. 

Check-in at LAX was quick and simple. Clearing security and immigration in the Tom Bradley terminal was smooth and expedient. Similarly, our layover at Incheon Airport in Seoul was simple and relaxing. 

Flight from LAX to Incheon (Seoul) departed and arrived on time, seats were generally comfortable and there was plenty of legroom. We slept comfortably for a handful of hours during the flight. In-flight entertainment was decent, in-flight meals were surprisingly good servings of bibimbap and a spicy chicken dinner. Overall, this was a good transatlantic flight. 

Flight from Seoul to Hong Kong similarly departed and arrived on time, was similarly comfortable with fair leg space. In-flight entertainment system was dated and probably in need of being upgraded. However, it was good enough for a 3.5 hour flight. Bibimbap served during flight was just fine. Flight was fine, what you want with a shorter international flight. Luggage arrived on the carousel in 25 minutes after arrival and we were on our way home. 

Overall, we still prefer Korean Air to Asiana for long international flights. However, this particular flight was booked a very low price compared to what other carriers were offering to Los Angelas. In this regard, the flight was just fine quality wise and very good value for money cost wise.

Aircraft was an Airbus330-300, I had just arrived in Singapore with Qantas on the same type of aircraft.  The Asiana aircraft interior was ancient compared to the Qantas aircraft.  The seats were ancient and n to lie-flat seats.  The screens were so pixelated you couldn't watch a movie.

Do not pay for a business flight on this route.  The only advantage is extra leg-room.

I have flown many different airlines on business class.
This was my first experience on Asiana and what an amazing experience it was.
The food and service far surpassed anything I’ve received before.
Food was like dining in a 5* restaurant and was plentiful.
Tea and coffee served from silver teapots too.
Cabin crew were very attentive,nothing was too much trouble .
Looking forward to the flight home
On time, hot meal, friendly service, reasonable seat room. There was nothing wrong with the flight and overall Asiana is a reasonable choice.
These guys know what they're doing.  First class treatment no matter the class of service and best value for your money.  Loved the stewardess' attire.  Classy gals.  Highly recommend.
Great food. Good space. Good amenities. Simple. The flight attendants were very friendly and made the flight very comfortable.

Asiana is one of the best values in Pacific travel.  They still offer a quality product at very low cost.  There are none for the fees seen in the USA or European low cost airlines. All tickets include seat reservation, checked luggage and meals. The staff were easy on carry-on weighing. 

Remember, coach across the Pacific is never easy. The Asiana seat is as good as any, which is still painful after 12 hours.

Check in was a bit troublesome as the agent was initially having some unknown problem with my ticket.    Eventually the glitch was sorted out and I was given boarding pass all the way to my final destination.    Realized upon arriving at the gate that Initially scheduled A330 aircraft was changed to A380 which was a pleasant surprise.     Boarding was done orderly and was on time.      I was given exit row window seat so had plenty of leg rooms to stretch out my legs.   The interior of the aircraft looked a little dated but still tidy and well maintained.    Cabin crews were friendly and helpful.     We were given full meals for this quick two hour flight.    The meal was tasty and good portions.    Arrived on time in Tokyo to catch my connecting ANA flight to Chicago!   Overall another nice and pleasant flight with Asiana.

I Will admit when i booked the flight I was a little reluctant, had ever heard about Asiana and was unsure what I was getting myself into! But my worries were put to shame, everything from boarding to inflight service, entertainment and food was above and beyond! I Will most certainly recommend and fly Asiana again!

I took return flights from Tokyo to London via ICN and to Dehli on business class.  The services, food and seats are not outstanding at all.  Particularly food was challenging for me. However, if one thinks about its price which is less than half of the other carriers, their product is competitive enough.

Traveled for family holiday from Bangkok to NY via Seoul. Flights were reasonably punctual. Service was friendly and efficient. Food was very good, light meals and snacks on offer throughout the flight.

We were lucky that there was no queue at check-in. After check-in we were asked to wait 5 minutes while our luggage goes through an x-ray inspection.

The seat of our aircraft was comfortable and seems to have a bit of a leg room. The flight attendants seemed helpful although I did not need any help nor request so I did not need to bother them.

I did not use their entertainment system as it was just over 2 hour flight and I would rather snooze and rest

This is the worse airlines in Asia! They deserve 0 stars! Very poor customer service, disgusting food, and most of all, we missed our connection flight to US because of problems with the airport congestion (totally not your passengers fault!) we were given the run around at the ICN airport and Seattle airport only to tell us they cannot help us!! All their crew and staff need to go back to train more on how to handle a proper global customer service! None of them wanted to assist us. They were only extra compassionate and helpful if you’re Korean or American. They completely didn’t show us they cared! They CAN’T compensate us for the hours of waiting due to delayed take off and inconvenience we had to go through! We were only asking if they can pay $100 for the change fee we were charged to book a new connection flight back to US, but they said they can’t! I have flown with Asiana since 2015 but now will officially retire from their business!

Staff told me about my refund my ticket but they never gave to me . Staff is not helpful . Poor customer service and food service. Food quality is low . They don’t know how treat their customers. They should train their staff properly. Rude and uneducated staff . Worst experience ever . Don’t fly with them . My flight number is 0768 on March 15, 2019.

Flew Asiana's A380 from Frankfurt to Seoul.    The aircraft was fairly new and seat pitch was great and had ample rooms to stretch my legs for the long haul.     In terms of AVOD, movie selection was somewhat limited but it was not too bad.     In flight meals were really good and tasty.       Due to late incoming aircraft from Seoul our departure was delayed for an hour at Frankfurt but we still made back to Seoul on time.      Overall really enjoyed my experience flying with Asiana !

First experience on Asiana and was quite pleased with my experience. Asiana is well run and service oriented. The economy seats are more comfortable than other airlines I've flown. Unfortunately, there was no seatback tv from Incheon to Nanjing nor internet service. The flight attendants are very attentive and helpful. My flight from Nanjing to Korea was delayed and someone was waiting for the flight at Incheon to get us to our outgoing flights. It was really well managed especially given my seat in economy. They took us to each of our outgoing flights which waited for us. My luggage didn't make it, fo course, but that was communicated to KIX where they already knew about it. My bag was delivered the next day. I would very happily fly Asiana again.

This was my fourth Asiana Airlines flight in three months and every one has been outstanding. From check-in to de-planing the whole experience is excellent. The ground staff and cabin crew were smart, friendly and responsive. The plane (an A350) was very new, all of the Club Class seats face forward and are very comfortable flat beds. 
The dining is fine dining of the highest quality. Each meal is preceded by an amuse bouche, followed by an appetiser (eg smoked salmon salad), then soup (eg a chowder) and then the main course (I had a marvelous fillet steak), then cheese and biscuits and then fruit!. All accompanied by white and / or red wine and / or bubbles. The ""snack"" at the end of the long journey would have done as the main meal on many much better known airlines.
The in seat facilities are good and comprehensive and the moving map on the A350 is a definite improvement over the 777.
Asiana sets the bar very high. I'm flying Club with BA in the next few months, it will be interesting to see if they have improved their offering to start to compete with this excellence.
I will return to Asiana when going east again and really look forward to the experience.

I travelled to Japan on Asiana and found the quality of service to be excellent,. I could not find my passport, when we arrived at Seoul,. The airline staff were extremely helpful in searching for it, but it could not be found before my connecting flight to Tokyo,. Subsequently, they carried out a detailed search, found my passport and returned it to me on my return through Seoul.  I found their staff to be very professional, organised and considerate.

It’s my first time taking Asiana to seoul, but definitely will be my last. Haha. The chair arrangement is kinda odd as my tv is not in front of me but side ways. No USB port but you can still charge if you bring the whole plug. Not a very pleasant experience.

Honestly i would say that i used Asiana Airlines phone number +1 844-313-4734 for booking my flight ticket. It was much easier to book your flight ticket through phone number rather than through its website or mobile app. But quality of service on the flight was amazing. Also it has several options to eat and drink which is very necessary during long journey. Over all i would say that it is was good choice to travel with Asiana airlines but booking its flight ticket or cancellation process was bit difficult especially when you are doing it online or through mobile app. So i would recommend you to book it through helpline number
Our departing flight left a little late, but they were very good to let us know.  Flight attendants on board were great.  Food was decent as airline food goes.

The equipment from Singapore to Seoul had no personal video.  It did have some audio channels, though.

The service, on the other hand, was excellent. And the leg room in Economy was above average. 

Ground service was great as well.

Absolutely loved the professionalism and efficiency of this airline.  The flight was clean, the meals were excellent and there were tons of flight attendants who were friendly and professional.

The only downside I experienced was an excessive charge for checking an additional bag.  They charged far more than any other airline and I was deeply disappointed in this aspect.

We just finished a flight from HK to LAX by way of Incheon (Seoul) with Asiana Airlines, who to their credit did a nice job working around unavoidable weather related delays, providing us with a pretty good flight experience. 

Flight was booked directly through their website when excellent rates were on offer for flights to LAX, around 9 months prior to our trip. Airline communicated slights flight departure time changes sufficiently through email. Check-in at HKG airport was timely. 

Unfortunately, our flight was delayed around 3.5 hours due to lightening thunderstorms that came up in HK just as we were about to depart. Thus, we had to sit aboard the plane, at the gate for quite some time waiting to take off. Flight meal was served while we sat on the ground at HKG. That was a first for us. We finally took off and arrived at Incheon International nearly 3 hours later. 

To our fortunate, our connecting flight to LAX was also delayed 4 hours, allowing us to not miss our connection after arriving very late into Incheon from HK. That was rather lucky for us, something else we've yet to encounter before during our travels. 

Flight from Incheon to LAX was smooth, comfortable and we were able to sleep quite a few hours, allowing us to be well rested upon upon eventual arrival into LA. We found seats comfortable on both flights, plenty of leg room. Entertainment system on the first flight between HK and Incheon was dated and had bad sound quality. On the flight to LA the system was newer, better quality. Meals were decent on both flights. We enjoyed the bibimbap and the ssambap were both better than you'd expect for airline food. 

In the end, we felt this was a good all around flight. Asiana is a grade or two below Korean Airline. However, considering how low their flight prices were when we booked, this was a very good value for money and overall flight. Hopeful we'll feel the same about our return flight home in a couple of weeks.

This was my third flight with Asiana in two months and it was equally as good as the other two. Check-in was easy and the Business lounge was in the Air New Zealand suite, very close to the departure gate.
The plane was a 777, noticeably older than the A350 and A380 which I had flown earlier but the welcome, friendliness and cleanliness of the Business cabin was at the consistently high standard encountered on the earlier flights.
The main meal, served soon after take off comprised an amuse bouche , an appetiser followed by clam chowder and then the main course of beef fillet, followed by cheese and biscuits and the fruit! Wow! Delicious, well cooked food of highest quality.
After the meal, although it was only late morning, the blinds were lowered and most passengers went to sleep.
A “snack” was served an hour and a half before landing, which most people would have considered a very good lunch! The wines were of the best quality and tea and coffee were served from elegant tea and coffee pots.
I cannot praise this airline high enough. It makes me actually look forward to my next flight with them.
My only criticism was that the moving map was very limited.

Traveled on the A350 from London to Seoul, On the A380 Seoul to Sydney. used United Lounge in terminal two which was a comfortable heaven after a long walk from checking, good choice of food and drinks and next to the departure gates.Business class suite was very comfortable in a nice cabin environment. Champagne offer on boarding, I could position the seat in a good comfortable position for watching the in-flight entertainment and seat reclines to a flat bed position. I manged to get some sleep which is unusual for me. I felt the on board services was a bit rushed compared to other airlines and no real drinks service after take off, tied in with the meal service, so you need to order two drinks if you want a pre-meal drink and then wine with your meal. Also not given much time to browse the menu before asking for your choice. The food was of a high standard with both western and Asian/Korean choices.You get two services on each leg with snack selection throughout the flight.The crew were very professional and attentive. Another disappointment was limited choice of in-flight entertainment.  All in all a very comfortable two flights. Lounge in Incheon Airport which there are two were okay but have been in better, you get 4 hours transit on the way out from London To Sydney ample time  to freshen up with a nice shower in the lounge. Returning from Sydney you would need to overnight in Seoul has flights do not match up around a 18 hour layover. We took four days out a used to explore Seoul

Asiana Airline has a great business lounge in Incheon International Airport, especially, it served the super and various meals. I am always looking forward to visiting the lounge whenever I visit to Incheon International Airport. This flight had the full passengers. There are some tour teams and some children got on board. Many children passengers called crews many times, but all crews served them as the good attitude and are very kind.

I can’t say enough good things about this airline. The flights were on time, they plane was clean, they kept the restrooms clean and stocked with toothbrush’s and toothpaste. The flight attendants were very friendly and the came around with water and juice quite often. 
We flew from LAX to Korea and then from Korea to Manila. We were served a total of 3 full meals and a hot snack. 
I would recommend this airline to anyone and I look forward to flying with them again.

I actually cannot review the actual flight because I did have to cancel my ticket but I had such an amazing experience with their customer service I had to review them. Also I immediately booked a new flight through them so I can update this next month when I do fly. They made a life long customer. I am not sure if this is the best airline of all time or I was given special treatment because of my situation. Although, this must happen to people all the time. The trip I was planning for a year was ripped away from me the weekend before I leave. I was devastated. Asiana really tried to work with us to change our plans but still leave the same time we were supposed to (although that fell through to, you need a permit for specific medications) long story short I had to cancel all together. They say refunds take 2-4 weeks and I needed the money to book new tickets so I was really hoping it would come in two weeks but it came in 1! They were just nothing but nice and helpful. No crazy fees or anything. I truly love this airline! I felt the really cared for me or at least about my experience with them.

We used Asiana for all three of our flights on our trip to Korea and Japan. I was quite impressed; their planes were rather comfortable (especially the one from Los Angeles to Seoul), their meals were good and the service was excellent. They even served us a meal on our short flight from Seoul to Tokyo.

The only downside to our experience was the fact that our seats got switched for the plane ride back to LAX. We had chosen our seats when we bought tickets and were looking forward to sitting together for the flight. But, we found out when we got our boarding passes that our seats had been changed :( I believe they likely changed the type of plane that was doing the flight and that was the cause for the switch.

The flights were just fine anyhow, and the selection of movies was great! I would definitely fly Asiana again and would recommend.

I have been flying with Asiana Airlines on all my trips (4 trips) in 2018 and 2019. I chose Asiana Airlines because it has been one of the cheapest options (~ 600-900) to Asia. The flight attendants were respectful and polite. The cabin was clean. The foods were delicious. I enjoyed the well-known Yeongyang Ssambap (marinated beef and rice) and the wonderful Potofu Bossam (rice wrap beef). The cabin toilet was clean. However, I would like to give some suggestion on the entertainment options. I had flown 3 times on 2018 and the movies were all the same. I wish they could provide more movies options. The transit time is often not long enough. Overall, great experience and wonderful staffs. Thank you

We usually fly Emirates to Australia as we can fly out of our local airport. However, as flights were quite expensive we decided to shop around. A call to Trailfinders led to a suggestion of using Asiana Airlines which would cost us almost half the amount of flying with Emirates. We did have to travel to Heathrow but it was certainly worth the train journey.
The first leg to Seoul saw the business class cabin half empty so service was excellent. The cabin crew were outstanding, so polite & helpful. Meals were very good with good choices of wine. The second leg to Sydney saw a full cabin, but that did not alter the high standard of the cabin crew. Nothing could be faulted.
The return trip was equally as good with another half full cabin on one leg. We had an overnight stay at Incheon in an airport hotel which was very accommodating. A meal on arrival & breakfast the following morning.
It is with reluctance that I write this as I am worried too many people will find out about this gem of an airline & prices will increase!!

I never experienced anything as the flights with Asiana on this trip despite remembering that it was some upper-class airline before this is an absolute no-go experience and an airline sure to avoid for the future.
It started all with the flight from Bangkok to Seoul (OZ 742 on 3rd March) where I tried to check in online well in advance but always got the message seating is not available and check in is only available at the airport. I was a bit concerned as I used the first time a web service (trip.com) for this standard flight as the booking wouldn’t have impact on the flight but that may have been a big mistake as discovered later. So from the start I was not able to put in any Window seat request or my special meal request as offered online. I was still good hopes and was able to get a window seat in the plane that was changed to an antique Jumbo.
Plane finally worked, and we had only 30 min delay in total but sleeping was almost impossible as it was really cold and with the 2 blankets and my Jacket I was still cold, but this didn’t really cover the fact that the fact that seats were so run down that the foot rest did not fit in and my feet were laying on the metal rack all time with a half declined seat. As there was no Vegetarian food ordered I had some salad and cheeses and that was that part.
As I had that experience I warned the agent well in advance to get a better placed but the agent was not able to put in any reservation of my Business seat as well as I wasn’t online. At least agent managed to get in a special Vegetarian Lacto Ovo request and I kept hoping. The departure time came closer so 46hours (not 48 hours) before the flight I tried online check in again with the same response – go to airport as no seats available. So, I was still hoping someone had received the request and takes care. So the day of the flight I got nervous as I worried for my window and so I called (couldn’t call earlier as when calling the line during day most is in Korean and it takes around 20min to get to somebody in English while I was working and had no time for that. So 3 hours before the flight I reached some service she took all my details so she knew me and confirmed that my VEGAN meal was booked (not as I requested) and that seats can only be assigned at the airport. To avoid any other delays, I decided for a taxi instead of the 10 times cheaper Airport limousine as that was scheduled to arrive 17:10 so that would leave me only 10min to check in with no window reserved so I took the high rate arrived at 4:30 just to learn that there was a mess due to change of airlines. The guide held me for 1 hour at the check in counter as the new seats had to be re-assigned whereas I still don’t believe that was a reason as I was the only one standing there and lots of Golf bags got checked in around me. In the meantime, the guy asked me even if I would accept to take a 2 hours later flight that I should have taken if I would have known what comes, but I had an appointment in Bangkok at midnight to receive a ring from a special jewelry shop, so I didn’t want to miss that (later of course missed that anyhow). After lot of lame excuses and many “in a moment’s” I got my window seat and proceeded already being informed that there is a 1.1-hour delay (at that time) – I proceeded and already my hopes had gone for making my meeting, but things turned bad of course. Already at the boarding there was a mess and apologies for seat changes that should have occurred long ago and here the excuse was aircraft connection (after all experience that meant waiting for 6 passengers for 2 hours from another flight). So slowly boarding and the flight attendant friendly said sorry for ONE-hour delay and I told her it’s 1.5 for sure and yes it got worse suddenly when it almost appeared as we are departing and doors were closed a new announcement came that we have to wait for 6 connecting passengers., that was at 8PM 1:40 after the original flight departure and incomprehensible even to the in-flight staff what was happening finally after a long wait then we departed at 8:45 more than 2.5 hours after the planned departure and with all explanations I was given by the staff I concluded for me that the online reservation didn’t work as the flight was overbooked and with the apps that are used by Koreans they will do their seats exactly 48 hours ahead and immediately it will stop the bookings as the seats get taken. Then with the overbooked flights on both flight going to Bangkok, changing aircrafts and waiting for the 6 from the other flight that didn’t fit into the 2nd hour later flight anymore made us wait.

This is a long flight but Asiana makes it pass quickly and easily. They offer a great selection of movies, the meals a good and the drinks are endless. The flight staff are very friendly and are willing to assist in any way. This is 1 of my favorite airlines.

I took OZ751 on 29/3/2019, was would like to commend all the crew members of the business class cabin. Services were excellent and all of them were attentive, helpful and smiley. Well done and thank you! 👍

It was a nice experience for a first time international traveler for me. Food is delicious and even if the personnel were Koreans, they know how to communicate well with other nationalities. Staff are very polite too. Seats were comfortable even in the economy class. My problem only is that I wanted to watch some Korean drama series aboard the plane but I can't understand since there were no subtitles. Also, they were very helpful to my senior citizen companions in boarding and exiting the plane, even until arriving the gates
Meal was great along with cabin service.check in was very smooth and the fact they spoke english was a real plus Thank you

We took this long haul flight with this airline for the second time. Checking in was very easy and fast, the airport lounge in Incheon was very good, food and drinks were plenty to offer. The in flight service was excellent.
The entire flight was comfortable. Highly recommended.

Booked online and got a very good deal with a flight from London via Seoul and onto Osaka Japan.

We booked extra leg room seats via their London Customer Service department. The staff member was so helpful and informative .

It cost an extra £100 pp each way to be seated in bulk head seats at the front of economy. We had seats 10A and 10B. 
Loads of leg room and our seats reclined back really well. Just as well as this was a 10 hour flight for us .Pillows,blankets and an amenity kit including an eye mask, slippers,ear plugs and tooth brush and tooth paste were also supplied.

Food was Korean style. We were given two meals during the 10 hour flight. Both were hot,fresh and tasty.
The first was a Bipnbap meal with salad and fruit.
The second was chicken and rice in a black bean type sauce,
Alcoholic drinks were complimentary. There was a constant supply of orange juice and water throughout the flight. Coffee and tea was served meal times.

The toilets on board were clean and there were a number of toiletries supplied for passengers.
Entertainment was good with plenty of choice of movies and music. Phone charging facilities too.

Staff on board were so polite and helpful. You could not fault them at all.
We had a very tight connection of around an hour in Seoul.
Transit was very quick. The airport was well sign posted and we boarded our flight to Osaka Japan with ease.
Our second flight was short and comfortable and as per our long haul flight lovely staff and our plane arrived bang on time.
Had never heard of Asiana before this trip. Very glad we booked with them.
Excellent customer service both prior to our trip and onboard.
Very competitive price compared to other carriers.
Would not hesitate to use again and highly recommend.
Asiana airlines cabin crews are very kind even if the flight is full. The meals are great and services are good.

I love flying on Asiana. This flight, although there were some pretty fun turbulence, was great!

As usual, the crew were great and did everything with a smile. 

Definitely flying with Asian again.

Seoul to New York was a long flight, 13 hrs my longest flight in my life. The flight was good , service was good,, in flight entertainment was very limited and food was Korean biased. Booking seat selection was nicely done,

first the positives:

1) not very costly
2) seat selection free in advance
3) food options available
4) seats comfortable
5) cabin service was very good. smiling staff

Negatives:

1) in flight entertainment very limited
2) screen size too small

Booked through a travel agency in Vegas and the agent was so informative to suggest that the long layover of 8 hours at Inchon could be utilized to take a short free tour of the surrounding areas of Inchon.  He suggested to make a reservation to take the free tour at the airport and that's what we did.  It was a surprise because we had an excellent female tour guide that taught us a brief history of the reclamation islands of South Korea.  Aside from having this experience, the airlines served meals that is nutritious.  In addition, we had a good package deal for a trip to the Philippines.

관련 업계의 2 곳 전시회 참관을 위하여 독일 출장을 갔었고 15일 귀국을 앞두고 12일 토요일에 업계의 각국 지인들과 저녁을 같이 하게 되었다. 중국, 캐나다, 미국 지인들이 함께 했는데 귀국 예정일인 15일에 프랑크푸르트 공항이 파업으로 폐쇄될 확률이 많으니 다른 공항을 이용하라는 안내를 자국 항공사와 대사관을 통해서 전달 받았다고 했다. 물론 그 때까지 나는 아무런 통지를 받지 못했었다. 1월 14일 한국시각 11시 10분, 현지시각 새벽 3시 10분에서야 항공사에서 카카오 톡으로 공항파업으로 인하여 1월 15일 항공을 이용하지 못하니 1월 16일 항공편을 이용하라고 연락이 왔다. 새벽에 일어나 항공사에 국제전화를 몇 번이나 주고 받고 나서야 항공편을 1월 14일로 변경하고 급하게 짐을 싸서 차로 6시간을 달려서 시간에 맞추어서 수속을 밟을 수가 있었다. 문제는 항공사가 좀 더 일찍 사태에 대한 상황을 알려주지 못한 것에 대한 미안함 조차 전혀 없었고, 프랑크푸르트에서 멀리 떨어진 곳에 있음을 알려 주었음에도 1월 14일로 예약을 변경한 후에 만일 제 시간에 수속을 밟지 못하면 1월 16일에도 귀국 항공편을 이용하지 못할 수 있다고 협박 아닌 협박을 했고, 이런 일련에 사태에 대해서 유감이나 사과조차 표시하지 않았다는 것이다. 국적기에 애착이 가는 것은 당연하겠지만 갈수록 타 사에 비하여 서비스의 질이 떨어지고 태도 조차 안일한 것을 보면 심히 걱정스럽다.

 Frankfurt airport was closed on Jan 15th, 2019 because of strike and most airlines got the sense to inform their clients from Jan 11th, 2019. Asina airline just informed me my freight had should been changed to 16th from 15th because of the strike around 03:10 of 14th. I had to make several phone calls at the break of day to change my freight to 14th since I had an important meeting on 16th. If he informed me the reality in advance like as other airlines, I did not have to have a restless night, I did not either have to drive in hurry for 6 hours. 

 2019年1月15号法兰克福机场因为罢工封闭了. 那罢工早就被预测到,之所以大多数的航空公司为了保证顾客的安全和便利从1月11号开始向顾客每天都汇报情况. 我呢, 在14号凌晨3点10分通过社交网络才受到航空公司的短信. 他通知因为罢工我15号的航班要改成16号. 16号在韩国有事儿,再没有睡,打过几次国际长途我把我的航班改成14号了. 如果跟别的航空公司一样他早点把情况跟我说清楚, 我没有必要傲个夜没有必要浪费国际长途电话, 还没必要那么累着开六个小时的车. 他没有向我道歉而还威着我说”我门帮您订14号的航班,但是您要记住把您的16号的预订要先取消,之所以您坐不成14号的航班很可能16号也走不了.” 我跟他们说16号有事必须要坐14号的航班,但是因为我在离法兰克福很远的地方不知道能不能赶上时间. 想问这家航空公司到底他们说的为顾客服务是什么呢!

맛이 너무 없어서 도저히 먹을 수가 없다는 말에 기내식을 준비하는 업체가 바뀌고는 그런 얘기를 많이 듣는다고 하더군요. 과일은 신선하지도 맛도 없었고 치즈는 사탕을 깨무는 기분이 들 정도로 굳어 있었으며, 국은 더운 물에 말린 야채를 풀어 놓은 듯 하였고 고기는 기름 덩어리에 제대로 익지도 않았습니다. 

I don’t want to recommend Asiana if you are an epicure. Fruit was not fresh, cheese was too hard to eat, steak was undercooked and soup was not hot. Nothing I could eat during the freight. 

飞机餐饮太差, 如果您是个美食家前往别利用这家公司. 要不不管您坐经济窗还是坐商务窗为了避免饿死您要带盒饭. 水果不新鲜奶酪很硬咬不动,汤不热就温水里放几块素菜一样.

Airfare - reasonable price during low season via their official website.  Can select the seat & special meal in advance without extra cost.

Check-in - recommends to do online check-in.  Everything was smooth while check-in at the airport in HK.  I also tried their city check-in service at Seoul Station before taking AREX back to the airport. However, it needs to do it 3-hour before departure hour that makes people cannot do last minutes shopping.

In-Flight service - the crew were very polite and nice to everyone.  Seating area are spacious.  In-flight entertainment such as movie, music are very updated.

This was our third trip to/from the Philippines, and our second trip there and back with Asiana Airlines & we were not let down!  Plenty of legroom & shoulder room for both flights - LAX to Seoul (A380 Airbus)  & Seoul to Manila (747).  Food & beverages were excellent, Service was excellent - always with a smile & very, very fast.  Flights & landings were very smooth.  I have yet to have a better flight experience period (my wife & i are both long-flight veterans).  The Flight crew was excellent in every respect - very professional & attentive & super responsive to passenger requests & needs - we observed this was the case not only with respect to our needs, but to all those passengers around us as well.  Not only that, the crew were very friendly too.  We noticed they were also very observant & seemed to consistently and correctly anticipate what passengers needed!  We really felt pampered, despite the fact we were in economy class!  We will be flying to the Philippines soon again, and we will book the flight once again with Asiana Airlines!
Nothing exciting to report which means that all went smoothly and according to schedule. The crew was helpful and friendly, the flight was on time, wish it was always this smooth!

An 11hr business class flight in an A380 during the day, upstairs and your expecting that plane with the bar to go and hang out at just like the other long haul flights right? Well no! They obviously decided not to cater for the Aussies enroute to Korea. 

Additionally the seating pattern is all wrong when you get to 24K. Pushed up against the toilets and, go figure, the ""window "" seating Pod actually has your body on the Aisle when they could have easily inverted the seating config so that 24k, which is last against the toilet was at least a window seat leaving the hoardes of toilet needy travellers leaning against the pod rather than your armrest or your shoulder....argh the trials of business travel LOL.

Best flight everrr
Didn’t feel like 12 hours from Seoul, South Korea to Heathrow, London. Had enough leg space and the food was brilliantttt

This was my first international flight. I flew to South Korea through Asiana Airlines from ORD to ICN. It was a 14 hour non-stop flight. I had a window seat, though for the majority of the flight it was closed. Will most likely take an aisle seat the next time I have a long flight like this. There was enough leg room/space, though because I am quite short I feel like I usually have good leg space on planes. During my flight, we were served two meals. They offer you two different options to choose from, with one being a Korean option at least in my experience. I had bibimbap, which was good! I was too tired and skipped out on the breakfast meal. From my return flight, I had the bulgogi and enjoyed it. I had shrimp porridge for breakfast, which was just okay. My meals also came with miso soup or other little side dishes that were very tasty as well. Overall the food was great! They provided a blanket and pillow, which I didn't use as I had my own. I did use the slippers that they provided though. Everything went smoothly and everyone was friendly and spoke English well.

For my first visit to Seoul, South Korea and Manila, Philippines, I chose Asiana airlines over Korean airlines because they had the most efficient connecting flight to Manila.  Korean Airlines would have been more expensive. 

The best part about this flight is that they use the A380-800.  Although the jet itself is expensive, it is the PERFECT aircraft to keep people comfortable and offers well equipped seats unlike the 747.  I specifically choose A380-800 airplanes when I fly because I need the space. 

The cabin colors are slightly more drab than Emirates - who uses the same aircraft - but the interior is still kept clean and neat. 

If you are tall or large you will want to look for the window seats without any other seat in front of them next to the emergency exit.  Easily the best seats on the jet. 

FOOD on the plane is very good.  I was given a choice between Korean meals and other types of international or vegan meals.  I choose Korean food and it was all very good. 

Everything surrounding the booking process, boarding process and disembarking was standard and well done.  I had no issues whatsoever and I wish more airlines were as good as this. 

Prices were fair and I had a very enjoyable flight to and from Manila and Seoul.
Overall OK but the in flight food not meeting taste bud. The flight slightly delay nearly 20 minutes. The stewardess wearing a nice apron during serving the food. Its look nice.

I’ve been to Seoul several times, yet this is the first time i’m flying Asiana airlines from Jakarta. Asiana offers direct flight daily from Soekarno Hatta Int Airport in Jakarta/Tangerang (CGK) to Incheon Int Airport in Seoul (ICN). The flight takes 7 hours, it departs at 11.50 p.m. from Jakarta (GMT +7) and arrives at Seoul at 08.50 a.m. (GMT +9).

When you booked Asiana, you can already choose your seat number as far as 1 week ahead of schedule (i don't know the exact time though), and they have option to automatically checked you in 24 hours before flight and send your boarding pass via email.

During my time flying from Jakarta to Seoul, the checked in process until boarding was smooth and perfect. Unfortunately, we got delayed for around 25 minutes due to inter connecting flight. But one thing i respect about Asiana is they've already told us about the delay as soon as we checked in our baggage, so we've already expected the delay and we can manage our time better when waiting for boarding. Anyway aside from the delay, i had great experienced flying with Asiana, the take off to landing process was smooth and seamlessly well done.

Asiana uses Airbus A330-300 with 2-4-2 seating from Jakarta to Seoul. As an Asian, i think they've got a pretty good legroom for me, the seat was quite comfortable as well because you can adjust your headrest to fit your needs. The aircraft was clean. Although for me personally, i think the air conditioner is not cold enough as they only have central AC (not personal adjustable ones). And the in flight entertainment to me was average as expected on international flights. 
Upon seating, they offered you pillow, blanket and headset for the in flight entertainment. You can also request for blindfold and ear plugs. As we're flying overnight, they offered toothbrush with coated toothpaste on the lavatories. 

During my flight, they offered various drink and snack for departure and breakfast around 1-2 hours before landing. The food choice was fried noodles and chicken with rice. I chose chicken with rice, and personally it tasted fine for economy class food.

As for the Asiana crews, i think they were very helpful and friendly.

Flying from Jakarta to Seoul costs approximately around 9 mill Rupiah for round trip (around 637 USD) but you can get as low as 5.5 mill Rupiah for round trip on promotional ticket (around 389 USD). I think the price was excellent though for direct flight, as they offered the cheapest fare available compared to other airlines flying from Jakarta.

All in all, i'm satisfied flying with Asiana. And in other times i'd travel to Seoul, i'd gladly choose to fly with Asiana again.

First time for me, I had expectations, yes, food is good, but nothing surprise, because I am here comparing with other Asia airlines, of course, they have standards, nothing will disappoint you, but nothing surprise. I transferred from Seoul to Phuket, it was 6 hours journey, thinking about the red eye flight, you wanna a comfortable sleep, but you feel like on dental chair, it’s not flat, you just keeping slope, this happened on Lufthansa business class. 2-2-2 arrangements of 777 in general, can be taken if you happy about price.

We were very pleased with this airline. Our flights boarded on time and our luggage made it through to our final destination with a short connection.  The ground staff and the flight crew were courteous and efficient. Our seats were fairly spacious for economy seating, and we were supplied with headphones for the entertainment system, a pillow, blanket and slippers.  The bathrooms had a wrapped toothbrush if needed.  The included food service was nice..chicken or fish and rice, or a Korean option. We would not hesitate to fly Asiana Airlines again!
Very good service, for such short flight food was excellent and on board service very helpfull. Easy check-in and fast boarding. In general no complaints!!

Flew from HOn to Sydney via Seoul.  The seats on the Hon to Seoul were not great.  They were the inclined/ recline.  The Seoul to Sydney was an A380 with the fully flat seats. That said the service was incredible. The food was nicely done and beverages were great.  The attendants could not be more helpful. Highly recommend them.  The lounge in Seoul was significantly better than the US Airlines.

My favourite A380 for the first leg to Seoul..3 hr stop-over then A350 to Sydney. Excellent lounges ..everything you could want on board..good food and wide variety of drinks. Limited English from some cabin crew but utterly delightful and beautifully turned out.Could not have been more attentive.
Return flight involved overnight stay in hotel..seven minutes by bus from terminal(though Asiana help desk at very far end of the Terminal..)complimentary dinner bed & breakfast.
