All flights arrived on time despite small delays at departure.Thoroughly recommend them having used business with BA..Cathy.Singapore and Emirates
It was fine, but economy class is still cramped.  They do give you slippers to wear during the flight!

February 19th to Jakarta from Seoul.
2.5 Hour delay of departure due to delay from connection flight, probably the plane coming from China.
Original arrival time in Jakarta was already late night at 10:30pm, but due to delay, arrival schedule was pushed out to 1:00am. And for my final destination it takes another 3 hour drive from Jakarta. Any delay from departure eventually screws up the entire schedule in the place like Jakarta where traffic jam is in disaster level. 

Dear Asiana, your flights to any destination have had constant delay recently due to having delays from your connection flight. This must be improved as it ruins your good reputation being built from your wonderful in-flight service.

I will fly this airline because of the flight times and price and service. The flight I prefer leaves Chicago at 11;55 p.m., and with a short layover in Korea you arrive in Manila in the A.M., therefore, you can book a connecting flight the same day and you do not need a hotel room or a cab ride late at night.  The price is great and about half of Delta. The airport in Korea has a transfer lounge where you can take a free shower and feel fresh for your arrival.   One downside there are NO ATMS in the Korea airport and that is not Asians fault.
Good flight, polite service, nice food, clean plane, relatively comfortable seating and arrived on time.

We flew business class on an Airbus 380.
The attendants were top notch.
Food was on par with the better international carriers.
When choosing your seat, make sure your seat is not on the aisle, i.e. storage serves as a buffer between you and the aisle.
I had a window seat that had storage lockers elbow close.
They are Star Alliance members.
Would definitely be a top choice next time I fly to Asia.

I have sleep apnia.  This is a problem in which the patient's windpipe collapses during deep sleep.  The apparently best way to take care of this problem is to use a CPAP machine which pushes air down the windpipe and so that you can breath air while you sleep.
I have traveled on many airlines business class and used my CPAP machine so that I could sleep throughly.  
This trip I flew to Taipei on EVA Airlines.  I obtained permission in advance to use my CPAP machine and was able to sleep through most of the flight from LA to Taipei.  All of the personel on the telephone and during the flight were very helpful to me as is usual.
I made arrangments to fly home from Shenzhen, China on Asiana Airlines.  I called Asiana a couple of times before I left for Asia.  I requested the person on the phone to approve me for using my CPAP machine.  They told me that because the flight was arranged with another airline I couldn't get permission to use my CPAP machine until I was at the airport.  The person was very firm and wouldn't help me.
Much later when I was going home, I contacted an Asiana employee at the Business Class Lounge in Shenzhen.  She contracted me with someone on the phone from her company.  I asked the person on the phone whether I could have permission to use my CPAP machine only from the leg between Soeul to LA.  She told me that there was no problem for me to use the machine.  Later on the flight to LA I took out the machine and a flight attendent told me that I couldn't use the machine in that it might start a fire.  I ended up not being able to sleep the entire leg between Soeul and LA.
I didn't like the attitude of the Asiana employees.  They were abrupt and not helpful.  I will never fly on Asiana again.

We had a very short layover (50 minutes) in South Korea on our way to JFK. When we entered the plane in Phuket, the crew knew that and said they would help us when we arrived in South Korea.  We experienced additional storm delays and we felt we didn't have a chance of making our connection. When we landed, a flight attendant immediately pointed to us and said ""follow me"".  We exited the front of the plane where another attendant was standing there holding up a poster board size sign with all four of our names on it as well as ""JFK"". We literally ran through the airport following her (about a half mile), through security, as she walkie-talkied that we were coming.  They had held the plane for us, the only four seats that were empty.  It was the most amazing customer service we had ever experienced!

1st time flying on this airline.  Service was not bad, food served onboard also not bad.  We were flying to Changchun via Seoul.  Our stopover time is about 2 1/2 hrs and we managed to walk around the nice airport and have a bit of Pho (Vietnam noodles) before re-boarding on our connecting flight to Changchun.  Only con on this airline is I would wish they could provide some hand towels for a wipe down before meals and after a night flight, a towel would be  very much appreciated for a fast fresh up.

Having arrived from London into Seoul, this was my connecting flight to Sydney. Another 10 hour flight! I unwittingly tested the service of Asiana Airlines by leaving my mobile phone on the London flight and only discovering my problem when sitting in the Asiana lounge waiting for my next flight!  No problem, the staff at the lounge arranged for my phone to be located and delivered to the departure gate for my flight to Sydney. Service!
The flight to Sydney was in the spacious A380 and the whole upper deck was Business Class. Once again the flight attendants’ service was exemplary. Dinner was the finest of fine dining: starter of melon, Parma ham, foie gras and salad, then a celeriac soup, followed by fillet of beef with dauphinoise potatoes and green beans, cheese and biscuits and then a choice of dessert. The wine selection was also first class.
Breakfast was excellent: eggs benedict, croissants, pain au raisin, fresh fruit and yoghurt. Coffee or tea, both served from silver coffee and tea pots. Extraordinary! I had missed breakfast on the earlier flight because the flat bed was so comfortable I had slept through it!
 Once again my only complaint was that the moving map is not very good. How you can fly down the east coast of Australia without identifying such places as Brisbane and the Gold Coast is inexplicable.
The last thing which impressed me was the fact that in Business you had not only a lap belt but also a shoulder restraint making it like a car’s restraint.

As a first time mom who travels international for the first time, I had the best experience. Asian has the best costumer service when checking in at the airport (LAX).
No hassle at all.
Being in the economy class flight, seat and leg room was ok. 
Food was great.

Probably the best flight I have experienced in 50 years of flying for business and leisure. Boarding was easy with a separate bridge for Business Class and the Business section on the A350 is configured with four forward facing seat/flat beds; excellent. 
The flight attendants are very smart and courteous and the service is exemplary. Dinner was as good, if not better, than many fine dining establishments. The starter of smoked chicken salad was very good and followed by a bowl of tomato soup. I chose the seafood main course served with steamed rice and Szechuan sauce and then had cheese and biscuits before a cranberry cheesecake. Water and (really good) wine was plentiful and I subsequently slept over 6 hours on the flatbed.
This was a really good experience, written first hand in the Asiana lounge whilst waiting for my connecting flight to Sydney, Australia. I can hardly wait!
My only criticism was of the quality of the inflight map. It was very basic and was frequently interrupted by adverts.

Flight is ok outbound the Flight attendants in Economy class was vey nice and courteous. I had upgraded to Economy plus for leg room and one of them came and ask me if I like to move 2 rows back with seats available to sleep. 
The Business lounge in Seoul is very nice since I am a Star Alliance Gold member.
Flight from Hanoi is ok just average and meals ok.
Overall Asiana airlines better than other airlines.  Return flights was really crowded and some of the passengers were a little rude and block the aisle before others in front of them could even get up.  They could not wait for their turn and just block the aisle so those in front could disembark and get their bags.

Celebrated Thanksgiving Day 2018 in LA once again. Going to LA, I took Asiana Airlines as I did in the previous years and trips. I enjoy the airline's A380 flight as I feel very safe and comfortable in that big plane. 

In my recent flight, however, Asiana used an overrated plane, the new A350. Was a bit excited coz the plane is one of the latest by Airbus. But got so dismayed in the whole duration of the flight. The plane's engine was so noisy and I felt that the seats are a bit smaller than those in the A380. Even if I was already using the headphone with its volume in full blast, I can still hear the noisy sound of the plane's engine for the almost 12 hours flight to LA. This plane should be used for shorter trips only.

Good thing though was that on my return flight to LA, Asiana used its A380. It was a pleasant and comfortable trip back to Incheon.

Asiana is a Korea-based airlines with perfect service, truly bilingual staff  (female only?) with an eternal smile and perfect manners. The food was excellent and servings generous. US airlines have so much to learn from their Asian counterparts!

Because of a delay, Delta rearranged my itinerary (dest. Hangzhou) and the last leg was changed to Asiana Airline OZ359. 
When I got to the transfer desk in Terminal 1 of Incheon Airport, a female agent looked up my info and said exactly “The flight is full. You are on standby. You cannot board. Go talk to Delta”. 
I gave Delta a call and I received Asiana’s confirmation number. I then went to another male agent at the counter and hope he could find my confirmation. He seemed to be confused and the aforementioned lady on his side told him something in Korean with an annoyed tone. I got the same response from him as well. 
At this point I said “Look, I’m in your system and you acknowledged that. If I cannot get on to this flight could you at least rebook me or something?” The whole staff at the counter suddenly got really annoyed and they all started yelling at me, especially the woman I first talked to who at the time leaned back playing her cellphone and spoke in a whiny tone. Multiple people shouted at me at the same time but all they said was simply “You have no ticket. You are on standby. No rebooking. This is not our issue. You are with Delta. Not Asiana. ” in a disgusted manner. I did not raise my tone or spoke anything rude to them during this whole interaction and their response was far from friendly. 
There is nothing more I could move forward so I left their counter soon after feeling humiliated and puzzled. The staff certainly saw my name in the system, and Asiana did issue a confirmed ticket — Delta actually went to check thrice on their end and Delta certainty could not make up one — but how could I “have no ticket” and “be on standby” at the same time? 
In the end, I gave Delta another call and a couple minutes later I sat on an Korean Air flight to Shanghai (and I traveled to Hangzhou via CRH the same day). 
To be honest this was my first time ever encountered an oversold flight that did not even allow me to check in. This experience could not be worse because of the hostility from Aisana’s counter staff. Funny that they earned a 5 star from Stytrax with this kind of professionalism. MAYBE they have excellent in-cabin service, but I could not rate that because I could even get myself a boarding pass to board the flight I was supposed to be on.

Asian Airlines is a company I respect based on my previous experience, but after today’s flight, it looks like the services standards have dropped down. It’s started with the Seoul transfer desk where I had communication with the representative who arrogantly responded to my request regarding an aisle seat possibility - “it was booked as an aisle seat” even though this information was new to me. No response to my thank you when I got my boarding pass - no answer, no smile and nor even a glance in my direction.
The second situation occurred at the time of breakfast being served two hours before arriving to New York.
I was given two meal options, yet only one meal was available at that moment and I accepted this reality. Despite my understanding of that fact, I was the last one served in my row, after the three rows in front of me where  already served and eating, and the row behind me was served even earlier. In my case the flight attendants started to serve the meal from the last row in the back. I was served the last one from over 30 people around me and with the option that wasn’t available for me.

I flew a red-eye flight from Singapore to Seoul (there were toothbrushes provided in the bathroom) during the peak Chinese New Year season and thus the prices were a little high on the side. 

This was my first time flying with time and I found the service staff to be courteous and efficient. I was pleasantly surprised by the legroom, it is really comfortable and I slept well during the flight. During my return flight, I was allocated the last row but was given an eye mask and ear plugs! Really thoughtful!

The food served was warm, and we were given 2 choices:)
Flew from Shenzhen to Seoul on Asiana.  Very nice business class with reclining seats, great choice of food (western and asian).

This flight had some mechanical equipment failure found when heading for the runway. Yes, it is not a good experience. but they managed the situation quite well, I think.

One of the senior cabin crew personally visited from business to economy class giving quite frankly spoken explanation on the situation and the plan at the moment. It was quite good.

The food gets worse every time on board. they have to do something for sure, by the way.

Last leg of my trip flying ICN to LAX on A380 upper deck, upon boarding immediately discovered trash from the inbound flight’s catering service at my seat - gross! Trash extended to the row behind me as well and was not collected until the passengers behind me brought it to the flight attendant’s attention, and this flight attendant didn’t apologize or seem to care that we had to deal with the previous passengers’ mess. Fell asleep shortly after take off, and by this time they were serving meals. I had to proactively get the crew’s attention to serve the special meal that I had preordered (Asiana’s response to my complaint was that the crew usually leaves a note reminding the passenger to ask for their meal, but they failed to do so in my case). Once I was done eating I had to wait quite a bit and ring my call button multiple times to have my tray collected, since the crew was not really walking throughout the cabin and checking on passengers. As we neared Los Angeles, I visited the restroom only to find liquid and toilet paper on the ground, and no toiletries (ie combs and toothbrushes) were available since they had not been restocked by the crew, and I even had to restock the toilet paper myself. Rest of the flight was uneventful. Food was good but nothing worth raving about, seats were definitely more comfy and spacious than economy class on most carriers, and IFE system was a joke with hardly any mainstream Western content. However I was very disappointed that I had paid a premium to fly Asiana only to receive a disgusting in flight environment and extremely underwhelming service. 

Complained to Asiana after the flight. They simply asked for “my understanding” regarding the poor meal service and garbage at my seat, and didn’t seem to acknowledge their own crew’s lack of attentiveness. When I responded, I explained that I was irritated that they neither seemed to care about my experience nor took responsibility on behalf of their crew on my flight, and asked for a small amount of compensation for the poor in flight experience. They not only denied my compensation request but also continued to allege no negligence or lack of attentiveness on their crew’s part. If anyone from Asiana is reading this, please seriously step it up in terms of your in flight experience, and acknowledge that your in flight crew seriously missed the boat. I have not had a dirtier in flight experience in terms of both the disgusting restrooms but also the unsanitary garbage I found at my seat, and I would’ve missed my meal if I hadn’t been proactive and familiar with how in flight service works. Overall very disappointing, and I will be moving my business elsewhere next time I fly between the US and Asia.
Flight Delhi- Inchon- Honolulu and Seattle- Inchon- Delhi. Dep Delhi 15 Dec and Dep Seattle 04 Jan 19

The whole experience was awful. The customer service would blame the customer, who did not call earlier. Their mobile apps did not work. You won’t be able to check in online. 
The attitude of the customer service is: I dont care!
The flight comfort was good, the IFE , food all were good. Cabin crew were very cooperative and helpful.

OZ 202, ICN-LAX, was operated on OZ's flagship A380.  I'm NOT a big fan of the whale (based on 6 flights in business class); I find the upper deck to shake too much as people move around, which disturbs my sleep.  

The OZ A380 ""smartium"" seat is packed in a bit more densely than on the OZ A350 - necessitating a bit of shifting and adjusting to make the seat configuration fit my legs (I'm 6'0"").  It's workable - but nothing special.  (OK, it's better than United...)

Also, in OZ's configuration, the J cabin overhead bins are poorly done.  The outer bins are very short, and cannot handle even a full day-pack; that forces most of the bag traffic to the center bins - resulting in most people having to split their bags between multiple bins.  

The VGML in J were a mixed bag.  The main meal (called lunch, but really a dinner - served at ~4pm following a 2:40pm departure) was quite nice; there were some hors d'oeuvres, followed by an appetizer, salad and soup - at which point the entree was served, followed by a choice of desserts.  They kept it moving as well as could be hoped - but it was still a long meal service, and cut into my intended sleep time.  

Breakfast was the biggest negative of the flight.  Our scheduled arrival at LAX was 8:40am, but at 6am LA time the cabin lights were turned on and the breakfast service began.  This was less than 7 hours after completing dinner service, and IMO they should have waited until 7am or even 7:15am to wake people.  

Compounding my dissatisfaction with breakfast was the meal itself.  The VGML entree was cheese tortellini; that's bad enough on its own, but since the VGML dinner entree was ravioli, it was totally ridiculous!

OZ 111 was operated with an A350-900, the newest addition to OZ's fleet.  The ""smartium"" business hard product is similar to what OZ uses on its A380 - but there is noticeably more space per seat on the A350.  

We had VGMLs on order - and for a sub-2 hour flight, they were EXTREMELY impressive.  (In fact, the entree was better than on the 11 hour ICN-LAX segment.)  Most of the amenities (IFE, lie flat, etc.) are wasted on a short trip, but I'd be VERY comfortable doing a true long-haul (even TPAC) on an OZ A350. 

One caveat re the seat:  like many lie-flats with constrained foot wells, you need to play with it a bit to get it comfortable in a flat position.  The foot well on the A350 was a bit bigger than on the A380, which makes a difference.

It was my first time flying with Asiana and I was highly impressed with the care that this airline gives its customers.   There is no better deal out there if you want to fly from Manila to LAX in business class, The price is amazing!! My experience with Asiana was so easy.  From the purchase, to issue, to seating, it all made part of the whole welcoming experience. Asiana really removes the stress out of long Travel.  I have submited photos of the two airbuses I flew on -connection(connected through Incheon,Korea).  I started out on an Airbus 330-300 from Manila to Incheon where Business class seats are very cushy and personal, then followed with business lie down seat on the connection on an Airbus 380 from Incheon to Los Angeles.  The food was good but not excellent, thats is why I give them a 9, but all the perks including access to Asiana’s Lounge in Incheon Korean is why I highly recommend this airline for long flights.
We were waiting 4 hours within the plane waiting for some announced “maintenance” work until we were told that the flight is finally postponed to more than 15 hours later...

My husband, daughter and I flew to Seoul from our home port of Naha. We went over the Martin Luther King holiday. This was our first time on Asiana. We were very impressed. In an age where nothing is offered for free and you pay for every little thing...we were pleasantly surprised to find that in our 2 hr and 20 min flight we were fed a full meal and beer and wine was included with the meal. The flight attendants were very friendly and efficient. The plane was very clean. The best surprise was that we were able to check luggage (one each) for free. Highly recommend Asiana Airline.

Good overall carrier service air side, very good attentive, food is good and you can pre order any special meals, diabetic, child's, etc. In flight drinks and beverages abundant and good movies.Good check in service and ez, priced to carry people which makes them good value. Sometimes a little difficult to book online  but we usually use agents, never been on a delayed or late flight so are dependable for connection flights.

Horrible Airlines and customer service. Do not purchase tickets with this company. They often have ""technical difficulties"" online and charge your account without issuing tickets. They charged my account over $1300 for tickets I never received. I had to call the bank and issue and investigation. I called and called Asiana and they told me there was nothing they could do for me. They told me that they had no record of my purchase even though I sent them a copy of my bank statement that showed that the money had been taken from my account. After countless calls with the airlines and my bank, it took over a week to get the money back into my account. Then when I did try to purchase the tickets over the phone they told me that they don't do over the phone tickets. I simply wanted to pay the price I was originally going to pay because prices had gone up to $1500. Yet when I called, they quoted me $1800, over $600 more than was originally taken from my account. In the end they said it was all my fault and blamed me for the whole transaction. They informed me that they would not honor their original price. They are highly unprofessional and rude to their customers. Would NEVER recommend Asiana Airlines.

Asiana kept coming up cheaper than Korean but of course just a bit more than the low cost carriers. Decided to give them a try since they had a decent flight time from HNL and a few options ICN to BKK. We took the one with the 50 minute connector. The flight HNL ICN is a big airbus, nice plane, individual screens. Pretty good legroom (but not as much as Korean). We had two meal service, I had the bibimbap (good), and then the next serving I chose the steak with potatoes (very good) That was the bomb as it was a HUGE steak. Could barely finish it. Both meals were good+ and came salad, dessert etc. In flight entertainment was good but just a couple of recent movies. Our flight to BKK landed very late due to winds and of course we missed our connector to BKK. But thank goodness they had 2 more flights after that and we had already been rebooked. We would not have had that option with a low cost. 
I only am making the comparison to Korean since that is what we normally fly and it's execellent. For the value and money, Asiana is a great choice and much better than even attempting a low cost carrier. Thumbs up!

Asiana is the best flight among Korean airlines for the family has kids/toddler.
They provide Kids meal (if we order prior to check in). And also they give some kids toy like colored penciles, sketch book and tiger masks. Even the flight time is very short (about half and an hour), they provide the simple meal and it was not that bad.
 All the attendants were very kind.
 And the seat gap is not that narrow even the airplane is not that big.
 I will use Asiana again for our next family trip.

Great experience, well worth the money. The whole experience was fantastic, the lay flat beds enabled my husband who is 6ft to lay down, the only drawback was that he has quite big feet & the area tapers at the end not allowing both feet to be upright at the same time. The quality of the service, food & comfort was very high. It made the 11 hour trip fly by (excuse the pun) I would highly recommend this airline.

Absolutely amazing airline. Although I was only in economy class, I still found a note from  the crew to let them know when I want to have food served (I was sleeping and didn't wake up for the food being served). And they were so polite and kind. Also the food was tasty. I am not a fan of airline meals but this one was exceptionally tasty. Really enjoyed flying the them. I also have to mention, that there was no delay and we took off and landed exactly on time. A very pleasant experience flying with Asiana.
Another great flight for 12 hours to Frankfurt Germany was great outside of flight being delayed a few hours...but it worked out. Great service - attentative to detail....
The airlines is top class - and the food is excellent. The service is top notch. I will always recommend them when I fly and nice it is part of the United program alliance.

I had flied 2 round trips with Asiana Airline in past several years.
 
First time was 2 years ago, round trip from LAX to Guangzhou. Flight was delayed in LAX for 3 hours, so it missed the flight from Inchon. So I had to wait in the airport from 9am to 5pm to wait for another flight provided by another company. On the way home, they said the flight would be delayed for around 7 hours in Guangzhou, so it would need to sleep overnight in Korea then catch next flight to LAX. But Asiana managed to find another flight from another company for me. (It was very nice for Asiana in that regard)

Second time was end of last year. Round trip from LAX to Hong Kong. Delay in LAX for 1 hour, too a big deal. But got another 4 hours delay in Inchon. The flight from Hong Kong to LAX was not bad, just around 1 hour delay in Inchon. 

Overall, it seems Asiana has some operation issue, 3 out of 4 times had quite some delay.

To start off, I can't fault the service. They are quite professional. Food was good. I've had their Western meal -- the steak -- for about 3-4 times on different occasions. Quality was consistently very good. Entertainment was limited and the selection leaves much to be desired. The seats, while comfortable, are quite dated. There are some scribblings on some of them. Overall, a good experience.

Flew from Heathrow to koror via Seoul found Asiana airlines very good. Plenty of legroom in both planes excellent and friendly cabin service efficient check in etc. Had pre ordered special meals for 2 in our party...these were checked as soon as we boarded and served promptly. Very tasty and plenty of it.
Little extras in toilets like moisturiser,toothbrushes,toothpaste, combs,mouthwash, much appreciated. Generous baggage allowance.
Would definitely use again
From checking in to arrival and departure, everything was fast and smooth.  Great flights...asiana has 24 hour check in service so its not a problem arriving earl

We normally use Middle East carriers to travel from the UK to the Philippines, breaking the journey up into comfortable legs. At Christmas, however, the ticket prices treble. Booking ten months ahead, I got a bargain with Asiana at £560 each, albeit with long layovers. (The same tickets peaked at £1600 each later in the year). 

I booked through Expedia. Just a few clicks and I had confirmed tickets delivered. I decided much later to upgrade to 'Smartium' for the last leg of the return journey and that was done by a quick phone call to Asiana, London. No hold, no problems. 

The check in process at LHR Terminal 2 was horrible; long queues and frayed tempers, in spite of previously checking in on line, but that's nothing to do with Asiana. 

Asiana do not board by row number but, strangely, boarding was completed very quickly on all legs - quicker than most other flights I have taken, without punch-ups or screaming. There was plenty of room for hand baggage, perhaps because Asiana enforce their limits strictly.

The LHR-ICN legs were on A350s, new, very quiet, comfortable aircraft. Seats were fine with ample legroom. The ICN-CRK legs were on A321s. Nothing special but still adequate legroom for a short flight. 

The IFE equipment on the A350 was top-notch. At first sight, he content appeared limited but there was more than enough choice to occupy the 11+ hour long legs. A321 has small screens but they're OK for a short hop.
 
What Asiana did well. The service was polite and efficient throughout. The food was very good, with the Korean options excellent and authentic. Toilets were clean and stocked throughout the flight. The slippers are a nice touch; better than bare feet. Our seat reservations were honoured on every leg. Every flight left and arrived on time.

Things they could do better. Drinks were brought through the cabin fairly regularly but the attendants rushed through the cabin and you needed to be quick to catch their eye. They did not take advantage of the advanced lighting on the A350. No nice transitions or mood lighting, just on or off. The cabin on the LHR-ICN leg was very hot, but I had expected that from other reviews.

I upgraded to Smartium for the final leg back to London because it gave us access to the business lounge at Incheon for our eight hour layover. It was definitely worth the £100 each. The lounge is simple but spacious and quiet. There was a variety of food on offer throughout the day and we felt secure to nap and snack. The time passed quickly. Priority boarding felt good, though it didn't make a huge difference. The extra legroom was generous and welcome on the longest flight of the trip. 

Arrival at Heathrow was disappointing, apart from the 'go around', which was rather exciting! Just waiting for the bump then suddenly climbing like a rocket. (Drones, we were told). We were through passport control in seconds, thanks to the automated gates. Fantastic! Unfortunately, the new baggage carousels are small and 'smart'. Once they fill up, no more baggage can go on until some comes off. And guess what; most of that baggage belonged to foreigners, still waiting at passport control. It was the best part of an hour before we could claim our bags. Terminal 2 definitely has issues.

Overall, I was very satisfied with Asiana. I got a bargain with my tickets but they are not always the cheapest airline. I would not hesitate to fly with them again if the schedule and price fit my needs.

I believe it's very good budget airline. Check in in JFK was fast and good. Lounge clean, with the food, with the chargers for phone, or if you would like to take the shower, please. In airplane the seats in business class can be more comfortable, now in other companies it's named KOKON , but in this plain was the old style seats. Food, entertainment is good, service good. My flight was with one stop in SEOUL (KOREA). Everything was nice organized with the transfer, so to Hong Kong I departure fresh, and was ready immediately for the tours which I have in the same day.

Unfortunately I have to write a bad review. I’m very disappointed with this airline. They wouldn’t let me on the flight because of visa problems. No customer service would help. No one cared. I canceled my flight for a fee to get fully reimbursed (they said) and only got half back. Over the phone, in person, and via email, I have been left with nothing except frustration. They have displayed no interest in helping me. It’s a shame. I was very excited to fly with them, but instead I’m out $500 and no real valid reason. I don’t get it. Please Asiana, please contact me and help me through this terrible time. Because of you, I lost my trip, loads of money spent on hostels, visas, and insurance, and the $500 of my $700 flight. I don’t get it. Please contact me and help.( K_krasney@yahoo.com) I can easily change this review to a positive one. I’m so flustered and disappointed right now. Thank you for reading.

We took a flight from Incheon Airport. Previously, we were already shocked that that was no personal inflight entertainment provided by the same airline during the first leg of the trip. I understand if it is a budget flight, but a full carrier like Asiana...and on top of that, it was a 6-hour flight.

I guess the flight to Singapore had a minority of non-Koreans, and most staff were pretty reluctant to speak English. They had previously labelled the seats to identify who are the non-Korean speakers, and the service delivered was quite different. The air stewardesses were exceptionally friendly to the Korean passengers ahead but became a little cold when they reached our row. The one in-charge of serving food seemed jaded and unhappy. She gave us an impression that she wanted to get past us as soon as she could. We never did anything unruly or impolite nor were we obnoxiously noisy - it could be our presence as non-Koreans that turned her off. It could also be because she was awkward with speaking English. Then perhaps ask if we could speak Korean instead?

I think customer service works in both directions. If you want to be treated nicely, treat people nicely.  That was why I spoke in survival Korean to let her know that I understood what she said in Korean. Well, the service never improved (obviously it was not about the communication breakdown) but at least I got what I ordered.

There was inflight entertainment on the flight departing from Incheon. The selection of films was not fantastic, but I was glad that there were Korean variety shows to keep myself entertained.

The service Asiana Airlines was sufficient. It does not provide excellence, nor does it strive to go the extra mile. It provides the basic necessities such as toilets, overhead compartments and reclining seats. 

I will choose Asiana Airlines only if it is the only airline that has seat availabilty on the dates I am flying.

Having travelled on Asiana five times in December & early January (in premium economy), I dare say I have been able to gather some insight into the perks of this airline. 
The staff are very friendly and try to make your (long-haul) flight as pleasant as possible. They are helpful, very patient (with impatient passengers) and keep smiling.
The food was good, as were the offered drinks.
Nice to fly on Asiana.

I've flown Asiana airlines many times and they have the best customer service of all. 
My flight from Seoul to Paris was upgraded to Business class. That's first time this has happened to me and it was the best feeling I've had in a long time. I left my passport on the plane and Asiana were amazing. They went to great lengths to find the passport and were apologetic that I went through the inconvenience that I did (which was self inflicted). I thoroughly recommend Asiana for their customer care

DO NOT I REPEAT DO NO FLY WITH THEM! THEY SWITICHED OUR SEATS LITERALLY 5 TIMES. We took Asiana Airlines from LAX-ICN- To our final destination in Manila 1/1/19-1/16/19. Flying there was fine.  YOU WILL TAKE A HUGE RISK WITH THIS AIRLINE. Either you will have the very nice A-380 or the complete opposite with them. 

This is were the trouble started. We were supposed to take an A-380 there and back. Our seats changed I kid you not 5 TIMES FOR OUR RETURN FLIGHT! Please check months/weeks/days/seconds before flying. 3 weeks before our flight our seats changed AND aircraft changed to a much much smaller plane. Called them and they changed our seats to a nice exit row seat (cool, problem solved). Then 48 hours before our flight I check our seats. No shock they changed my Fiancee's seat and mine so we were not even close to one another. Not only were we 4 rows away from each other, we were booked in the center row on a non packed flight (cause we all know center row is super fun to sit in). Once again called them and changed them. They ""promised"" us this would be the last change and sat us next to one another. SHOCKING when we went to the front counter our seats had changed again. The seats were super small and had a stunning 4"" by 4"" screen with what had to be 3 MP clarity. Our flight from ICN-Manila was even on a nicer aircraft. Message me call me Asiana Airlines I will gladly tell you more. FYI that picture is my 100lb 5'1'' Fiancee. That's how small those seats are.

After Scandinavian Airlines messed up with my luggage, saying checked-in to final destination, which obviously was totally wrong, I had to make a new check-in in Shanghai.
The thing, SAS said i have to do a new check-in in Shanghai, transit, but that was wrong, i had to enter the country, applying for visa and all that. Finally came to check-in desk, of course without my luggage du to SAS info.
Big problems occurred to pick up my luggage at the but this lady gave me extraordinary service helping me. 
Thanks a lot Ms Luo/Yu Ting!

Tried booking through website and attempted to trace payment and booking confirmation. Kept telling me no, no, no and no. Can't do this, can't do that, it was quite frustrating. Everything was a no!

Call was made on 14 Jan 2019, around 3:30pm. Didn't get the agent's name.

On the other hand, the Korean agent (in Korea office) was very pleasant and provide quite useful information. I had to give 1 star because of the double standard. Sorry.

Recently took Asiana airlines for the first time between Seoul and Chengdu.

With the exception of the fact they destroyed my luggage, the staff on Asiana from check in to arrival were great. I dont want to give a negative review on luggage damage, since I dont know if it was in Seoul or upon arrival.

Check in was smooth. Staff were very friendly and efficient. They did send us to the wrong lounge but that may have been more of a language issue

The onboard staff, from moment of boarding to deplaning, was attentive, efficient and good. Granted I was in business class, but they always asked... can I get you a pillow, blanket a drink?

Now the planes were old on this route, so I cannot complain about the non working sockets.

Overall this airline is on par with AC, EVA and approaching Lufthansa

Flew from HK to Icheon by Asiana Airlines for a day layover and eventually back to Toronto. The check in was smooth and efficient. The staff was well trained, smart and even offered my travelling partner sitting together in both flights. No checkout of luggage necessary and they automatically transferred my luggages to the Toronto flight. This is because Asiana and Air Canada are part of Star Alliance. We were arranged with good seatings. Close to the food storage area, the flight attendants provided courtesy ear plugs and ever cover. Service was great. Flight was on time. The whole experience was so smooth that I am impressed. I would fly again with them given the opportunity!

Just reviewing the return trip.  But out and back was all the same.  Great Service by both airlines.  DaNang to Inchon on Asiana 747 still 1 great airplane.  Inchon to Dallas on American's 787 in business class.  My God what an exceptional aircraft for long distance travel.  I won't try to explain so I'd recommend googling the 787 cabin accommodations too see for yourself. Creature comforts just plain exceptional.  Then R/J from Dallas to ECP.  You won't starve or go thirsty on these long haul flights.  Cabin Crews just fantastic on both airlines keeping you comfy.

Arrived in Sydney this morning on a flight from Paris via Seoul and despite the length of the two combined flights and a 5h layover in Seoul not feeling tired as we usually do when traveling to Australia from Europe. Actually managed a swim instead of a usual long nap which inevitably leads to jet lag. The flights were on time, the plane impeccably clean (the toilets were obviously cleaned and refreshed several times during the flight), the selection of food and drinks was very good and the level of service excellent. Last but not least, the seats unfolded into a full length bed, so that it was possible to lie down properly and rest well.

Took the Incheon to Frankfurt flight last 12 December. Check-in was speedy. Ground staff were pleasant and helpful. Flight attendants were very accommodating, and they serve with a smile. Food and beverages were dished our regularly. Good service.
Took the Manila-Incheon route last 11 December. Flight was satisfactory and the plane was clean. Flight attendants were accommodating and helpful. Food was also tasty.

Flight crew were friendly and professional but I was quite surprised by the food.  I ordered all the Korean options and they were rather mediocre -- but the Western food being delivered to others looked very good (terrible food envy on my part).  

I also found the lounge in Seoul to be very dark and overly busy -- with a somewhat surprisingly limited food selection.

Seats comfortable enough. Inflight entertainment with limited selection. Average food. Flight attendant just got my son’s untouched meal while he was sleeping without asking if he was going to consume it. No hitches purchasing tickets through their mobile app; smooth check-in. On time flight.

No service in English.All services are in Korean, you do not know if they are serving coffee or tea unless you speak Korean. I was even, as a blond Scandinavian, given a passenger card in Korean, and when I asked for a card in English, the request was received by a frown. Asiana Airlines should not be Star Alliance  Partner, They only seem to cater for Koreans not English speaking passengers.

First time in A380, super cozy seat that you can lay down straight. But I got a bug bite at my ankle. Service was only in average. Since this big monster can hold eight hundred something customers and has only two entrance, upper and lower deck, It took too long for all guests boarding. I really hope the airline find out a quicker way like divide to few group avoid all in one long long line up.

Problems dropping connecting Asiana segment in United Itinerary making baggage check in painful and then dropped and canceled segment enroute and told to stand by . . and that is for a STAR GOLD!  You also have to schlep to a transfer desk upstairs and off beaten path to get onward boarding card.  After standing by, got a terrible seat bulkhead window with a bassinet blocking row and crying baby.  Not a good way to travel - AVOID!

Out of 10 long distance international flights in the past 5 years, this airline is at the top of the list.  Excellent food, amazing stewardesses, on time flights.   After 13 hours in the air stewardesses were still smiling, helpful like they were at the beginning of the flight!  I have never seen that before.  Of course you would expect them to be tired but they were not.
Business lounge in Seoul mediocre.  Seats were less comfortable than those in the terminal waiting areas.
This Airline needs some revamp on its interior. seat fabric are itchy. food is average, leg room is great, flight attendant were so so...

I flew to Vietnam and back from SF either Asiana and had both great flights. The seats were comfy and the blanket and pillow provided kept me comfortable to sleep on the plane. Their entertainment system in front of you was also great. The best thing for me though was this one flight attendant who came out like an angel. I was sitting on the window seat with this terrible woman next to me and a kicking and ear-piercing screaming baby behind me. The flight attendants tried to help the mom to calm the baby down but never let up on kicking my chair and screaming. Eventually this one flight attendant asked me if I was doing okay and found me an empty aisle seat away from the baby. Thank god for her I was able to sleep on my 12 hr flight! Thank you!

The whole experience was average per say. The air stewardess were friendly nonetheless. The only downside were the in-flight entertainment and meals, as I am very less inclined to consume beef. Almost all the meals contain beef, which is nothing new as it is a korean airline. The in-flight entertainment did not have much choices, as such, my husband and I slept most of the time.

I would rank Asiana similar to a lower rating American Airline company with customer service.  Maybe a bad experience but both times checking in the attendant was very rude and upset I gave her our family of 4 passports saying “ give individuallyed ” over and over again. This happened again coming back on check in- both times at Seoul and May have been same agent. Should have got her name. 

Other item was during flight from Singapore had lots of turbulence but not once heard from Captain on what was going on. I would not recommend or fly with them again preferring the more expensive Japanese Airline ANA.

Asiana Airlines is a relatively unknown to travelers.  The airline offers outstanding value for its product and service, especially flying out of LAX (wonderful Star Alliance lounge) to Incheon, Seoul (outstanding Asiana lounge) and beyond. The Smartium seats are modern and comfortable, though the A380 upstairs cabin consistently runs hot making it hard to sleep after a full meal. Flight attendants are well trained. Korean food while simple is very well done. Try the Ramen noodles in-flight snack. However, they cannot prepare Western meals well at all. Asiana offers great value especially if you book well in advance. I have noticed that they're starting to raise their prices as more travelers become aware of Asiana Airlines.

I have  taken ten long-distance business class flights in the last five years for leisure.  Asiana easily tops the list.  Even after a 13 hour flight the stewardesses were happy, smiling and helpful. Food was excellent, seats were comfortable.  Business lounge had very uncomfortable seats - for a long layover this was really bad.
Unbelievable service and comfort!  Food was excellent, with wine and spirit selections. Great seat comfort on long segments of travel.
OK airline. Had nice service and was actually surprised they had a food item considering the flight was so short.

OZ 174 on 26th Dec 2018.

This flight is great! The crews are friendly and helpful. Very willing to serve. From the time we boarded, voluntarily helping to hang up our jackets, passing us the immigration forms and pens etc. until webdissembark they are still with smiles. 

The food on this flight is great too - we selected the beef steak. Wonderful choice although we thought it’s a little to heavy for a 9am flight!

The staff was not helpful . They were rushing . No flight entertainment EVEN A BUDGET AIRLINES WOULD HAVE A SMALL SCREEN AT LEAST!!!! The flight was so dirty. I feel so unsafe I cannot believe I have to fly back to Singapore on the 2nd jan with the same flight. Shame on you to be a member of star alliance!
First time I have taken Asiana.  Selected it due to very good price.  Seats have nice leg room.   Service was good.  they had enough staff to care for fully packed planes on all routes.
Not much to be said. We arrived at the terminal, waited, left on time and arrived soon after. Meals provided for an additional cost which was quite nice but rushed.

OZ 704 on 22nd Dec 2018

Terrible delay started even at the check in counter. The efficiency of issuing boarding passes seriously need to improve. We waited almost 30 minutes even when we were in the shorter queue for biz class.

Next is the 1.5 hours delay. No reason, announcement or whatsoever were given. 

The flight was smooth. The crews were fine and courteous. Food was nice but a little too heavy for a midnight flight. Overall onboard was smooth and comfortable.

Good food, a variety of drinks, and comfortable seats make Asiana’s business class worth the effort for the weary traveler. The hassle of airport routines just disappear once you get to your seat, where you can rest assured that you’ll be taken hood care of.

In terms of service Asiana Airline is as good as other Asian airline, such as, Singapore, Eva or Cathey Pacific and much better than United Airline. In terms of hardware, Asiana Airline is not as good, the seat was hard and not very comfortable, not down comforter, the pillow was shiny and small. The video on the flight was outdated. The longe at Chicago was terrible, they shred with SAS. On the other hand, the lounge at Incheon was huge, very inviting with lots of foods. I also flew from Seoul to Hong Kong. The lounge at the Hong Kong Airport was adequate.

As a Diamond member, I was able to bring extra baggage, checking in was seamless and was able to board early regardless that I was flying economy.  The food was good and the service was excellent.  The Lounge in Korea was a wonderful experience.  I flew the new airbus a350 that had wifi on the plane at extra charge.  It was great as my flight was nearly 15 hours and had to use the wifi in order to get a project completed that could not wait for me to land in korea.  I opted the $20 24 hour pass which was more than enough time.  Overall the wi fi experience was satisfactory. 
Always recommend Asiana . Even if their flights are slightly more, it is worth it for me as the perks make up the difference.

First time flying via Asiana, airfare is not cheap due to holiday season despite I booked the tickets as early as July. Per pax still costs S$955.

Seats are comfortable and it’s 2-4-2 seating.

Meals wise, it’s no good, Chef got to work harder to improve in-flight meals.

Overall, as Long as plane landed safely, that’s the most important!

Asiana was the most reliable airline we traveled with while in Asia. We even canceled our Thai Lion flight in order to fly with Asiana instead. They provide excellent service from start to finish. We will fly with them again for sure.

Better Asia international flights from the USA compared to others. The services are friendly and enjoyable for the whole time. The food are good. The air plane A385 is big and comfortable. Recommended and will do it again in the future...

It was a great return service from Sydney to Korea for 10&half hours.
It was long journey but when I travel to home, I always using Asians Airline. One of big reasons is meal “Bibimbab”. They include English version how to eat with picture so non Korean speaker can have their own meal in the flight.
Nice cabin crews are always great job.

Something wrong with their reservation system. When I checked-in online, I found that only 1 of our 4 vegetarian meals were registered in the system.  If I had selected meals for one family member, I would have done so for all.  On the day of the flight, I called the international helpline to attempt to rectify the situation, was put on hold for 27mins, before getting through to an agent who said he couldn't help me, and that I had to call the local office which would only open at 3pm that same day (my flight was 11pm).  I called the local office at 3pm, and was told that meal selections had to be made 48hrs in advance.  Thankfully, the agent said she would try her best to contact the catering kitchen.  Good news was that when we eventually arrived to check in our baggage, the check-in agent confirmed that our oriental vegetarian meals were in order for both the departure and return flights.  Thumbs up for their ability to resolve the problem; thumbs down for the reservations system creating the problem in the first place, and long hold-times for the international reservations line that was useless anyway.

In flight - service was great and meals were palatable.  Business Class seats can be extended flat, but not full 180 degrees lie flat - there was still a slight incline. This was a minus for me.  But the biggest minus is the very limited entertainment selection, even in Biz class.  Asiana has possibly the fewest movies and TV shows in their entertainment system that I've encountered in full-service carriers.  On the bright side, I got more sleep!

I have flown Asiana. Many times since 2012.The flight crew are always curious,polite and really do care abut  the passengers comfort. The airline is well run with  great lounges if you travel frequently like me which is important and check In iis quick and easy
When you fly out of Soul you can even check your luggage in at the Main Seoul railway station and clear passport control . Saves  you so much time at the airport port. This also gives you fast track though passport control as iis already been done in the railway station.
Asiana Airlines always my first chice
L

I had to make changes to my flight. I called US office. The US office was closed and I was redirected to Korean office. I spoke to someone who could hardly speak English, and asked to cancel my outbound flight but keep the return. I was told that I will get the refund for the difference in the airfare. I show up to board for the return flight out of Danang to only find out that my ticket was canceled. They made me buy a whole new one way business class ticket at the check-in counter and pay $300 cancellation fee for the original ticket. Fraudulent!!!

Flying Asiana has always been a wonderful experience for our family. We always get friendly service, great amenities and good food that's why our long flights become bearable. They also pay special attention to the small details like providing towels for freshening up. Asiana is and will always be our priority when choosing an airline going to the States.

Simply the worst airline experience I have ever had. The airline was delayed by 8 hours flying out of Singapore and failed to leave on time out of Korea (meaning I failed to make connections in Japan and I had to be shifted to Korean Air and Virgin flights home). My colleague took 10 hours to get to an important meeting, I took 24 hours. The Airline offers the bare minimum compared to others I have experienced
Flight crew very knowledgeable and respectful, great video entertainment nice lay over in seol south Korea

I flew business class on Asiana’s A380 from Tokyo Narita to Seoul Incheon Airport. Business class was lie flat seats in 1-2-1 configuration. Service was warm and friendly and food served was of a very good quality. As it was a short flight, I did not get a chance to enjoy the seat in its lie flat mode but am sure it will be very comfortable for a long haul flight!

In reality the flight is very ordinary just like any other airlines traveling in Southeast Asia. But one thing does stands out for me everytime I fly Asiana, the flight attendance customer service is constantly very good and always with a smile. I am an Asiana frequent flyer and I chose Asiana for for the value in their airfare pricing and customer service. No problem so far for me.

The first impression is how the flight attendants, almost all women, reminded me of US Airlines ""stewardess"" from 30 to 50 years ago. They were all immaculately coiffed and the majority had their hair pulled back into a severe bun, the rest wore their hair ear length. Their make-up was perfectly applied.  That's where the similarity ended, however,  because these women were all about the same height, same complexion and walked and moved alike. During this trip we flew other Asian airlines and none were as ""uniform"". 

All that said, we loved the experience!  They all spoke and understood English. They appeared sincerly courteous and attentive.  Food was good and by-the-way wer're going on Asiana next year to China, this time returning on Business Class.  We signed up for a long stopover in Incheon to take one of those free tours of Seoul.

So I'd say we enjoyed our experience.

Great flight, great crew, on time, relatively new aircraft with true lay flat seats.  Meals well beyond typical airplane food. Cabin crew was attentive, courteous, very professional.  Number of crew seemed larger than usually found on these kinds of flights.  This was a long flight but crew was always alert, attentive, and on duty. One of the best international flights I've had in quite some time

Ever since I experienced Asiana for a trip to Seoul many years back, I decided to travel with them as much as I could when I need to fly to Korea.  It's for no other thing than their chilli paste that they give as part of their in-flight meals (of course you gotta pick the Korean food option).  It is by far the best, no other airline comes close to Asiana as far as chilli paste is concerned.

Traveled both Economy and Business class on Asiana.
Hands down by far the best service your money will buy.

My first time with A380. Pretty comfort seat , but window seat is few inches away from window so i couldn't lean my head to airplane wall properly for sleeping. 
Overall was good , clean interior , good movies on board and good food.
Passengers are offered a choice of Korean or western meals.   Choices are limited, however.  The negative I have to offer is that the airlines lost our luggage for 5 days.

Cheap tickets, nice onboard experience, ontime. When our return journey flight got rescheduled, causing a layover of more than 24 hours, the airlines provided us with foods, transportation and accomodation in a 4* hotel in Seoul city.

service is the 1st thing on my list. 5 Star always
cabin comfort Excellent 
inflight amenities Deluxe
electronic entertainment also 5 Star selection 
nice selection of meals

I flew from Chicago to Tokyo via Seoul.  The flight goes from ORD at midnight and arrives at Incheon at 4am the next day.  The flight left on time and got in early which is quite rare for a westbound flight.  The carrier gives out a toothbrush and toothpaste to every economy traveler which is much appreciated.  There seems to be a good deal of time between meals.  We ate right after take off and 10 hours later, we'd had no more food.  I asked for and got something to tide me over but 10 hours is a long, long time between meals.  The flight attendants were nice and I thought the checkin agents were quite pleasant on both ends.  The Seoul airport is interesting enough to keep one entertained for several hours.  If you play Pokemon there are many enough gyms and Pokestops to keep you entertained.  If you have a long time between flights, there is a hotel inside the terminal but they book up and you should hold space in advance.  Back to Asiana -- I liked them enough that I am taking them when I go to Osaka in March.

Asian airlines is the best airline to fly for such a long distance. Food is amazing with complementary drinks of best brands wen I asked one more she was keep asking me and I took 3. Really very nice Crüe and full of comfortable. I wold like to fly with this airline.
I have a pleasant flight with Asiana, the foods are amazing. The flight attendant looks beautiful and handsome. Argggh maybe because I am Kpop and Kdrama fans?

Best way to travel such a long distance - flatbeds very comfortable and I would recommend this airline without hesitation nothing was too much trouble for the air hostesses, we were welcomed on board by head steward and every attention was paid to our comfort.  Only downside was that entertainment via movies and news was very limited.

I've ridden with Asiana many times, because it's often the cheapest option for my route. The staff is friendly and the flights are uneventful, which is pretty much all I ask for.  I wouldn't mind a little more leg room, but it's certainly no more cramped than a lot of other airlines.
Very pleasant flight with excellent in-flight service and on-time! A380 with good space between seats and options to recharge equipment.

A great experience flying ASIANA Airlines. Their service was great, food was excellent and the aircraft I flew in from San Francisco to Seoul was a brand new Airbus A350. My choice of meal was the Bibimbap, the traditional Korean meal. It was a delight having the meal, not at all airplane food, this meal transcends that. The flight crew was very accommodating and very friendly, always smiling and ready to please. Our flight was always on time, leaving from San Francisco to Seoul and then onwards to Manila my final destination

Asiana’s Business Class is a long way away from its rivals. Flat beds it has but it lacks in level of service. In fact, service is really below par. Entertainment is painful as there is hardly anything to keep one occupied. Take lots of your own entertainment. You’ll need it. The only thing which would sway me to fly Asiana Business class again would be a good price! Disappointed! BTW, the service from London Heathrow to Sepul was much better. Very odd that there would be a difference is service from one leg of the journey to the next. I had heard similar comments from others & had dismissed it as not possible. Same crew & same company. I was wrong to have dismissed it.

This is one of the most amazing airlines that I've flown.   Their service is awesome.
The double decker A380 is the biggest plane I have flown and it's so quiet.  We connected from MIA to LAX, change carrier to Asiana in Los Angeles and flew from LAX to Seoul; connected one more time from Seoul to HoChihMin City.   On the return we flew from Bangkok to Seoul to connect to Seoul to LAX.   All the connections were done in the most efficient manner.   I hate to admit that none of the American carriers can compare to the efficiency of Asiana.   A few years ago I flew Singapore Airlines and at the time I thought they were one of the best airlines in the world.  Asiana compares favorably to Singapore Airlines.

Took Asians to Seoul on business. 

All seats are aisle seats which is great...except some face windows and other the aisle. Very clunky sitting area and cluttered. 

They did not have my requested vegetarian meal. I asked them to just give me some bread and butter and anything else that they could scrounge. I’ve never encountered such unfriendly and unhelpful attendants. They refused to give me some bread cause it was only for breakfast. They seemed to be trained like military—-inflexible and only capable of following rules blindly. They couldn’t speak much English either—-even the pilot. 

Worst flights I’ve taken internationally. 

No internet and just a few movies on their old outdated screen. They should really update to international standards.
Friendly staff and nice service....AB380 to Seoul and AB350 coming back. 350 was better. Short list of In flight movies. Wine selection could be improved.

Asiana flights were on time and the flight attendants were pleasant and helpful.  Business class is definitely an option you want to consider on these long flights.  The aircraft was clean and seating was comfortable.  Restrooms were clean and easily accessed.

While living for 8 years in Korea, I used Asiana a few times, amoung others, to traval through Asia.  Asiana was one of the best I used. 
Their service and extra attention to little details gave a travel experience a feeling of speciality.  If you have a chance to experience Asiana, I recommend it.

I've flown business in the 777, 747 and the A380-800 with a few airlines. Asiana Airlines business class in the A380 is in a class of it's own. Nothing comes close.  I can only swing it with sufficient credit card miles but this the flight I will spend it on, any more. There is absolutely no comparison in both the aircraft and the service. 
I highly recommend this if you can book it.

Since Asiana has changed it onboard food prep company from the German Lufthansa Kitchen in Seoul to another local Korean producer, the quality has been dismal. The food is on quality as the mid-tier Chinese airlines. Some of the things are not edible. I had a meat dish and the meal was rubbery and too saucy. Before landing, I had the omelette with sausage and the sausage was a cheap meat filler sausage. This continues to be a problem for them as they try to wittle down costs. Entertainment is limited but everyone has a nice screen to view. Bring some of your own food if possible.
Flight was comfortable, on time and the flight attendants were great.  The flight were great going to and from my destination. The food entertainment could be better though
Lovely service from all the flight attendants.  Lie flat seats were very comfortable and the food good.  The spicy ramen snack was a stand-out!  I would definitely fly with them again.

Always fantastic in-flight services.
Most beautiful flight attendants 
more room between seats - economy

just over all, pleasant to fly with Asiana Airline.

great comfortable seat, attentive service. Excellent amenities in business! Overall a great experience on this carrier. 
I flew chicago to incheon and it was awesome.

I am very pleased with the experience of traveling with 2 small kids with Asiana Airlines. If ur kid is below 30 lbs and 30 inch, request an inflight bassinet. Even if your kid is over those limits and under 2 yr old at least you will get those front seats with ample leg room. I also requested day use hotel while in Incheon because with little ones you need a break. They provided a free day use hotel and a shuttle came to pick us up. Kids were well rested and less cranky when they flew two long haul flights. I also requested hindu meal for my flight but I should have requested hindu veg meal. They served goat and fish, which did not taste Indian from any angle. But I was so tired not to care for any food. Overall I think it was pretty good deal for about 700 each.

After a 3 hour wait we arived in soul to have missed out connecting flight . A bit upset But quickly changed when we were Put up In a howard Johnsons hotel . and feed dinner and a fantistic Brekfest then transported to the airpore to be connected to my new return fiight and given the great treatment and consideration for the yrouble .. Nothing was charged for all the flights to get me back to the us and very comfertable.
wonderful airlines...on time, wonderful services, clean and legroom much improved during the years.....thank you !

We flew from Seattle to Seoul, Seoul to Phnom Phen and then Ho Chi Min City to Seoul and Seoul to Seattle.  Each flight was fine and fairly comfortable in our economy seats.  The food on board was pretty good.    We were a little worried about the short time for our connecting flight, but it was a simple process of following the signs to Transfers, going through security screening and then a short walk to the gate.  I would fly Asiana Airlines again.

I chose this airline only because it was the cheapest at that time compared to my preferred airline.  I can't appreciate how roomy the seat was for an economy class, and I was already impressed by Emirates, but Asiana was better.

Food on the other hand, bland as an unsalted boiled watercress.  better pack some salt and pepper sachets for any Asiana flight.  even the return flight meal was so-so, the seat space was really its only saving grace.

and the return trip baggage check-in was tedious and unnecessary, I already checked in online, so it would be logical if we just went straight to the self-check in baggage counter right? nope, had to fall in line with folks going to the US which took forever until we were left with only 3 minutes before boarding time, and to think we arrived 4 hours early just so we can have peace of mind.

Good experience,  the staff are so nice, the Flight Manager was great.I left my laptop, when travelling from Delhi to Seoul, got the same at their office, when travelling back to India. The people are very good.

days before our flight home my wife injured her ankle. The doctor gave her a note that described the injury and deemed her safe to fly. We took his professional opinion and sturdy foot brace. In fact it would have been better not to fly but one does not realise all the logistics before the experience.
People at large recognise that they can help in little ways that make life much easier.. little things like holdiong a door open for a wheel chair are really helpful. I am left doubting that Asiana staff we encountered would extend such a basic common courtesy!
Here is what happened in brief.
1. I checked in online early to select seats with extra legroom. on arriving at the airport our seats had been allocated to others and we had to argue to get them back.
2. after take off the altitude caused swelling and great pain to the ankle. As the economy cabin was full we put the leg up on some carry on luggage. It did not block an aisle or exit. The flight attendant swifty moved in with stern objection. if its against the rules then fine.. but what is the alternative? No alternative was offered even though I could think of plenty myself.. including paying for an upgrade to business class where she could raise her leg as there was plenty of space there. The Flight attendants claimed this was not possible after take off. Those seats should remain empty and my wife should suffer the pain until landing. Of course this was not an option, or necessary so we ignored this suggestion much to the frustration and aggression of the cabin crew. Even the flight attendant manager saw no alternative!! Having walked top the bathroom I spotted an empty seat, the kind and patient gentleman besides us agreed to move there.. we all thought it best not to involve the cabin crew as the had proven most incompetent so far.
We spent the remainder of the flight with her leg raised on my lap. 
I believe the flight conditions made her condition worse. The cabin crew chose not to help and in-fact made matters worse. They did not use their power to present solution, simply used it to in-force rules that were of questionable importance given the circumstances. I wrote a letter once we got home requesting protocol on such scenario and expressing my experience. I have yet to receive a reply.. its been almost 8 months. 
I have been a loyal customer of Asiana for many years but have never had opportunity to test there customer service. Unfortunately they have proven to be lacking and let me down when I needed thee help the most. I have lots of milage.. and yes I will use that but There are other airlines I can travel with and I will be selecting the alternatives from now on.

There wasn’t many passengers for this flight, so a nice touch getting three seats to myself. For a 11.5 hour flight, I managed three hours sleep plus watched four movies. Food was decent. A few extra snacks helped pass the time.

Alright when I say that ""someone died"" I mean someone actually died. And it was awful to see and it must have been horrible to be in that situation. Luckily we were all still on the tarmac when it happened, but then we got held up there for 2 hours. I tried to ask what had happened but nobody could explain it. We were on the tarmac until 1 am, and I believe we were supposed to take off at 11:30pm. 

The air conditioning on the plane had gotten turned off (understandable since we were at a standstill for a while, no need to have the engines running and using fuel) but it seemed that it never got turned back on, or at least never got back to its full capacity. It was ridiculously hot on the entire flight back, and lots of screaming children to show for it. The flight attendants all tried to fan a middle row of crying babies, but it didn't help that much. I felt like crying too, honestly. Other than that flight the rest of my trip was okay, but damn. Definitely gonna spend the few hundred extra dollars to get a different airline next time.

Used this airlines many years ago and my recent flights indicate why it is still the best airline out there. I had to take a Mileage Plus return flight where they route you to Seoul first before flying to Hawaii. Originally the layover was 1.5 hours but the flight had to be changed, and for the trouble, Asiana allowed me a 25 hour layover in Seoul so I was able to spend a full day there as a bonus, after 2.5 weeks in Japan.

Now on the 1.5 hour flight from Kansai to Incheon, they served a hot meal! It was curry on rice with bulgolgi with a bread roll. On a 1.5 hour flight??? Amazing. Then on the flight from Incheon to Honolulu, they served two big meals, for dinner I selected the Korean menu and for breakfast, they served a big platter of omelet, two sausages, steamed broccoli, french fries, together with a bread roll, yogurt, and a big plastic tray of fresh fruit: pineapple, honeydew melon, and grapes - big chunks.

In addition, the plane on the flight to Hawaii had really roomy seats without your legroom blocked, it seems all the seats were Economy Plus size. I believe Asiana choose a plane like this on purpose for long international flights.

Hey, can't beat this on a free airline ticket from Japan to Hawaii!

I've been flying on Asiana for over 10 years about 1-2 times a year. What in the world is going on??? You cannot call them, their web site is changed and is just crazy, I am locked out of my mileage program account and, no kidding, over 30 min waiting, when they'd allow me to stay on hold vs. a message that says ""we're experiencing a high volume of calls"" so call back later sucker. THEN, no help with access to Asiana Club even though I pressed #4. Anyway, they are really suddenly (been at this for 2 weeks) just a mess!!!! Bought a ticket from 3rd party same price as theirs on line. Yes, hooked on the miles even with all this hassle but who can survive this??? Even their online web ticket purchase site is a mess. What's going ON????

Flew business class via Seoul and we had top shelf treatment.  Hardware was A330 and not the most comfortable aircraft, but Asiana outfitted the planes well and attendants kept everything clean.  Western food offerings were arguably the best in the air as far as taste and component quality. Presentation was excellent by a staff that cared about passenger dining.

We flew from LAX to INC in business class. It was a long 12 hour flight on the A380. The seats were very comfortable with a flat bed. The flight attendants were very attentive. Service and food were excellent. Will fly them again. The 1-2-1 configuration means that everyone has an aisle!

Overall experience was good. though the Flight was not modern or new age. Had good time in the flight . Had 2+4+2 Configuration seats with considerable Good Leg room & reclining was better than other Asian airlines. Opted for Indian Vegetarian meal (AVML), Food was the best compared to Malaysian or Thai airways. Crew was polite & helpful. 

downside was the USB port for mobile charge was not available (Even charging socket could not use, as the socket was not universal). The entertainment option was also not good, as there was not much of movie or music selection.

I will go with 3.5 out of 5. as overall experience was better than average.

Flew from Korea to Cebu and was a very good experience Seats were extremely comfortable and staff were helpful was toothpaste and brushes in bathroom which was a nice extra would fly with them again as was a very good experience and nice flight

I always travel on Asiana because it is the most convenient for me since they fly directly to CRK from INC (10 minutes from home) and I don't have to fly to MNL as I would on all other airlines flying out of INC (Three to much longer time to get home by taxi or bus... depending on traffic).  This flight is frequently late in departing due to aircraft congestion at INC, but Asiana keeps you well informed about possible delays.  On this particular journey on November 9th, we had stayed in Seoul for four days and it was even more convenient because if you are in Seoul and will take the AirEx express train to INC airport from Seoul Station (no stops... 45 minutes... 2 X 2 seating with assigned seat numbers and baggage racks for bag storage, if you still have bags).

At Level B2 in Seoul Station, if you are traveling on Asiana, Korean, or Air Asia  there is an airline checkin counter where you can check in for your flight, check in your bags, clear immigration, and buy your AirEx Train Ticket with your choice of departure time (W 9,000).

Then you can either come back later (having rid yourself of your checkin bags) or remain there in a lounge until you are ready to board the train. When you arrive a INC Airport you can go directly to an expedited lane for the Security Check and go to your gate. Super Convenient!

From the Lounge to the fast track passport check invitation, Asiana runs Business Class the way others attempt (often unsuccessfully) to run First Class. 
Food and beverage selection and quality are outstanding, airline staff superb and the seats are fabulous. If you ever doubt if spending on airfare is worthed, this 12-hour flight would absolutely convince you. 
BTW it was 40% cheaper than British Airways and many other ""top"" airlines. I flew British business class from New York and there is no comparison, BA executives should fly Asiana to learn how it is done!
The Asiana flight from San Francisco to Seoul was comfortable. The food was ok and the service pleasant.

I chose Asiana for two reasons: I wanted to experience the new Airbus 350 and check for myself the reputation of the company. The aircraft was somewhat disappointing; as the European competitor of the Boing 787, the 350 is noisier and has smaller windows. Other features may differ from one company to another. Asiana had a good ticket price - less than USD 1,000 from SFO to Hanoi, Vietnam, round trip. On economy, seats configuration are 3-3-3. Leg room was more than enough for my 5'5 height. Seat reclining was comfortable and the screen size adequate - smaller than an iPad, though. By the way, IFE was less than good. Not many new blockbusters. It seems the company follow the Asian traveler preferences. Blanket, headset, and a pair of slippers were distributed for all passengers on Economy and toothpaste/brush were available at the lavatory. Meals were good, specially the Korean option (they had one Korean and one western choice). I had the ssambap - quite tasty. Liquor was served at no additional cost for passengers. Stewards were nice and worked with a smile on their faces. I would not rank Asiana with Singapore Airlines or ANA but they are close. I believe Asiana is a good option to fly to Asia.
Staffs very friendly, professionally. My flights is better when I choose their service. I think I will choose them for next time
Good flight with on time boarding. Seats were comfortable. The meal served was actually pretty good and hearty for a 2 hour flight.
As korean airlines we can’t expect more... but from Gimpo airport to jeju is domestic airport, you better understand korea as no one can speak English...

I flew Asiana Airlines from Bangkok to Los Angeles.
