The boarding process is not done in a timely manner, and is completely disorganized, so essentially everyone is just racing one another to get to the flight door to board (oh, goody!). I had a connection in Seoul, and both flights were delayed with no reason provided. The economy seats are small and uncomfortable, (I flew Korean Air economy and my experience was exponentially better, but that’s another review). The restrooms were unclean, and the floors were soiled. The in-flight food was awful as well, we weren’t even offered a bottle of water for a 10+ hour flight. The final cherry on top upon arriving in Los Angeles was broken luggage! When I filed a claim they tried to offer me very cheap, very poorly made luggage as a consolation. When I told them the luggage they offered was not satisfactory, they told me, ‘they would call me’. The likelyhood of that is as strong as me ever flying with this airlines again. Bottom line; spend a bit more for a better travel experience!

Great flight, friendly crew, great food . Seats and controls were pretty old and the screen was an old timer too with multiple taps needed in the remote control to click on an icon of your choice. Seat are comfortable, but could be good if they can put their new machines in these long haul routes

Flew Asiana on November 26th from Seoul Incheon to Seattle Washington. Flight was excellent, service outstanding and flight attendants providing the best of service.Plenty of water and juice and the food was warm and the best they can do with aircraft food. Was fine.

Got into Seatac 35 min late due to the airport issues.

Not a big fan of airbus..toilets running out of water always jammed with people waiting. Seating in economy a bit tighter than boeing 777 coming over. But that's the plane only. Imho

But this was a Good flight..

Short hop flight was smooth enough and unlike the experience I had on the same route last year, the staff were reasonably attentive. 

What costs Asiana marks here is their poor excuse for a business class lounge. It was jammed to the point that once I finally found a seat I was unwilling to get up again for fear of losing it. Food and drink selection was poor and the bathrooms were a mess. I was glad to have been using points, as this sort of shabby corner-cutting would have driven me nuts had I paid full fare. It was almost as bad as a US airport “business class” lounge. The whole concept of the lounge being a seamless and equal part of the same experience as one gets on board seems to have eluded Asiana’s Incheon management. Asiana should  consider bringing in an outside consultant group to show them what they are doing wrong.

Having had a mediocre experience on Asiana’s business class last year, I was reluctant to try them again, but figured that the opportunity to fly First Class for the same number of points as business class would be worth giving it a go. The experience was generally good. 

The lounge at LAX was comfortable, with a waited dining service (limited but respectable menu). The boarding process was a bit disorderly, with the business, Star Alliance Gold and First class lineup long enough that it stretched across the terminal (but that’s mainly LAX’s fault). 

On board the suites were nice and reasonably private, though it would be nice if more airlines would adopt the Air France model and use curtains to achieve full privacy. The bedding was comfortable and the meals and drinks were good, though not spectacular. The staff were reasonably attentive without being too intrusive. Pyjamas were good enough to keep and look like they will be fairly durable. Vanity kit had some nice Salvatore Ferragamo products. 

Only two real  complaints. First was that the cabin was kept uncomfortably warm, which I’ve experienced on Asian airlines before. It kind of defeats the purpose of providing nice pyjamas and a duvet when the cabin is a toasty 25 C or warmer. Second was that Asiana still discriminates against passengers who have used points to purchase their tickets on other Star Alliance websites, by making it impossible to choose seats using the online service. Star Alliance needs to fix this across the network, either with an integrated fusion service or requiring individual airlines to provide a fix. The latter could be as simple as having a dude sitting at a terminal manually completing such requests. 

All that said, the flight was very pleasant and left me quite refreshed.

My trip included flights from MLA to LAX to LAS to CUN.. i used 3 different airlines, Asiana is the main one from MLA to LAX to MLA. With Interjet (LAX-CUN-LAX), i experienced nothing but trouble. Asiana has truly set themselves apart. On my return to MLA. I was surprised that I fidnt get the seat I had thought I chose. I did not argue but my face called out unhappy. The supervisor at LAX on Nov26 noticed it and approached the staff even when I didnt ask and was already walking away.. I heard him ask what happened, but I no longer bothered. I went to shop a bit and when I got to the business lounge, I was surprised that a new boarding pass had been issued to me with the seat I wanted. The staff explained how it was changed due to change of aircraft but was able to make arrangements! This was done even withput any escalation or interactiom with the supervisor. That man is a gem! Some might say it is because Im on business class.. but we did pay almost 3x for certain reasons and they made sure they lived up to what the cust had expected. He couldve ignored me but he didnt. Again eve  without me escalatimg or even arguing.. just poor face of disappointment 🤗

This flight was about 10 hrs, the legroom, entertainment and service was very good, the meals and drinks were sufficient (two meals served), toothpaste and toothbrush were provided, the washroom was cleaned throughout the flight, blanket, pillow, eye mask and earplugs were provided and the flight attendants were very helpful and friendly, you get value for money and they are a part of star alliance

I am sitting in the airport in Seoul Korea completing this evaluation since I have a 9 hour layover with Asiana at this Airport. Continuing on to Seattle. This is my opinion on this. Again disappointed. Flight was packed which is good for them. But The most disgusting passengers I have ever experienced in my life. I will not pick on ""any"" ethnic group because there were several but I have never smelled so much passing gas through the entire flight along with the hacking with phlegm in the throat etc. And coughing. Not the airlines fault but I almost vomited and could not eat. And flying internationally four to five times a year since 1992. The passing gas was 4 hours. Flight attendants just plain average. Video system primative, No one used it!. During the boarding it was a mass rush for the gate in Bangkok.. The lady could not even use the clicker counter to verify boarding passes they were rushing in so fast ladies were shoving like football players This to me beat out China Eastern by a long shot in dissatisfaction. I'm sure the super long haul to SEA will be better. I tried to remain positive because I had good experiences with Asiana years in the past. But this time around ""0"" from me..Will not be back.

What a great airline.  Seats are configured in a 1-2-1 for business class, which can give a semi-private feel.  Flight attendants are very efficient.  Food selections are either western or Asian and are very good with a great selection of wines.  They become part of having a memorable trip.  Using flight consolidators, they become even more economic to use.  Only set back is you don’t get mileage credits.

This was a short flight but so nice.  Just as soon as we leveled off, I was served a healthy fruit and vegetable plate and it was delicious.  The flight attendants were so pleasant and friendly.  This was the most enjoyable of my three flights.

2 meals and a snack, constant water and juice being served.  Just outstanding service and right on time,  Arrived Korea early and connections where right on time.  Have used this airlines in the past and will use again in the future.  This airlines offers the best prices I could find, book 3 months in advance.

I have been a loyal customer of Asiana for years and they had a promotion where they give vouchers to the Sky Lounge at Incheon Airport.We have a 15-hr lay over so that was excited to get that voucher. Asiana sent me an email, however, they did not send an email to my husband. When I inquired why I have not received the digital voucher, Asiana US Marketing told me it was voided because it says in the instructions the voucher cannot be duplicated. I asked them to send me another one but they refused due to policy. I told them I forwarded the voucher email because I thought my husband can use the same link to request his digital voucher. Had they sent the email regarding the voucher to my husband in the first place, I would not have gotten my voucher voided. Is that the right way to treat a loyal customer when they should have sent an email with the link to request a voucher to my husband. Their customer service is really bad and to think I was not requesting something like an upgrade but just a voucher. Due to this I will tell all my friends and family who are now using Asiana to take Korean or another airline. Asiana's customer service does not have good business sense!
Flew from Tokyo to Seoul. Service was great and decent food and service. Not quite at the level of JAL but I would recommend when convenient.

Me and my sister used Asiana Airlines, a star alliance member last October 2018 from Jakarta – Incheon (OZ762 & OZ761) A 330-300. Seat configuration 2-4-2, and our seat 35K with an ample leg room, we had basic comfort blanket and pillow. Our flight was 11.45 PM, we had a breakfast couple hours before landing, choices were chicken porridge and omelet, both served with fruit, yoghurt and bread. The meals during flight back from Incheon to Jakarta even better, we’ve had full dinner course Korean dishes, choices were Beef and Chicken, with side dish Miso Soup, Salad, Kimchi all delicious.

We took Asiana for our family trip to Seoul and back to Manila.  During the Manila-Incheon leg, I was given mushroom congee and since it was early morning, I guess that was sufficient to tide me over to the real breakfast.  On the Incheon-Manila leg, I was given the Sambap - a beef stew with rice, samjang sauce and a variety of edible leaves.  I'd wrap the beef and rice on the leaf and since they were different kinds of leaves, every bite was different. I really enjoyed it.  My husband chose the chicken and potatoes which was just usual - he did not even get to finish the chicken breast as it was tough already.  So, if there is a chance to get a Korean meal, that is what you should choose.  

I bought our tickets in July '18 but only went to their website to check-in on 29 Oct. '18. By that time, most of the seats were taken so our group of 8 ended up seating in different rows.  Luckily, we were able to get 2 adjoining seats for some of us.

My husband and I were seated in the middle and aisle seats, respectively and the seats were comfy.  I did not realize that the seats were spacious until the man on the window seat of our row (who was the same size as my husband) decided to go to the restroom.  My husband and I did not need to get up from our seats.  We just had to straighten a bit and the man went through without touching us.  He passed us again on the way back to his seat and still no contact.  I was pleasantly surprised at the legroom.  We are looking forward to our next Asiana flight wherever o whenever that will be....

Started my second part of my trip to Sydney and we changed aircraft at seoul to the A380 and the flight in Business was half empty but the service and crew were amazing nothing was too much and the seats and flat beds very comfortable.served 4 courses on board. Again shame about poor entertainment selection.

First time I've used Asiana Airline and i was very impressed from check-in to arrival at South Korea The crew and service was very good and food was good my only grip would be that the entertainment on the flight was pretty poor not a lot of choice not like other airlines that have many channels to pick from. Nothing was too much for the staff and some crew they English was very limited. But i would used this airline again and the business lounge at Seoul Airport was ok.

Flew with Asiana to Incheon, and from Gimpo to Jeju. During my flight to Incheon, the inflight entertainment had some issues which prompted an entire shutdown to reboot for 20 mins in the middle of a red eye flight. Food choice was limited and didn’t taste very good. Inflight entertainment is extremely limited. So note that their domestic flight does not have any inflight entertainment at all.

The international flight has roomier seats and appreciate the 2-4-2 seating configuration.
Asiana takes extra care of special need passengers and I appreciated their efforts to make your flight comfortable.

I was excited to take Asiana because I had used it many years ago and thought they were very classy even when traveling economy. This time around was a little disappointed. Yes the seats are roomy when you take the Boeing 777. But when you switch over to an Airbus if you have an aisle seat get ready for the big change..You will be bumped every time a flight attendant walks by even though they are very polite..very small seat. Did not think much of the movie selection on the trip. And when I looked around many people weren't even using the monitors this time.. The food was ""ok"" typical aircraft food. The flight was ""over"" an hour delay leaving SeaTac. Not much more to say hope the return will be a bit better..

We were a family of 3 on a family holiday and decided to take 2 suitcases, we had a total allowance of 69kg between us.
When we checked in at Seoul one of our cases weighed 21 kg and the other one was 25 kg total 46 kg. However with this Airline the maximum case weight must not exceed 23 kg per passenger. So we had to open one case and transfer 2 kg to the other case. In all the years I have flown this is the first time I have experienced this.
The flights were punctual, the seating was comfortable and the food was very nice.

Check in was quick and headed to the Swissair lounge. Fairly unimpressive but a lounge none the less. The lounge in Incheon was large and had a good selection of food and drinks. The 777 from JFK to ICN had fully flat seats and good space. Foot space in the bed position was a little tight but doable. The food was good not great. Cabin crew were friendly and always helpful. The flight from ICN to HKT was on an a330-300. The service again was great and the food was good. The seat didn't go flat which may not be a make or break but I felt this seat was just uncomfortable. It was also loud and when reclining it made a sound like the landing gear was coming down. This was a 7 hour flight and I felt the business class could have been better. The entertainment system could offer more as well. Both flights were on time.

Asiana have had issues with catering that they say are now over. They're not.  Rather than a choice between different western meals as has always been the case, now you get chicken. The flight lasts 12 hours and arrives about 1900 London time, and you get fed scrambled egg as your prelanding meal. Really?
The crew were apologetic; the plane was OK (A350, nice and quiet). The movies were acceptable. Flight was as often the case delayed, apparently by China) Seat was good. But for a so-called 5 star airline the food  would only have been acceptable in a one-off case. In the present situaiton the same half-assed menu has been all that's offered on the London route for at least a month.

This was our first time flying with Asiana and we wasn't dissapointed. We chose to pay a little extra for Smartium Economy seats and they were definitely worth it, we had lots of leg room to stretch out, the seats reclined and slid forward so were comfortable. Being given slippers to wear as well as the blanket, eye mask & toothbrush & toothpaste was a nice touch. The food we had was tasty and we had 3 meals provided throughout our flight as well as drinks being brought around all the time. We also had a short flight to Tokyo from Seoul and this was a very pleasant journey too again food & drink was served. At the end of our holiday we flew from Osaka to Seoul and then had an interconnecting flight to Heathrow and everything went very smoothly, our bags arrived safely at Heathrow with no problems at all.We would definitely recommend Asiana to others and will definitely use them again.
Flight was on time, staff was courteous and friendly.   Plenty of leg room in the economy section.  Meals were good!

Pleasant experience and excellent service.   Comfortable flight.  Great food. Try the Korean cuisine.  Attendants were wonderful and personable. I was impressed how they helped a young mother, who had an infant aboard.   The hours ""flew"" by!

Based on price, this is a good airline to go with. The service was good, the crew were nice, and it was nearly on time. With the lower price don't expect the comfort, entertainment equipment or selection, nor quality of food as you'd get on a Delta or similar.

I had to participate in a conference at Sendai, so I decided to go to Japan with Asiana film.
I entirely feel satisfied with their regularity. All the procedures exactly occurred on time by minutes.
The ticket already included a snack. My previous snack contained 1 boiled chicken breast with sauce, some boiled potatoes, 1 cup of mixed fruit, 1 fluffy bun and 1 cup of minralized water. You can ask for some tea, cola or fresh water before the meal. After your meal, they would like to offer you some tea or coffee. Some cheap film may make your airplane become a market; therefore, I advise you who travel by organization's fund should choose such films like Asiana to reduce clearance's complex.
I met some problem with my Vietnamese name order; however, the ground service's staff help me to solve the issue. So anyone who has a complex name shouldn't worry about your name on the ticket, the staff can understand it if you clearly explain your problem.
I flew Asiana from Tokyo to Seoul and chose them because they are Star Alliance partner airline along with Air NZ.  They looked after us well.

Had not heard of Asiana before but reports were encouraging. The flight was an excellent experience due to the attention received from the staff. Their attention to detail was extremely good. There were plenty of them and there all the time IF you needed them. We were well spoilt. Good food and excellent wine.

The staff were all very friendly and accommodating, speaking good English. The food was good and drinks were offered regularly. The seat was a little uncomfortable but not too bad. Both flights I had with them were on time.

Airbus 350 was quiet and comfortable. Business Smartium was quite spacious on this aircraft. The cabin temperature was ok for sleeping; the amenities pack included eye shades, ear plugs. Crew were attentive, food was excellent with a good variety of options for main meal. IFE was fine.Flight was delayed due to late incoming. 
As usual toilets were kept spotless.
Onward flight on OZ108 was good, even though on a A321. Seats very adequate.

The economy class seating was a little uncomfortable but they gave us earplugs and eye masks. Didn’t get those on the return flight for some reason. The staff was very friendly and warm. I would love to fly with them again!

No complaints here. Kind and attentive service, adequate food, including some interesting Korean cuisine and smooth travel in this enormous plane. The movie selection was a little weak, but that's the only negative aspect of the journey.

Clean, modern plane.  Super friendly staff.  Decent entertainment package.  Food could certainly have been better.  On time flights, outbound and return.  It was fine and I have no complaints, but next time I’d try Korean Air to see what it was like.
Took an Asiana airline our family’s Rome trip. The cabin captain was aware of senior passengers and frequently checked how my mother was doing. Very considerate and kind.

I really enjoyed this flight. The leg room in economy felt more than in Europen Airlines. The food was ok and the service was very friendly. They could add a few more choices to the entertainment program.

Friendly crew members. Although the food just so-so and limited movie choices, enough for a 3.5hr flight
attentive crew with ok airport lounge (shared with star alliances in hk)
Could check in at airport bus terminus then use fast lane for immi checking. Great service. Although the lounge at ICN is so crowded. around HK$5k for a biz tkt to seoul is a reasonable and good deal. Rem to try the in-flight shopping, i pre-order jo malone and the price is cheap.

I fly internationally on several different airlines but I really enjoyed Asiana airlines.  The lounge at JFK was with Swiss Air Star Alliance so it was small with a few snacks and drinks.  However at Incheon the lounge was great, excellent selection of food and drinks, showers and restrooms. Boarding the plane was very organized - everyone lined up by section and it was the most orderly and efficient one I have experienced.  On board, there was lots of room for your carry on bags included a seat compartment (by the window).  I chose the A seat by the window as it was a single so I had some privacy.  The crewed bowed as we pulled out of the gate on time. They took your food order early and paid attention to details - we dined as if in a restaurant with several courses, drinks topped up in between courses, water glass filled. You have a choice of Korean or Western and the quality was good.   Lots of recent movies to choose from so I watched 5 movies going (as I cannot sleep on planes).  The bathroom was clean with lots of room and amenities and they cleaned up and restocked during the flight.  I found the service to be very good and thorough.  I would fly with this airline again and recommend to my friends. I felt it was worth what I paid for the ticket.

We flew from London to osaka with Asiana.
The flight was on time. There was not much leg space. 
The staff were very friendly and helpful, food was good. Drinks were only offered with the meals and my wine poured from a bottle. No refill was offered. 
It all felt a bit basic.
Friendly staff, amazing in-flight food, and they actually provided do-it-yourself lettuce ssamjang wraps! Yum!
Thank you Asiana Airlines for everything. I live in Korea for 9 years. Everytime best conditions good service. And so respectful cabin staffs. Thank you

It was my 2nd time to ride this airline and the flight went well. I rode in this airline en route to Seattle from Incheon years ago. The entire flight during that time and the recent flight this month were all excellent flights. I am not sure if I made a review about this airline before though. 
     I said this is an alternative airline to ride in, to Korean Air. I always ride in Korean Air, but in the event that the said airline does not have a schedule to fly on the day of my flight, I would opt for Asiana Airlines. 
     The service and food were great, although the console for the entertainment screen may need some additional improvements like instructions on how to use it, in English. I had a somewhat difficult time figuring out how it works the entire flight.

Got a good deal, got even better service. The tickets we got from them were not the cheapest that we can find but it was certainly reasonable. I regularly fly with Asiana and have had the chance to fly to the US from Manila three times already. I also had the chance to fly to Korea twice with Asiana and all these experiences have been altogether pleasant. Our last trip earlier this year was no exception. The service was top notch as usual, there was a restless child (the perfect gauge when trying to figure out the capability of the crew to address a passenger situation) which they were able to successfully pacify while still providing warm service to the family of the child. Food was not hotel grade but the tiny details about the ingredients (i.e. Gochujang,etc.) that you put into you bowl is really a nice touch. Seats are adequately comfortable and in-flight entertainment is updated regularly, having some Korean movies that I can watch nowhere else was a welcome addition to the usual Hollywood options. I think the flight has an option for you to purchase Wifi but I didn't feel the need to as the media selection being offered in-flight was good enough. Excellent experience overall and have yet to be let down by this airline. Keep it up!

I fly regularly with Asiana. They are nice and service is efficient but certain factors of service like in flight meal quality has been on the decline in recent years. Nonetheless their A380 is very comfy even in coach.

Used to be excellent serviced airline but 
Run down somehow from the owner scandal I guess.
However, they still providing decent food,
Proper space for economy class compare
To other airline.
On the way back home, they gave express
Card that we could get through all long lines and smooth connection to YVR.

I rode Asiana from Lax to Manila and back to Lax again.   I thought at first the airconditioning was just starting to get fired up thats why it was still warm inside.  But after an hour or so, the temperature havent changed.  I think the aircondtionting was only place at the ""fan"" mode.  Imagine my inconvenience for almost 14 hours.  

The food is better than other airlines, but its a total fail in the airconditioning.  Please make your passenger enjoy the flights and feel less tired.

Evening Flight from Tokyo to Seoul.
Bigger 777-200, Full Flight, lots of food served, ran on time, even got us there earlier by 20mins. Star Alliance with Air New Zealand on a flight from Christchurch, Auckland, Tokyo, finally Seoul.
The seat was very comfortable. I was very tired and surely had a good nap during the flight. The crew members were also very friendly. I will use this company again in the future.
When I found out this airline was five star it wasn’t hard to see why.  I couldn’t fault it in any area.  Excellent food, service and punctuality.

Seating was very comfortable and recline was nice enabling decent sleep on the long flight. 

Service was adequate but since it was an overnight flight, admittedly a lot of the time was sleeping. 

Food was OK but not really anything exceptional. 

All in all a decent flight. 

All was on time including luggage delivery.

(Actual travel date - Aug. 2016)

I can say that the aircraft, entertainment system, inflight meal, cabin crews are above the average. However they don't know how to treat passengers when they are facing problem with aircraft. Overall, I won't suggest this airline unless if you want to spend half of a day in front of the gate until they solve the problem without any other notice. Your patience will be running out.

It was the first time flying with Asiana and usually flew with SQ or QF. Overall, I have to point out how great their service was and especially the cabin crews are super polite and helpful. I was very impressed with Japan Airline's service last year but it was nothing compared to this airline. I beg you cannot expect this kind of quality service in any other carriers and especially Qantas (had too many unpleasant experiences).

They also provided us with a transit hotel located in the heart of Seoul which was great for a short sightseeing. Surprisingly the hotel was very modern, clean and breakfast was amazing. 

The best part of the trip was a free upgrade to Business class for ICN-FCO and ICN-SYD. Crews were even polite with dedicated service in business, foods were good but I would suggest you try the Korean option because Bimbab tasted so good and it was served in economy class. I also regret not trying the vegetable wrap which also looked amazing for an economy class food.
I love flying with Korean people. Even though it took 5 hours longer to fly Istanbul we loved to fly with one of Korean based airlines and we loved it again.

Very professional and very comfortable.  Of course business class should be but Asiana hires the best for this long trip.  The food was incredible and the flight attendants were wonderful.  I couldn't have asked for anything more!

Complete experience was fantastic. There were 3 times more flight attendants compared to an American or European airline. The flight attendants were incredibly focused on service and were constantly running back and forth doing their job. Very well groomed and pleasant. Food was the best I have ever had and heads above United, Delta and Lufthansa.

tried to reschedule the trip with them directly, this agent name Roger, worst attitude ever, not helpful, very arrogant. 

would not fly with Asiana in the future for sure.

I flew one way on Asiana, and the return route on EVA. Between the two, Asiana was was much better in terms of both food and comfort. The meals were great, especially for airline food. I ate everything they served. The seats had foot rests and movie screens for each passenger. I would definitely recommend and fly this airline again.

The food was very good. And the portions were ample. The flight attendants were very attentive and ultra-polite.

There were a number of shortfalls, though. The cabin was much too warm to sleep comfortably. The lay flat seats had very little padding. Bring your own pillow. Asiana's are flat and hard. No Wi-Fi. Apparently only their new A350s have Wi-Fi. Understanding the announcements was a real challenge. Finally, the in flight entertainment system is a relic. The screen quality was like a 1950's TV with rabbit ears with the broadcast station 50 miles away. Horrible! Bring your own entertainment. Trust me on this! 

One piece of advice if you are travelling alone and want a window seat, select even number rows - that puts your seat next to the window. The odd number rows place the seat next to the aisle with a wide console between you and the window.

The flight was ok, although not that comfortable. But what can you expect from a 10HR flight. Flight attendants gave the kind of service and attention I have come to expect from Asiana.  The chicken dinner was ok but the breakfast omellete and Franks were a bit bland.

The flight was OK. Flight attendants were kind and attentive. I really don't like it when you have to join the movies in progress.  We did not particularly like the good selection but that is not to say it tasted bad. 

Flight was on schedule.
A330 business class with 2-2-2 configuration and the window seat has no direct exit. The cabin crew are friendly and efficient. Actually if you want a better food choice, western style is quite good.

Asiana is so accommodating. My unclaimed  luggage was returned using the best possible way for us to pick it up from the nearest airport.  

Love their food as well.  Kudos to Mr. Choi of Asiana Chicago O Hare for seeing to it that my luggage gets into the nearest pick up airport.
I Flew with Asiana 2 times to Seoul, services are good, legroom quite spacious and food is nice. no issue
The plane was spacious and the stewards were excellent. The inflight meals were also pretty good. Entertainment was pretty good as well with many movie selections to choose from.

The flight was delayed and I guess everyone was tired including the staff. 
After we boarded, the departure was delayed again for another 30 min or so. 
When a lady went to use the bathroom, the flight attendant did not say anything. But after the lady returned to the seat and I tried to stand up to go to the bathroom, I was yelled.. ""Sit down!! Sit down!! Don't stand up!!"" 
I didn't quite understand why I was yelled, but I was very embarrassed to be yelled like that...  I think there was another way, perhaps nicer way, to tell me not to stand up. 

It was such a shame because I had a great experience with flying with them from Haneda to Seoul, Seoul to London, London to Seoul, then this happened during my last flight, Seoul to Haneda. 

I will be flying with them again in November, I am hoping my next experience is a bit nicer.

I flew with them in June from Seoul to London, then back form London to Seoul. 
Compared to my short distance fight from Haneda to Seoul and Seoul to Haneda, it was so much better. 

The seat was comfortable and clean, the service was attentive and it was quiet. 
I will fly with them from Tokyo to Seoul in November and I am hoping the short distance would be better this time.

We've traveled to visit relatives in NYC many times over the years, but have never used Asiana Airlines before, but a friend recommended we try them and we did!  Glad we did since it was one of our most comfortable long haul flights ever.  The seats were comfortable and seem wider in the economy class as compared to other airlines in economy class.   Plus the flight attendants were very polite, helpful and professional.  The meals on board were not bad and we truly enjoyed our first experience with Asiana Airlines.  We will definitely try them again on our next visit to the USA.

Everything to do with Asiana was absolutely fine.  From the price, the automatic check in, to the very helpful ground staff who fast tracked us through Haneda airport when we got lost on the way in, to the food, to the legroom. All fine.

If I had to suggest a small improvement, it would be for Asiana to make it easier to contact customer services before the flight without having to phone.  I did manage to find an email address eventually but it wasn't easy.

Quiet and roomy Airbus A380 with excellent entertainment system.  Crew members are super nice and friendly!  Food is excellent for airplane standard :)  I fly often internationally and Asian is the best!!!

Everything starts at the airport, an hour late and waiting without explanation
Then come the meal time, great moment of loneliness when I learn that there is not enough meal for all passengers
They given me snacks to wait. 20 minutes later I see a hostess with real meal trays bibimpap and for whom? for the crew. So thanks to Asiana for the passengers who bought their tickets and they can starve during this time, the crew is satiated.

Travelling to Vietnam we went via S Korea with Asiana. Comfortable seats, very helpful flight attendants, great entertainment system. Also impressed with S Korea airport, free showers and sleeping area for people on transfers.

Crew are excellent since upfront seat are arranged by staff cannot be done once assigned;  hence, food are not preordered. First leg of long haul flight with bibimbab as well as Calbi provided for midnite Dinner & need to ask fir caviar which comes with western service: ironically on return flight, chicken are excellent provided in leu of Calbi ...she had asked me if I wanted caviar? Oo yes!
Bkfst I prefer soft foods hence, pourrage! Lounge food in ICN first class by the female bear upstairs was excellent! Not,  to be confused with business class by gate 28 not so good food wise, btw! However, staff are equally as cordial, excellent service, great job!

First, I have to admit that I am a fan of Asiana airlines. I've been living and working in Asia for 25 years and have used several airlines but Asiana has always out performed them all.  The aircraft on this particular trip was modern and clean.  The staff, from the check in desk to the flight attendants, were considerate and courteous.  I always pick Asiana when it flies to the destinations I need.

What I liked about the flight
1. At 1.86m tall, economy seats are always tight for me. Surprisingly and the best part for me was that the seats was somewhat spacious (see picture) 

2. The food on the return leg was excellent.

3. Service was always friendly and with a smile

What I think can be improved 
1. I was under the assumption this being a full service airline, the check in baggage was 30kg per person. Not the case of our flight, it was 23kg and 1 piece only. 

2. The food on the to trip was very bad. It was a red eye flight and they served egg omelette which was tasted poorly. 

3. Somewhat basic entertainment system. With only I think 7 or 8 movies. The newest they had was Solo or infinity wars.

Wheelchair was provided for my wife but Asiana airline staff did not provide her a sticker for handicap passenger at the NAIA Manila terminal. This caused my wife not to be provided with a handicap transportation at Incheon international airport resulting in my wife's running to the airline gate of our flight to Seattle. With strained and weak legs she had to walk and run the far distance from the gate we arrived at at Incheon to the gate for Asiana bound for Seattle. She had to practically run since flight from Manila has been delayed for almost 45 minutes leaving us only some 15 minutes to travel from gate to gate after going through Incheon airport's immigration. We both arrived at the gate for the Seattle bound flight at the last minute boarding time!
As for the food, there was no Western food in-flight and if there was, maybe it was limited. I am not into Korean food which was given to me but good thing my wife likes it. Also, airline stewardesses were not that friendly and helpful...not like the earlier years we traveled via Asiana. This year, my wife and I decided to change airline to Eva Airlines. Hoping this will be better for our trip to the Philippines this coming October.

The crew members were polite but difficult to understand in English.  The food was good Korean chow and western fare was available too.  Drinks were reasonable in price, wine was free  The trip required a change of flights at Incheon with a mandatory security screening by the Korean version of TSA.  The security staff will seize any liquids exceeding the maximum allowed so if you are hand carrying something liquid you bought at the last airport kiss it goodbye.  They run you through their scan quickly so be careful and don't forget anything in your haste.  We will spend a little more and ride a different carrier next time. We will avoid flights stopping in Korea.
Taking asiana is always a pleasure. The seats are quite comfortable and meal is always good, especially the korean bibimbap!

On the first leg of our flight (BKK-ICN) we were on a new double-decker plane and the seats were remarkably uncomfortable owing to headrests that stuck out too far and kept your neck at  an unnatural angle.   For the flight back from Seattle to Bangkok I had  to buy a neck pillow ( which I hate and which I think look stupid)  just to keep my neck in a comfortable position while sitting in the  seat.    In addition to the uncomfortable seat,  find it very annoying to have to sit through mandatory videos at the beginning and the end of every flight  and which override and interrupt whatever movie you are watching.  At the beginning we  are forced to watch duty-free sales advertisements,  and at the end of the flight we are forced to watch stretching exercises ( which, looking around the plane, about one person in 100 actually participate in).  Thirdly  on the BKK-ICN leg,  there  is a much much smaller  movie selection than on the ICN-SEA leg,   despite that it's a huge new double-decker plane.   That really seems counterintuitive-- you would think the newer planes would have at least as many if not more movies to choose from,  as opposed to a dramatic reduction in choices.  Lastly,  with so many people in economy class one would hope there would be staff responsible for keeping the restrooms clean, but they got dirty almost immediately and stayed dirty during the entire flight.   Really disappointing (and  not to mention gross).

This was our first experience of Asiana Airlines.  We were very impressed.  The flights from Heathrow to Incheon and on to Sydney were on time.  The cabin service was excellent, as were the meals.  The planes were comfortable .  Both flights were overnight so we did not use the entertainment systems.  The one downside was the lounge in Incheon which would benefit from an update.  Overall though flying with Asiana proved an excellent experience and we would certainly consider flying with the airline again.

I flew A380 plane - the big one from Bangkok-Incheon-Bangkok. Flight quality was superb. The entertainment (Movie & Etc) during flight time not much variety like another airline but it's ok.

Food on the way to Incheon was ok but on the way back to Bangkok was superb. The quality of the Economy Class amenities on board were outstanding (beer, wine & etc) as was the standard of service.

we are a regular asiana airline traveler and they (airlines) so far  has not failed our expectations. From ticketing to boarding and in flight service was great.  food was just ok but that is expected on an economy flight.
The Service was excellent. The seat was wide with lots of leg room. Toilet was clean, with adequate amenities. Food was tasty and of good portion. Definitely a 5-star service airline.
It was our first time to fly Asiana Airlines and to be honest, I was positively surprised. Economy seat legroom is better, service is great and staff are very nice and polite.

Our flight consisted of two legs: NYC to Seoul, South Korea...and then South Korea to Sydney, Australia. From beginning to end, our experience with Asiana Airlines was excellent. The plane itself was super clean, nicely decorated, roomy and efficiently set up. We had an uneventful layover in South Korea as we awaited our 2nd flight. The crew on board were extremely accommodating and considerate. The business class lay flat seating was absolutely the only way to fly such a long distance. It made our travel tremendously more comfortable. Food and meals were abundant. We were fed with a five-star restaurant menu from soup to nuts. In fact, I would dare say we were over-fed. Everything was lovely and delicious. Disembarking and luggage collection was good. Overall, one of the best flight experiences we have ever had.
I like the set up of the Asiana Business Class, 1-2-1, it provides more personal room. I find the food on this trip excellent and the wine selection is outstanding.

Flew economy from Seoul to Phuket. The service was great, the flight attendants are fluent in English and always ready to help. The food was good and they came around often to see if you want anything.

We flew out to Japan business class as the flight was through the night. We returned economy class as we were flying with our family who were also economy, and we were flying through the daylight. In each case the journey was very comfortable, the seats in economy class having a little more space than in some other airlines. The airline staff spoke perfectly adequate English and were both polite and helpful. The food was very good. In every case there was a choice between Korean and English food.

Flying to Tokyo we had to break the journey at Seoul. Going out, during the break, we had all the benefits of business class – separate lounge, buffet food and so on. Coming back economy there were still comfortable places where you could lie on a couch, and buy food.

I would be very happy to fly by as Asiana again.

A super interesting feature of Asiana's business class is the lounge they have. The lounge has two small couches and a bit of space for a baby to crawl/walk/cruise around. This was invaluable to 'change it up' on the baby over the super long flight.
Flight attendants were also helpful with the baby. They took our little one when we needed a break to eat, and were also helpful in staggering our meals so one parent was eating at a time. 
Check in was also great as we felt prioritized in one important way: Asiana also has 'honeymoon' seats -- that is, business class that are right next to each other, so that when both chairs are flat, it can almost make a full sized single bed. This made sleeping with the baby a little easier.

This was my 1st international flight and I have to say it was great! The service was top notch! Food was delicious (I recommend the Korean food) and the economy class seats were comfy and I feel like they are bigger than flying with Delta in the economy plus seats. Again I have to say the service from the staff is what makes my recommendation so high. Keep up the good work Asiana airlines, we will definitely fly with you every chance we get!!

Flew economy class from Seoul to Chicago.  Though I was in economy class, the service and food were good.  Flight attendants were attentive and their level of English was good.  The only recommendation is that they serve a limited selection of drinks as they seem to only serve what they can put on their food serving cart.  

At the end of the flight, my micro sd card dropped out of my phone and several flight attendants came to help me look for it.  I was embarrassed having all those attendants surrounding me trying to look for it.  In the end, it wasn't found, but they did a thorough job helping me look for it.  

I would gladly fly them anytime.  Puts our domestic airlines to shame.

It was my first time to travel via Aseana Airlines. It was a sponsored trip by a family member because the rate was very low. I thought services was poor but to my amazement, their aircraft is modernized. You can charge your mobile while in the sky. Not every airline has it. Flight attendants were very courteous and attentive. They give slippers even at economy section. Food is balance. 

The only thing I did not like is that they limit your size of the luggage is 23kg each for each passengers.  It should have been stipulated on the ticket. Other than that,price and services are very good 9

This was my first time to use Asiana. I went from Narita/Tokyo to Rome (through Seoul). Everything was nice on the way to Rome - however, on the way back to Tokyo, there was a big delay from Rome, which made me miss my original flight from Seoul. I was supposed to reach Narita at 6 pm, but instead, I reached Narita at around 10 pm, which made me miss the last bus to my city. So, I had to go to Tokyo once (I was lucky I could catch the *last* Narita express to Tokyo station) and from there, I had to take a bus to my place. I am glad they could find me a seat on a plane to Narita (from Seoul), however, the delay sucked a lot of energy and money out of me!!!

I have had the opportunity to fly on U.S. airlines and Asian airlines. there is no comparison. from the moment you contact the staff of Asiana or ANA , etc, you are greeted with respect and a kindness which is real not for public relations only. the first bow that the flight crew gives the passengers is indicative of how you will be treated by them throughout the process and of course it ends with the last bow as you leave. what a kind gesture. in between, the crew works hard , is always on top of the needs of the passenger and smiles and kind treatment abound. I enjoy flying Asiana. I also find the similar experiences with other Asian airlines. Professional and kind, what a combination!

My flight Singapore to seoul was horrible

 I couldn’t believe that they do not have inflight entertainment and the inflight meal was inedible.

The aircraft  was very very very old and looks unsafe. I think it looks like from 90’s aircraft and the meal ... just buy your own food if you booked for Asiana airline.

As business class seats it was adequate while lacking some storage and drink holders .
Food sterile, and minimal. limited to 2 western , 1 oriental, and 1 vegetarian option. Meat portion so small had to ask for a second portion.  Staff pleasant but not very gracious. Quickly disappeared after food service. Wine limited to dinner service period.  Seoul and Vietnam Business Class lounges just ok, with so so food. 
On board amenities kit cam in a very cheap looking. It was a flat useless purse.

I was pleasantly surprised on our trip to Phuket from Melbourne on the seat size in economy on the leg from Melbourne to KL... 
The local flights from KL to Phuket and back again were a bit squashy but ok.
The flight from KL back to Melbourne however was horrendous !!  
I'm just on 6' tall and 100kg - so  big bloke.
I could hardly get into the seat never lone get comfortable in it. 
it was one of the most awfully uncomfortable experiences I can ever remember.

It was my first trip with this airline and I was impressed with the quality of service. I have flown a few different airlines to Europe which were sub par in amenities and in-flight hospitality, but with Asiana I was provided with everything you would expect for a long flight: two meals, hot drinks, a blanket, a pillow, free movies, and prompt service.

Being a tall guy, I'm always a bit wary before a 10 hour (night)flight, the seat was a bit hard and the food a bit unsatisfying, but otherwise, enough legroom and very friendly service, would fly again with Asiana.
All Cabin Crew are the best!! An Aircraft is superb!! Flying to seoul is almost 6 hours however it is not made me tried for journey!!

We flew tourist class. We experienced timely arrival and departures. Moreover the flight attendants treated passengers as paying customers,rather than inconveniences.
Flying again in November and yep booked Asiana Airlines again. Econmical prices, dependable times and cannot overstate the services provided. Cannot say that any 12 hour flight in economy class on a commercial airline is something to look forward to, but with Asiana Airlines passengers are treated as people rather than cattle.

I fly Asiana Business Class when I travel to China (it's worth the stopover in Seoul). The planes are spotless, the business class seats are sublime, and the crew is as friendly and helpful as any I've encountered.

I used this Airline in 12/2015 and again in September and October 2017.  I was seriously impressed with the friendliness of the staff and crew of the flight, the leg space, the outlets for my laptop, the staffs willingness to provide ice and drinks throughout the flight, clean restrooms for my long 19 hour flight to Korea, and flight to Cebu.  I had Jet Blue from Orlando/MCO to JFK, and Cebu Pacific to Davao/DVO, Asiana International from JFK to Seoul, and from Seoul to Cebu/CEB.  This last trip Asiana did a little skit which I though was unique they didn't do this in 12/2015 I guess its a holiday thing.  A ceremony skit.  Other than this I can say Asiana is very accommodating.  Slippers, blankets, pillows.  For economy I couldn't have expected anything else.

The last trip the food was ok, not the best but then again I am a cook so standards are WAY UP THERE.  But the 2015 they had this spicy pork.  For airline food that was top notch.  I wish it was available in my last flight.

If you are flying from the US to Japan, check Asiana Airlines. The staff are universally professional and helpful. A wide variety of special meals ate available. you have to preorder those. They serve 2 meals and snacks and drinks, including wine, and free movies, forinternational flights. They have lounges at O'Hare and Natita with buffet, drinks, showers, wi fi, and massage chairs. You may have to reserve shower in advance. The lounges were free with my flight info and club pass for 5 people, otherwise 10$ for 2 people if you don't have the club pass.

Flew with Asiana on from Seoul to San fran.      Boarding was orderly and aircraft looked fairly new.     FAs were ok but not overly cheery or friendly.     Meals were fairly decent quality along with good inflight movie choices.    Seat pitch was really good and was super comfy.     We arrived in San Francisco a little ahead of schedule.   Overall no complaint!

We have flown Korean Air, Cathay Pacific, Eva, United, and this was our first Asiana flight. It was absolutely wonderful. The flight attendants pampered us. The food was excellent and the cabin beds were very comfortable.  We will defintiely fly Asiana again.

As usual, Asian airlines have good service. I was surprised by the food quality on our flight, that is not your usual plane food. The air hostesses are very kind and the counter personnel is professional and helpful. Their millages system is very generous. I am a happy and loyal customer!

This was my first time flying Asiana Airlines, and to my surprise, it was really nice. Had a 12 hr flight and a short stop in Seoul but the seats were pretty comfortable. The food portions were decent, and food was actually really good too. They didn’t disappoint. They had slippers and blankets for everyone for the long flight, so people could atretch their legs and walk about the cabin. The take off and landings were the smoothest, I’ve ever seen and I fly way too often for business and leisure. The flight attendants were very nice and accommodating. I would definitely fly Asiana again.

Everything was great...the service, the food, the choice of in flight entertainment, etc.
Seemed like anytime anyone went into the restroom, someone was there checking on it.
Seems the restroom was the biggest one I've ever seen on an international flight I've taken in the last 18 years. They even give you slippers, toothbrush, toothpaste - all this in economy. 
I paid $501 RT from SFO to MNL - leaving Dec 2017, returning April 2018

ペットと一緒に旅行する場合には、アシアナ航空は選ばない方がいいと思います。将来、改善されたペットポリシーが発行されることを強く望みます。I booked a flight from ICN to FRA, being accompanied by small pets in cabin.  But I cancelled it because they require pets to be stored in the luggage space above the seats during take-off and landing according to their rule.  Though I informed them of the pet accident caused by United Airline in March 2018 and United Ailine's action taken after the accident.  Then Asiana's response was that they have no responsibility and passengers have to be patient even if a pet dies because pets are different from babies, who can be held by a parent during take-off and landing.  I never recommend to bring pets in Asiana's cabin.
Very comfortable seats, good on board service, punctual flights.Value for the price is excellent.You can order your meal, if you have a special diet.

Our flights from Singapore to Seoul was good - the seats were wide and spacious, the movies selection was sufficient and the food (especially Korean) was rather authentic and delicious, given the usual bad name given to airline food.  We enjoyed the selection of Korean movies for the in-flight entertainment.  With the high expectations set in the first flight, our return flight was somehow not up to expectations - seats were smaller/tighter, and the in-flight movies were old and uninteresting.  However, I must say that the pilot was superb as the touchdown at Changi Airport was smooth and we hardly realized that we have touched the ground.  The air fare was decently priced, and for the price paid, it is really value for money.

Cabin always very hot.
Poor choice of movies.
No choice in meals.
Cheap airline...    
Always seems to be late.

I was a bit apprehensive about flying with Asians Airlines as I hadn't heard good things about them but the price and flight times worked so the choice was made.
The planes are old and the decor dated but you get a good amount of leg room and seat comfort.
The food was very good, which from someone as fussy as me is something I rarely get to say.
Given the choice between this airline and say Korean Air to Seoul I would pick Korean Air but if the price difference was a factor I would pick Asians.

My family and I suffered an absolutley awful experience with Asiana last month. We were halfway into our flight from Fukuoka, Japan to Seoul (where we were supposed to transfer to our flight to London) when we were informed there was a problem with the landing gear and therefore we were returning to Fukuoka (why we didn't just continue to Seoul, I don't know). Upon arrival back at Fukuoka, we were given no updates or information, had to sit on the plane for an hour, before being told the flight was cancelled and to get off the plane. We went back into the departure lounge where chaos ensued! No information, explanation or advice - nothing! No sign of anyone with authority or control, they all quickly disappeared and left their poor groundstaff to deal with all the increasingly angry and frustrated passengers. Finally at 9:30pm (10 hours after the original departure) we were put on another plane to Seoul. Only once we arrived in Seoul were we told that we would be put in a hotel overnight and then put on a BA flight to London the following day, meaning we arrived in London 20 hours later than planned. As a result, this meant we missed one night's accommodation in London and theatre tickets for the following day also went unused. After returning home I asked for compensation but, when they finally replied, this was turned down by Asiana, all I received was a standard issue apology and request for understanding of the situation. Have never experienced anything close to this in 30 years of taking long haul flights, would never use this shambles of an airline ever again and strongly advise anyone thinking of doing so to look at alternative options!

Our flight was cancelled as we were lined up waiting to board. No reason was given. We were just asked to pick up our luggage and head to the front desk. We were told our flight would fly the next night over 18 hours after our first flight. We were very unhappy. Not sure I would fly with them again.

It was my first time flying with foreign flight - before I only flew with locals. First thing I was asked while on board is to close the window while the plane was flying and opened it once touched down and took off from airport. Flight attendants are ready to help with smile and fluently speaking english so no need to worry if you don't speak Korean. While flying, passengers would see one or two attendant walking along the aisle (as if they're on rotation in case anyone needs aid). The only issue I had is the couch because it hurt my back hence I sufferably slept on board and managed to sleep when arrived in the hotel. Overall the service is satisfying and I left the plane with smile and being happy. Those boarding Asiana can also get privilege by having city check in (it must be done 3 hours PRIOR to their scheduled flight) and get discount for having ride on Arex from Seoul station

This was my first time flying with them and the only reason I picked them was bc their prices were decent. My first flight with them was from Seoul to Jeju and my group of 4 missed our flight because we read the time as standard time but it was written in military time. I called the airlines and waited about 15 minutes before a live operator assisted and she was trying to help us on another flight. She was really calm and attempted to be helpful but ended up telling us that we would have to pay a fee for missing and would hold our spot for the next flight until we go to the airport. We arrived at the airport and the counter lady did her magic for about 10 minutes on the computer and then said they were not going to charge us any additional fees and booked us on the earliest flight and we all got to sit next to each other too. The airplane was spacious and the attendants were very poise and polite. They handed out coloring books to all the kids to keep them occupied and handed out a meal on a 1 hour and 40 minute flight which was new to me (the food was great by the way). Our second flight was when we came back home from vacation and it got delayed after our first transfer. We waited at the transfer counter for Asiana and while I was watching all the people infront of me get help I noticed all the employees remained calm which was already a plus for me since I've experienced hell with American Airlines and Spirit Airlines with delays and cancellations. When it was our turn the lady who helped us was working extremely fast trying to find us the fastest and similar route for us. She printed each one of us copies of everything and made sure all our questions were answered. She had a smile on her face the whole time and gave us food vouchers for a 5 hour delay which I thought was unnecessary since it was still in the middle of the day. The only issue I had was the food coming back to the U.S. sucked but thats just a personal preference. I would definitely fly with them again.

When I reached my destination I found a lot of valuable items missing from my suitcase, for instance my mobile phone, my expensive designer hand bag, my cosmetics etc. This is when I was traveling in business class! I don't even know where can i report these thieves! Their customer care email never ever responds, there is no grievance email support. they have no customer care service available. A word for the wise! Can you beat that!!? I don't know what to do. This never happened to me before. I lost a lot of money. Worst flight ever, worst attitude. Stealing is not acceptable, that's worse than a bad service. I really want to sue the airlines now.

This was my first time to take Asian airline.  I was kind of nervous but it was actually pretty nice.  The aircraft was A350.  

First, lets start with boarding process.  We were business class and I think this aircraft should have about 30 business seats.  When the airline stated to boarding, the business line was about over 100 people.  I can not believe my eyes but the local staffs were ok to process all of them.  We just waited to be the last one to get in.

The cabin was clean, the flight attendants were very nice and polite. Their service was great but the food were just OK.  The food was not bad but not great too. I would said Japan airline has best food.  If you compare to US airline, Asiana food was actually good.

The business chair can lie flat or half. The business seat has a big screen TV set but with very limited movies or TV choices.  Our fly from SFO to ICN and ICN back to SFO was exactly same channels.

The business lounge: in SFO, Asian airline customer can use UA's business lounge.  It was nice.  In Seoul, their lounge was full of people. We could not find any seat to seat and some of area was not clean.... you can request a shower room but the wait time was long.

Overall, If you take their newer aircraft, the fly is good.  We took Asiana Fly from ICN to TPE, the aircraft was a grandpa 747.  The inside chair was so very very old...I hope Asiana can replace it soon.  Our fly from TPE to ICN was B77L, the inside was new.  It was a lot better.... 

So if you are flying to Seoul or other asian city, this could be a good choice.

The Asiana flight to Seoul was comfortable despite the economy class!  Attendants were friendly with a great attitude for service.  The new fleet of Airbus planes were much quieter than I've ever experienced!  With the addition of a low fare - this flight made a lot of sense!  
However - do your homework and preparations before the flight!
The flight leaves SFO around midnight and arrives in Seoul before 4 am!  While public bus/train services into the city don't start for another couple of hours!  So prepare to WAIT!  Public transportation into Seoul is extremely convenient but once arrived - dependent on your accommodation arrangements - normal check-in times for hotels will require you to wait for another 5-6 hours!  Regardless - with proper arrangements ahead of time - a good time can be had by all!

My family flew on Asiana Airlines' A380 in First Class.  My wife and daughter were seated in the center aisle, 2E and 2F and I was seated in 2K.  During boarding, my door (2K) did not close at all.  After all the eningeers who worked on it, they decided to give up on repairing the non-operational door.  Plus, I told them it was okay with the door issue and it did not make sense to delay the flight, because of this issue.  The purser was nice enough to stop by and told me that I could use the Row 3 aisle seats for sleeping, which I did and took seat 3F.

The hard product looks a little bit old, since the A380 is about 10 years old now.  The pajamas were good and the amenity kits was good, but I wished the zipper was not broken when I first opened it.  The TV screen was great.  I just wished that the entertainment section had more of a selection.  The lie-flat bed was pretty good.  I've got two good hours of sleep.  The food was probably the best part of the flight from the bibimbap to the caviar, everything was great.

Hopefully Asiana Airline can increase their luggage weight from 23kg to 30kg for their international flight.
Luggage weight system, to calculate based on total luggage weight according to booking number instead strictly 23kg per person. Asiana Airline need to be more flexible!!

First time taking Asiana Airlines,  went to various locations in Korea (group tour)  in my judgment this airline is somehow a middle range airline of it's design.  Why? Design of the aircraft is weird.  Seating is not even,  which mean,  you are suppose to watch tv/ movie in the plane comfortable directly in front of you (12 clock position).  But instead it's design is slightly towards the (1 clock position). The seat is uncomfortable, very different from SQ cushion.  Movies, shows, 
songs etc is so limited. Overall not recommend!

Nothing negative to review. I fly Asiana whenever I can. The schedule is convenient, service is outstanding and the food is pretty good as far as airlines go.

You get a choice of Korean or Western meals... Pick the Korean, it's a bit better than the Western. If you have a food requirement, wow... My wife has Celiac disease and requires a gluten free menu. Her meals were really good! Huge portions of steak, chicken, etc. I still can't get myself to tell them I'm also gluten intolerant just to get the better meals!

The economy seats aren't bad, they're a little thin, but with decent legroom and decent width. I usually bring a seat cushion on these flights. I also try to book the upper deck of the A380 aircraft. They have 2 abreast seating on the outboard rows of seats, unlike the 3 abreast in the lower deck. The window seats have a compartment where you can store things like laptops and small bags. The compartment can also double as an arm rest.

Flying economy, you get about 7500 points on the flights from LAX to MNL. Compared to JAL, that's generous. I get less than 2,000 points from JAL for the same departure/arrival combination.
Great service and has spacious leg room. Meals served on the flight are good and staff are very friendly and accommodating. Restrooms are kept clean and has excellent amenities.

Along with air New Zealand, for me the best airline i've ever flown, Awesome service, very friendly staff, and most important, seats are wider than usual asian airlines, i'll fly Asiana every time i get a chance

The biggest problem I had with this airline was that they messed up my wifes name on her ticket and wanted to charge us to fix it even though it was their mistake.  They told us that the only way to correct it was to cancel the ticket and re-issue us a new one at the new higher price.   When I complained, they were unable to fix it in their computer system and told us that we would have to check in early because they would need to work on it at the ticket counter and that their might be issues going through security because of the name on the ticket not quite matching up with her passport.  Nothing like embarking on an international flight knowing that there were going to be issues every time you went through security.
The in-flight service was fairly good. There was a good selection of movies and games and the flight attendents were very nice.  I would recommend that they serve beverages more often.  They came around with coffee several times, but only offered water or other drinks with the meals.  My kids don't drink coffee!  Also, they offered you a choice of one of two meals, but sitting next to the window along with the difference in languages, I couldn't understand what they were saying.  It would have been nice if they had a sign or something stating what the options were.  
The other complaint I have is that they need to put their name in bigger letters at the ticket counters, especially in Manila.  Nothing like being in a very big crowded room and trying to figure out which ticket counter you need to go to based upon their logo which looked like everybody elses logo.  Their name in big bold letters would have saved me several minutes as well as having to fight through several lines of crowds trying to find them.

The seats was incredible with your own private cubicle.  Plenty of space and privacy and a big screen.  The bathrooms are huge, it's about the space or 2 - 3  bathrooms with a cushioned seat and full amenities.  They stopped giving away those amenity bags and just stock the bathroom instead.  Aws it's a red eye flight they serve you breakfast but you can ask for instant noodles which they give you in a nice bowl with a side of kimchi - Breakfast is well breakfast - dont e3xpect much from airline food but the saddest part is the entertainment system isn't so good.  Very few movies and tv comedies - Although better than nothing.  All  in all quite good.  The lounge is share with TG in thailand although not impressive.  Flight was delayed an hour which isn't the best part of the trip.

It was just a short flight and it was ok. 
The business lounge at incheon could be improve a little with more food selection. 

The seat was ok and service from crew were great. 
Inflight meal was ok too except the movies selection just so so. 

Ok for 2 hours flight.

Flying Asiana's business class was AWESOME. Make sure your plane is an Airbus 380 - the seats are roomy, and fully extended provide a bed for a good night's sleep while enroute from Kennedy Airport to Seoul's Incheon Airport. The flight crew was marvelous, the food good, and the in-flight entertainment was varied. A Class A1 experience!

AIRPLANE: Boeing 777. I am just wondering if they ever changed the interior of this airplane since they bought it.....to be sincere the Business class is waaaaaayyyyyyy too old. Seats are not very comfortable.

ENTERTAINMENT SYSTEM: help!!!!! I don't know if it's because it's old but:
- the choice of movies was so limited!
- it kept breaking up. They had to reboot it at least 7 times and every time you had to start the movie again. 
It was an afternoon/night flight though, so not a big deal as it would have been in a day one.

FOOD: after seeing and experiencing the above, I was somehow skeptical re: food. Instead I was pleasantly surprised.

CREW: this is the best part! They were AMAZING! Able to juggle all the problems of this old chap/airplane with grace, readiness and flexibility. They should get a pay rise because they are no second to Le Cirque du Soleil for their skills!

To sum up: flight was ok and the crew was amazing. Yes: I would recommend it to a friend

這家航空公司出現下列問題：一、不是做服務的航空公司；二、沒有承諾的航空公司；三、謊言處處的航空公司。

We, party of 4 pax, arrived the Terminal One of the Incheon International Airport (ICN T1) by the Airport Railroad Express (A'REX) at around 18:30 (GMT+9) on June 30, 2018 and towards to the check-in counter J with Asiana Airlines.  We were not allowed to check-in with any counters as told by the ground staff whom was stand-by at the entrance of the queue.  Passenger A sincerely asked her why we could not queue for check in as our flight was supposed to be opened for check-in.  She refused and pointing us to check-in with the kiosk by ourselves or we were needed to show her we did the check-in by the Asiana Airlines mobile app or success the check-in with the kiosks.  Friend B was getting oddly with the speech of the ground staff and telling her that we were going to take Asiana Airlines but Air Seoul or Air Busan which are low-cost or budget airlines that subsidiary of Asiana Airlines.

The ground staff understood the feeling of Passenger B and seek for assist with her supervisor but the supervisor replied us the same with very cool attitude.  The supervisor even asking us could we speak in English but Passenger B and Passenger C was asking with simple English with the ground staff and the supervisor when starting the conversation.  The supervisor was not using her heart to listen and provide service to her customers as passages C questioned back to the supervisor: “Aren’t we speaking in English, why you triple asking us that ‘can you speak in English?’ for times”.  The supervisor was black-faced as not saying anything and helpless.  We all disappointed as we not believe we were providing service by Asiana Airlines with those tones or attitudes.

As we do not know much about the check-in process with the kiosk as well as there is nil staff assisting, all the boarding pass was just notification pass except passenger C as he scanned the passport with the kiosk.  By the same time, we really cannot feel that the honor of the World’s best service airports since 2005 as the notification signs under Asiana Airlines were putting around on the floor of the airport and the ground staffs of Asiana Airlines were not helpful.  

The ground staff at the counter waved her hand with a little bit of smile and we approached the counter and check-in with her.  She got all our passports and the ‘notification pass’ and the boarding pass of passenger C.  She let us knowing that the flight was being delayed for another an hour till 21:40 (GMT+9) after she made her professional skills of the check-in process with the computer when we started receiving the passports and the boarding passes.  The boarding time were printed as “21:10” but the boarding time of the boarding pass was printed as “20:10” with passenger C's.  She explained that was correct and no error for all.  All of us except passenger D was wondering that why our flight was being delayed again.  She informed to us that there was an air traffic control in China and passenger C claimed that the flight should not have any air traffic control affect with Republic of China.  “No! not your ‘China’, and I do not know much.” angry replied by her.  In here, we cannot feel that she is kind and she seems having discrimination based on the nationality of passenger C, Taiwanese / the Republic of China, or travel document(s) that he hosts as she required passenger C to show his Hong Kong Identity Card but passenger C is not a resident of Hong Kong as fact.

She started to making another story that claiming Asiana Airlines sent us one delay notification/alert email in the morning already with her fully confidence but there were no results were found with our mailbox with showing to her by passenger C after we questioned her why there was nil notification like our inbound flight to Incheon or Korea Republic.  The staff was black-faced and double confirmed the email and telephone number with passenger C correctly.  Finally, she claimed that there would be system error that led we could not receive any related notification or alert but without any apology.  We all get angry and passenger A was asking any complimentary for her fault and wrong information was being given.  She refused with straightly and claimed that could not upgrade to another category due to all the seats were going to be occupied with the flight OZ745/AAR745.  On the other hand, passenger C received notification email at 19:21 (GMT+9) about the flight delay which we left the counter J around 15 minutes.

In addition, the ground staff was working and serving strict forward with the standard operating procedures that nothing with flexible.  Seoul was cats and dogs during our journey and we got umbrellas as souvenirs with the hotel that a kind of memory of the trip.  Therefore, two umbrellas were lost in the Hong Kong International Airport due to the staff refused the umbrellas as checked luggages.

We were on time arrived to the gate 50 for boarding to the flight but it was another delay as queuing for long time.  And we were noticed to queue at another side of the gate after queueing for 10 minutes.  All of us and other parties with the same flight were getting angry due to the staffs were getting wrong direction for queue and the flight was arranging confusion.

One of the crew staff at the entrance of the aircraft was shouting to us one by one with “Show me your boarding pass!  I need to check you take the correct flight or not!”  but our passports and boarding pass were being double checked before landing to the aircraft at the gate 50.  The crew was so rude with oddly voices and tone.  In addition, two of the ground staff at the gate 50 were no smile and seems working like slaves that not welcome us to take the flight to Hong Kong.

The flight was not going to depart Incheon as passenger C noticed the crew staffs were starting to ask passengers would like to have some water or drinks.  passenger C asked crew A, the crew staff whose name tag with five-star red flag were printed on it, when would the flight would be departed.  Crew A believed that we only can speak and listen in Mandarin/Chinese and thus saying that the captain of the flight announced the flight would delay another 40 minutes in Korean and English in early minutes and pointing us could not listen that but we all did not hear any related announcement by the captain.  Crew A extended her story saying that the there is a sudden or temporary air traffic control by the aviation traffic  control room by the Incheon International Airport and would seek for the captain to announce when would the flight could take off.  In addition, she explained that there was air traffic control with Shanghai and Peking since the aircraft was depart from Shanghai (she could not mention which airport of Shanghai as Shanghai having two airports which are Shanghai Hongqiao International Airport (SHA) and Shanghai Pudong International Airport (PVG).) to Incheon before this flight itinerary, from Incheon to Hong Kong.  However, we found that the aircraft HL7741 was take off from Shanghai Pudong International Airport (PVG) under OZ366/AAR366 with delay 85 minutes compare with the schedule when we track back related record through website days later.  In addition, the flight was nothing delay related to the air defense identification zone with Shanghai or Peking as we checked with websites.   

Therefore, crew A said that the captains were going to rearrange in current for the flight route again as it would be pass by the air defense identification zone of Peking and Shanghai at that moment which needs the delay for 40 minutes more.  Passenger C was wondering that captains should arrange the flight route before they enter into the cockpit and the flight should not pass by the air defense identification zone within mainland China due to the flight normally directly to Hong Kong after pass through the air defense identification zone of Korea (Korea Republic), Japan and Taiwan (Republic of China) rather than pass by Peking and Shanghai.  Crew A immediately claimed would ask for the update information and share with us after asking with the captain but no response.  Passenger A got angry that why crew A would share those unconfirmed information to us and making stories.
