Crew A may think about her fault, thus she offered us to choose the meal with chicken or seafood due to the shortage with the meals when we were waiting for the flight to take off.  We all choose with chicken as our decision made since Passenger B is allergy with some seafood such as shrimp.  Crew A dropped down our selection with a memo pad afterwards as eyewitness by Passenger A and Passenger D.  When the dining car arrived to our side, one of the Korean crew staff B asked we would like to have chicken or fish.  We all ordered for chicken again and she delivered.  By the same time, crew staff A with the dining car with that Korean crew staff B but crew staff A did not noticed that we made the request with her.  We all disappointed as the meals with fish rather than chicken.  Passenger A wanted to complain that but Passenger B claimed that was fine as he is not allergy with fish.  This can proved that crew staff A did not listen the words and out of promise to her customers.  In addition, there was no communication between the crew staffs.  On the other hands, a Korean workmate shared to Passenger C that his flight was being delayed due to the meal cannot be deliver to the flight on time as this is the actual reason for delay since there was a giant accident for the main kitchen of the aircraft dining.

The whole journey was not service airlines and it can be described as the worst airline in the world.  In addition, the service by the budget airlines are much more better than this Korean brand airlines.  We complained the case to the Asiana Airlines, but they did not reply for more than one month till today
The service and amenities were top notch.  The personal space and lay flat chair made the 2.5 hour flight seem too short.  The food and service were Absolutely awesome.

Very disappointing flights from Phuket to JFK, specifically with respect to Asiana’s inflight meal service...it was an absolute fail...they did not inform us prior to the flight they had problems with their caterer, which meant we paid for a business class ticket, and was not provided a business class meal...had we known this, we would not have booked, and Asiana k ew this but did not disclose it to its passengers...very unprofessional.

To make matters worse, they answered my formal complaint email with a simple apology, with no comments on reembersment, and they have still not responded to 2 additional emails.

I would not recommend this airline to anyone

They abviously do not care about their passengers

There are too many quality choices out there to settle for this company

Attached is the inflight meal menu they handed us that was printed on a cheap piece of paper, and they only served us they main course (no appetizer or dessert...totally unacceptable for a 14+ hour flight)

#asianaairlines#avoidthiscompany

We flew Asiana to Seim Reap via Seoul and then back from Ho Chi Minh/Saigon via Seoul and were very comfortable & well fed--much nicer than US carriers. A schedule change made our 2 hour layover into a 10 hour layover and Asiana gave us all free city tours of downtown Seoul. It was great. On the return there was another schedule change resulting in a very long layover and Asiana gave us a free hotel night with food voucher. We were able to tour the DMZ before our flight back to Chicago. It was great!

I've never been so frustrated and at one point, angered by the pure lack of either the website to simply purchase a ticket (full fare Business class no less) and not having much success at all, calling reservations not two but three times to their Korean reservations number to try to rectify the problem of why I could not purchase a ticket, was told I had to wait  until the following day to call the US reservations office.  I politely asked, ""Well, what exactly is your job?""  Aren't you supposed to be reservations and sell me a ticket??   I was so disappointed I simply could not buy a ticket from the actual reservations agent.   What kind of service is this???   

Next, I called the next day to the US ticket office and again, was told I could not buy the ticket for a reason I still to this day never understood.   Their answer from the US reservations office (notice it's supposed to be ""reservations""?) that I had to wait until I got to the airport.   At this point, I was laughing at how poorly the reservations service was for this airline.   Maybe it was just my bad luck... and I had to wonder if others had experienced any issues similar to mine.   

It was too late to change to another airline so I was somewhat committed to flying Asiana and I will say the actual onboard service was quite good as was the food and drink.   But I just have to think how much business they have lost over the years having such horrible website ease of use and actual reservations agents who, apparently are unable (or unwilling) to do their job... Make a Reservation!!!     Wow...     

Never again and I can't in good conscience recommend Asiana to any other regular business travelers.   There are many others who will treat a full fare business flyer with more ""kid gloves"" if you will.
11 hours flight was an amazing. The staff were friendly. The meals were specific and tasty. I recommend them to update films and music. the lainer isn't new, but comfort.

What a FIVE Star airlines this is!! I always fly on Asiana wether for business or pleasure.
In 2010 when I first started flying with Asiana , I was in economy class and back then they already had a great TV/movie choices better some of the famous brand airlines in the US. After a few times flying economy I went to business class in 2012 and since then I always in Business Class and what a great service they were and they are now years after years. Especially in the A380 upstairs, I love it. It’s beutiful setting and quite and wow... awesome. However, there are other airlines out there that I have not been on (international carrier) also have a great service in Business class that I want to try but Asiana always have better schedule and reasonable price for me (to my opinion). Keep the good work Asiana Airlines. You are the BEST!!

We were a family of 5. We were with our autistic son. The flight crew was nice. One FA even looked for a row of seats where my daughter could lie die. Flight entertainment made the flight seem shorter. Leg room was sufficient. 

On a delayed flight (45min) we even got to talk to the Asiana pilot. That was nice.

Overall this flight was pretty good.  I had enough room as my family had all 3 seats.  Did not have to deal with neighbors we did not know.  The food was frequent.  The drinks were plentiful.  The service was great.  The legroom not bad.

I am writing this towards the end of my return trip from Seoul from Los Angeles. I flew to Seoul  form LA on Singapore air and had so much better service then on my return trip from Seoul back to LAX on Asiana . Had much better food options then the usual beef or shell fish on Singapore and once Asiana flight attendants were aware of my food limitations (I was not able to make special meal requests online) I was almost totally ignored for the last six hours of the trip. Had to make repeated calls even for coffee... The seat was reasonably comfortable and the flight attendants smile a lot, but when it comes to service on Aisana the smile just was not enough. Unless I have no option my trips to Korea will be on Singapore Air or KAL and not Asiana.  As bad as I was treated in Business, I feel bad for the folks in Economy class

Words can not express my total enjoyment on this trip.  My first time in Business Class and hopefully not my last.  All my reviews of Asiana Business on YouTube came true.  It was everything I expected and more.  Very friendly staff on all routes to and from.  I must admit my first choice was Eva Airlines but due to an unfortunate administrative error I was re-assigned to Asiana.  I'm glad the mistake occurred.  Enjoyed not only the ride by the lounges in both LAX and ICH as well.  It's good NOT to be in economy on long hauls.  Looking forward to more flights with Asiana....

First the good:
Service was excellent, people friendly and professional.
Seat room was excellent, especially if compared with United Airlines.  There were a couple of free inches between  my knee and the seat in front. (My legs don't fit on United).
The food was good.  Usually a choice of a traditional Korean meal and something like chicken was given.  Just didn't get enough to drink.  A small cup of water came with the meal and after that they pushed coffee and tea.
Baggage-Made it both ways, although in Chicago I was one of the first at the carousels and one of the last to leave.

The bad:
The ORD-ICN flight was scheduled to leave at 11:55 PM, already inconvenient enough.  I went to check in at 8:30 PM, the first anyone showed up behind the Asiana counter, and was told the flight was delayed 8 hours.  They took us to a hotel way north of the airport by a State Farm Insurance complex for 2 /12 hours sleep and shower.  The replacement plane was a 777 that must have been the first or second to roll off the assembly line.  The seats were worn, there was no power, and the screens were smaller than my 7"" tablet.  As a result of the delay, my connecting flight had already left and I had to get a later flight and then a later Shinkansen, etc.

On the return:
My 7PM flight from Incheon to O'Hare was changed/delayed to 1:20 AM.  I left the airport but don't recommend it as security lines getting back in are longer than the worst ones at O""Hare.  On top of that, all you get in the secure area are Mont Blanc, Rolex, and ugly brown leather LV bag shops.  There is no convenience store or ATM past security so have your credit card or Korean won ready.  At 0:50 AM, the new boarding time, it was announced that the departure was delayed due to ""flight traffic control"" and the new boarding time was 01:50 AM,  I left the area as I figured no airline would then leave earlier than announced but, when I got back to the gate at 01:35 AM, the whole plane was already boarded.  The 777 was at least new and had power outlets and USB ports at each seat.

As a result of all the delays, I got back into Chicago an hour after the last bus left and 5 hours before the next (6 AM).  I then had to waste tons of time in O'Hare after wasting a day In Incheon.

Check-in at Fukuoka International Terminal was only 2 hours before the flight.  I had to check out of the hotel in the morning so I went to the airport.  I couldn't check in for 3 hours because they can only check in one flight at a time.  The airport has no waiting room so I had to roam around dragging my luggage until the long line instantly appeared 2 hours before the flight as the bus tours arrived.  I never had this problem in the domestic terminal with JAL or ANA so it's either Asiana or the International Terminal that can't handle check-ins.

I think I picked Asiana just to try a different route to Japan other than though Narita or Haneda, but after this scheduling/delay/rescheduling nightmare, I think I'll go back to JAL or ANA, even if it costs a bit more.

It's unbeliable that Asiana Airlines use such an out-of-date features for such a 9-hour international flight. I took Asiana Airlines five years ago to Honolulu, but evidently they are falling behind. Their seatback screens are only a bit larger than my iPhone (I mean iPhone, not iPhone plus), not touch screen, the status of the screen is very terrible. Very dark, you cannot see the contents clearly,  any only less than 40 films. And the films are not choosen, one channel one film, you can change the channel by the remote. But the films are scrolling playback, you even did not know the name of the film. Food is ok, but I have to say they should adope the state-of-the-art amenities, otherwise they will lost passengers.

지상 및 기내 직원의 친절도는 최고 수준이었고 음식과 음료도 다양하며 맛도 있었다. 
 하드웨어 곳곳에 낡고 헤어진 곳이 있고 유지보수가 제대로 되지 않은 듯 했다. 의자는 어깨 측에 달린 안전띠가 좌석에 튀어 나와서 너무 불편했고 팔걸이도 리모컨 위치와 중복이 되어 불편했다. 
 가장 엉망인 것은 청결 이었다. 좌석 및 라운지 구석 곳곳은 먼지가 있었고, 특히 화장실 내의 환풍구와 창가 좌석 하단에 위치한 환풍구에는 먼지가 거미줄처럼 엉겨 붙어 있는 것이 족히 한달은 청소를 하지 않은 것 같았다. 청결을 지적하니 10여 분 후에 지적당한 모든 부분이 모두 사실이니 앞으로 개선 하겠다고 한다. 결국 아시아나는 가장 우선시 되어야 하는 청결과 위생에 관해 점검 시스템이 없다는 얘기로 들렸다.  10일 후 귀국편의 항공편에서도 여전히 청결은 엉망이었고, 첨부 사진은 돌아오는 편에서 촬영한 것이다. 

We know Asiana is famous for warm service and delicious in-flight meals. But I could not enjoy them since I felt to fly in the garbage. 

这家航空公司以精彩的机内饮食和出色的服务态度. 可没办法享受它们因为觉得我在垃圾堆坐着飞行.

So we flew with this company and it will be the last for sure. Poor customer service when calling. Website not user friendly. Took forever to find phone number and then when we did find one we sat on hold for 5-10minutes. The lady on the other end could not even help us.

I picked this airline because it was actually the cheapest at the time. Our flight was delayed by about an hour so the boarding at SFO was just chaotic. Because of the delay everyone was itching to get on, The ground crew should of expected this as they were aware of the delay. As soon as boarding started people were lining up in no particular order or seat class because it wasn't clear where anyone should go.  The ground staff was not organized, with 3 different staff members telling me different things. I was made to line up in first class for 20 minutes only to be redirected over to economy with 100 people in line in front of me. Some families with infants and stroller who normally are boarded first were even farther behind me in line. But once we got through the mess the flight itself was fine. We were given an amenities pack with a dental kit and slippers and my 9yr was still given one of those kid's play packs. Seats were comfy (though I wish it wasn't cloth seats and leather instead), our korean meals were tasty (thanks for the hot pepper paste), in flight entertainment had alot of variety but unluckily I was stuck with the flight attendant that really hated her job. All the other attendants were great except for ours, lucky us. Overall, I did feel like I got more than my money's worth on this flight in ecomony but the ground staff at SFO really needs to be more organized with boarding.

I'd flown Asiana once before between Seoul and Bangkok and was impressed, but this time I was really underwhelmed.  The most annoying thing about Asiana on this route is that the entertainment is severely limited.  The in-flight magazine shows that on flights to New York, Tokyo, London or a lot of other routes there is a huge selection of movies.  For some reason, on flights to Bangkok there are about 5 movies to choose from.  I don't get this.  It doesn't make sense.

The food wasn't impressive, no bimibap.
I've been a loyal customer of Asiana for a long time now, always great service! excellent food and lounges. Just keep up the good work guys and more power to you.

I had to cancel my trip going back to the U.S. I was told that I need to call Asiana to get half of my refund. I've been trying to call them but none of the customer service phone number works. All of the phone numbers provided don't answer phone calls. Also, when I traveled to the Philippines last December 2018, we were stuck at Incheon airport for 8 hour delay and they did not even give out water! the children were sleeping on cardboards on the floor! Don't fly Asiana because they will not take care of you of something will happen.
Food for vegetarian is terrible & no expression for regret when whole pack was returned to crew. Flight was delayed they don't utter a word of apology to passenger.

You cannot choose your seat on the website (terrible experience, most of the content is not even translated in English), and at the airport they tried to charge me and my colleague for premium economy before telling us that actually one of us was elegible for free upgrade since there were no more seats available in economy.

I recently flew to Thailand, Phuket the service was mediocre. Normally on an International flight, the Pilot and the Flight crew translates everything being said over the microphone. During my time on the flight on more than one occasion I found myself clueless when an announcement was being made on on the flight. The flight crew never translated anything in English and because the flight crew aren’t that fluent in speaking the English language they seem to avoid Westerners during the flight. Nevertheless, outside of that the plane is clean, the drinks and the food was pretty decent. This airline sucks when it comes to Customer service for Westerners or maybe just African Americans. This isn’t my 1st time flying to Asia I flew previously with united emirates , I must say the quality of service on United Emirates was way better. Hopefully my review is ready by an authority figure and the Flight crew goes under new training, until then I’m not in any rush to book another flight using Airsiana anytime soon.

They just don't accept their mistake. 
Too many reasons. Terrible reasons. 
will never fly with them again.

I've flown on Asiana in the past, but my best experience came onboard their new A350 that they're utilizing on their LAX and SFO routes. The Economy Smartium seats offer more room, but the biggest bonus comes when people choose not to opt for the service. This affords you the opportunity to stretch out across all 3 seats, making it easier to catch those intercontinental z's. For taller/bigger folks, it's as close to getting a back-relieving, business class sleep as it gets!

travelled again but flight were old and catering issue delayed the inbound flight 
very less in flight entertainment

I just completed my first flight on Asiana and it will be my last.  Seats that are flat but not horizontal and so desperately uncomfortable. No chance of sleep at all. Food was poor, service was friendly but only in the sense you felt the crew were making the best of a bad lot. The difference between Asiana and Singapore Airlines biz class cannot be overstated.

Have flown with Asiana in the past.  This trip was no different.  Great Service, clean aircraft and the seats a westerner friendly.  Flight attendant are always nice and always ready to assist you if you need anything.    

As a side note, if you book with them and have a layover in Seoul, you may want to call them.  they are great at making you layover great with free hotel and bus tours for certain flights and layover.  Worth looking into. 

Can't wait to fly with them again.
Very good experience for an economy flight. Lots of leg space, always fresh drinks and very friendly and helpful staff. Good entertainment programm. Highly recomendable!!

I took Asiana on a transit flight from CTU to MNL on 28th June.
I would like to compliment the crews on board this flight OZ324 and OZ701. The crews were courteous, always smiling and responding quickly to requests. There were 2 rather rude and demanding pessengers on the 1st flight but the crews responded very professionally. Accommodating. 
Food was good and the wide selection of inflight movies. 
Overall I had a great experience on Asiana for this red eye flight.
Flew from Ottawa with AC to Vancover to Soeul. The service was first class...the meal the in flight service was second to non I would always fly them for my first choice

good service, feel like in korea while sitting on this plane. the stewardess are very beautiful and all are white skin. no need to transit/transfer from jakarta, because the airlines is from korea. so from jakarta direct to incheon. their meals so far ok.
The seating was comfortable, the food was great, the entertainment was current, the flight attendants were polite, accommodating and kind to my child.

Every airline in the world usually seats together  family member who booked tickets together. Not asiana. Nope. Wife and I got 2 middle seats even though we booked weeks in advance of the trip. Asiana website crashes for 48 hrs while trying to do online as they suggested. Customer service hangs up if they have too many callers. Worst experience w airline ever. #asianasucks

I have always taken Singapore Airlines but used Asiana this time because of the domestic flights. It is cheaper this way for international and domestic flights using same airline. Service was pleasant. Flight entertainment was very limited. Food choice was just ok. You may not get what you want as some food choice run out fast. Seats were not too big but still alright.

We recently flew to the USA via Asiana Airlines and going back to Manila. Seats were okay. Food was lousy which seemed to be lacking in balance. For instance, in one of the meals, they served Bibimbap with ground meat and the other offering was Beef too. Normally, it would be a choice of red meat or either fish/chicken. Not all were poor. Some offerings were good also. 

Asiana's movies too are limited which is not a good idea for a long flight! Nevertheless, I enjoyed watching  the classic ""Breakfast at Tiffany's"".

Cruising was good. It was a comfortable ride. Seats were okay. 

Flight attendants need to be more service oriented, like giving drinks from time to time. In my experiences in flying this is the first time that I've encountered such service that was lacking in hospitality. Good thing I brought some snacks that I could munch while waiting for the next meal with a confused body due to time zone difference. Other airlines I've flown with offer main meals with little snacks in between, with some drinks in between too. 

Next time, will consider other airlines.

594099031

I have flown on Asiana Airlines before, and the experience was the same; friendly and courteous, with very attentive flight attendants. Flew round trip to and from Korea. Service was excellent with two meals and a snack. In-flight entertainment was very good and on a long flight to Seoul, there was time to watch several movies if you wanted. We took off before noon for an 81/2 hour flight, so I napped to find a nice note from the attendant asking if I would like to have my skipped meal. Frequently checked on passengers' needs and the meals were very good. (I chose a Korean meal.) The cleanliness and size of the bathroom were a nice surprise, included mouth wash and toothbrush and toothpaste! The person sitting across from me was over 6 feet tall and she was impressed, and watched five movies! I will be flying on Asiana Airlines again in the future.

We arrived at Jakarta Airport @ 8.00PM to catch our flight back home @11.45PM to find out that our flight was delayed for 4 hours. No one send us notifications even we did sign up for it.  Again another 4 hours delayed from Seoul to Los Angeles due to the late arrival from other connecting flights.Then after boarding we were informed by the pilot one passenger was unable to fly so the luggage(s) must be retrieve from the plane. Another 2 hours further delay.  We arrived LAX exhausted.
Will think twice to fly Asiana next time.

Cabin crew were extremely friendly, first time I have ever seen this - before take off they each came around the aisle and thanked / welcomed everyone onboard. 
Quick complementary beverage service which was standard. 
Aircraft was nice (A320) with good leg room and storage space. 

Nothing special and no complains for short haul.
a very nice private suite ,but business is near as nice as have flown first 3 times and business over 25 times between asiana and cathay pacific flight over 6 years

Good service on new A350. The A350 is a new aircraft that is less noisy inside and also more humid making it less dry.

Service is good, food is much better than other airline especially the Korean selection (bimbimbap) that comes in real ceramic ware and real metal spoons.

Slippers also provided.

Selection of movies was okay with some new movies and other old movies. In total there are 20 movies. And also there are other TV selection and music.

My flight from Frankfurt to Incheon was quite comfortable on an A380 and I flew in a Business class, seated on the upper deck.  The food and beverage offered were of average quality; I noticed that no Champagne was offered before the take-off (used to it from Swiss and Lufthansa). The flight attendants were attentive and very professional.  Unfortunately, the flight from Incheon to London was less than optimal in that the food was quite bad (some dishes couldn't be consumed). I understand that Asiana Airlines were dealing with a temporary catering company, but the food in the Business class was quite substandard.  Additionally, it appears that the cleaning crew forgot to clean and restock one of the lavatories in business class as there was no soap and no paper towels.  Once again, the service provided by the flight attendants were pleasant; however, the airline could improve tremendously.

This was my second time to fly with Asiana Airlines and both times have been great. The attendants are always checking on you and it seems like you never have periods that you can not find anyone if you desire something like so many of the overseas airlines.
The feed you a lot and taste is great for airline food.
My next flight over seas flight  to the Philippines or Korea will be booked on Asiana because the service is consistent the food isn't so much airline food and the planes interiors are well maintained.

When I arrived at LAX for my flight, I was informed that the outbound first leg aircraft was late and the flight was delayed approximately 4 hours. Since my turn around time in ICN was about 2 hours, that meant that I would miss the ICN to MNL leg.  The agent told me that Asiana would put me up in a hotel and put me on the next available flight out of ICN. He then told me that personnel in ICN would take care of things.  I checked a bag through to MNL and went to the lounge.  After a little thought, i decided I didn't want to rely on what might happen at 10:30 at night in a foreign airport.  I contacted a pasenger assistance rep in the lounge, and she got my ticket to MNL.  When I arrived in ICN, I, and maybe 60 other people had to go through immigration and customs, and then wander the full length of the airport in search of magical ""Transfer Desk"".  There we were given a hotel voucher, and put on buses to the Days Inn, which is probably 15 minutes from the airport.  We arraived at the hotel, and were told that check in was on the 4th floor. There was only 1 working elevator ( of 5) and we slowly made our way to check-in.  This took another 20 minutes, at which time we were given our room keys and a complementary dinner - a plastic bag with a bottle of water and a round tub of something.  Gourmet, no doubt. By the time I got to my room, it was nearly midnight. Since we were told that the buses to the airport would leave at 5 AM, I put in a wake up call for 4 AM.  No coffee. No breakfast. And worst of all, no Asiana personnel to take care of their passengers.  As a result of this, I lost a prepaid non - refundable hotel room in Manila, and a prepaid non-refundable plane ticket from Manila to Dumaguete.  And Asiana didn't want to hear about.
have made this flight a number of times with different airlines...the flight attendants are younger and generally very pleasant and accommodating...for airline food, it is better than most..

Asiana had a summer sale on Business Class, which made the upgrade affordable and I'm glad I did it! Five stars for the privacy of my single seat on the right-side aisle and the delicious food choices for a fish-eating vegetarian: marinated shrimp appetizer with a mixed seafood entree and a delightful cheese course before the fresh fruit and chocolate mousse for dessert. Calorie counts were on the menu. The flight departed at almost midnight, so dinner was quickly served before the lights were turned out. There was also a breakfast about two hours before landing. Traditional Korean food like Bibimbap is also served, 
The flight attendants busted their butts for the entire flight and I got a big smile when I complimented them on the beautiful silver tea and coffee service like the one I received for my wedding and haven't ever used. ""Too heavy,"" they said. My only in-flight criticism is that the drinks never seemed to arrive at the right time. I usually wound up with my food in front of me while waiting until the beverage cart showed up. Shouldn't it be the other way around? However, I got six hours of sleep and watched a couple of movies with great sound quality on the headphones provided and a large screen. Plan to finish your movie in plenty of time because it will be interrupted to show an exercise video about 20 minutes before landing, with most of the passengers participating in the stretching exercises.
Upon arrival, I found the Senator Lounge closed and a crowd of people waiting outside. As a Star Alliance Gold Status member, I rely on these lounges to recharge when I have to travel in economy and I certainly expect a lounge to be waiting when I've paid extra for business class. Because the lounge was operated by Asiana, it's hard to believe they didn't know travelers would be arriving at 4:30 am. When the lounge finally did open at 5 am, the cleaning people were still at work and the food was not ready. There was a long line to check in and the early arrivals cleared out the buffet, which wasn't replenished until an hour later. Not the standard I've come to expect from Star Alliance member airlines and I hope they'll improve this in the future. 
I should add that my connecting flight to Hanoi was in exactly the same kind of plane, so both in-flight legs of the journey were delightful. I arrived rested, well-fed and ready to work.
Travelling with asiana is a breeze.The FAs are very warm and helpful and the amenities are ok.In terms of food,its average.
Very good service ! Comfortable flight! Though it was just a 2 hr flight, stewardess managed to serve drinks and lunch onboard.

Although the command of English appears better than the flight to Incheon, the speaker is either in need of some upgrade or the crew have been speaking too close to the mic, all the announcement are so muffled that I could not make out anything. 

Other than fhat, the flight is as what it should be. The crew are friendly. The seat space is what you would expect from economy. So it’s a regular flight. I’d recommend if this flight based on cost.

Flew from Incheon to Heathrow. Business class has flat seats and no neighbour if you are by a window and flight was on time. Food was pretty dry and tasteless, staff were more interested in chatting in the kitchen area than helping the passengers, and entertainment selection was very limited. Maybe worth considering for a late take-off (mine wasn't) if the ticket is cheap but bring your own food and drink.

Hello, I had a very smooth and easy time moving my cat with me from Buffalo NY USA to Phnom Penh , ID LIKE TO SAY FIRST THIS IS THE DETAILED INFO FOR ALL MY FLIGHTS AND WHAT I WAS TOLD EVERYONE REQUIRED BUT I WAS NEVER ASKED ONE TIME FOR ANYTHING. NO ONE EVER LOOKED AT HIS KENNEL, HIMSELF, OR INFORMATION.

The flight is 23 hours with two layovers. Also the flights i booked was operated by 
delta/skywest and Asiana. Obviously very long for a pet but he was IN CABIN with me on all three of the flights and did meow a lot but we did what we had to do and it wasn't to bad. The Vet gave me gabapentin just incase he was freaking out which I tried to give him and it didn't seem to do much once  on the plane. I pretty much held his carrier on my lap and had my arm in the cage to pet him and sooth him and that was most effective. Make sure to give him little treats over time to calm in and little bit of water. My cat was very thirst but I limited his water since in the family restrooms when I laid out something to pee on he would not go.

First Flight: BUF to DTW
Delta: Flight 4627  
Canadair Regional Jet

First layover is in DTW for 40 mins. then to ICN Seoul, South Korea
Flight #: 159
AIRBUS INDUSTRIE A350-900Dinner

The second layover is in ICN for 2 hours.
ASIANA FLIGHT # 739
Airbus A321 April 27th to Phnom Penh Cambodia

It was actually very easy with airlines once at the airports but research proper dimensions of the cage and what paperwork was not easy at all. It took a ton of time calling since it's something I wanted to make sure of. 

DELTA: cost $200 to bring my cat on board. They said they required cats and dogs must be accompanied by a Veterinarian Good Health and Rabies Inoculation Certificate issued at the port of origin. dated within 10 days of flying. So basically, the vet looked at him to make sure he has him shots up to date and looked healthy and I paid 50$. ""On DL 4627 operated by our connection carrier SkyWest, kennel dimensions should not exceed 15L 15W 10H. On DL 159, the maximum under seat dimensions are 14L 15W 8.8H"" told to me from Delta.
Their number to help: 1 800 221 1212

MY cage was too big but it was a hard bottom and soft on top so I figured I could push it down if necessary but I was never asked to show the pet health certificate or anything and they never looked at him or the size of his carrier, I just paid the fee. 

For ASIANA: They just said that he had to be less than 15 pounds with the carrier included in that weight, which he was not but they never even looked or checked. For a soft kennel, they said the cage needed to be less than 10 inches and if a car carrier than it needed to be less than 8 inches. Mine was too tall again but i knew I could push it down and they never checked. They also wanted the same certificate of good health but never checked. I had to pay $160 to them even though I already paid Delta, that doesn't matter you have ti pay both. 
Their number to help was: 1 800 227 4262

So, my cat did pee on my during the last 3 hours of the last flight and it was horrible and got all over me since I was holding but I rushed to the bathroom and tried to rinse it all but I smelled horrible. I tried to rub lotion on me and just had to not care since it was already such a long and not fun experience. 

Cambodia requirements: 
1. Microchip
2. Rabies vac
3. vet health certificate
4. copy of owners passport
5. copy of pet info
6 the 3 in 1 vac, calcivirus, herpesvireus, penoleukemia 

Once I arrived in Phnom Penh no one ever checked anything or even saw I had a cat, I literally just took care of my own visa and then just walked into the country. So you can move your cat from USA to CAMBODIA!! :D  Ask me for any other questions please about my cat or phnom penh, etc. :)

Overall a good airline with a few misses.  I flew from DC to SGN, with a stops in SFO and ICN.  Since Asiana doesn't fly from DC, the DC-SF leg was handled by Virgin.  Here they messed up.  I paid for the extra checked baggage, and the fee was collected by Virgin.  Yet when I checked in at SFO, Asiana wanted me to pay for it again.  It turned out Virgin did not give me a  coupon that I supposed to give to Asiana.  Instead of working out between them, they had me running back and forth between their counters (20min walk) half a dozen times before a counter agent figured out that I should get a refund from Virgin, and charged again by Asiana.  The whole business cost me a good 2 hours of running between the counters, and gave me a good sweat out exercise.

Cabin service was generally good, however.  Food was very decent too.  In flight entertainment was a little poor though.
Comfortable and courteous flight experience. Good meals, leg room for westerners, and entertainment services. Layover in Korea was handled smoothly.

Our flights from MNL-INC and INC-MNL were superb! The babies could sleep soundly as the pilots are masters of smooth take offs and landings. 

But it was hellish when there wasn't a bassinet seat available (where I could also sit near my toddler and hubby).  Asiana squeezed us in a code share flight to Los Angeles with passengers from other airlines and we weren't aware that the layout of the plane also changed.  Horror of horrors, our seats wouldn't recline properly and it was so hot and cramped in the flight; the kids weren't able to sleep at all.

Our LAX-INC flight was weird too.  We had high expectations because we finally got to ride their new airbus and they finally ensured us bassinet seats. However, it was so turbulent and the flight was so slow, we had to rush to get to our connecting flight because we arrived late at the airport.
My first time with asiana airlines and i was upgraded to business class. I dont know the reason why but still thank you so much to asiana.

My wife and I took a 14 hour flight from Seoul to Chicago, after spending a week in East Asia for a few math conferences. It was by far the worst flight of our life. It was an extremely old and dirty 767 we flew on, the in flight entertainment was broken so we couldn't watch anything, our seats didn't recline at all (on a 14 hour flight!), and the flight attendants were very inattentive. When we got to Chicago, we found that all of our luggage had been dented. Will definitely not be flying Asiana again, especially as there are so many choices of airlines that fly from Chicago to East Asia, and many of them have very good reviews. Extremely dissapointed.

I love this airline because of its comfort and safety features and services. Aside from the promo price I got, the service is ok, the food is delicious and excellent and the cabin crew are all kind, courteous and friendly. I surely recommend this airline for your flight to Incheon and Istanbul. The best so far in terms of services and safety. I love Asiana.

First time to fly Asiana, the booking process online was straight forward and tickets were issued immediately. Check in at the airport went smoothly and the flight departed on time. We were given the emergency exit seats which has plentiful leg space. overall, the seats are very comfortable. Service onboard was good. 
For the cost of the ticket, the value for money was really good and I wouldn't hesitate to fly Asiana again in the future.

I flew 4 long segments, so I think that gave me a pretty good perspective on what they offer. All were in economy, but with lounge access. 

The good:

Slightly better seat pitch than you get on US airlines. Every extra inch helps. 

FAs were polite, not surly like Delta or Air Canada in economy class. And their foreign language skills were versatile, unlike say Air China. On the flight to Tashkent, they even spoke passable Russian. 

They didn't hassle me about carry-ons on any segment, even though flights were mostly full. These days airlines are being increasingly onerous about carry-on sizes, and often make you check in bags that fit perfectly fine. Props to Asiana for not being jerks that way. It's a sad commentary on the state of airline travel that just normal decency puts you a cut above the rest these days. 

Another nasty little trick they DON'T do like some other airlines, is wait an inordinate of time to serve the food, so that more people go to sleep and FAs have fewer people to serve. Here, they get the meal over with very efficiently, and then let everyone sleep. 

Food was pretty good even for coach. But choices were limited (remember when airlines gave you 3 choices?). I figured it was best to stick to the Korean options, since it's a Korean airline, and I wasn't disappointed. I mean, who can get excited about pasta? But the bibimbap and beef bulgogi were surprisingly well done. Drinks, especially alcoholic, were surprisingly limited for a long haul international flight. 

Power outlets everywhere. Didn't use them but it's a nice touch. 

Flights were mostly on time, and when they weren't, they did their best. Our flight from Tashkent was delayed by 45 minutes. The crew was very apologetic, saying with a hint of  justifiable resentment, ""We're sorry for the delay, due to extra security checks from the government of Uzbekistan."" 

The bad:

Entertainment choices were limited. A few mediocre new releases like ""Black Panther,"" but mostly the entertainment seemed to be carefully curated to show the most vapid, empty, cookie cutter movies possible. From SFO to ICN, I settled on ""Battleship Island,"" a Korean film with one-dimensional caricatures the point of which seemed to be to illustrate just how much Korea hates Japan. 

The pillows were foam, unworthy of pilfering. Standard for coach on US carriers, but I expected better from Asiana. Air France and Lufthansa provide real feather pillows in coach, something that I'm grateful for years after the fact. ;)

Nothing special about the A350. It's not the A380, that's for sure! But it beats the heck out of Boeing's insultingly named ""Dreamliner,"" a nightmare with shades that don't even close. 

The Business Class lounge:
Again, not quite what the best carriers offer, but oh so much better than anything in the US. The showers were well-appointed, tasteful, and clean... a godsend after a June day in muggy Seoul on a 12-hour layover. Most importantly, they were available. 

Also available was luggage storage, for free. Again, very useful for that 12 hour layover. 

Lots of computers for use at the business center. 

Food was mediocre, which is where they don't particularly shine compared to some international carriers, but quite enough to fill you up. Alcohol choices were drinkable enough though. Better than anything on the plane, so I knew to drink up before my flight to SFO (haha!)

Ultimately, though, the mark of a good flight vs a bad flight is whether there's space to spread out. The flight to Tashkent wasn't full, so I grabbed a bench and got a serious 5 hours of sleep across 3 seats. But that only happened 1 out 4 flights. Used to be that you could do this all the time. 

Bottom line: decent airline by today's standards, but it's hard to get excited about a flight that's packed to the gills.

The entire process of travelling through Incheon Airport is extraordinary.
The staff are absolutely dedicated to their individual roles of giving the most excellent service possible.
Asiana carries this experience skyward.
Incredible standard for all their customers regardless of class.

What you expect from an Asian airline, slightly dated planes but outstanding service.

Check-in in China is always crazy, boarding also so i dont think its fair to review this.

PVG to ICN was delayed but made up time, transit through ICN i was a bit pressed for time but it was efficient enough.

Boarding onto ICN to SEA was chaotic, so many people getting onto flights departing next to each other. Once on-board it was as expected. Aircraft is a bit old, seats are worn but are sufficient for 10 hour sector.

Arriving into SEA was on time, getting off the plane and though immigration is always a messy process in US but it was fine none the less.

I enjoy flying with Asiana. They are professional and offer great service.  My first leg from Hong Kong to Seoul was on a A330 and it was a great flight. We had turbulence but that’s the weather for you.   The flight from Seoul to Chicago was on 777-200.  This plane was older than other 777 they have on the route. No had screens. In flight service excellent.  They should consider a snack offering along with the 2 meals, it’s 13hr flight.

The flight from ord to Incheon was on 777-200er and it seemed reconfigured. Larger seats with a lot of recline space in economy. In flight entertainment was good and the screen was had with usb. Great service. My only issue with the service is needing a snack along with the 2 main meals. 
The flight from Incheon to Manila was on a older version A330. For a short flight it didn’t matter and they also served food.
The staff were excellent very attentive and extremely helpful, loved the flight , highly recommend to anyone

I couldn’t imagine that i would like any airplane food but the food here is really much better than some of the better airlines. 

Other than that, announcement on plane are made in Korean and Korean accented English. I couldn’t understand either but that does not really bother me as you could more or less guess what they are saying. 

It also seems that the host and hostess are trained to put on a straight face. No smile, no emotion.

2018 Mar30 flight from ICN-NRT business class 
-feels old
-some features not working
-in-flight entertainment very limited ie movies (unexpected in Business Class)
-the food does not suit me personally

the saving grace is a very hospitable flight crew, all 3 of them :)

We got to the airport about 2 3/4 hours before our scheduled flight.  It was not really clearly marked as to which line we should be checking our luggage.  However, there were airline employees throughout the line to confirm that we are in the right line.  Please be prepared and have patience, because the lines are not short and they do move at a rather good pace.

Since we had additional luggage, we could not pay for the additional luggage in the line that we checked our luggage in.  We had to pay for the luggage at a different counter.

Boarding went rather smoothly and no issues were encountered.

The service on the flight was great!

The flight was smooth and comfortable!  The only issue that I had was that the person sitting next to me beside the window wanted to take up my floor space and his due to his placement of a bag on the floor versus the overhead bin.  Note:  There was ample overhead bin space available.

The flight left and arrived on time.

The worse airline I have travelled on. 

Lost my bags - totally unsupportive. 

Airbus A380 - same set up in suites 1-2-1 as Singapore Airlines . Not comparable for comfort whatsoever. Comfort far inferior. Food absolutely abysmal. Lobster - well - it may have been once upon a time. By the time it reached my plate - not for eating really. 

If this is first class my the Lord preserve those travelling in economy. Not for anyone liking for quality!!!

The seats were an older model but comfortable for a day flight. The staff and service were outstanding. The food and wine also fabulous. There was a western menu and a Korean menu but you could not mix choices. Entertainment choices were enough, not a lot of new movie releases though. As there is no direct flight from Melbourne, we had to transit overnight in Sydney. Sydney airport is always a pain and adds to the cost.

Flew over 14 hours to Ho Chi Minh City via Inchon.  Economy was reasonably comfortable, and had sufficient movies to pass the time.  The staff was professional, helpful, and always accessible.  Food service was timely and with sufficient beverages.  I will fly Asiana any time I have the chance.

I’ve already taken a lot of different airlines but had never heard of Asiana airlines before. We flew with them for the first (and last time) to go to Japan last April. We had an entirely 12h DAY flight but we were not allowed to open the window nor switch on the lights to read at anytime. We were also not allowed to walk around the aircraft at all because that was bothering the others passengers who wanted to sleep. The crew was not nice at all with us. They told us it was their culture and we just have to watch a movie and shut up. The screen was terrible and the selection very poor with films only in Chinese, Korean or English... but my parents do not speak English and just wanted to look out the window or read a book. That was just not possible as we had to stay in the total darkness. We really felt discriminated and will never fly with Asiana again.

Asiana is about as good as it gets for a long flight in an economy seat. This is the time I've taken this flight and the service and amenities have been consistently good.

Asiana's 777 economy class is 9 seats and two aisles across, which is very much better than most airlines which have now reconfigured to be 10 seats and 2 aisles.  The extra width makes a big difference after a few hours.

The service is above average and meals were significantly better than average.  The flight attendants were attentive but not so active that is was hard to sleep.

The entertainment is a bit dated but serviceable with a wide selection of options.  On down side there was no power at the seat on this plane.  The plane on way back did have USB power at the seat.

I have to admit to still being skeptical about the safety and training of pilots flying for Korean airlines.  The record is much better than it was in the 1980s and early 1990s, but the Asiana incident in San Francisco just a few years ago was still a result of poor pilot training.  However, our trip was fine or I wouldn't be writing this review.  Same with each of the last three times I've taken this flight.  Still one star missing after spending a whole flight wondering about pilot training.

Although I have traveled quite a bit, it was my first experience with this airline and I must say I liked it a lot. It was just a very short domestic flight from Seoul to Jeju Island so you would think that on such a short flight there would not be any service but there was! The personnel was extremely friendly and professional and we got a drink. I also like the interior of the plane, the use of soft beige colours gives a relaxed feeling. I would definitely fly again with air Asiana.
yes, I was not keen on the colours the seats were light brown also the cabin crew were in brown the crew were friendly and the food was good overall a good airline.

I was told by my travel agent that this was a budget airline but the only one they could use that fitted in with my planned itinerary.  We checked in at the airport with no problems and waited at the gate.  It seemed to be very last minute to actually get people to board but eventually we got on the plane and got seated.
The interior was a bit dated but it was comfortable and there seemed more room than on other budget airlines I had used.  Service was good, inflight food was decent - a full meal for a relatively short (2.25 hours) flight and punctuality was good.  Overall I was impressed.

Boarding, flight attendants passenger attention, food quality, onboard entertainment was adequate but not extensive resulting in my Cathay Pacific experience being awesome. Even the legroom estimated at 32 to 33 inches was above the average plane and at 5' 9"" my knees seldom touched the back of the seat in front of me. This was a Boeing 777-300 plane.

Flew on an A380.  Service was flawless.  FA’s were attentive, service with a smile.  

Food was terrific.  I had Korean dinner and breakfast and I really enjoyed the quality.  I also had a snack of ramen noodles.  

IFE was good with more selection than I had expected, but not to the same level as Emirates.  Headphones where over the ear type but not noise cancelling.  My Bose adapter wasn’t working well and couldn’t fit properly so I ended up using their headphones.  It was ok, nothing to write home about.  

Bathrooms were terrific.  The one in the front of plane was huge.  The one behind us, in front of economy, was also a good size with a window.  

Seat was very comfortable.  I generally don’t sleep well on long flights and I was able to get a couple of good hours of sleep in.  

Asiana is my new favourite airline.

New A380, good internal condition. Flight left on time. I could not get the meal I ordered (western meal) despite being one of a few western people in business class. Movie selection is poor and sparse. Otherwise comfortable flight

i took package to los angeles to danang vietnam 3 night 4day trip and to seoul korea. with asiana airline. i flew from lax to inchon airport with airbus 380 which is one of newest big airplan by airbus and very nice and clean, then when we arrived inchon airport we have connction flight to danang vietnam with beoing 747 one of the biggest plan by beoing,
it was also very nice and clean.  Did i mention all the flight attendece was really nice and kind.
ps Asiana airline use most newest plan in the market.

Our business class flight from New York to Seoul was wonderful. The service was seamless, the meals were wonderful and the accommodations the best. We had a lounge with room to stretch and walk around. I can't say enough about how positive the experience was.  However from Seoul to Sydney we ended up with an old aircraft that had seen better days. The in flight entertainment left a lot to be desired and there was no room to really stretch or move around. I felt cramped but fortunately slept most of the way. I was full from the first flight's meals so only had a snack. Were it not for the second leg of the flight, I would have rated this five star.

Business class from London to Sydney with an overnight stop over in Seoul on the return flight. The experience was good, on the whole, with what you would expect from a business class cabin and courteous and helpful staff.  My partner is disabled and the assisted service he received was excellent.  Food and entertainment a little disappointing but since the price was half that of the leading airlines it woud be churlish to complain.

I booked this flight from Australia to fly over to Seoul for a short trip whilst on a larger vacation to Japan.

Comfortable plane, wonderful customer service. Definitely will use them again if traveling within Asia.
Paid a bit extra for ""Special Coach""  but well worth it.  a few inches make a world of difference when taking a long haul flight.

The service was good, the entertainment was good, the staffs were nice and very well dressed, the seat was also comfortable. The only thing that didn't satisfy me was only the meal. I ordered Muslim meal, but the quality of Muslim meal was not satisfying for me, other airlines such as Thai airways serve better halal food for the same economy class flight.

Asiana provides great service and I like their planes. The flight from Manila to Seoul is not as nice as Seoul to LA. The lounge in Manila is just awful for a business class lounge. Alas, it's Manila. The lounges in Seoul and L.A. are fantastic!!

One of the best airline 
Not many flight connect to the world but best food and best service by crew ever!!

Asiana Airlines an excellent Airlines with very trained crew members and aircrafts are having a good leg spaces for a long haul travels. 

I suggest better quality food should be served to vegetarians. A lot of improvement required for both breakfast & lunch/ dinner. Also choice of Indian Hindi movies were limited and needs to be improved.

Airbus A380 with lie flat seats on upper deck. Aircraft very comfortable and quiet. Good friendly service onboard. reasonably good menu, but they ran out of western meal starters so had no complete meal. As the fine print says, sometimes your choice will not be available. A bit disappointing for Business class, but not the end of the world.

we were booked on a super break holiday using Austrain airlines, had never used the airline before nor had any feed back from other travellers. so upon arrival we discover there is a problem with the booking - despite paying super breaks for 2 cases the airliine didnt have any recorded of our cased being included in the booking - but no problem the flight is full so the cases can go on for free.super breaks are rung and confirm cases are included so no problem and have a good time 
upon returning to the airport on friday we are met with automated check in - in a very busy airport and - cases not included in the booking !! cant ring home as austria is one hour ahead of Uk - so we have to go to ticket desk where we were met by a very unfriendly member of staff who refused to accept our holiday documents as being in order  staff would only accept one case as having been booked and paid for and only option is to pay £40 for 2nd case - the woman on the desk was rude, un coperative and very unhelpful.
fortunatley the super break team were much more helpful and coperative and agreed to get our money back once we were back in the uk.

it is such a shame that the ground crew dont match the helpfulness of the aircraft crew who simply could not do enough to help passengers on board. 
the plane was clean and tidy and the staff very attentive
Great airline flew business, clean, great staff, good food very comfortable. Good business class lounges, used United at London which was excellent.

The cabin crew on this flight were the friendliest, most helpful and charming I have ever encountered.  They literally couldn't do enough to make our flight an enjoyable experience - I wish other airlines would learn from Asiana.  I highly recommend this airline.  The stewardesses were also stunningly beautiful and perfectly groomed.

I was pleasantly surprised with the seats in economy.  There was sufficient leg room and the wings on the headrest held your neck in a comfortable position.  Flight was full, but most are these days.  Would fly with them again for sure.

I am in a very expensive and horrible situation because of Asiana Airlines. I called to make a reservation on April 7th for my flight, and I also booked a reservation with my emotional support animal. It was accepted and everything was alright. I called back to reschedule the flight, as there was a similar flight leaving around the same time that was 6 hours shorter. The reservation call center representative happily rebooked my flight, but they failed to tell me that they cancelled my emotional support animal reservation. From my knowledge, everything was fine as it was the SAME agent who cancelled and rebooked my flight who added my emotional support animal reservation.

We made our connecting flight to NYC from Boston, where we went to check in with Asiana. They said we had no reservation on file as the original reservation was cancelled with the flight that was rebooked. There was apparently nothing they could do about it. The girl we worked with Alleyah, was very nice and tried to accommodate us, but her manager told her they would not make any exceptions today because there were already other dogs on the flight. They then tried to tell us that we would not be allowed to bring our dog, because we did not have a USDA stamped letter. When I called the USDA, they said that I DO NOT NEED a stamp to enter Korea on a LAYOVER. Regardless, I have since obtained a USDA stamp and I have all necessary paperwork. We could have made our flight that day but the staff at the airport REFUSED to allow us.

We are now STRANDED in New York for several days until this is resolved. Asiana is trying to blame us and make us pay additional fees to reschedule. We own an import/export business in Vietnam and will be contacting our lawyers to obtain the recordings of the voice calls as subsequent staff admitted that the original service member should have told us to rebook the emotional support animal reservation. We should not be treated this way.

My husband and I booked on Asiana because they were part of the star alliance, we belong to united mileage plus. They took our UA # at booking , we never received our travel miles. When I contacted them they said economy doesn’t receive miles! I’ve never heard of this and should have been told that at booking. I would’ve used another airline. Then I ordered vegetarian meals at the time of booking, and on all flights was told they never received the request. So 19 hrs without food. The people at the call center are incredibly rude, that is when you can actually get through. After being on hold for almost an hour, they were of no help whatsoever.  At the airport in Ho Chi Min city, we flew in from Cambodia and the guy at the Asiana desk refused to print our boarding passes, forcing us to sit in the customs area for 14 hrs. I will never fly Asiana again!

In-flight entertainment was out of order for the whole flight (even if it wasn't, their 90's style system would never offer any good experience), food was terrible (the menu said it was pork something, and it turned out to be ""Where's the pork?"" in the pile of cabbages), seats were too old, and lounges at ICN looked like fake library (the food at the lounge were also terrible).

Satisfied with the entire trip, from checkin to landing. I was surprised that the meal was hot, rice soft and fragrant, meal tender and juicy! Fast and good inflight service, smooth liftoff and landing, efficient and good. Not any poorer than some premium airlines around this part of the world.
this is my first time flying to this airlines....the only thing i do not like is they always announce that our flight will be delayed

I was wary of flying with this airline after their recent accidents on long-haul flights, but opted to use them after reading customer reviews.
The outbound flight was in a brand new aircraft, and you could smell the newness.
The seat (27A) was comfortable and reclined just that little more than other Economy seats of old. The screen for entertainment was large and the newer models now mean you are less likely to be irritated by your neighbour’s screen light blaring out at you. The headphones however, did little to cut out external noise like the screaming baby several rows in front. If you’re trying to watch a movie in the first and last hours of your flight, forget it. The unnecessary amount of announcements about Duty Free shopping, ads and meal services, was so bad that I gave up using the system and opted to watch movies on my iPad instead.(And at least my own headphones drowned out that screaming baby).
Meals were fresh and served quickly. My only bone of contention was that every meal, including breakfast, has rice!  Staff were polite and helpful, but reluctant to serve alcoholic beverages after the first 2 drinks, citing concerns for my health. (Thanks, but I’ll be the judge of that.)
The aircraft boasted a multi-coloured lighting system, but this was not used. In fact, the crew could use some serious training on using this, because on both outbound and inbound flights, they deemed it necessary to smash the lights on to full power, going from complete and relaxing darkness to neon white in an instant! (Cue screaming baby again). This made many of us passengers uncomfortable and grumpy. Not to mention the same reiteration of Duty Free ads.
All in all, the flight was reasonable and comfortable and I’ll likely use this airline again, especially given the fact that airlines like British Airways ticket prices have become a joke! But I would hope to see less advertising and better use of the multi-coloured lighting system. And perhaps some training for crew in turning off personal seating lights for those passengers who are sleeping so their light doesn’t light up the cabin when we’re all trying to sleep! And it wouldn’t hurt to turn the cabin temperature down a degree or two. Not all passengers are okay with flying in hot air.

It was a good flight, reminding me of how air travel used to be. We got a meal and the crew was friendly enough. Flight was delayed because of a passenger not showing up after checking luggage, but obviously that is an exceptional situation.

My only complaint was about the video screen. They are using older screens with some sort of touch screen overlay that basically doesn't work. Controlling the entertainment system is really difficult and you can see everyone pounding on the screen. This means the person behind you will be punching the screen a dozen times.

I liked the professionalism of the check-in clerk as she was able to dispatch our bags to BRU with another airline despite our ticket with Asiana was only for the leg Haneda - Incheon..
On-board experience was very good, no complaints.

Horrible experience with Asiana airlines station manager C. D. Kim on flight OZ 748. Granted flight was cancelled due to weather, this station manager had no sense of customer service and dismissed our concerns, all he had to say was “no, no, no” on any questions we had or when asked about how the airline will compensate us. He also walked away from us while we were expressing concerns. 

Very disorganized when flight was cancelled. No clear communication of what was going on with our flight until they led us to get our checked bags and was being led to a line up for a hotel. All 300 people fighting to get on buses to get to hotel at 2am with a clear lack of organizination from the airlines. People were pushing and shoving each other to get to the bus. Airline staff did not know how to speak English and had to ask a different airline’s staff to translate to answer our questions. We ended up taking our own cab to get to the hotel. 

Our flights were booked with air canada,  which when we called to find out what was going on with the rest of our connecting flights to Canada said they can’t help and we have to deal with Asiana airlines. Poor experience especially since we were in a foreign country in the middle of the night.

It had been a while since I flew Asiana. The aircraft was an A330-300, seated in economy from Singapore (SIN) to Seoul Incheon (ICN). The seats were slightly narrow, its colour made it look old, but it probably isn't. In fact, the seats turned out to be sufficiently comfortable. With the flight leaving SIN at 3 AM, I actually had a good sleep. The IFE screen was small, and it took some time to get the hang of it. 

Breakfast was ok, but nothing special. On the other hand, the cabin crew was very polite, efficient and professional. Not too invasive, just the right touch. 

We arrived at the gate, but the seatbelt sign didn't turn off for about 10 minutes. During that time, despite not having any explanation from the captain or crew, all passengers kept seated patiently. Quite impressive passengers, but I felt that the crew could have communicated better. To bad.

Well, Asian business class lounge is the worst I have ever visited and the one in Incheon International Airport has to be third class. Not good enough and well shows you that you cannot keep up with Emirates.. one pot of food and one of rice.. yes that was it.. with some rolls and bread, some pretzels and chips... in a bowl. What a terrible experience..
Travelled Asiana for the first time. The business class service was wonderful. The planes were new and cool. The food was great. Flight attendants were wonderful.
Very enjoyable flight with world class service. Will definitely recommend this carrier to everyone. American carriers could certainly learn a thing or two from their Asian carriers.

We flew Asiana both ways, to and from on our 28 day tour of Vietnam, Cambodia and Hong Kong. Asiana made the trip even more pleasurable due to on time performance, very accomplished, spiffy and kind flight attendants, good food and beverage, and some extra help at the desk at ORD when we had a glitch with our Vietnam visas that was successfully resolved. We booked our flight through United but I must say that the on-board service of Asiana was a level above what we are used to flying on U.S. carriers. Thanks, Asiana, for nice flights and continue the great service.

this was the first time I flew Asiana Airlines (International). it was a Special Promotion, AUD$2650 Return for 1 pax, Direct Flight from Sydney to Seoul, Feb 5th 2018.

International Flight Asiana Airlines is good. I sat the New Airbus A380. the Flight Stewardess are gorgeous and well mannered, they have excellent attitude, very friendly and made sure that you are comfortable for the duration of your flight.
I have attached some pictures of food served in flight and pictures of the seats. Overall Flight Experience is 8/10. only feedback is that the Flight Entertainment Movies Pack could be better with more variety.

Domestic Flights Asiana Airlines is Misleading though. I bought Domestic Tickets from the Asiana Airlines website.
 
The reason I buy tickets from Asiana is because they are Star Alliance. Im Singapore Airlines PPS Club (Gold Star Alliance) and I was refused entry to the domestic lounge because although my tickets are bought from Asiana but codeshare Air Busan (a subsidiary of Asiana Airlines) isn’t Star Alliance. THIS IS DEFINITELY MISLEADING!
I can check in at the Priority Lane but cannot access the lounge because its Air Busan BUT I bought the tickets with ASIANA. at Jeju Airport, the Asiana Ground Staff keep reminding everyone waiting at the Priority Lane that we must hold Gold Cards to check in (tbh, I was bewildered and amused). if I had known that this was the case, I would have bought Korea Air instead because I have Sky Priority and can access the Lounge.

Conclusion, THATS IT for ASIANA! no more flying ASIANA! Im sticking with other Airlines that does not mislead. I think Im very fair in giving them a score of 8 for International and 1 for Domestic.

International Asiana - 8/10
Domestic Asiana - 1/10 (Ground Staff Experience and Misleading)

I was pleasantly surprised by wide seat and extra legroom on A380-800.  Big screen was nice to watch movies.  I like A380 better than Boeing 787 Dreamliner.  Flight attendants were friendly and provided good service with smile.

We selected this airline as it was the cheapest airline at the time. I was a bit worried due to the cheap ticket price, but I was pleasantly surprised. The flights were well serviced with drinks, meals and snacks and good legroom. Incheon aiport was great for a four hour layover on our returning flight... I discovered the free nap zone, if feeling a bit fatigued during the flights check out the level with the lounges, a bit more peaceful than the hustle and bustle on the main level. Would fly again with Asiana.

We departed Spore on April 11, 2018 vis Asiana Airline flight no OZ752. Our flight was quite smooth except we were very upset with one Korean Flight stewardess.  She is the one who serve from row nos. 35 to the last row at right hand side.  We could not see her name tag but we can see she is more senior than the other flight stewardess.  Because of language barrier, my cousin and my elderly uncle has a problem to communicate with her for more warm water. As service provider, she should has more patience and understand what they asked for. Instead she abrupted ignored  my cousin when he tried to stop her to serve some water. 
  I witness myself she glared at my elderly uncle when he tried to talk to her. 
However the other young flight stewardess on left hand side were very friendly and helpful.  Sorry I did not get their name tag but I am impressed with their attitude unlike the other one

Flight Journal for Online Reviews

Route:
OZ0601 - Seoul Incheon, South Korea (ICN) to Sydney, Australia (SYD) - daily departure from ICN at 20:00, scheduled

Airline / FFP:
Asiana Airlines - part of Star Alliance.  Codeshare with Qantas, but unable to enter Qantas Frequent Flyer (QFF) when checking-in at ICN airport.

Plane (Type, Model and Call-sign):
Boeing 777-200 HL 8254

Date: 
Tuesday 24 April, 2018

Seat / Class:
Economy, 33C (aisle).  3-3-3 configuration.  

Duration:
Nominally 9h 50m for the 8,348 km route. 
Stated on IFE: 9h 50m

Departure (Scheduled / Actual): 20:00 / 20:24
Arrival (Scheduled / Actual):  07:15 / 07:10 (Link to FlightRadar24?)

Baggage:
1x 23kg suitcase

Comfort:
In Economy, the 3-3-3 configuration is good. In fact, the seats were a little cramped for me knee-wise (188cm height), so I really appreciated the longer backs to the chairs, and the fact that the height-adjustable headrests stayed up.  Width-wise it was fine.  Plenty of storage space in the chair back - table was clean (as clean as can be for a plane table) and stayed level, rather than dropped on worn-out hinges.  No foot-hammock. 

Didn’t have any IFE units in the footwell spaces for seats A-C - great!

Service (inc Timeliness):
Departed approx 24 minutes late due to hold ups on the apron.  All in all, the flight was boarded in about 25 minutes which is quite impressive for a B777. 

Slippers were handed out but no eye mask or ear plugs. 
Toothbrush set in the toilets.  

IFE:
The older Asiana Airlines entertainment, featuring flight map graphics and old-school layout.  Screen was a good size and touchscreen, contrast was poor and a fair level of glare on the monitor screen.  The seat back contained a USB port and the arm-rest a dual-pin headphone socket.  USB port had sufficient ampage to charge an iPad - albeit slowly.  Two power points per 3 seats, which is generous. 

Catering:
Meals: Dinner within an hour after departing ICN, and a breakfast about 1h 15m before landing.  
For dinner, offered a choice of Western (chicken and potatoes) or Korean (Beef, rice and Ssimbap).  Opted for the Korean meal and really enjoyed it, especially the interactive nature of the salad leaves, and the tasty Korean bean dumplings for dessert.   Dinner was served hot.
For breakfast, offered either Chicken Rice porridge or Omelette with potatoes and vegetables.  Opted for the plain omelette but was disappointed that it was covered in a white cheese floury cream sauce, and the omelette was lukewarm.  Side dishes included fresh pineapple, blueberry Yoplait yoghurt and bread roll with butter.  A sachet of tomato sauce included, but no salt and pepper though.

See photos of menu.

Mid-flight snacks: None.

Water runs - only two which is disappointing for a 10 hour flight.  No post-dinner drink run for refills either.  Hot drinks weren’t really hot at all.

Quite surprised that they started serving the lunch within an hour of taking off (so 11am Brisbane time).  No pre-dinner drinks for Economy in the style of Singapore Airlines.

Key Staff:  
Friendly smile and Korean welcome on-board.

Miscellaneous Nugget:
Two firsts on this flight - this was my first long-haul trip with Asiana Airlines, and my first direct flight Korea to Australia.  

In general, was not impressed by OZ service, food and the plane - it was reliable rather than stand-out.   Best thing was the excellent leg room in cattle class.

Overall Verdict: rating 3 out of 5

Review, and paid for by, purple_traveller (https://www.tripadvisor.com.au/members/purple_traveller) - a Qantas Bronze / Virgin Platinum / Flying Blue Platinum for Life member.

1. Amazing food - I never knew airline food could taste this good.  4 course dinner: Caprese salad with fresh mint leaves, tomato, and delicious cheese with tiny bottle of balsamic vinegar - I was already impressed by this dish. Then came my seafood pasta dish with 2 prawns and 2 scallops - both done right; and the al dente pasta with a scrumptious mushroom sauce.  I try to not eat too much carbs so I let my daughter try some pasta and she took it from me.  (she chose something else that wasn't as impressive - take note).  Then cheese course - slice of brie and another semi-soft cheese with crackers and fruits - really good cheese.  Then tiramisu for dessert.  It felt as if I went to a good restaurant and had a great meal.  

Breakfast was just a amazing.  The croissant was warm and super flaky!!  I usually don't eat airplane croissants because they tend to just look like one from the outside but is just chewy dry bread on the inside.   Asiana croissant deserves a sonnet!  There were fruit slices carefully cut up and a yogurt.  

I really believe in quality over quantity and the food that Asiana served was cooked and selected with care.  Thank you!

Service was professional and kind.  
Seats were comfy - I just put my eye patches and earbuds in and try to go to sleep. 
Entertainment was fine - I watched a movie.
Landing was a bit rough - not like a gentle embrace of the ground - more like a rough tumble.  But, all was safe and good.  

The only part that was a departure from the high level of service this flight impressed on me was the Asiana Lounge in Seoul.  First, their posted hours were incorrect.  We landed in Seoul before ANY lounge was open (around 5m) so we tried to look up the hours and went back to check a couple of times but different times were posted at the closed gate vs the website. I asked the 'not very helpful' information desk who told us that the Lounge open sometime between 6 and 7am, but weren't sure. - not very informational.  We checked at 6am and still saw the Close sign. We sat at the chairs at the Gates to try to get some rest, and then checked the Lounge at 6:30am and it was open and seemed to be opened for a bit as there were quite some people there already...so really confused as to when they opened.  Food was just ok.  The best part was the shower.

Travelled with Asiana from London Heathrow to Sydney, via business class, as the cost was the best value against other carriers, and the duration was equivalent. First time with Asiana and in business class and we thought the service was superb.  

The seats from London were lovely, converting to bed like state, and the food and service both awesome. The lounge access was also appreciated, and the accelerated passage through passport control and getting our bags.

Only downside, the flight from Incheon to Sydney could have been better.  We couldn’t select the seats online for our flight from Incheon to Sydney, all were shown as unavailable. When checking in only two seats were left which meant my wife and I had to be separated.  It was clear when we got on that flight that the other passengers had selected theirs, so was this a case of preferences for passengers booking in Korea over those using Incheon for a transfer? Also, the plane was tired, not as nicely presented and the entertainment functionality a bit old.

We’d fly with them again, as the value for money is good, although the seat selection issue would need resolving.

Flew from Jakarta to Seoul for holiday in economy class. I got off at midnight, still we got a welcome snack though. We got two choices for breakfast: scrambled egg or shrimp. Had the quite same price with Garuda Indonesia at the moment, I didn't regret choosing Asiana to have new experience of flying. All of the stewardess are Korean, very professional and efficient. I could choose the seat online for free, the seat were large and comfortable. Got in-flight entertainment with various music and movies choices. Very recommended.

This was a surprisingly comfortable and even memorable flight.  The seats were large and comfortable with good opportunities for sleep.  Staff were kind and helpful and the food, particularly the Korean dishes - delicious.
Korean company using good airplanes for their route. Staff is kind, very polite and helpful. Food is good (for airplane food). Overall good airline, and good price too.

Flew from ICN to SFO on a fully-booked flight in Economy class.
Was a bit apprehensive at first to sit in Economy for a ten-hour flight. However it went very well: attentive flight attendants, good video/ entertainment system. It was a night departure so we were served a dinner and eventually a breakfast before landing.

This was a fairly new Airbus 350 plane. Overall great flight!
I had a good flight. I just hope that there's more option of food and bigger pillow since it's a long flight. But overall it's very good experience. Thanks.

the airline is nice and clean, flights attendants are very pleasant and attentive to passengers. the reason for three stars is the food.
