From JFK to Incheon food was good, but from Incheon to Clark and clark to incheon all the way back to JFK the foods are not so good, you just have to eat. Other than it was pleasant and comfortable flight

I often choose Asiana Airlines for my trips. They serve quality food (love korean foods so yummy :) ) and good service inside flight. Toilet is always clean. Good point for me! But especially if you are going to Istanbul, planes have old multimedia system (especially headphone jack always make me annoyed not working well ) 
They have to improve check in service at airport. They are too strict sorry :)  By the way they must change or make some improvement on their website. It is not their class.

My first flight on Asiana, and was bumped from economy to business as plane was full for overnight flight.  The seat was a flat bed on the A380 and I had the last seat in the section in front of lavatories.  Not ideal in terms of noise but I got a much better rest than had I been in a reclining seat in economy.  Lights were dimmed rather late after takeoff.  The meal was served a few hours before arrival at Incheon so it was a bleary-eye breakfast but very good and served with white cloth and silver.  I highly recommend Asiana business class!

What an amazing flight!  Flight attendants were attentive but respectful of your space.  
Seat 2E, a closed suite, was extremely comfortable.  The suite was equipped with a large 32"" television and a personal closet for hanging your clothes.  When it was time to sleep, you were provided with a pair of soft pajamas (you picked your size!) and slippers.  While you were changing, the flight attendant converted your seat into a bed that was wide and long enough for a larger-than-average man.  It was topped with a mattress pad, blanket, and duvet.  The lights were dimmed in the cabin and the ceiling was dotted with tiny stars.  So soothing!  The only downsides to the flight were the food (which was plentiful but rather lackluster [I selected from the Korean menu]) and the very limited selection of movies.  I should mention that one of the TV choices was a feed from a camera mounted in the cockpit which provided AMAZING views of the taxi, takeoff and landing!!  That was awesome!  I would absolutely fly this A380 route again...but would pre-load my iPad with movies.
compare with EVA snack during the flight still lower than EVA the rest its ok ____ coz i like korean food.

We traveled as a family of 5.  Myself, husband and 3 kids aged 12, 6 and 3, all in business class.  

In-flight entertainment is sorely lacking in selection.  If you've got kids, better load up their iPads or bring them lots of toys.

The cabin was WARM.  UNCOMFORTABLY WARM.  

For the first long haul, the flight attendant adjusted it maybe 2 degrees and it became bearable, but still not comfortable.  

Our long haul on the way back was just as warm, and despite several requests to lower the temperature, we were just plain ignored. Not even after I showed the flight attendant that my son was perspiring and restless in his sleep.

Even after I heard other passengers (not just myself and my husband) complain.  I would understand if a majority of the passengers had requested to keep it on the warm side, but our section wasn't full and quite frankly, my family of 5 pretty much outnumbered the other passengers who were travelling solo or in pairs.  

The food was okay.  Nothing spectacular but not really awful.  My steak was served at room temperature, and it arrived late for some reason and I was starving, so I took it and didn't bother sending it back, lest it take another 30 minutes.

When we arrived in Manila, not one but TWO of our luggage were badly damaged.  Oh and did I mention that this airline is fond of altering departure time?  So our connecting flight was delayed and we barely made the next one, but alas, our luggage did not.  It was delivered the next day to our home, but yes, with a large crack in each piece.  Bear in mind, one was a Samsonite and the other a Briggs and Riley.  I don't know if I've just been lucky all these years travelling or what, but this is the first time I've ever experienced damaged luggage.

I reported it to their website, which stated that all reports of damage had to be made within 7 days of the flight.  Lo and behold, I got a ""Page Cannot Be Found"" error when I submitted the form.  So I emailed the only other email address I had on file and I got a polite message saying I had mistakenly sent my complaint to reservations, but my complaint would be forwarded to the correct department.  I replied back that I did make an attempt on the website and got an error reply and I NEVER HEARD FROM THEM AGAIN.

So here I am.

Asiana will never be an option for me or my family.

I've flown to various Asian countries over the years and my go-to has always been EVA. For my Vietnam trip however, Asiana offered the best deal, and it really was quite a good price. They're business class offers single seats next to windows and double seats in the middle, all offering quite good privacy from fellow travelers. Service was very good, seats comfortable, food good, and fairly ample booze; all of my requirements for long distance flights! The entertainment choices for movies may have been a bit limited for my choice, but I don't care at all about that, I always bring plenty of electronics and reading materials. They lay-down seats were good, however your feet wind up in sort of a cubby area that limits mobility a bit. But the overall experience for me was really very good. And all 4 of my flights with them were on time except one, which was due to the airport; still made my connector!

I just came back from Asia, and I had the opportunity to fly on Asiana's A380's First Class.   

I would like to keep this simple. 

Entertainment: 3/5
There are a lot of negative reviews on the Entertainment system, but I felt that it was just enough to keep me entertained, but i can definitely agree with some of the limitations compared to many of the other international airlines in the world. 

Seats: 4.5/5
If you are traveling alone, you should try and secure the window seats.   It offers more privacy and space compared to the middle seats.    Asiana provides private suites for First Class customers with closing doors.    My door was slightly damaged that I was not able to enclose it completely.   It was not a deal killer.    The seats overall was spacious and wide that anyone would feel comfortable in any shape or size. 

Food: 4.5/5
You are capable of preordering from a special menu before your departure.  I was able to order the galbi.   The meal feels like it goes on forever.    There is a tremendous amount of food and the main entree comes with the typical Korean sides such as kimchi and other pickled vegetables.   I enjoy Korean food in general and it was a definite treat to have the opportunity to eat Korean food on our flight.    

I would consider the food on Asiana's first class to be up there with Air France's First Class which is phenomenal.    We flew Qatar's business class product as well during this trip as well.    Qatar has a great product in general in terms of service and seats but the food itself is subpar compared to Asiana and Air France.   

Amenities: The restroom is small and limited for First Class compared to other international airlines.  It does not have a shower as Emirates.   Qatar has a bar on the plane.    Asiana has a bar, but it is limited. 

Overall: 4/5

I usually use Inchon Airport, which is new, and great shopping for the duty free.  However, I found the Gimpo airport was interesting, and convenient!   Firstly, it is much closer to Soul downtown, which requires little time and money compared to the Inchon.  Secondly, there aren't many people, you don't have to wait in line.  Thirdly, you can still enjoy shopping at the Lotte Mall.

I am a loyal member to Asiana so I may be biased. I simply like the meals served on this airline. Been traveling in coach and was satisfied with its legroom. So great food with decent legroom is what I would recommend Asiana Airlines -though the entertainment system selection (esp. movies) has always been disappointing.

I flew from Seattle to Manila in the process of moving for work. Check-in was fairly quick compared to some airlines I've flown. And the counter people were very nice and found me an isle seat for the flight. The only isle seat available was at the bulkhead (first row in the middle section) next to a mother and baby!!!! Figured that the baby was in there anyway...may as well jump in the fire and sit right next to them! Lol! It was the mother and her 7 month old daughter flying to Korea to visit family. Mom was very nice, and her daughter was the happiest baby I've ever been around! Barely made a sound the whole trip (not like some flights we've all been on!) Smiling, laughing, or sleeping the whole trip! 

The flight attendants were great. Good food, decent seats (no sore back or butt) and smooth flight.

If you're looking at flights don't hesitate to book Asiana Airlines you'll have a good flight!

Very satisfied with Asiana Airlines flights from Tokyo  to Los Angeles. We would definitely fly them again. No problems making the reservations. Checking in at Tokyo was smooth. Boarding process was quick and efficient. Plane was modern, clean and everything worked properly. Flight attendants we dealt with were professional, helpful, friendly and spoke very good to excellent English. Cabin announcements were in understandable English. Food was adequate and good. Deplaning was smooth and efficient. Transfer in Seoul was smooth. Easy to find your way in the airport. Flight to Las Angeles was similar to earlier flight, e.g. efficient boarding, great staff and smooth deplaning. We really enjoyed the meal. We were in the upper level of an A380 and had plenty of room. Departed Tokyo on schedule and arrived in Los Angeles on schedule. Would definitely fly Asiana again.

I usually rate Asiana Airline as my favorite airline. Our last trip was a total disaster. When we arrivedd in Incheon, we told the staff that we will be in a tour. Since my wife needs a wheelchair due to back problem, I cannot ride the vehicle for those who with problems and I will have to walk myself. Our flight will not leave until late that afternoon.
I waited for my wife to the area for the tour but she was nowhere to be found. I found out later that she was taken to the departure area for the flight that will not leave several hours later. I contacted the service desk and ask for my wife whereabouts and I was told that she's on her way to the area where we have the tour. It took almost an hour before she was wheeled in to the area. We checked in for the tour but we were told that it is already fully booked and they accommodate us. We were so frustrated for the service we received from Asiana's staff in Incheon. I will evaluate my choices for flights to Clark and choose another Airline. We have been using Asiana for over ten years now.

I had a tight connection in Seoul but the crew waited for all passengers to be on board. Service is delivered with a smile, the food is good and a wide array of entertainment options are available. The legroom is very limited though if you only get a regular economy class seat.

This was my first flight aboard Asiana airlines and I was pretty satisfied.  The flight was only half full so I got to move from my seat so that I could have a row all to myself.  This gave me plenty of room to spread out.  My flight was late departing but Asiana held my connecting flight in Incheon so that I and several other passengers could make it.  Entertainment options were below industry standards and the food wasn't the best, but with the price being more than fair, I will probably give them another try.

We flew two legs on Asiana on award travel.  The first from HNL to ICH (Korea) was business class, which was absolutely phenomenal.  And the second leg was ICH to Sydney.  We had gracious and wonderfully comfortable service on both legs.  The economy class seats reclined about double what US airlines do and we had ample leg room and footrests, which made resting so much more comfortable on a lengthy flight.  Again, the service was wonderful  in both classes and we would choose Asiana over the US carrier that we flew back to the states.
My friend recommended me Asiana Airlines. It was a great flight, I felt comfortable during the flight. The flight attendants also very helpful. overall I enjoy my long flight.

I had an impressive in-flight experience.  It was my first time flying Asiana Airlines.  Honestly, I don't know Asiana Airlines beforehand. I liked their pleasant and courteous flight attendants.  Their meal was good and they also offer i think two rounds of drinks after the meal.  They have current but limited in-flight entertainment, how I wish they offer subtitles with their Korean shows in various languages.  They offer more lavatory toiletries than usual.  They also have bigger legroom than other economy flights I had.  Check-in and baggage claim is a breeze.

It was my first time on Asiana and I am impressed. The level of attention was superb as the flight attendant would come around to personally introduce herself. The food was good and the attendants would come around with water very frequently throughout the flight. The reclining seat was comfortable. My only complaint was the limited choice of in flight movies and rather old equipment.

Asiana airlines have lived up to one of “ the best airlines“ category. Roomy legroom.Flight attendants have been very attentive and helpfu. Always checking out on passengers and kept the lavatories clean.Liked that they would provide juices and snacks in between meals and can always request for extra drinks.To top it off , with a long lay over, we’re given the chance to tour the city for free. That , surely,added an extra excitement with our travel!

Excellent flight...courteous, friendly, professional and attentive. 2 delicious meals on first leg, another full meal on short end. In-flight entertainment was current and free. Made a long trip go by in a blink.

I booked my flights on a third party site because I was using my Citi Thank You points. Because of this, I didn't have the option to choose my seats and ended up picking them 2 weeks before my trip. I was in a middle seat flying from JFK to HND and luckily got a window seat coming back. On my flight to Japan (layover in Incheon, Korea), most of the flight attendants were friendly and helpful. However, the women next to me had lots of questions and one flight attendant seemed irritated with her. When she needed her medication from the overhead bin before take off, she asked twice before another passenger helped her. She was given the ""wait"" signal both times and then seemed to have been forgotten. When the meals came, she asked what was in them and was rudely told if she had diet restrictions, she should have noted it during the ticket booking. The women just wanted to know if anything was spicy as she would have an upset stomach. That was not an option for meals like being diabetic is. 

Entertainment: the movie options were plenty in multiple languages. I wish they had English subtitles on all their movies. 

Seats: were comfortable enough. I was born with extra leg room as I like to say when asked if I'd like that upgrade (I'm 5 ft), but the guy on my other side seemed pretty tall and needed to stretch out often. 

Food: Usually 2 options of Western like chicken/potatoes and Korean of marinated beef (bulgogi)/rice. Slight variations on the return trip (bibimbap or veggie wrap). Mid way snacks included a chicken burrito (more like a hot pocket), ice cream, yogurt and plenty of drinks throughout the flight. Nothing amazing but I'd give it 3.5 stars.

Asiana has been my choice of flight to go to Korea and onward to Asia destinations for the past 10 plus years. 

Upside : Courteous & friendly in-flight services, on-time departure and 2 daily flights
Downside: many unfriendly attitudes at LAX check-in desks and less desirable in-flight food quality compared to other Asian airlines
Very friendly flight attendants, very helpful if you needed anything.  The food served on the flight was very good.  Wasn’t expecting food and such a short flight.

Plane was old...seat was ripped. The food was not good at all. I had chicken and veggies. The chicken was dry and the veggies were still cold. Flight attendants were very good at their jobs. Flight took off and landed on time.

I purchased my 1 way Business class ticket 2 months before departure and got a very good rate.The departure was over 1 hour late due to inclement weather. We arrived in Seoul only 30 minutes behind schedule. The follow on flight to Manila was on time. Business class with Asiana is very relaxing, The food was very good and the service was prompt and professional. While the seat would recline fully, I had difficulty sleeping as the space for a persons feet was about 12"" wide overall,if you don't turn over when sleeping this may be adequate,  and the cabin was extremely hot. After requesting that the cabin temperture be adjusted, I dozed on and off, not fully asleep. All in all the Business class was a 8.5 out of 10. I will fly another asian airline upon return to the USA.

I went to visit my son for the first time in Australia and decided to make the flight part of the holiday experience and therefore decided to book Business Class. My travel agent suggested I try Asiana, having never heard of them I was slightly concerned at first, but read reviews and watched Youtube videos from paying customers, which helped me make the choice of using them, excellent service.

Checking in at Heathrow, you are guided through to the separate fast track security check in which literally took me 3 mins, great first experience and then straight to the Business lounge which again was a great experience, spacious, quiet with all the food and drink you could possibly want or need. Boarding the plane was also very fast and I will say now that on all four flights, I could not fault the Asiana cabin crew, polite, attentive and a little later I will touch on one member going the extra mile for customer  service.

The departing flight time was 20.10, after a great choice of food  and a number of glasses of port, I went to sleep on the full length bed and woke up 2 hours before landing at Seoul having had a very comfortable sleep. The welcome pack waiting in  my seat took care of all required needs form slippers to teeth cleaning etc. 

An estimate of your seating width  space is about 2.5 seats in economy with the row in front of you taken out, see photos. On all four flights I booked window seats with the associated pod being next to the aisle giving a feeling or even more privacy.

My connecting flight was 4 hours later, Incheon airport is vast and the business lounge took a little finding as the signs seemed to indicate it was upstairs, it is in fact on the main level on the left hand side as you walk down the main concourse, after checking in at reception, you are greeted by 2 large lounges with numerous privacy zones if required. On checking in at reception, I requested a shower, I was booked in and given a buzzer notification, 20 minutes later I was refreshed and ready for the next leg. Probably a 10 - 15 minute walk to the boarding gate ( due to the size of airport ) and after another speedy check in,  off I set again, At this stage I swapped my timing to Sydney time, more food and drink and took a sleeping table to help me sleep to assist in falling in with the Sydney time zone. I arrived at 08.20 local time, ready for my son.

I can say, I did not have any jet lag at all doing the above which was surprising to say the least I was though my actions may reduce not negate the jet lag

Be aware that entering Sydney, there is no fast track for Business class and due to the Australians strict entrance rules, this process took a while to clear as this is a two levelled process.

Leaving Sydney was the only fly in the ointment with this flight experience. Business lounge was great, however, when the call notification for boarding came up and attending the gate, it was mayhem. I was called to gate 16, what it didn't say was gate 16 had numerous sub departure areas A-G (I think), one member of airport staff attempting to police this with a strap band as a barrier leading to downstairs to the departure buses taking you to the plane. Therefore, with 6 - 7 plane loads of people trying to get into this zone, even though Business class was called first, it didn't work, you are then herded onto a bus to take you to the plane, again, Business class being irrelevant, however, once on the plane , normal service was resumed, so this comment is  not directed at Asiana, but Sydney airport itself.

Take off time in Sydney was 09.15, landing back at Incheon at 18.40 local time, the return flight had an option of an overnight stay in a hotel 10 minutes from the airport which I took and would recommend as again, this helped negate any jet lag and this is where I refer you to my earlier comment about a member of staff going the extra mile.

I actually had never received information about which hotel I was staying at, all I knew was it had been confirmed, I explained this to the cabin crew manager ( who had introduced herself to each individual personally in Business class , she walked me off the plane, and took me to a section within the airport that I would never have found 
( this took about 10  minutes) , explained this situation and within minutes, the issue was resolved.

Following morning, checked out of the hotel at 11.00, taken to the airport for a departing flight of 14.30, I took a 2 hour sleep on this flight with an arrival time of 18.55 local time, again, not a jot of jet lag. 

All I can say is that when I visit my son again, it will be Asiana Business class with hopefully the same flight times, what a great experience at a cost of £2650 as opposed to most other being at least £1000 more, one more thing, Monty Don, was on my return flight from Seoul, so if its good enough for Monty, enough said .....

Asiana is pulling it together, I refuse to fly Delta, Northwest or American. It is pure hell for 12 hours. Asiana makes it bearable, Korean is still in the lead but more costly. I suggest booking through any online agent for the best deal although the cheapest ticket I've ever bought was for the very next day.
The layover in Incheon was smooth and easy. Airport is very nice, and clean. Everything looks new, and free wifi is easy access.

Used to like Asiana Airlines but had a bad experience this time.
Flight was delayed from 12:30pm to 2pm, at check in counter, was told we are not able to catch the connecting flight to hk, but will accommodate a night of hotel. We immediately packed clothes for a night. 
When we get to Seoul, they rushed us to the gate, very tired and not very pleasant. 
Didn’t arrive hk until 11:30pm, had hard time arrange transportation that late.
Thought that it was just a one time thing, but it happened again on our way back to Seattle, very disappointed. 
For that 14 hours flight, plane was old and the tv screen is small, only pro is that food is tasty. 
Will not travel with them again :(

We were very much pleased with the service. 
The staff were so approachable, friendly and respectful.
The leg room was surprisingly spacious compared to Asian airlines.
Temperature inside the aircraft was not consistent, felt hot for a little while.

Flying oversea from the US, Asiana Airlines rank among the best, probably one slight notch under Singapore Airlines.  Asiana Airlines emphasize on ""services"" and the whole crew is well trained, attentive, and recognize the importance of customer service. Flight attendants assure that toilettes are in working order and acceptable for a long flight.  Food variety is a plus, and Korean foods are even offered from flights from the US to Seoul.  Cabin, overall is clean.  Getting a coach seat on the second floor is a plus, due to the 2-4-2 seat arrangement.  It's sad that US airlines could not provide the same type of attention, care and service on long flights to Asia.

Flew Business Class from MNL to HNL via ICN, both segments of the flight were exceptional. Service was epic, flight attendants were very attentive and gracious. Selection of food items and beverages were adequate, and the presentation was equivalent to any five star restaurant on sea level. Seat arrangements and space were very comfortable, even for a wide bodied person like myself.  Have nothing but accolades for both fight and service.

I was not sure what to expect from an airline I knew nothing about.  I was pleasantly surprised by the superior service onboard this flight.  The plane was relatively new with lie-flat seats. Service was pleasant & helpful.  Food choices were good. My seat was very comfortable and entertainment choices were sufficient to keep me entertained.

At first glance leaving BKK at 2:00 am sounds lousy because red eyes are tough if you can’t sleep followed by another red eye Honolulu,.  However the long 10-11 hour layover works positively because Asiana has a special NAP corner at the Incheon Airport where one can sleep as long as desired to catch up and rest.  And there are massage and food corners too.  It makes for a great trip in a good and caring airline!!

I was once again able to fly Asiana Airlines business class to Asia by using 90k United Air miles. I have flown Asiana in the past under the same arrangement but every year it seems to cost more miles to make the same trip. Asiana business class is, in short, wonderful. My little pod had everything I needed to sit or sleep comfortably. The seat becomes a full, lay-flat bed and amenities include a mask, ear plugs, slippers pillow and blanket. The meals are 5 course world class offerings with 3 choices of entrees and include wine, beer and other spirits. The entertainment options include music and a wide range of movies and TV shows on a large high-definition screen. Earphones are provided free. Our little section with 10 or 12 seats had 3 full-time flight attendants.
I heartily recommend Asiana business class if you can afford it. It makes a 12 hour flight bearable.

Their food (western) has a lot to be desired. Otherwise, I would have rated this excellent.  Nevertheless, I would still recommend this to my friends and others because of their legroom and their service.

I’ve flown this leg several time but this last time leaving Incheon, S Korea the airline made me change seats after I was seated because an mother and daughter ( mom was in her 50’s and daughter in her mid 20’s) complained to the flight attendant for 5 minutes in Korean ( yes they spoke English very well as I had the privilege of listening into their conversation ) that their seats were separated by one row . They kept complaining about the lack of WiFi prevented them from getting the seats they wanted 
Unfairly in was asked to relocate to an uncomfortable seat to accommodate these two 
Had this been a young child I think i would have understood and be willing to relocate but for Asiana flight attendant to bend to the pressure and whining from this customer puts an unfair burden on other customers especially in light of the fact that I made my reservation 6 months in advance yet the airline failed to accommodate the customer that made zero fuss and bend to the biggest whiner 

I will give my business on this next trip to other competing airline

The airplane drivers are the most experienced in the Pacific Fleet.  The Flight Attendants are the most knowledgable/friendly/pros of any airplane service. and the food surpasses the closest competitor in the skies.  I would highly recommend even to immediate family members!

Took a flight to Korea and the Philippines in January 2018 with this Airlines and felt like I was actually in 1st Class although riding in Economy Class. The cost is substantially less than all the others!!! The food selection was incredible and strangely filling for airline food. By the time the flight was over I could barely finish their last meal served! The lady's working the flight were all very beautiful, classy and sharply dressed!! The in flight entertainment was out of this world as there was at least a dozen recent theater movies to choose from, music, sports, video games and other programs on a 8"" to ""10 inch screen on every seat back with choices of languages. It was a bit hard sometime to understand what the Captain was saying over the intercom but trust me when I say it is all worth it. Even in the restrooms they supply lotion and other amenities to make you comfortable. I highly recommend this Airlines and already have my next trip booked and paid for...

I found the service good on the long haul flight from Los Angeles to Korea.   Food was good and entertainment system current films   The flight attendants were hospitable and accessible.   What I particularly liked was the second leg of the trip from ICN to SGN.   I could actually lay almost flat and sleep.   I don't find this to be true on Korean.  So that was a real plus for me.

Took the new A-130 (I think) from Los Angeles with a 4 day stop over in Seoul and then to Phuket Thailand. The flight to Korea was on an awesome new plane. Looks like a beluga whale with its two decks and large front cockpit. Good I’m flight entertainment and decent economy class food. Great staff. Would fly again.

My last trip on Asiana about five years ago was excellent. It seemed as if they had not updated their fleet since. Plane was tired and older. No wifi. Only on one leg was there an electrical power supply.
Food was good but not great.
Better options are available.

I flew Asiana from west coast US to Seoul (their hub).  I am 6'4"" and was concerned about having sufficient leg room so I sprung for the Premium Economy option at an added cost of $150 each way.  I lucked out in that the plane was packed but the Premium Economy section was nearly empty, my entire row was just me.  The flight attendants were fine with me laying down across all three seats and sleeping most of the flight away.

Positives:
Legroom in PE was fantastic, comparable to JetBlue in the USA.  

Entertainment options: Plenty of stuff to watch.  Included movies, TV, radio.  There is an in-seat messenger system built into the entertainment system too.

Food was surprisingly good.  I was surprised to receive real silverware!  Bread, microwave-level main course, then tea or coffee.  Attendants are remarkably attentive, I got asked if I wanted something roughly every 30 minutes.

Slippers and a toiletry kit are provided!  This may have been a PE benefit, I don't know.

Negatives:
While the outbound flight checked our tickets and made sure we were in the right spot, my return flight didn't do that.  We had a rush of people crowding the premium economy seats (someone even tried to take mine!) before complaining.
One meal was extremely spicy, no warning given.  Me and my entire row breathed fire for a few minutes (none of us liked spicy food).
While I'm used to paying for Premium Economy on long flights, Asiana had one of the more expensive costs for that upgrade ($150) that I've paid.  Typically it's $120 or so, $60 cheaper round trip.
While PE got to board with first class on the way out (cool unexpected perk) we did not on the way back (I actually got stopped at the gate).  If they hadn't boarded me on the way out I would have missed it, but I was kinda irritated after they took it away.

Overall I would definitely fly this airline again.

Received and update on the long leg from Incheon/SeaTac. Second time in 2 years the gold card status means priority check-in which means a lot in long lines overseas. In flight service is awesome with alert attendants.

First time flew with Asiana Airlines, Skytrax gave 5 Star to this airline, but isn’t 5 Star, economy seats are really good, but food is really not good and restrooms are pretty dirty, A380 plane is good, overall experience is 3 Star not a 5 Star.

Asiana flies an Airbus 380 on this route. I had booked a business trip, but at boarding gate was upgraded to 1st class; which on the 380 is a private suite with doors. The word excellent does not begin to describe the experience; my only problem was the flight was only 2 hours. Food, service, comfort - all superlative.

We flew this airline for the first time and the only negative was on the initial leg leaving Tokyo we had to be at the Airport at 4:00 am.  to catch a flight to Seoul.  Other than that we found both legs of the flight excellent  The Asiana lounge in Tokyo was very accommodating with excellent food and comfortable seating.  The flight to Seoul is what you would expect in Business class.  The flight from Seoul to L.A. was exceptional and beyond our expectations.  The food was excellent and the seats/beds were the most comfortable  we have experienced.   The staff from check in through the lounges and especially flight crew was a welcome change from most air travel.
The lounge was crowded and difficult to get proper service/access to showers, etc.  The flight was better, but nothing particularly special.
We travel constantly and often fly Asiana because the prices are good and the service is great.  We even like the food.  Comfortable and quiet aircraft.

First time flying with Asiana.  The service was excellent...very efficient and friendly.  Now, I'm not usually a fan of airplane food, and maybe I was particularly hungry on this day, but the food was great.  Will choose to fly with Asiana again in the future.

Flew return trip from London Heathrow to Sydney via Seoul in Business Class.

Lounges - can use Star Alliance lounges. United was the best one at Heathrow. The Asiana lounge in Seoul was very busy, and not particularly good, although the showers were fine. Food choice there was poor. Best lounge at Sydney was the Air NZ lounge. The Singapore Airlines lounge was busy and cramped. 

Aircraft - none of our 4 flights was on the aircraft type stated at the time of booking. Only an A350 on LHR to Seoul (not the A380 that Trailfinders told us it would be), so it was small and cramped (nowhere to stretch/ exercise for instance). 777-200 between Seoul and Sydney was tired and past it's best. 

Onboard - it was a sea of beige, with the worst entertainment system I've seen in the last 20 to 30 years. The screen on the 777 was old and low resolution. Very little choice of movies etc. Legroom and seat comfort were fine. Air quality was as bad as it is on other aircraft and air lines. Particularly frustrating that the window blinds were all pulled down as soon as we had taken off, and kept down for the entire flight, despite it being in daylight and in normal daytime hours of destination time. 

Staff - were generally good, but the standard of English amongst both flight and Seoul based ground staff was poor. We simply gave up trying to ask for things, it was too difficult. 

Meals - were mixed. Main meals were good, but snacks were poor (not even a chocolate bar available). Staff came round once per flight to offer drinks/ water etc. (flight times of between 10 and 12 hours per flight). Didn't appear to be any snacks available between meals. This is not what I expect in any airline class, but particularly not in Business Class. They served a snack (roll, crips or noodles) half way between meal times. Limited wine choice, but the wines were ok, just not particularly good. 

Compulsory night's layover in Seoul - when we booked it we were told it would be a 4 or 5 star hotel in Seoul. They don't tell you which hotel you'll be in until you reach the Asiana arrivals desk after immigration. It took nearly 2 hours to get to the hotel from landing. We were offered a Howard Johnson hotel ""nearby"", which was in fact a mixed Howard Johnson/ Days Inn near the airport. Initially, we were put in a Days Inn room (which is definitely NOT a 4 or 5 star room - I've attached a photo of it for reference). Complained, moved us to a Howard Johnson room (we were told that reception staff are instructed to put Asiana passengers in the Days Inn rooms). There was a pool & gym, but there was a charge for using them. Basically we did not get the 4 or 5 star hotel in Seoul we were told we would get, at the time of booking. So if you are thinking of flying Sydney to London in Business Class, be aware of this.

Incidentally, the hotel was an hour from Seoul. The next morning we tried to get to Seoul by train (no shuttle or other transport available) but found that we couldn't buy a rail ticket to Seoul with a credit card (cash only!), & there was nowhere to change cash, so we were stuck. 

All in all, disappointing product, and the hotel arrangements for the compulsory layover in Seoul were unacceptable. Would NOT fly Asiana again.
Staff very accommodating, wonderful meals and entertainment. Seats on the A380 could us more padding.

This was the first time I have flown this airline. I flew Cathay Pacific on the way over. The service was outstanding. The staff were always checking to see if you needed anything. The food was very good for airline food. The seat was very comfortable and I was able to sleep about 6 hours on this 13 hour flight.

My ticket was economy flying into multiple cities over several days, Seattle- Hanoi, Ho-Chi Minh to Korea to Seattle, counter attendant told me my ticket is ""very low class"", not exactly the correct term to use to describe economy. Seats seem to be tighter, food was average. You definitely get what you pay for with this airline. Will not be using again, I would pay a little more with another airline to get better service.

Was pleasantly surprised by our experience on Asiana, which was a first.
You really do not have the impression, except may be for the seat fabric, that you are actually flying a budget airline.
Punctual new plane, with friendly service and excellent value for money.
Can't ask for more really !

Check-in boarding were all no hassle. Seat was bigger and cabin roomier than those of airlines owned by American companies. Arrival for connecting flight was 20 minutes later than schedule, but was able to board the connecting flight just in time. A female passenger who sat to my left, put up her feet on the back of her front passenger's seat, with her leg butterflied out.  The other passenger to her left covered up his face (I think to avoid the sight of bare feet and butterflied legs. I endured this on an about 11 hour flight for a long while, and finally I walked up to tell an Asiana customer service staff.  I didn't want to sit next to her until the unsanitary, inconsiderate and indecent postures were corrected. The staff finally went to talk to the female passenger and told me this was done. I would recommend customer service staff to walk the aisle and correct unacceptable postures of passengers.

It was a Asiana 380-800 I believed, I went with my daughter my mother is from Japan but I've never been, Asiana must of change its original plane for thi's trip bease thE seating I picked a year ago wasn't the seating I picked when the time had come, I called them and they were very polite and gave us seating on the top deck and we both had aisle seating which is want we wanted, they serve 3 meals and snacks during the flight to South Korea which we had a layover of 3 hours then off to Narita with another meal.All the flight attendents were professional and helpful through the 12 plus hour flight, they had lots of movies to watch, and slippers for our feet, So I would use them again. Thank you Asian, Frank

Can't beat Asiana for the price and service even in economy.  Flight crew did everything to make the 13 hr flight as comfortable as possible. Love the little touches such as on flight slippers which I used immediately after take off. Good food and on board entertainment selection. Two things I didn't like: 1) Seats are not comfortable for the long flight, seat padding is very thin and for people like me who have back and leg pain, it's a killer; 2) Long layover time, but I guess that can't be helped in this day and age when airlines wait to fill up as much seats as possible.

I would highly recommend this airline if you are going to Vietnam or anywhere in Southeast Asia. We had a comfortable flight on Asiana both ways, and the price was great. Unfortunately, there was a 12 hour layover on the way back in Seoul. However, we were able to catch a free city tour from the airport that was excellent.  I highly recommend looking into this as soon as you arrive, because they fill up fast and you cannit sign up in advance. It's first come first serve.
This is what I expected! Excellent service wonderful food and wine! Facilities that worked. Good job!!

In other airlines flying Economy equals poor quality food. Not with Asiana.  Foods are delicious even in Economy.  I flew a 14+ hour flight and not going hungry is definitely a plus.  Also, the ticket prices are very reasonably cheap.  Will definitely fly Asiana again.
The TV service from SeaTac to Korea is poor.  The TV service from Korea to HKG is super.  Food is good and service is good

Overall all the planes were really old. My first flight from JFK to Narita (with layover in Incheon) was pretty big with USB, electrical outlets, and large screens. I was pretty surprised and assumed since it was a 13 hour flight they used the nicer planes. The planes from Incheon to Narita and Narita to Incheon were really old but it was only a 2 and half hour flight so I did not mind. However the plane ride back from Incheon to JFK i expected about the same quality plane as my first flight but that was not the case. Small cramped seats, no outlets or USBs and screen with blurry pixels. I would probably take Korean Air next time.

Check in for the flight was easy.  The staff was very accommodating.  The LAX terminal is still subpar compared to many other terminals I have been in.  We boarded fairly quickly for such a large aircraft; Airbus 380.  The onboard entertainment was via seatback interactive TV screen.  The climate was perfect the entire flight.  The inflight food was surprisingly very tasty.  The bathroom facilities were more than adequate.  The seat areas also had power receptacles and USB ports for charging accessories.

The in flight staff was very accommodating and patient, even for the ""special needy people"" who pay for economy and think they are in first class.  I will gladly fly this airline again.

I do not like their way of doing business. Basic price is OK. But if you do the web-check in there is not a single seat available without extra charges. They are expecting that you do their job, by checking in. With that they are saving money and manpower. Same time you must pay additional money. I do not accept this business model and will not use them again in future.
Travel from Singapore to Bangkok using Asiana as there was a promotion on the air tickets. It's within expectation of a full fledged airline and everything was pretty pleasant.

The flights both down to Vietnam from Korea and back up to Korea were in an old 747.  On the flight into DaNang airport, we experienced the roughest landing I have ever endured.  There were mild turbulence on the descent, but not enough sheer or other weather to justify blaming the bouncing on conditions.
There was also no wifi/internet on the flight.
Other than that landing, the flight was okay and on time.

I chose the airline because of the great fare that they offered. I'm used to flying with the airlines but never with this airline. The lines at SFO wasn't long unlike other carriers and they weren't so strict with baggage weight as long as it just goes over a little over a pound which was nice.
Surprisingly, aircraft has a lot of legroom even for economy.
The toilet was well stocked with disposable toothbrush, toothpaste, etc.
The food was mostly korean but you get a choice of another dish if you don't like it. I just ate the dessert and the sides. I don't really eat much during a flight and I bring my own snacks .
The staff were polite and offered water and drinks all through out the flight which was nice to keep the passengers hydrated.
We had a stop over in Incheon. They offer day trips but didn't avail of it because our lay over was only for a couple of hours. If you are interested on a free city tour, make sure that you get a longer lay-over in Korea which I will do next time.

Flew ANA's brand new Boeing 787 Dreamliner red eye flight as a continuation of my journey from Toronto to Seoul.     Boarding was on time and FAs are super friendly and professional as usual.     Cabin looked over 90% full comprised mostly with Koreans and Japanese.     Leg room was very spacious as it felt even more spacious than Air Canada Dreamliner I flew across the Pacific a few hours earlier.    As I still had some fever and chill from the cold I caught on my previous flight, I flagged one of the FA for Tylenol.    She was able to understand my English without too much trouble and promptly brought me two pills and a glass of water.     She said those pills were very similar to Tylenol but it is made by Japanese company.      I took the medication and it helped me with fever and chill for the rest of the flight.    She also came back to check on me three more times during the flight to see if I was doing ok and needed anything else.  Such a nice gesture from the FA and very much appreciated by me.     The flight was fairly smooth for the most part and we arrived in Seoul ahead of arrival time.     Had a really pleasant flight except for not feeling well from my cold and fever.      Flight like this always remind me why service on most Asian carriers are so much better than the rest of the world.      ANA is undoubtedly my all time favorite airlines and I will always try to fly them over other carriers.
First time with this airline and what a lovely surprise.  Excellent lounges at both ends, delicious food and caring service.  Spacious and comfortable.  I would definitely travel with them again.

Overall, the flight was OK.  Good meal, great flight attendants and OK ground crew.  Our flight was delayed an hour both to and from LAX and I'm not sure why since its not weather related and was not explained clearly.  Boarding the plane was little chaotic because even though they announce to board by rows, passengers were still boarding irregardless of where they sat. Their ground crew should enforce the rules of boarding starting from the back rows going forward for economy passengers by carefully checking their seat #.  It should not be determine where you stand in line but rather by seat row also...  .

Seat a little old and lacked comfort. Poor storage.
Entertainment limited - few movies, limited music.
Staff polite but not efficient, missed serving drinks, slow serving meals. And made so much noise in the galley during the overnight flight, could not sleep.
The temperature was set too high - perspired all flight. Staff finally adjusted the temperature just before landing.

Recently flew the A380 from LAX to ICN and back. My husband and I sat in economy on the upper deck in a row of 2 seats. The great thing about sitting in this location is that there's a large storage bin next to the window seat. There was in-seat power through a USB port, a very large in-flight entertainment screen with lots of entertainment options, and ample legroom. I was shocked by how many delicious meals we were served. Asiana offers a Western and Korean option for each meal. Between meals, the flight attendants constantly circulated water and orange juice. The flight attendants were very professional and strict on all safety measures. During flight, they required passengers to close the windows to create an environment conducive to sleep. Overall, a wonderful trans-Pacific flight in economy. I'd be happy to fly Asiana again.

This airline is always one of the cheapest options when I look for flights. I have done two flights now from Seattle to Manila (layover in S. Korea). The last flight I had less than an hour layover without problems because the plane was able to land on time. The seats are normal size and comfortable for me (6ft 2, 300 lbs). 
On the 12 hour flight everyone in Economy is offered 2 meals. They also come with drinks (orange juice, and water) every few hours. On the 4 hour flight everyone is offered 1 meal and drinks are offered periodically as well. They have two types of meals to choose from which usually consisted of one Korean themed meal and one Western style. They also have vegetarian options available. 
All of my flights with the airline have been in planes that offer touch screen media players with a variety of films available. The longer flights offer about a dozen current Hollywood films along with about half as many classic Hollywood films. There is also news, games, tv shows, and in flight information (showing location, remaining time, time at origin, time at destination). They have children’s shows/movies and the last flight offered a small coloring book to all of the kids on the flight. 
There is plenty of bathrooms on each plane to accommodate the amount of people. One of the flights offered free toothpaste and brushes in the bathroom. One annoyance is the last flight they did not have overhead signs to show the vacancy of the bathroom for people sitting near the front of the plane. It did not pose a problem because they allowed individuals to wait near the bathrooms for vacancy (something that I have not been able to do with other airlines). 
Both flights were booked via search engine website. Last flight price was compared to price on their website and it was cheaper to book from search engine website. 
Boarding seems to be faster than similar airlines I have been on because they have the people in the back of the plane board first. This is not completely eliminate the annoyance of people blocking the isles because they do not turn people away if they board out of order. There were still people who sat near the front of the plane that would board first and they were not turned away by the boarding staff.

The service was horrible. The economy class seating started from row 10 and i was seated at row 20. and the stewardess was serving from the front to the back, by the time when they were serving the food to my row, bibimbap was no longer available. So i have to take the other fish option which taste so bad. 

About 1 hour or so later, not wanting to trouble the stewardess, i walked to the back of the plane where the pantry was to request for water. Disgusted to say, THREE OF THE STEWARDESSES WERE EATING BIBIMBAP TOGETHER! So much about customer first. 

The choice of entertainment on board was limited too. what's worst was my seat's system was down. movies streamed kept hanging and have to restart in order to watch the movie.

horrible experience!

Asiana really offers good service on board and the fare was really low at US$624 for a round trip fare Manila/Los Angeles each for a passenger.  However, the staff at the Incheon airport have to learn English.  The service at LAX and Manila were okay, telling people to line up at particular rows to board the flight; however in Incheon, since there was difficulty in English, staff could not explain that boarding of first class, business class, special assistance passengers and passengers with children came first; then economy passengers should line up according to seat number.  This created confusion among the passengers. But otherwise the planes had wide leg room; food was good and staff on board were helpful.

Boeing 777-300 was immaculate and seats in Business were extremely comfortable. For exmple, United's 777s have 8 across vs only 5 across on Asiana. Inflight service was warm and very professional and meals were creative and well presented. Asiana is a truly world-class airline, somewhat dwarfed by the likes of Cathay and SQ, but they take second place to nobody, in my opinion. The only minor negative is the Asiana Business Class loung at Incheon, which has some of the worst food selections anywhere. Not a nice place to have to sit for 6 hours bteween connecting flights!

Reading all of these great reviews, I would think I was on another airline. We had to take a last minute emergency flight to Los Angeles and I called customer service - 3 times. First time, on hold over 30 minutes and hung up. Second time, on hold just over 30 minutes before they picked up. Third time, on hold 17 minutes. Was told by telephone reservationist that the flight was ""wide open"" and I would have no problem making the flight. Got to Incheon Airport two hours in advance and was told to come back in 45 minutes after being assured I would make the flight. Arrived back to discover that there were no seats except in Business and they were not going to put me in Business or upgrade anyone from Economy. Because of all of these assurances and delays I missed opportunity to change to Korean Air flight. Not the kind of customer service I'm reading about from other people.

This was the first time we flew to the us via asiana. The service was ok. What impressed me were the seats. Each had an adjustable foot rest. It made the long haul  flight comfortable and it compensated for the limited entertainment choices.

Staff at check in counter was very helpful..she made sure that I had the important information / documents to fly back to Cebu...They also facilitated the check in of  the Kimchi (bought sealed and packaged), that I had in our hand carry. I did not know that it needed to be checked in.
Over all, the flight service was good.

This was part of a RTW fare and I had never flown with them before.  What a pleasant surprise.  The service was excellent and the food was varied and extremely tasty.  Matched with a smooth flight (on tome as well) just made for an overall pleasing introduction to the airline.  I will definitely be looking to include them on my (short) list of airline to use in future.

This is the 4th time that I have flown Asiana to the Philippines. The airline has been just great. The seats offer plenty of room, the food is good, alcoholic drinks are free and they come around with water, soda and orange juice on a regular basis. The flight crews are very pleasant and ready to assist. The movie selections are fantastic which is important on a long flight.

The aircraft for both inbound and outbound flights were old and the entertainment program had an issue that I could not hear the sound throughout the return flight.
The entertainment program was rebooted for a few times but nothing was fixed in the end, and no complimentary service was offered either which I expected from a legacy carrier. (When the similar situation happened with SQ flight before, I was given a voucher even when I was taking Economy class.)
The in-flight meal was also not fantastic.
I do not know if I am taking Asiana next time.
A380! It was huge! Three entrances to get on the plane! Lots of leg room. We even got a meal on a short flight. Will definitely try and fly Asiana again if we are on this side of the world soon

The one thing that stands out are the seats are uncomfortable, My back was killing me. Some of my 4 flights taken on this trip had no entertainment counsel and when it did had some issues. All 4 flights were delayed. The flight attendants are personable helpful

Took an Asiana flight to Seoul recently. Choose them largely because the cost was significantly less than my normal airline of choice. Very impressed with overall service and comfort. They have a small number of 'comfort' seats at the front of their economy section. Cost is about $100 each way. Even with this cost it was still less than any other airline. Seat had extra leg room and a combined tilt/slide for the recline. Definitely an airline to consider for flights to Asia.

For a flight just one hower long the legroom was grate and the crew was very nice. Enertainment was good, for a such a short flight they gave us a funny movies to watch so the the flight felt wery much at home.

As a Lifetime Diamond Plus member, I could have flown Asiana more often, but since its parent company has been going through financial difficulties, the airline has suffered a lot. Old planes (Look at those ancient B767s they fly), downgraded inflight services, old lounges, and a disastrous webpage. I still love this airline but since I have relocated to Hong Kong, I decided it was about time to ditch this airline. Bye bye.

Before I write this: I got where I was going, the airline covered a hotel when my layover went from being 2 hours to 25 hours, and they had everything ready to go when I arrived for my long layover. It was well organized...BUT...

My flight was delayed several hours out of Honolulu. I was made aware of this when I checked in and knew I was going to miss my connecting flight in Seoul. I asked immediately if they could help me rebook prior to boarding the plane, I was informed that Seoul was not aware of the delay yet, and that they couldn't help me. I was told to call the hotline to see if they could help me, otherwise to check once I landed in Seoul for my layover. I searched to see what other flights would work for me so I had a list of connecting flights to give them. I called the hotline, and after being on hold for almost 40 minutes, was told that they couldn't do anything at all, that it had to be done at the counter in the airport. Fast forward to landing in Seoul- they had a ticket and map of the airport ready for me at the landing gate for my next flight. 2 problems, the ticket was for a flight at 2pm the next day. From my research, I knew that there were 3 other Asiana or alliance partner flights that night, and 4 before 10am the next morning, so 2pm seemed an incredible delay. Second problem was that because I was flying to China, the Map of the airport on where to go to get my hotel voucher was in Chinese. I don't speak Chinese. 

I asked at 2 different customer service desks about trying to get on an earlier flight, and phone calls were made, but I was told all the flights were full. Disappointing to stretch an already long trip over several days because of a delay on their end. 

However, the hotel was fine and included meals, the airport transfer to and from the hotel was fine, and the flight the next day was fine. I was disappointed in how long and how much extra time the delay cost me, but it was organized well.

Asiana Air used A380 plane on this leg of our trip and it was very room, classy, and very comfortable ride in our journey.  Food choices and quality were excellent and so was the service.  Boarding process was smooth with upper deck passengers entering on a separate level and amenities on the flight were excellent.  Flight left in time and arrived in designated time and the crew was very attentive.

First time with Asiana and I was rather impressed.  The staff are all extremely polite and friendly.  The business cabin is okay.  The seat moves down to provide a reasonably comfort sleep.  The area around the seat was a little dirty and there is no where to store one's bag during take off, except up top (A330) However they did an amazing job keeping the washrooms clean.
There are some good options for food but they seemed confused when we wanted the appetizer from the western meal and the main from the Korean.  They were pleasant but confused.  
If you are a first time traveller the boarding process and where to line up is not overly intuitive with the supporting signage.
Luggage was slow coming off the plane in Bangkok.

loved the 77L J class as it's a 1-2-1 config.
Crew members were very efficient and friendly.
Meal served promptly despite heavy turbulence during the first hour of the flight.
The only downside would be the limited selection to the entertainment, plus there's no massage function.

At desk check in ground staff gave me a coupon to the HX lounge, but then OZ is under Star Alliance therefore I went to the star alliance one instead without any problem. Apparently star alliance lounge (near gate 14) will reject your entry if they were full so...
J class was not full and the entire row 5 was emptied, and I thought I would have no problem sleeping but then the crew members kept banging the storage doors inside the gallery, and it could be heard within the entire J class, couldn't sleep properly.
To my surprise, I found the angle flat bed pretty comfortable.
Loved the service. The crew asked me at least twice if I really wanted no meal service, even 30 minutes prior to landing the purser came again to check on me, very attentive.
The only downside would be the entertainment system, there's not much choices....

One of the best value business class product out of Australia.  The airline will provide an overnight hotel stay with meals in Korea when flying to Europe and USA which means you'll board your second leg of the journey fresh and not jetlagged.  This complementary service is also available for economy passengers.  The return journey has a short layover so no need for a hotel.

The seats are fully flat on the new smartium configuration of 1-2-1 which means all seats have aisle access.  Service and quality of food is always top notch and the flight is always smooth being on the larger A380.

The only downside is the lounge out of ICN can get extremely busy.  From SYD though you get to use the Air NZ lounge which is a great new and modern lounge.

Overall no problem with this airline. Food is yummy. Unli drinks :) On flight movies are the new ones. The only downside i experienced is that they are not flexible when it comes to the checkin baggage. For economy passengers, one pax gets only one checkin. Even when you are travelling in a group, adding up your baggage altogether is not allowed. So if your bag exceeds the 23kg limit, they will patiently wait for you to repack your stuff until you get the right kilo.

First time, we flew on this airline and business class experience was very good.  The flight took off in rain/snow showers in timely manner and arrived in time at destination.  Boarding process involved separate doors for business and coach passengers and it was smooth and fast.  Airport staff was courteous and so was the flight crew.  Food was very good with good choices of Western and Asian items along with 20 yr aged excellent port wine for desert.  Entertainment was average with some good but old movies on this Boeing 777 flight but the monitor was low definition type.
Every time I travel with Asiana Airline, I don't have to worry about anything. Staff is super nice. Literally, everything is so nice!

flying first time with Asiana Airlines, great experience, confident pilots, hard working friendly crew, comfortable bed, entertainment, tasty food, smooth take off and landing. i would fly Asiana Airlines again and again. D

our family with 6 people will fly from seoul to tokyo when check in we will enter our suitcase as much as 6 and a trolley how shocked we turn out we only allowed the input of luggage as much as 6 pieces in accordance with the remaining personnel must pay 30,000 won and each suitcase should not be more than 24 kg. For that we want to share the caution that will buy airline tickets asiana if not forced may be considered up another airlines

Had this airline recommended by booking agent, I’d never heard of them but decided to give them a go as there was a massive difference in price. I done plenty of research, read hundreds of reviews and couldn’t really find a reason not to try them. My main criteria was lie flat beds for the long flight to OZ. To be honest I wasn’t really sure what else to expect but was very pleasantly surprised by the complete standard of service they offered. The only business class experience  I’ve had is with Ethiad Airways who were superb, but the price this year was extremely high, hence looking for an alternative. 
If was going to be picky I would say that Asianas crew had limited English which on occasion caused a few minor difficulties, but nothing that couldn’t be sorted.Conversation outside of their service was very limited.
The business lounge in Seoul was disappointing considering this is there home city.And it certainly doesn’t compare to other lounges I’ve used. However to gripe about this is unfair as it had everything you needed and was satisfactory,but plenty of room for improvement.
On our return trip we had a planned 19 hour layover before connecting flight, I decided to view this as a bonus as we didn’t need to rush back being retired. So I was looking forward to getting off the plane and having a proper nights sleep and shower etc in the hotel provided inclusive of the price by Asiana.Also inclusive was an evening meal and breakfast and transport to and from airport. This was all provided and was satisfactory, but I do feel there is room for improvement and I feel this area let’s down the otherwise exceptional standard of the business class product they offer. Nothing major wrong to note, but just lacked the polish!
Staff were all lovely, food and drink great, standards of plane and cabin comfort very good, special assistance given for my elderly mother excellent.
Will definitely use again, my comments above aren’t criticism just observations where improvement could be made. They are constructive comments aimed at assisting other people who have never heard of this airline to make there minds up and to inform them of a few minor weaknesses. I for one thoroughly enjoyed using them and will look no further when it comes to booking my annual flight to Australia

Flew from Seattle to Ho Chi Minh City with a layover in South Korea.  I flew coach in Feb 20th 2017.   It was a delayed flight, but we made up time in the air.  Arrived in Incheon airport in South Korea after about 12hours.  The seats were comfortable for me, I'm 5'6"" so it was fine. My friend, who's 6,6"" was not as comfortable, but overall he said it was more comfortable than what he is used to on American carriers economy class.  Service was friendly.  Food was decent.  Wish there was more selections for food.  Each seat has its own personal tv screen with remote on the seat  Lot's of selections for movies,games, and tv shows.  Several current movies that was just in theaters.  
Pros:  Service, comfort, movie selections.
Cons:  Delayed flight, not too comfortable for my 6'6"" friend.   Selection of food on menu.

Service was very good.
Plane was very clean and food was also decent.  Even though I flew economy, sit was roomy.
I had lay over at Incheon airport in Korea, airport was also nice and clean.
We have medium rare steak with veggies and potatoes wine was included. The pilot did not bother us during our he flight with useless announcements. Flight attend ends very courteous

I really like their service from their check-in officer, their flight attendants, also their pilot which made smooth take off and landing. Their check-in officer recognize me and help me a lot when I had some problem with custom officer. The food was nice and it was a totally pleasant flight to Korea :)
this the first time i fly with them and only reason was cheap.the service and staff was very helpful to.

I flew Asiana for the first time this past January. I was really happy with my experience. The flight attendants were great and their bathrooms were always cleaned. They even stocked the bathrooms with toothbrushes and comb. This was a nice surprise. I expected a good experience because I have flown Korean airlines before and I always had a good experience flying Korean planes. My mom also injured her ankle during the trip so they were able to arrange a wheelchair service right away. Also, I had a lay over in Korea for about 13 hrs. The Seoul airport is just amazing! Great airport to have a long layover at. But I found out from another passenger that if you were to have a layover longer than 12 hrs, you could actually call the asiana airliens 72 HRs before hand and they will arrange a hotel and free tour of the city! If I knew this ahead of time, I would have taken advantage of the treat. But now I know so I’m actually looking forward to a long layover just for that experience! The only reason why I scored this an 8 is because the plane was older. Other than that I had no issues.

My flight experience was good, the flight offers korean food and food products also but if your the kind of international food they could offer a western type also. The duty free shopping is also more on cosmetics and beauty products as the korea known for it. They domestic flight also offer snacks and refreshments but the duty free products are not meant for tourist but for locals only😊that is for their domestic flight like travelling to Gimpo and Jeju Island

I am a premium Asiana member and until now have always been happy with their service.  However on my recent flights to Bangkok and Singapore I was very disappointed.  My return flight from Bangok to Seoul was delayed for 3 hours, and the flight from Seoul to Singapore a  was also delayed
The in-flight entertainment system had to be re-set twice during the flight and I noticed that several monitors were not working on the Singapore flight.
I was also very unhappy about the check-in counter staff service in Singapore.

My first 14hr nonstop flight and this was a great experience.  Never had a bad landing.  Very little to no turbulence.  Flight was smooth.  Food was excellent on the way over, on the way back not good choices.  Seats were comfortable enough.  Lots of bathrooms.  We had an empty seat in between us, and on the way back we each had an entire row to ourselves.

The flight to Seoul in an Airbus A380 was very comfortable. The food was excellent and the personal very friendly. Had enough space for legs and also sleeping. 
I booked a rail&fly ticket and a special meal without problems before flight. 

Entertainment is a bit low - could be better. 

Also the 23 kg free baggage could be higher, specially in winter.

I have seen several reviews comparing Asiana to Cathay, and decided to try them both. I guess I ma glad I did bc now I know they are *not* comparable, but I did waste a nice business class flight on Asiana. In short:
1. Cathay has amazing lounges in Asia. The food spread, alcohol, restaurants, and comfort are top notch. Asiana? stale croissants and fried rice is all you get.
2. Cathay greets you on board with champagne, fresh water, freshly squeezed juice or signature drink. Asiana? greets you with nothing.
3. Cathay lets you seat where you want as long as seat is taken, take as many pillows/ blankets as you want. Asiana: better not try any of that. 
4. Cathay has cheese, fresh fruit, Nuhu pralines and fresh bread fro snacks. Asiana has ramen soup from a box.
5. Both airlines have fully reclining seats in business class. But Cathay's seats are far wider and newer, resulting in fewer people on board but more comfort per passenger. The entertainment selection is also larger and more up-to-date on Cathay- movies from 2017-2018 in 2018 vs 2013-2015 on Asiana. The TV screen is adjustable on Cathay but not on Asiana.

Bottom line: if you want a top notch flight and service, choose Cathay
To avoid traffic in Manila, we fly Asiana when going abroad as much as we can. Service is impeccable, flight personnel are courteous, making travel hassle-free. Keep it up Asiana!
Really good airline. Flight attendants were super friendly and ready to assist passenger all the time.
I have been on this flight several times, and it has NEVER left on time.  I wish there was another choice.  they should just advertise this as a 3am flight and be done with it!!

Flew round trip Haneda - Incheon / Gimpo - Haneda flights.  

Overall, good experience.  Service was great, planes were clean, food was better than average. 

Only thing to watch out for is that at Haneda, there are no kiosks so expect a long wait to check in / drop off baggage. 

I ended up checking in online while i was in line and carrying on my baggage since it was taking so long.

Travel to Seoul from Kansai in Asiana airline 
Flight was international but no alcohol was served little weird 
Economy class seats were little old and tv was very small but okay for 2 -3 hours flight

The staff were very friendly and check in was easy. The plane was a bit older and seating a little more cramped than usual. Was a nice flight, meals were good, and the plane was clean. The movie selection was a little old and not so much to choose from for a 9 hour flight. I would fly with Asiana again.

Generally, Korean (not ""Korean air"") airlines provide good quality of service. However, I hate ""Korean Air"" because of ""Nut rage incident"". The boss is still doing her job, and the crew, who did right thing, was demoted. So, between Korean air and Asiana, I'd rather choose Asiana.

a380 asiana business smartium what ever is...not too clean and my stewardess is look angery.....my partner which seat next to me stewardess she was very experience..from seoul i fly to singapore round trip....bad experience also dirty plane....asiana air always delay.....i had this experience since when they 1st fly to lax........

As family we were moving from Almaty to Shanghai. There were several airline options. Air Asiana had the best prices. I did not fly Air Asiana in the last 15 years. But as it became a Star Alliance member I trusted and bought this airline. Flights were on time. It was very comfortable. Service was very good and the flight attendants were very friendly. What else do you need from an airline? A good value for money...
I like to fly with Asiana Airlines when I get the chance. Their flights are usually affordable and have great food and entertainment choices.

I flew from Incheon International airport (ICN) to San Francisco, CA (SFO) in Business Class and had an excellent experience. Service is top notch and they make you feel like you're sitting in a five-star hotel. Seats are comfortable and you can lie down flat on the seats. Food is excellent too. You can also get access to Asiana lounge before the flight and can enjoy light meal and drinks. Overall, excellent experience.

First time flying with this airline and with a group of 16 from Los Angeles to Manila, Philippines with stopover in Incheon, South Korea. Seats were comfortable, service was very good, and meals served were very good too! Airline had good entertainment options which helped in the 10-11 hour flight to Incheon, South Korea and even just a 4 hour flight to Manila, Philippines. Though there were delays the airport terminal and its facilities were very good and we were very comfortable. Return flight was the same great experience. I highly recommend Asiana Airlines!

A real pleasure to use Asiana Air.  The employees assigned to meet me at the gate were outstanding. They helped with my carry on bag, wheel chair, and got me through all the security and to my check-in location for Asiana Air. When it was time to travel to my designated gate.  It was promptly done.  I was assisted to my seat and travel bag stowed.  Upon arrived at CTU International, once again, everything done from leaving the plane, going through immigration, and taking me to a reliable taxi was quick and professionally done. Bottom line, need travel assistance, fly Asiana Air.  They are second to none!

This airline is a favorite on my 3rd trip with Asiana.  I flew to Sydney, Australia via Seoul and had 6 hours of sleep on each flight, arriving in Sydney well rested.  The cabin flight attendants couldn’t be any more accommodating.  I asked that my lamb chops be done medium rare and they were.  The choices for dinner were numerous as was the wine selection.  The comfortable pods in business class were ideal for a good nights sleep, though in first class you get your own room.
Even though it was a long journey, the flight went by quickly and I was quite surprised that we were landing already.  I just had enough time to shave and brush my teeth.  In a previous flight in first class, I found the shower quite refreshing, I wish there was one in business class.  I highly recommend this airline in either first or business class.

Decided to try Asiana, having flown BA (3 times, average) and Finnair (once, good). Very impressed (hard though it is to be impressed flying economy). New A350 better than any similar sized plane I've flown before (and no shortage of overhead locker space). But the best thing is the service - helpful, attentive and never obtrusive. And the cabin crew don't barge into you as they go up and down the aisles if your arms or legs are straying just a few inches into the aisle (and if they did, they would apologise). Unlike BA & co where the customer is ""in the way"". Would definitely fly Asiana again. They don't pretend to care, it feels like they actually do care. Legroom ""good enough"" for 6 footer.

I hate the business cheap saving seats that cramp your feet so they get a few more seats in business.. No 1st class on this run. Service was marginal. Korean lunch was great. Then rationed wine even though we could not sleep in seats. finally another meal 12 hr later before landing same good Korean beef dish. Lack of English on stewardess crew.Next flight to CAN was very good except for snow delay cabin staff great!

When I first booked the flight with Asiana Airlines, I thought it would be some cheap and low fare airline (why I don’t know). That was just not the case. Service was top notch and the comfort was amazing - even in economy class. And this is from a 183 cm tall girl. Even on short routes, like from Seoul to Hanoi, I had plenty of legroom and service was still on top

From check in to completion of trip a good experience. Good flights, sufficient space, attentive service, almost on time. A delay arriving in Seoul and a delay on return, but both less than one hour. Good attention to safety issues and happy efficient flight crew. Check in staff noted my height (nearly 2 metres) and offered exit row seating - this seldom happens with other airlines and was appreciated. I would highly recommend Asiana based on this experience.

I am a 77 year old seasoned traveler with minor pulmonary problems. My wife and I were returning home after a trip to Bali and cruise to Australia. We were flying from Sydney
( FL.602) to Seoul and then onto LAX (204) on 2/9/2018. The flight left Sydney almost 1.5 hours late, no reason given. We knew we would have trouble with the transfer to our LAX flight as we had gone from a 2 hour cushion to less than 20 minutes. Despite my asking for assistance, from Sydney ground crew, inflight attendants on Flight 602 to make sure we could get from our arrival gate in Seoul to the departure gate in Seoul and being assured that we would have this service,it never materialized. In addition once we landed, the ground crew had difficulty getting the gateway ramp to the plane delaying us even further.
