We were met by a man carrying a sign with our names at the arrival gate in Inchon, who told us to proceed toward the Transfer signs, but did not tell us the new gate number, did not speak English very well or understandably, did not offer to escort us and did not provide anything in the way of assistance to enable us to make our way. We had to go through a security check point and walk/run, carrying hand luggage weighing at least 50 pounds from gate 10 to gate 46 thru a maze of hallways without signage in English or any Asiana or airport employee assistance. My wife wit less hand luggage was able to run faster and made the gate just as they were closing the doors and asked them to wait for me. Fortunately they did and we both made the flight, but of course our luggage did not and we are still waiting for it.
I certainly understand and can accept flight and weather delays etc, but the total lack of ability to handle our transfer in an expeditious manner was very poor customer service. 
Fortunately, I was in good enough physical shape to make the 3/4 of a mile trip between gates, actually measured on my fitbit, without too much trouble other than needing to take some puffs of my albuterol along the way.

The Business lounge in London was shared, but ok. The flight service was a bit strange, I don't think the flight attendants have enough training on serving drinks..the mix of cocktails etc. but they are very keen to please. Food excellent. Seat, amenities all as you'd expect from a Bus. class cabin. The Lounge at Seoul (their flagship) was dark wooded, with faux books and not very much choice of food - disappointing. Drinks choice more appropriate. Asiana share the Air New Zealand lounge at Sydney so the standards were very good.

Loved the Business Class seats I had, make the 18 Hr. trip comfortable, don't think I would have done it any other way. The aircraft was pretty cool, sat in the upper desk area of the plane...would definitely fly again. I totally recommend this airlines.

Great airline.  All attendant very nice and polite and behaved as if they were happy to see us on their plan.  Very unlike US airlines who act like you are lucky to be there.

Service great, food average service excellent 

Prices great. 

Flight was geo nyc the app would not allow this to be entered

My family took 4 flights with Asiana Airlines between Japan to Cambodia (via Korea).  We requested two vegetarian meals and two childrens meals.

On ALL FOUR flights we received the same tasteless eggplant, very dry tomatoes and rice.  The quality of the `so-called-meal` would not even pass for dog food.

On ALL FOUR flights our two young children received chocolate and cookies (in other words SUGAR).

On the Seoul - Fukuoka flight we did not receive a drink with our meal (not even a water).

The in-flight entertainment selection was very limited and the earphone quality was terrible

Very bad cabin service and I will avoid this airline in the future.

OK first of all, this is a 13 hour flight lets get that out of the way.  The fight was full. Next, this airlines understand that their customers come first.  Stewardess where great friendly respectful they all speak English and they are funny too.  The comfort was very good despite the issues at hand, movies run the entire flight and water very hour.  Food really good and hot this company does not approve cold food.  I was hydrated the whole time and slept very well.  I even got to speak with the captain over a few drinks it something I do on each flight.  Its a thing makes me feel more at ease when I can put a face with the driver,  LOL

In general, the service and flight was very good. The stewardesses are very polite and beautiful. The baggage had no damage. I could watch some good recent movies. The only disadvantage that during a flight from Incheon to Narita we have served with hotdog from pork. When we asked for any other option, we have told that we could choose meal 24 hours before of flight. But being in rush we forgot to book a halal on our way back, so have served with pork food again. It is a bit inconvenient to book meal 24 hours before of flight. Not everyone has access for a proper internet 24 hours before of flight.

I got bumped to Business Class for my flight from ICN to BKK. This is actually my first time ever I got upgraded from economy to business. I have been with Singapore a couple of years and been with United for a long time and I even have their credit card and never got upgraded. So now I am sticking with Asiana FFP. Also, service is really good. I usually travel light with no checked luggage so I don't know about their handling of luggage. 

A couple of negative things: first, their website is horrible. I had hard time booking tickets through their website and mobile app. Second, their in-flight entertainment is not as good as Singapore.

I bought $505/person roundtrip tickets from Seattle Wa USA to Manila Philippines. I started getting nervous couples days before our flight. My friend who was also flying asiana told me that his flight was delayed and he had to spend the night at Korea. My layover in Korea was only 1hr20min. So that also made me even more nervous. 

Anyway my flight from USA to Korea went smoothly. When we got off the plane we had to go through security again even though we were only transferring. We sped walked all the way to the end of the gates, by the time we got to our gate it was time to board. I was relieved that the plane was on time but at the same time irritated that the layover was so short. We arrived 5mins early went through immigration smoothly but was so confused. Where’s my luggage?! You can feel the anger and panic of all the customers. After waiting in line for an hour they told us that our luggage is still in Korea! The luggage will be shipped to the address of our choosing in Philippines no extra charge. We went to our home in QC so sad and disappointed, all our gifts to our relatives were still in Korea. It’s our second night here in Philippines and I’m still waiting for news about our luggage. I am never flying asiana again. I don’t recommend it. Unfortunately I have to fly asiana again going back home to Seattle. Hopefully that will go more smoothly.

First time travelling with Asiana Airlines, but very impress.  I like the decoration color of the cabin, earth tone, simple, but feel like home.  The toilet was kept clean all through the flight.  I asked for extra pillows, some drinks, food choices and travelling tips.  Air hostess are willing to help with humble and friendly smiles.  What else would I ask for!  Go on board with the friendly crews that look after us well.

I have used this airline twice now to get to and from work.  First flight was okay, but they still need a lot of work.  The crew is quite aggressive almost power trippy in the air.   They forget who are the customers and who is paying for their wages!!!  I found them to be quite short, rushing, pushy actually.  There were a few that certainly need to spend more time on training and personality development.  It's never fun to fly for a few hours when you are dealing with someone who's having a bad day at work.  Abdul Khaeva was the only one on the flight who was professional, she was really good!!

The service is top notch. They wait on you hand and foot (they even put my slippers on me!) The meals are better than average and they are constantly coming around to ask if they want a beverage. Their service is always done with a genuine smile. The flight was smooth and landing was unblemished. The first one to check for flying overseas.

I flew from Hanoi to Incheon Airport before heading off to Sydney. This was probably hands down one of the best airlines I've had the pleasure of travelling with. 
Service: 
From check-in  to in-flight service, the staff and attendants were so courteous and respectful and would go above and beyond to make your flight comfortable. Incheon Airport has an amazing business class lounge with a self-serve alcohol bar, massage chairs, showers, buffet and storage lockers for your baggage. 
Food: 
The in-flight food service was impeccable! The attendants would come around and take your order just after take off and everything is served in nice chinaware and metal cutlery. They also have an amazing beverage list with various cocktails, wine and champagne and spirits. 
Chair: 
The flat bed chairs are ultra comfortable and spacious. There is ample leg room and space for your personal items.

What a pleasure to take a long flight (SFO to MNL) in such a comfortable atmosphere.  Not only did the flight leave on time the seats were comfy, with enough leg room to stretch.  The food was good.  They offer Korean cuisine and a continental cuisine.  However, I did get ill from eating the pasta with shrimp on my return flight.  Slippers, pillows, blankets, and ear buds for everyone.  I will always keep Asiana in mind for my future southeast Asia travel needs.  Oh, and the Incheon Airport is beautiful.

I flew close to 2 million miles with various airlines. Oz203 was my first experience on A380. I felt taxing took a little too long but found out that A380 took off so quietly. Dinner with a good selection of wine was so good. 
The best part of the flight was a comfortable flat bed. I had a good night sleep. 
I would like to recommend this flight to the one who is tired of a long flight to Far East.

Nino Aquino as an airport is irritating to deal with. The lounge was old and small. The food choices were not that great either, thankfully when you board the plane, things get better. Older aircraft and so is the cabin. Food and service was good, but the limited entertainment forced us to sleep despite it only being a 4 hours flight. 

Overall a good experience and would fly with them again.

My wife and I flew from LAX in Los Angeles to Sydney, Australia via this airlines and it was an amazing experience. The quality of service that we experienced was excellent and we thoroughly enjoyed flying with this superior airline. We chose to fly business class due to the length of flight that we selected which went through Seoul, South Korea. Although this flight was a little longer taking this route, we saved considerable Award Miles by making this choice in routing. We were fortunate enough to have lie flat sleeping accommodations and the quality of food onboard was excellent. Flying business class was definitely the way to go when making this long a journey.
We would thoroughly recommend this airline when going to this part of the world from the United States.

Pretty much nothing bad can be written about this journey. 
Outbound B777 to Seoul, A320 on the short haul flight to CRK. Food ok, cabin crews really polite and helpful. 

Inbound journey on A380 to Frankfurt, pretty much standard. 

Entertaining system on board of all planes, decent selection of movies, etc. 

Would fly again.

Efficient reasonable price and let you change the return day one time. One thing I do not like is the Air Bus A380 takes forever to load and unload passenger, lucky that they transfer to a smaller 777 to Hanoi. We experienced AirBUS 380 unload baggage when we go back to the US, the conveyor broke because overload.

A pleasant and comfortable flight, 
full entertainment system on seat back,
But the most weird food possible. 
(we have previously travelled extensively world-wide, and especially throughout the Far-East, and love Chinese, Thai, Philippines, and other  east Asian food,  but this Korean food was nothing short of weird, quite nasty, and completely inedible. 
Best recommendation is to bring your own sandwiches.

Asiana airlines has Surprisingly bigger planes and more leg room even in economy. The crew was attentive, food is warm and one can tell they are not trying to  save on food. They are by far the cheapest option even on short, last minute booking.
Very attentive service, choices of western or Korean meals. I am 6' 1"" and 200 lbs. and I had enough legroom, seats were wide enough.
Friendly service and great food. We had bad weather, and rough flight, but all staffs were very professional and kept smile on their face.

Nothing special. Just a normal economy flight fro Korea to Australia. Service was fine, flight attendants were nice and polite. Food was average but what plane isn't average at best unless your in business or first class.

My flight departed Incheon on time.  The aircraft was an old 747, the seating was thread bare.  In flight service was meh for a 5 h flight.  Flight was supposed to arrive in Saigon at 22:40.  At 22:10, the captain announced the flight was on final approach.  Landed (late) at 22:51.  Then the captain said the aircraft could not reach its gate due to (get this!) congestion!  That was it for announcements.  Half an hour later, we arrived at a gate. Now 23:30.  During the delay, no refreshments were offered.  I contacted Asiana about the lack of communication?  Incredibly, their response said no negligence on our part!  Negligence?  All I wanted was someone to acknowledge that one announcement and no service for 30 minutes was unacceptable?  Sadly, I am now checked out of Asiana in South East Asia - old aircraft, and the crew don't communicate.

4hours delay, but they didn't explain well why the flight was delayed.
There were three different reasons of the delay, I don't know what is the truth. The staff was not professional and ignored my question about delay.

They use the airbus 330 for this flight. The food is horrible this service is even more so in the seats even more so again. Use this airline on there A380 only otherwise avoid them like the plague. Planes are Old rundown and disgusting. You think you’re going to sleep on that flight then you should bring your own cot in business class

Great airline. There’s a reason why they have 5*. Fantastic service with smiling stewardesses :) probably best economy plane I’ve ever had. They have choices of Korean or Western menu.good choice of drinks. Absolutely fantastic entertainment system. I wold fly with them again!

Overall we love this airline. Good planes, prices, food, and great service. On our last trip, however, huge problem. A tobacco Nazi of a stewardess WRONGFULLY accused me of smoking on the flight. IF I were actually a smoker I may have taken less offense. (how would one get away with this in the first place!!) This Broad accused me of not only smoking, but called my a LIAR in front of other passengers when I denied her accusation. THEN she made great pains to announce on the P.A. that smoking is not allowed on the plane! Wow, really, who knew? Asianna responded to my email complaint, and assured me that the problem would not happen again. It probably won't, but I hope that that nasty broad of a stewardess got fired in the meantime!

I flew from Sydney to Seoul for a one night layover before flying to Seattle the next day and then the airline arranged  for a quality hotel in Seoul with 3 meals and transfers for $100 per night.  The economy service and food was the best I have ever had.  The best part of the trip was the they bumped me to business class on the ten and one half hour first leg and in the A380 it was wonderful.  I doubt that will happen again but this airline knows how to keep customers.  A great job all around.

I travelled just before Christmas, the price was good.  New aircraft, good legroom and comfy seats and this flight includes an overnight stay in Seoul with dinner and breakfast in a modern hotel.  Asiana staff are efficient and polite.  Choice of films could be better.

We forgot one piece of luggage at luggage carousel at CDG airport. Next day I called to customer service line to check where can I find my bag. They took my phone number and never came back with answer. I whote on aircompany facebook page and they told me to write email. Nobody answered to my email. Next I wrote to FB again and my message was opened by no answer again.
There is NO CUSTOMER SERVICE in this airline.

I flew with 13months son, who is bigger than 2 year old, and I bought a seat for him. When I contact Airline Reservation office, I found out that they offer baby car seat for free on US router. I didn't have to carry anything for my son and he rested in car while sleep and eat. Flight attendant were very helpful and friendly. I enjoyed my flight with my son!

First time with Asiana and was not disappointed!
The aircraft was clean en during the whole 10 hours HI stop over to Incheon, SKorea.
The stewardesses were courteous, the food was ok!
But movies and music were very limited:(

I've never flown Asiana before, but I believe I will fly them again! The seats were comfortable and had more leg room than most airlines. It actually seemed as if I had paid the extra $80 or so for the preferred seating, but it was simply their higher standard for economy seating. The food, entertainment, & the service were all great. The bathrooms on this flight were exceptional - maybe 2x as big as on other airlines. 
The bottom line: nothing but thumb's up for Asiana!

A long fly can be really difficult, specially if the seat in economy are vary small and not to much space for your leg . But let me tell you about this company. Asiana airline have the best economy seat ever !! So much leg space and the seat is nice and comfortable not to small just a good size .. also you have a nice video screen in front of you with a lots of good movie choices and more .. also all the information from your Stuart are transmitted true  your  audio. Also there is I formative video and stretch exercise suggestion ... I thought was a great idea 💡 the Stuart are super nice and welcoming food is not to bad to be a airplane food lol I will suggest this company 100 times !!! Thank you Asiana to make my trip memorable !! ❤️
with excellent cabin services and a fully reclining seat I was in heaven .. what a shame it was not for longer .. good food and comfy ,

From the moment we stepped on board until we left the plane this was a first class experience. The flight attendants were helpful and kind, the cabin was clean and as comfortable as a plane can be for 12-13 hours. I hope I have the good fortune to fly Asiana Airlines again in the future.

We’ve travelled with numerous and flew for one for 15 years so we’ve sampled first and business travel both as passengers and passengering crew members. I have no hesitation in saying Asisna rates above most and equal with the very best. 
The cabin was light airy and spacious and the seat as good as any of the pod seats available with other airlines. The pack, slippers and headset usable and adequate. The entertainment system only had limited films but they were current and high quality however limited in number compared to most other flights I’ve done recently
However the food was literally sensational with well cooked interesting menu’s catering for both western and Korean tastes. The were excellent too, well bslkNced and with good tasting notes.
The crew on each sector where incredibly polite, helpful and their attention to detail and presentation worthy of accolade- they worked hard to anticipate your needs and nothing was too much trouble.  I cannot recommended them enough. From check in to departure they where all so very helpful
This was the least torture I've had on a 13 hour coach flight.  We got a lot of leg room at the bulkhead, and I used a neck pillow for the first time.

The flight was like a high school lunch room.Many of the fellow passengers, were like screaming at each other in their conversations. The flight attendants that I had to converse with had such heavy accents, I could not understand them. One gal had to repeat herself five times, before I gave up and asked for someone else to talk to me. The people we had to sit by were very rude. One fellow actually lifted his rear to pass wind in the direction of my wife.
 The lavatories were a disaster,one had fecal matter on the wall. And water or urine all over the floor.Paper towels scattered all over.
 We had a terrible flight and Seoul experience the last time we flew Asiana Airlines in 1989.I forgot that we had such a bad ordeal.But this experience is enough to stay with us for a very long time.
 Do yourselves a favor and do not book with this airline! Period!
Excellent airline...clean, comfortable seats, good leg room.  We changed planes in Seoul.   A meal was served on each segment of the flight even though they were only 2 hours.

I would like to amend my prior review “not bad but being picky”
My trip to Tokyo late last year I said the lay flat seats were not perfect.  However on my current trip to Hong Kong
I found that this flight using the A388 was more comfortable. It did lay flat and the foot space was much roomier. 
So, I assume the aircraft has different seating designs despite the fact it’s regular LAX to Incheon flight. 
I use Asiana for 2 reasons, the cost!  It’s the most reasonable compared to the competitors crossing the pacific. 
However, if you’re not terminating your flight in Korean, be prepared for a long layover. I spent 4 hours in the lounge waiting for my Hong Kong flight.  Likewise my earlier Tokyo flight was several hours. 
Food and service is adequate but not great.

Have been flying Asiana to and from and intra Asia since 2011 mostly in their transpacific A380 metal. Usually great service, very good food, and they do have port wine (unlike JAL) which is my favorite libation. In-flight entertainment options are also very good and so are their many airport lounges.

Asiana Airlines does not have a lounge at Shanghai Airport (PVG) so they have their premium passengers use the Air China lounge. So we were there waiting for our flight to ICN on OZ368. Asiana personnel came through making a last boarding call for our flight and rushed us outta the lounge. I forgot my iPhone 7+ at the lounge and told Asiana personnel as I boarded the flight. They would not let me go back to retrieve the phone. I reported the phone missing then and there on PVG tarmac.

Upon arriving at ICN, I tried in vein to have someone assure me that I will get my iPhone back to no avail. Asiana is headquartered at ICN. The phone with its memory is worth a grand but it's open with no pass code and contains all my bank and travel programs information. Again, had to board the flight to LAX without my phone but used my wife's iPhone 8 to take our flight photos. Aboard OZ202, I also reported my lost phone and again upon arrival at LAX on Monday.

Yesterday had a knock on my door, lo and behold, FEDEX at the door with a package from Asiana LAX office that contained my iPhone! Thank you Asiana for the great service and for retrieving my phone!

We mainly chose Asiana as it was significantly cheaper than other airlines even with an Economy Smartium upgrade. 
Exceeded expectations. Excellent service, particularly from the flight crew.
Good food, both the vegan and Korean options. 
Decent facilities at Incheon for the transfer as well.
Will certainly consider flying Asiana again.

I flew from Chicago Ohare airport (ord) to Manila Philippines. We connected through Inchon Airport. A few weeks before flying out of Chicago I ordered a Fruit Platter as a special meal. Asiana Airlines provides this free of cost. This is a great choice. You get fresh cut fruit made that day. This meal is perfect for an international flight. It is light and very juicy. This will help you stay hydrated and you won’t feel too full. You get your meal first before all others. Just make sure you tell the flight attendant your drink choice when the flight attendant confirms your meal. Otherwise you will wait for a drink as they serve the others. Most airlines offer this service but Asiana provides a lovely selection of fresh fruits. Please give this a try you will be happy.

Never heard of Asiana Airlines until we booked a return flight London to Sydney, and as there was 17hour stop over on return we received a complimentary hotel stay in Seoul.

Note - when you get back to Seoul you will not know your hotel until you get to the Asiana desk, get into Arrival hall and turn right, and desk is down to the left, we couldn’t find the desk so hope it helps. And if flying business you get complimentary transfer too. 

The staff are great are very helpful, they come and introduce themselves and try to make you as comfortable as possible, you receive your dinner menu nearly immediately with the drink list.

Choice of films are limited as well as the menu unless you fancy a Korean menu, as this was our first business flight it’s hard to compare to other carriers, 

My wife left here iPhone charger on the plane, we got to the outbound departure gate and there was a member of staff with a charger which she didn’t realise she had lost, what great service.
Would I would fly with Asiana again in the future. The answer is yes. 

I will point out Asiana lounge in Seoul will have a very limited choice of food which was disappointing when we had 4hour wait on outboard flight.

The checkin was convenient and fast.
The cabin was clean. Minimal service. The seats were comfortable and well spaced.
Low cost.
I flew to Shanghai via Soul from SFO last December. Very good service and the food was excellent too.

Asiana Airlines is one of my favourite airlines, because the in flight service is always excellent. The whole night they flight attendants go around with drinks. Never seen this frequency with other airllines. The transit in Seoul is excellent, because it is never too crowded (specially compared to the Middle East transfer points). Friendly staff everywhere!

On this time I got prepared. I brought with me warm clothes its socks and sweater its a must if you don't want to get cold. Also I ordered online food because flight is long enough, on road its important to have a meal. and I brought a neck pillow these three will have you enjoy the trip. so you can have both comfortable flight and cheap price.and also  very important buy your baggage because they will charge you overprice for that then your tickets won't be cheap anymore

Pay attention that hotel availability if you stay overnight is not the case which means that you will have to stay pretty much 24 hours at the airport.

Avoid Asiana for European and Asian directions.

Excellent on board service by attendants and also by airport staff. Superb quality of food and the aircraft maintained in impeccable conditions. One final comment, the temperature of the cabin was too warm to the point of mild discomfort, I noticed this also on the flight from to LA to Seoul when the trip began

This flight was one of 4 I have recently taken with Asiana. Without exception the in-flight service I received was excellent and left BA, for instance, following far far behind. Full flat seating, really edible and individual food, wines etc, very very polite and attentive cabin crew all made for good, including red eye, flights. One minor negative, many of the inflight (in english) announcements were impossible to understand. One major negative; all four flights were late, very late as in up to over 2 hours late, in departing with knock journey arrival time impacts. Again using BA as an example comparison, excellent value for money.

The take off and landing of the flight was perfect. The flight attendants were helpful. 

It would be better if the pilot could turn off the lights in the cabin as it was an overnight flight and passengers would like to take a rest.  There could also be more varieties of movies for passengers to choose from as the movies that were shown on the flight were kind of boring.

Pros
- I like the seats, particularly the 'honeymoon seats' for travelling with kids. Comfy.
- I liked being able to gate check prams - this is a big deal in my world
- Flight attendants were very responsive 

Cons
- Asiana seems to heat their planes to uncomfortably hot as a rule. I ended up getting a towel, pouring water on it and squeezing the excess out and draping over my neck and face. As a result I didn't sleep on an overnight flight

- food is nothing exciting and the meal service is way too long for an evening flight - lights weren't dimmed until 11.30pm. Do an express service with all components together then turn the lights off

Tip - don't lie the smartium seats fully flat. Keep a slight angle and waaaay more comfy

This my chance to fly on a A380 from LAX to TYO via Incheon. I though this huge plane would have some extra special features in Business class. 
Business is upstairs so it’s a different entrance and exit door which is nice. 
Surprisingly the cubicles are about the same size as other business class airplanes (Boeing-777). 
Here’s the part I’m critical of. The lay flat was not flat. It was angled down. Worse yet the foot area was very narrow so your feet have to be close together. So it’s hard to turn from one side to the other, and you are constantly sliding down. 
So the experience was not what I expected. I was a little disappointed. 
Also the added area where they advertised a bar and social area was not functional. It was just an empty space. 
The service was impeccable. The food was good. They do have lots of snacks available. For some reason on these long flights I really get the munchies so that was appealing. 
Another drawback if flying Asiana is that you will have a layover in Incheon when traveling to Tokyo, Hong Kong, etc. it’s not that bad as their lounge is nice but you can add on 4-6 hours compared to a non stop. 
All in all not bad but not great.

We have never flown Asiana airlines and bottom line we were underwhelmed by the service and the quality of Business Class. The cabin was dated and didn't seem that clean, the staff seemed a little inconsistent and the food was terrible. We never expect great food on an airline but these meals on both legs were poor. We had a very tight connection in Seoul and we kept telling the Business Class team and they didn't seem that interested in helping. When we were delayed upon landing they seemed clueless as to what to do to help us. Most of the Business Class was making the same connection so luckily they had to hold the next flight but we did not feel like the crew was well trained in how to handle. Many of us were stressed and they just kept looking at each other for how to handle. Ultimately it all worked out but both legs of our trip were bumpy and the service was just very average. We were disappointed as we had heard it was a nice airline.

Flight Seul-Rome 13 hrs: old aircraft, no charge for phone, entertainment only in english (ok, good) or korean/chineese.
I ask for no lactose meal due to my lactose intollerance, they told me “so sorry we forgot”..13 hrs eating nuts.
NEVER AGAIN

On our 2nd time going home to Manila we took business class because of my mom and we needed a lavatory that can fit 2 people so i can be with her inside and didn’t regret paying a bit because she was comfortable during our 15 hrs flight. 
it was the best experience we ever had. Customer service and food were excellent. Flight attendants were courteous & i love the lay flat seat. 
Our first flight we’re in economy class and the service and food were great, spacious legroom and comfortable seats 
I will always fly with Asiana now.

I came across this airline when researching flights to Sydney last February. I had never heard of them as I usually book with BA. The price was ridiculously low, effectively two for the price of one compared with BA and others.
With a little trepidation I set off. The first leg to Seoul was one of the best airline experiences I have ever had. Wonderful service, excellent food and very comfortable seat. Likewise, after a 3 hour stop in Seoul in an excellent lounge, the second leg to Sydney was equally superb.
Our return in January involved an overnight layover in Seoul. Asiana provided a wonderful hotel with transfers and all food, free of charge. Admittedly it took longer to reach home but the overnight in Seoul was well worth the additional duration of the whole trip.
I would eagerly recommend Asiana as a top class airline and I will definitely book with them again.

I am writing this on behalf of my fiancee who i booked on asiana in december. I asked her was fight ok and for a person who's longest trip before was 2 hrs she was very happy with her experience  with asiana flying to korea first then waiting 4 or 5 hrs in  airport for connecting flight to jfk.the flight itself she said she had plenty of room(window seat) and was very comfortable and well fed as well and airline stewardesses were very nice and helpful  to all passengers.I had done my research on travel sites  like tripadvisor and where i could have gotten cheaper flights I narrowed it down to 3 airlines and schedule of this floight won the day and i wasnt disappointed nor was she either.Thank you Asiana airlines money very well spent

WOW, WOW, WOW! Asiana absolutely delivered to my best economy tastes. The legroom was AMAZING! There was about 5 or 6 of my palms between my legs and the seatback pocket. There was no meal, that I can understand on a 45min flight, a wide variety of drinks were there for your choosing. Checking in CJU was realllyyyy fast. FAs were really nice, with BTW an important feature, most of them being able to speak impeccable english. No IFE, but a tv screen was extended down with hilarious shows, overall better than nothing. 100% should be choosen and definitely deserve their best economy product award.

First time we flew with Asiana Airlines. Loads of room, great movies and delicious food. Our flight was only a short one but very comfortable. The flight attendants were friendly and spoke very good English which helped. We would definitely recommend this airline.

First time to fly with Asiana. Did not pay much much attention to this airline until they offered deeply discounted rates. I flew from Manila to Istanbul via Incheon. Flights were on time, cabin crew were attentive and courteous. I found the meals surprisingly palatable. Cabin slippers were also provided.

The long layover in Incheon is not a disadvantage for this airline. For the free Incheon transit lounge and free tours are very good -- from an economy passenger's perspective, that is. To avail of free tours outside the airport, just make sure you have a valid South Korean visa (if enroute to a final destination in the USA, a US visa suffices.)

We flew our initial flight to ICN on a 777-200 from SEA, then our connecting flight to DEL on an a330-300.  While both aircraft were older, and fairly worn interior-wise, that issue was the only thing the two flights seemed to have in common other than the chaos that seemed to embrace Asiana Airlines most of the time.   

We had a 24hr. unplanned layover in Seoul, due to a late flight from Korea, making the departure several hours late, and our connection to New Delhi impossible.  Asiana then put us up in an airport hotel, and provided meal vouchers.  That aspect was nicely done.  While the unexpected delay cost us some time at our destination, we did enjoy the time, and explored parts of Seoul.

I'll attempt to breakdown the various aspects of the flights for you in separate segments due to the immense differences in the flights.  Neither were what I would refer to as stellar in regards to business class travel:

Flight 271, SEA-ICN, Boeing 777-200

SEATS:  Pretty beat up for business class, and seemed rather small and confining for a lie flat pod.  Actually lost my dinner spoon in the side of my seat cushion, (a surprisingly large gap), and cut my hand retrieving it.  To top off the Smartium Business Class seat experience, it wasn't comfortable. 

IFE:  Older screen and system.  Remote control in armrest.  Very limited entertainment selections available, and nothing very current as far as movies went.  Quite limited as far as choices.  The IFE performed without gliches.  

MEALS:  After a slow service start, the meal was acceptable, (not as impressive as I had been led to believe it would be), however OK, but the service was the standout.  Spectacular. Multiple course served, great wine, fair appetizer (scallop), chicken or fish or beef for dinner, and a cheese and fruit plate for desert.  Baked goods and eggs for breakfast.  All good, not great.  

CABIN SERVICE:  A very slow start, but terrific afterwards.

CABIN CLEANLINESS:   Acceptable, but barely.  

CHECK IN DESK AT SEA:   Chaos.  Having a late plane, and trying to work around a planefull of missed connections has to be trying, but it wasn't handled well at all.  Extreme stress was the rule of the day behind the counter.  In the business class line, it took over 30 minutes to check our bags, and we were the first in line with many stacked up behind us.  

AIRPORT BAGGAGE DELIVERY AT ICN:  Really, really, fast.  Very impressive.  

Second flight, Asiana flight 767  ICN to DEL, Airbus 330-300  

SEATS:  Side by side.  Moderately comfortable considering the wider seat, and around 80% recline.  Not that comfortable by other airline standards, but OK enough.  Plenty of room  

IFE:   Very, very limited.  Not many choices in any category.  Disappointing tor an almost 9 hour flight.  

MEALS:   It was like a bad economy meal.  It was hard to believe in was even a meal that would be thought of serving in business class.  My wife asked for the beef choice, and they were out by the third row of business.  This flight was definitely a weird experience.  No arrival meal was offered.  Coffee seemed a task to get 90 minutes before landing.  

CABIN SERVICE:  Horrid.  If you were Indian, North American, or European, your service needs were secondary to others.  I haven't ever seen anything even remotely as offensive as this in any international flight ever.  We thought we were imagining it all in the beginning, but the situation kept repeating itself.  Unbelievable in this day and age.   

CABIN CLEANLINESS:  Acceptable.  

CHECK IN DESK AT ICN:   Quick, efficient, courteous.

AIRPORT BAGGAGE DELIVERY AT DEL:  Considering the vast amounts of people waiting for their bags at 3:00 am at the New Delhi Airport, the delivery time to the luggage carousel was quite good.  

There were nice aspects, and bad aspects to our experience of flying Asiana.  It was our first time flying with Asiana, and we had heard great things about their flights, but alas that proved not to be the case with us.  Maybe it was just bad luck, or a bad couple of days for them, or us.  Nonetheless, I don't think I'll be recommending Asiana to anyone I know.  There are a lot of ways to get around the globe for business or pleasure, and I think the competition will be my next choice.
Had a great flight experience while flying to seoul. Crew was extremely courteous and helpful. Journey was comfortable.  Flight entertainment didn't have much choice for Hindi channels.
Good flight helpful crew and good food with time to sleep on 22 hour flight.  Arrived at final destination rested as could be after that long a flight

The service was good, seats reasonably comfortable for economy class. The entertainment choices were only fair - lots of second-tier movies. Planes were older but were clean. Food was reasonably good but definitely not great. We ended up missing our connecting flight in Seattle and staff was helpful (after some encouragement) to rebook us on a different airline. If it would have required a little less encouragement, I would have added an additional star to this review. I've flown this route many times over the years, but this was the first time on Asiana. I wouldn't go out of my way to choose this airline again.

The high point was the layover in Incheon, S. Korea. The airport offers free tours if you have at least a 6-hour layover, and we took advantage of this by taking two tours, both of which we really enjoyed. You can search for ""free city tours Incheon Airport"" to check them out and make a reservation.

this is my second time flying with asiana. for one, there were very limited flights going to lax from clark. first thing you'll notice when you book from clark is that there are longer waiting hours for the lay over at incheon compared to when you're coming from manila. not sure why they can't get you on an earlier flight to reduce the lay over waiting time since they have lots of planes going to lax.
next, delays are common. there was not a single inbound or outbound flight i had that took off on time. 
food was ok. not bad, but not excellent either. what i appreciate about it is they serve the meals in just the right amount of time.
their website is not user friendly at all. difficult to navigate and more often than not its too confusing to continue using. highly suggest they update their website to be more user friendly with the interfaces.
lastly, one of the worst comments on a review i can give, but this airline does not keep their word. during the return flight from lax to incheon during my first trip with this airline, there was a medical emergency for which the crew approached me if i could help a out fellow passenger. i assisted in stabilizing his condition and continuously checking up on him the whole flight. as a gesture of gratitude, the airline said they would put mileage points in my membership  account. 2 years later, and those mileage points still hasn't appeared in my account. i tried following up with them, but for some reason, they cannot be contacted all of a sudden. if ever a similar situation arises and they ask for my help again, i'd be very reluctant to accommodate them. 
now that i'm based in Manila again, there are more airlines to choose from. not really inclined to take this airline again. i hope there are airlines with much better service than this. if you're considering taking this airline, make sure you're expectations aren't that high.

My wife and I sat in the center 2 seats. It was a huge seat and enormous monitor screen. Very private and comfortable. The service was outstanding. Our only criticism is the lack of variety and selections in the inflight entertainment.

This is a flight from Nagoya and then to Seoul before to Hong Kong included connecting flight. The whole journey take me over 12 hours to arrive destination, because long waiting time for connecting flight at Seoul. Even worst is that the flight departing time keep changing in past 4 months until my departure week. Hope not have this kind of flight arrangement in future!

I obtained a business class ticket on points for a trip from Europe to Tokyo in fall 2017 and decided to split the journey up with a short stopover in Seoul. Even before boarding the plane I was struck by Asiana's dated and largely unusable website, with its requirement for multiple registrations and passwords and its incomprehensible interface. Doing something as commonplace as online check-in was a chore, and I was completely unable to make a seat selection online.

Once on the flight I was treated with indifference by the attendants on this short-haul flight, notwithstanding the business class cabin being 2/3rds empty. They did proactively take my jacket to hang it up, which was nice. What was less nice was that they didn't think to return it to me when the plane was descending or after landing, which is what happens on all other airlines I have been on. As I was jet lagged after my long trip from Europe, I myself forgot about the jacket until I was in a taxi half way to my hotel. The hotel called immediately and a day later the answer came that the jacket had indeed been located. However, rather than offering to deliver it to my hotel - hardly an unusual thing for an airline to have to do - they said I could pick it up at the end of my week in Tokyo (not very convenient given the weather). If I needed it sooner, I would have to pay the cost of a taxi to have it delivered. Wow, Asiana, nice...

Between this and the longer flight I took on Asian from Seoul back to Europe a week later, I was left bewildered as to why the Star Alliance would want this airline as a member. It certainly is the worst long haul business class experience I've had on a Star Alliance airline (other than United, of course, which is garbage).

Flew from Sg-Seoul & Return and also Seoul-Jeju, pleasant flight with good korean cuisines, crew was friendly and attentive, legroom on board was good for economy, inflight system though only had a few shows... could have been improved so much more...

I was lucky enough to be given seat 1a with the note it was still business class food. They did not disappoint. Food and service was great. Seat was very good, private and large. Will fly like this again
Fair airline. Qantas was much better. Nonsense once again about being able to book seats for an extra charge. Don’t do it online, don’t bother.Avoid aisle seats.

I was one of the luck Star alliance gold members who was upgraded from Economy first to Business at Check-in and subsequently to first class while boarding.
The whole process of upgrade was very neutral and positive and it feels nice to win an upgrade.
I think for that week Asiana had brought in a bigger plane as they had large group bookings and hence they had a first class which is not a regular service and hence was not sold. That explains the upgrade
Overall I found the first class cabin to be brilliant, well designed and very private. The service was warm but not very bothering and I got a decent shuteye due to that

Excellent service and food was over the top very good.Always attentive  staff, and plenty of room to move about. The entire floor was set aside for business class, on the new a380. Largest airplane in world. even the economy had plenty of room. the only problem was landing in seoul and dealing with fog, and bug time delays. had to catch a plane but no one provided any service upon landing and no signs and no one there. very disappointed upon arrival

Service was average, meals are just as every airline has,but their schedules are very very bad!!! Their flights are often delayed so the connecting flight gap time is so short that they would divert us to San Francisco then to Seattle. Instead of arriving in Seattle at 11am we would be arriving at 7pm. Ask then about options .... first is to take the two stop over which is INCH / SF or take the next day flight, so I said we would be willing to take the next day flight if they are willing to pay for our accommodation but no they are not willing so their is no option right!!!!!! And that was a week before our return to Seattle, w h at I did was call Asiana and after a long and arduous time arranging our return flight we had our tickets rebooked for the original time of our arrival in Seattle which was 11am. Lo and behold we arrived at the airport counter early and was instructed to a special line in another counter and they where insisting that we take the the flight through SF again oh was I livid!!!!!! I just said it is not acceptable for us and they should find a way for us to catch that Seattle flight from Inchioen Korea.  After a very long wait we flew with Korean airlines and was able to catch the flight to Seattle we originally booked for.

My girlfriend who lives in Russia was going to Saigon from 3 months so we decided to meet as Visa is you can get on line. Checked fares and Asiana had the best prices and read good reviews. For long haul flights fly business. In every process from check-in, boarding, in-flight service, to transfer in Incheon could have not been more helpful. 
Seat was very nice, I choose window seat as it was single row and has extra storage. Food was very good and I selected Korean menu over Western. Food portions for me were perfect many American’s might think it was small.

I think business class had 38 seats 1-2-1 configuration. Center seat alternated each row from sitting next to each other with storage on aisle to separated with storage between seats. Also isle seat had small overhead bin above seat and large bin in center overhead.

The only two downsides for such a long flight was the selection of music and movies in entertainment system. For English language you had 2 movie choices, Hollywood (current movies) maybe 6-8 movies and Classic 12 movies. I remember one being “One Flew Over the Cuckoo’s Nest. Music had different channels with was OK but tracks were only about 2 hours in length so you heard same music over and over. Digital music takes so little storage, why not 10 hours on each channel.

Second, plane was A380 (first time on A380) so superior to Boing counterpart. Problem was no WIFI.

Would I fly Asiana again? Yes, anytime I fly in their travel area

So... never heard of Asiana Airlines before this... found some super cheap flights from Sydney to London via Seoul and decided to have a night stopover in Seoul along the way. Here’s my thoughts on Asiana if your thinking of doing the same...

Pre flight

Booked and paid online and all went ok, confirmations fine, became members, got a card, got their newsletters, chose seats online, checked in the night before online easy peasy. Running late to baggage drop thanks to Monday morning Sydney traffic, counter staff had great English and super helpful and quick. Calmer than us that’s for sure!

Flight

Boarding for A380 learnt a neat trick, Asiana have three queues based on seat numbers, so finding your right queue could save heaps of time, we literally went straight through and on via the upstairs queue! 

Seats for four in economy we had 74 J and K and 75 J and K, two in front, two behind. Window, seat, seat, aisle. Cool! Under the windows they had really big storage bays which were unreal, as I didn’t need overhead locker at all and used that for my backpack and gear.

The seats are not plush, but were fine and no problem. In fact the thinner seats gave me the big winner... heaps of legroom. With three of us over 6ft tall legroom is a thing... but not on this flight. Lots of room to stretch out. More than I can ever recall before in economy. Excellent. 

The flight itself was 10 hours and no dramas at all, on time.

The food and drinks on board are all Korean. The Bimibap for meal 1 was better than the chicken. The fish and pork options for meal 2 were good too. The Korean beer didn’t cut it! Cass? Pass! There were no bubbles either. Sad. The coffee was actually pretty good though.

Big tip. There is no snack buying option on board for chips or drinks. BYO and you’ll be set! 

The service from staff was efficient and polite. Brought everyone lots of glasses of water and soft drinks during flight. 

Online movies, games and phone charger worked well. They let you use your devices the whole flight too which was great.

Arrived on time, off the plane pretty quick, and baggage pickup went fine.

Overall a very good flight experience for a great price. I’d fly with them again, oh yeah... that’s tomorrow’s leg to London! 

And having a one night stopover to breakup the flight is a real winner! Just sayin’...

I have never experienced  the awful service starting with booking my seat on any airline domestic or international.   I am an older traveler who is temporarily  disabled which really shouldn't have anything to do with it but anyway I flew the 380 with the 1 2 1 seating.  I always  like the 1 primarily since I am a solo traveler.  My wonderful agent always books me that way but this time he wasn't able to.  I decided  to call asian a myself.  I got a runaround being told if I wanted one of those seats I would have to go to the airport because they don't allow it ahead of time.  Needless to say I was furious saying that this isn't sea that you have to get there early to fight for your seat although domestically  it is the best, this is first class which cost a Lot of money.  They refused and said call LA IN THE AM, LA said call Korea.  This went on 3 to 4 days.  I felt harassed.  Finally they gave me first row.  I asked if second was available,  I certainly would have understood but same story cant book you.  
Got to LAX look8ng at a 12 hour lay which I will never do again and the counter just closed but everyone was still there.  Wanted to check my 1 bag and again they refused.  As I said I am temporarily disabled  and what would I do dragging  it around so I decided to go to the lounge,  nope I couldn't do the either they wouldn't is She boarding pass.  I started to cry even the airport police and security officers felt bad for me.  12 hrs by baggage really.  Security Mr had to go to them and assist.
Overall flight was ok but first class cabin something kept banging as if someone kept opening and slamming a steel door.
I fly first class international  fairly often but this was a nightmare.  I asked the two other passengers if the experienced it they said no

It was our first experience flying with Asiana Airlines from Seoul to Sydney. The day we flew was the first day of winter in Korea and the heavy snow was falling on our way to the airport. We actually have chosen our desired seats before we departed from Sydney 2 weeks ago but when we checked in at the Asiana Airlines counter, one of our four seats had been taken by someone. The ground staff could not solve the problem and her English was poor.
Boarding time was delayed by half an hour and on top of that we had to wait for another 3 frustrating hours in the plane because the runway and the plane had to be cleared out from ice/snow.
But as frustrating as this was, we could not blame the airlines because it was the act of nature but it would be much better if passengers could spend the time in restaurants and shops at the airport rather than staying in the cabin for so long !
As a result of this, food was not served until late and everyone was hungry with dinner being served around 11.00 pm. Luckily, the bulgogi was good, served with fresh vegetables.  
Fortunately we were also able to swap seat with the lady who took our seat and sat four in a row. The aircraft is huge, clean and the seats are comfortable. Cabin crew are polite and helpful.
It was my second time having congee/porridge for breakfast but Korean style
I’m hoping that when I do fly again with them in the future there will be no delay !

..Really Good!!. Plane is in pretty good condition, food is great!, staff is very attentive and always taking care of business, services are always clean! (That is a Plus), the only downside I found was...entertainment options!, unless you are fluently speaking Korean, you'll get stuck in a 16 hrs flight with 3 or 4 movies you can watch at. Other than that I would recommend this airline and most likely I will use it again.

Second leg of a Heathrow - Sydney flight, this deserves a separate review as the aircraft and cabin is, in my opinion, much nicer and has more modern and updated feeling, although the seats/ beds themselves are much the same as the Boeing 777, as is the service and food and beverages, which are all excellent. 

I sat in seat 10A, on the upper deck, forward business cabin. The cabin lighting is much calmer and less yellow in appearance than the Boeing 777. In front of this cabin is a small social area, with seating for 4, and enough space to gather with fellow passengers of travel companions, chat and stretch your legs. There are 2 toilets here, one of which is very large and great for changing outfits for the flight or arrival. I imagine it would be really handy for travelling with children or for less mobile passengers, or the needing assistance.

The audio visual system is controlled via a small touch screen remote, again located in the seat. This is much more user friendly than the Boeing 777 system. Earphones are the same and I couldn't hear any aircraft or cabin noise over them. 

Food and drinks service were all great, if similar in offering to the previous flight. The chicken breast main course was really good, and I couldn't fault any of the dishes. The Port was delicious, a 20 year old Taylors, and the Chardonnay was a lovely rich older style. The coffee with breakfast was also excellent. 

I slept like a dream and only watched one movie, during dinner and before falling asleep. 
Again the seats are as on the earlier flight, although were more modern in appearance and looked newer (less wear and tear). Pillow and quilt were the same and very comfortable. 

The only issue I would have with this flight was the cabin temperature, slightly too hot given the quilt etc. Pyjamas would be handy, but for the return journey I will pack shorts and a T-shirt so I don't wake up sweaty. 

The crew on Asiana really were excellent, and would rival and of the crew, in any class of travel I have flown with.

This flight had a stop over at Incheon Airport.  I was actually glad to have chosen Asiana for the reason that its layover is in Incheon Airport.  That airport is very good especially for long layovers.  I did not go for the free transit tours and instead just settled to stay at the Transfer Lounge.

I got a good/cheap rates with Asiana Airline that is why I did not expect high quality service from their end.  Overall experience was fine.

Why am I paying for pains? There are 4 things that I am deeply disappointed with Asiana Airline. 

1. Numerous delays: 3 times. I had to cancel my Saturday dinner appointment. But it's okay. It could happen.

2. The world worst customer service at the counter: I and my wife's seats are separated. (When I have purchased two people's tickets at once, it's automatically and always assigned seats together for decades.)  And of course, gentely asked if we could sit next to each other. The only answer I received was that 'You figure it out. I can't do anything. This is how it is' . I still cannot believe. She moved our seats close. My seat was in front of my wife's seat. When I asked her 'what's going to happen next' she replied 'it's all up to you. You need to ask people around to change your seat'. I was like ' what about cabin crew? would they be responsible for this? "" She told me NO. And she asked me to take $10 voucher. This got me really upset. I was asking for her effort to put us together, no the cheap vouchers. I left the counter speechless. 

3. As I got on board, I looked for the manager if he could do any help for us to put together. I've waited for a long time and finally, he solved my simple request.

4. The airplane looked like 80s one. fabrics had its old smell, no touch screen, no USB ports, no nothing. Incredible. I haven't seen this old aircraft at least for 10 years. There was a box beneath my seat. and the metal corner part started hurting my foot. I didn't have any will to ask cabin crew to do something. I took care of it with my own bandage. 

The agent at the counter was like an old lady and her name is Seung-Hee Kim. I can't believe that Asiana Airline lets this rude service to customers.

Horrible experience ever. Never with Asiana Airline.

On the B777-200ER from New York to Seoul lasting more than 13 hours, the flight was smooth, the attendants were friendly, the seats were comfortable and had enough leg space. Very clean, spacious, mostly quiet except for one child having certain reactions at times (and the flight steward tried to help). Two items were given to every passenger: In-flight slippers, alongside a toothbrush with a travel-sized toothpaste. A thoughtful and very-welcome gesture.

Korean food such as bibimbap for lunch was delicious (with good quality gochujang and sesame oil) and well-presented, although the veggies did not fare so well when it came to the steamed rice selections with gochujang-flavoured beef or chicken for the second meal. Did not try the steak for lunch, so unable to comment on that. The mid-flight snack of a ham and cheese roll also went down well. I was very well-fed, and my hot water requests were quickly answered.  

Entertainment was slightly less varied than Cathay Pacific or Singapore Airlines, but still very decent. For the ticket price relative to overall quality experience if flying from New York to a Southeast Asian destination, this airline is better than those 2 airlines (IMHO, but YMMV). Asiana is one of South Korea's two main carriers, and provided a positively memorable experience with this aircraft.

Even though I was already at the boarding gate but had gone to the store next to it to look at Maui Jim sunglasses wonderfully-designed to truly protect the eyes from the sun in a stylish manner (and not easily available outside certain countries), the Asiana representatives at the counter later called my name alongside the gate number and flight number, to ensure I would reach the correct gate with enough time. Boarding was also quick. Flight took off on time, and landed on time. 

Notes: If you have any specific dietary requirements involving animal-free meals or not eating certain meats for personal reasons, check to see if special meal choices can be booked to accommodate your preferences, prior to buying a ticket.

HND to ICN 2h 20min.Relax and comfortable.
ICN to IST is long fright but I could watch many good movies and I took delicious Korean food at this fright.
Been flight with Koreanair mostly.  but Asian has good price compare to Koreanair and seat was very comportable.
I had no problems checking in online a few days before flight, everything went smooth. Good check in at counter desk. Flight was good with a meal provided, drinks hot and cold handed out.

Much improvement on the food being served not dry as before so enjoyed the meals Korean style all the way thru for my first segment! Overall, there are three segments, luckily, only three hours delayed so it was feasible.
No signage on arrival at the airport since the delay of flight, luckily I had recognized your uniforms,lol
Unfortunately, the trainee was newly hired and English was not her strong command of language regarding seating arrangement;('
Luckily, it was rectified once on board upon much discussions later, lol
Seriously, there was not much commotion on my other flights...
All in all, I felt very fortunate that it was a very smooth and enjoyable flight,
Much oblidged!

1st time to use Asiana Airline. The service is very good and foods serve is open unlike with other airlines company that appears there is a limitation for meals and snacks were not all the way serve but one have to buy or purchase food.  With Asiana we got free snacks and meals on during our trip duration. 

I witness too on how Asiana staff responded to one Passenger that complaint of short breath that seems she has having a stroke so there were so many Passengers who volunteered to check the condition of the said Passenger.  Close to where I was seated even one passenger beside me volunteer to check and monitor the condition of the sick passenger and a lot of Asiana Staff were there to get what is needed and their respond and expressed concerns is very commendable and really excellent.  

Note: The Sick Passenger was transferred in front of where I am seated thus I witnessed all the activities and happenings.  It took more than an hour before everything wemt to normal.

First time flying with Asiana and I'll have to say it was a solid experience, flying business class on an international flight.  Considering my return trip back to the U.S.A was on American Airlines in business class, Asiana beat out the service of AA.

Though I found Asiana to be a ""no frills business class"" it actually beat out AA for its inflight customer experience - from attention received, food quality and comfortability. 

For the price, cheaper than most business class service, it outdid AA and I'm a lifetime status holder on AA. 

Though it's baggage handling service and execution needs attention, they broke one of the wheels off my luggage, the overall service still beats many of its competitors

Flight was great but had a significant problem when checking in at Seattle.  Philippine immigration requires a return or onward ticket to be allowed entrance to Philippines. This can be a pain
 but its the law and you have to obey it.  When I arrived at Asiana  counter I showed my ticket from Manila to Taipei I purchased before.  It was for travel March 15 2018.  The agent refused me to board plane because he said I needed a return or onward ticket within 30 days of arriving Philippines. This dont make sense cause many tourist stay longer and get a extended visa.  Since my flight was soon and I could not afford to miss I was forced to buy another ticket to leave 15 b
days after arriving in Philippines.  I argued with agent but he refused to look into it. I think travelers should be sure to check into this before flying on Asiana,
Amazing flight from Korea to Germany with a large and modern plane (A388). Long trip but with all we can expect from good professionals with excelent entertainment

This was my first flight between Asian countries and I was a little nervous because of all the talk that you hear about the seats being smaller and what not. But the seats were actually very comfortable, the food was delicious and the staff were very courteous. They provided me with all the documents that I needed to go through customs and tried to speak to me as much as possible in English.

I could hardly believe the line of people for this aircraft - it took a long time to get everyone on.  Once on, everything looked a bit dated and the entertainment screen resolution was so poor that I did not bother with it.  However, seat comfort and leg room were adequate for economy and the food was really tasty.  This flight was quite reasonably priced and so met my expectations for a 2 hour 15 minute flight. Not exactly an enjoyable experience but perfectly adequate, safe and comfortable transport.

Excellent service is what they provide very similar to Cathay Pacific's except the stewardesses are not so conversant in English.
Food is excellent, a choice between western and Asian. Wine selection is very good.
The suite is simple and understated unlike Emirates' over the top ""golden"" suite. 
We especially love their first class lounge at Incheon airport, very classy and quiet.

We've flown in business class too early in the year and it was very good too. Food and service topnotch.
The service was good, the air stewardess are all friendly and polite. Korean bibimbap was good, served with hot seaweed soup.

Found this flight while searching online for a Hong Kong trip. Our goal was to get a direct flight but the options were very expensive so went with Asiana connecting through Seoul. It was one of the best Star Alliance flights I took in recent years. The price was great with almost 70% of the closest competition. The leg room is unusually large for economy and they reserved us the emergency exit, which most airlines only do for select customers, with no extra cost. The service is great and the crew is excellent. They have been very helpful throughout the trip. We had to wait for about 10 hours in Seoul due to the connection but the timing was great to explore the city which we enjoyed a lot.

I was mesmerized by the Korean beauty and elegance of their plane. If you are a kpop fan like me and riding on their flagship airline is really something else, PLUS, their food is really good. The space and atmosphere is right to an Asian passenger like me.
I always sit on an isle seat. never have a problem getting one.  Flight attendants have always been very friendly and helpful.  I fly with them every 5 months.

Recently flew round trip to Sydney, Australia from Los Angeles in business class on the Airbus A380-800. The flight was great, cruising around 40,000 feet at about 640 mph. The inflight service was excellent. The flight attendants were very professional yet courteous. Their smiles were real. They have pride in their work. The food was top notch as was the selection of wine, champagne and liquor. I would honestly say it was like flying in a first class restaurant. The ceiling even had the effect of stars when sleep was suggested. And the amenities such as pajamas, slippers and toiletries were all quality.

I've ridden this airline a few times and have always been pleased with the service and space given for economy class. I wish I could say the food tasted good, but I hardly eat on airlines. However, the people around me on Asiana have always eaten all of their food if that helps. I love the toothbrushes they give out in the bathroom! The TV show selection isn't that great. The movie selection is kind of spread out which I would give a B- score to compared to what I've seen some other airlines offer on international flights. The flight attendants try to keep the bathroom as clean as they can, but its obvious the passengers don't care to keep it nice for others.

the 380-800 is one of the nicest planes of them all ,flown all of them over last 10 years,the most spacious bathroom with nice ammenties,the lounge are nearby,and business class upstairs cant be beat,gong again on thhe same flight in sept,same airlinnes,only think asiana dropped out the menu first or bisnrss class was the blue label not even inn first class lounge in hkk anymore,othrwise still excellent when on 380-800

Have flown Asiana a number of times and have always been satisfied with their service.  I need assistance boarding and debarking, a service which is always there and efficient.  I will be returning to JFK mid next year and have already made my booking with Asiana.  Their prices are also very reasonable for the class of service I need.
The inflight service was very good! Stewardesses were very attentive to my needs. The food was delicious. And the wines selection excellent..

Good cancellation and change flight policies and friendly flight attendants. 
Seats were comfy and flight was on time.

My husband and I have been flying Asiana to the US since 2015. They have consistently great service and their loyalty points program is felt as a customer. On our second roundtrip flight, we went up to Gold status and our bag allowance was increased. Also, they gave us coupons to use the business lounge in Korea this year! For our trip last year, we were upgraded to business class from Korea to Manila, and their service was great! They have great service in economy,too, and good quality of products in their amenity kit. Comparing it to the Emirates amenity kit (we flew Emirates from South Africa to Manila), they had better quality. The earplugs were much better and the eye patch also had better quality. They flight crew was warm and their food was great as well. I like PAL, but honestly, I’d choose Asiana over PAL, unless you really want a nonstop flight.

We had an excellent flight. The service was faultless, polite and friendly. The food and wine selection was very good and the seats very comfortable. One of the nicest planes too, an A380 800 which Asiana are now using on their Sydney route. Would definitely fly with Asiana again. One thing only, as we were in the middle two seats I wanted to see shots of the pilots' views and the camera showing out the windows on my screen but nothing came. Never mind. Overall wonderful.

Decided to fly via Asiana since it has a flight from Clark which is very near our home. Though it has a long lay over in Incheon, you may use the pay lounges to sleep and eat. For the Incheon- LAX flight they have the new A380; it has wider leg room and very clean including the lavatory. The food is very good even if your are flying economy and they always serve juices and water. The flight attendants are very warm and helpful. You can never go wrong with Asiana!!!
Limited food range, limited entertainment programs; beautiful and handsome cabin crews, some providing friendly service, some not so.

Some years ago, I used to ride Asiana because of the wonderful service they offer on board. While this has diminished a little, together with their amenities, I still feel that it has something good to offer. The flight itself is uneventful. Food was average. The seat are not that spacious so I needed to purchase a better seat for the long haul. As usual, there is the difficulty to understand English announcements by the flight attendants. 

There is a long lay-over in the airport but Inchon has a very passenger-friendly airport. There is a space to sleep, eat or even take a shower.

I took a flight to Korea in the middle of the night from Hanoi, It took about 4 hours to flight. The seat was really comfortable. The amazing thing was there was power outlet to charge my phone during a long flight. Pilot was really amazing. It was a really nice taking off and landing. Flight attendants were really friendly and helpful. Some of them can speak Vietnamese, so it was really covenient for my mother when she needed something. Food was really delicious. I can tell that I was in love with Asiana Airlines
Great crew, very clean and well maintained aircraft.  Good in flight food.  Excellent service.  I will definitely fly Asiana again!

The airplane ride was smooth until we got closer to Seoul and it was bumpy and rough.
The food (BiBimBap) was okay, but not as good as the year before.  The stewardesses were attentive, always smiling and friendly.  The bathrooms needs additional cleaning since the under portion of the seats were pinkish in color.  It was a decent direct flight trip to and back from Seoul.
Comfortable seating, attentive and courteous cabin crew. Selection of food and beverages limited. In flight Entertainment extremely limited.

The flight was full but the seats were comfortable - decent leg room.  The food - esp the Korean selections were very good.   Nice amenties such as over the ear head set and tooth brushes.   the blankets were also soft and large.  It is a long haul but I would fly with Asiana again.

Pre-flight, things look precarious as I wasn't able to assign seat online until online check-in the night prior to the flight; and the call center was constantly busy when I called for seat assignment earlier. Arriving at FRA 4 hours before flight time, there was no one at the Asiana First check-in counter. So I went to the landside Luxx Lounge to chill. An hour later, I returned to the Asiana First counter. Everything changes to smooth sailing from that point on. The efficient and kind agent handled everything quickly and smoothly. Within 2 minutes, I was on my way to the LH Senator Lounge in Area B of Terminal 1. At 5pm, the boarding time printed on my board pass, I arrived at the gate. Showed the lady at the First Suite boarding line (no one in the queue at the time) my boarding pass, and within 1 minute, I was in the plane. As soon as I arrived at my seat, 3E, one FA, holding a few packages of OZ pajamas, asked me about my sizes. And I went into the bathroom to change right afterward.
Upon return to my seat, one of the FA was serving drinks already, and I ordered my favorite guava juice - delicious. Shortly afterward, they were serving champagne. Prior to the flight, I had read in Flyertalk that OZ downgraded their top champagne offering from Pol Roger Winston Churchill to Barons de Rothschild Brut. But I found the Rothschild just as tasty (in different ways, with different notes) as the Pol Roger, much to my relief.
The culinary offerings are fantastic, and I think the dishes on their Korean menus stand out more than the ones on the Western menus, with one exception, the caviar course, sumptuously presented with a mother-of-the-pearl spoon, blini, separately chopped egg yoks & egg whites and other scrupulously tasteful accompaniments - absolutely brilliant.
After dinner, an FA made the bed for me so I could catch up with some sleep. That's when I discovered one of the very handful shortcomings of Asiana's suite product: the bed really doesn't have enough paddings. Since 3F was not occupied, I just borrowed the blanket from it, increasing the padding and was able to sleep quite comfortably for a few hours.
As usual, the purser and the FA staff were wonderful: friendly, efficient, professional, poised and genuinely caring. Asiana should be proud of them.
11 hours passed quite quickly, and after a short break in the Asiana First Lounge at ICN, I would be ready for the sequel flight, ICN-LAX.

WE had a very pleasant, on time , experience with Asiana Air.  THe seats were comfortable,and the food was very good. Nothing to do airline food jokes about.  As opposed to other flights we have made to the Philippines on other airlines,which were terribly late at every leg.

The flight involved a lay-over at Inchon Airport,South Korea. Due to my height, flying Economy class for long hours(in this case,about 12-13 to Korea alone and then another 4 to the Philippines) provides a level of discomfort that does not allow for a restful trip. In contrast, the level of service and attentiveness exhibited by the flight attendants is unsurpassed. Between S.F. and Korea, 2 complete meals ( and between those,snacks) are served. I recommend this airline for trips to Asia and the far Pacific.

Cheapest possible economy flight but same smooth service.  I love the Korean food but there are alternatives on offer.  Stop over at Seoul Airport allows just enough time for a walk around the airport to keep the circulation going before the long flight to LA.

High quality service, everyone, counter people, agents, flight attendants showed high levels of professionality when customers got disgruntled and they took very kind care of me and my service dog. Great meals also.

Superior aircraft, superior suite, great food choices, really friendly, smiling cabin crew. 
Highly recommend.

In these days of crappy flying experiences this was a treat.  On Asiana's A 380 Economy class we felt far better than on any Air Canada Business class flight. The huge plane divided into smaller sections, each with its own galley, washrooms and attendants. Lot's of leg room, full recline and more. Good food and drinks, complimentary.
Long flight made palatable!
Well done, Asiana!
Peter B.

After a fabulous month in Vietnam, I got ready to check in my Asian flight for some time in Australia with my family.  I was advised there would be baggage fees, and I said, ""Fine, I was careful to weigh my bags, and they weigh less than 50 pounds"". I was then informed that there were fees, anyway, and after weighing my 2 bags, they informed me my fees would be $720 US Dollars.  I'm like, No Way, and that's insane, and was told I could always ship my things.  I'm in an airport in Saigon, and I asked, ""Where would I do that?"" and was told ""We don't know"".   Then I was told I could either pay the fees or leave my luggage there.  It was a nightmare, and one of my worst flying experiences.  Asian Airlines does not tell you of this fee before hand, so beware, and avoid traveling with them at all costs.

Having flown Economy HNL-Seoul-Delhi on the way out and being perfectly satisfied with the transportation but underwhelmed by the warmth of the in-flight service, we were luck enough to upgraded to Business for the Seoul-Honolulu leg.  Coming after a 7-hour layover in the wonderful Seoul Airport where we were able to use the Asiana transit lounge, listen to chamber orchestra music, and do Korean handicrafts, it was superb.
