The attendants were personable, the food and wine good, the seats comfortable, and the flight on-time.  At the end of 48 hours of travel, it was blessed.

This was my first flight with Asiana, and I would not hesitate to use them again. Check in was quick, and airline lounge facilities comfortable and well stocked with food, drink and hot showers if needed. The flight itself was smooth, on time, and comfortable: the lay-flat beds in particular were a boon on the long overnight segment. Service was excellent, and dining options were more than adequate.

First Class service on Asiana Airlines is truly First Class! I was impressed first by the very clear diction and slow, calm speech of the English speaking person who announced the flight. There was NO problem understanding what was being said, as can often be the case during international travel. Boarding was smooth and swift, and a choice of alcoholic or non-alcoholic beverage plus mixed nuts were offered while we waited to take off. The lovely, smiling flight attendants were professional, cordial, and truly attentive without being intrusive. A nine-course dinner and delicious breakfast, both delicious and served impeccably, left little to be desired. The lavatory was absolutely clean and neat each time I used it. All toiletries provided were in a nice, zippered kit of a higher quality than is sometimes the case, and the soft, comfortabe pajamas and slippers fit better than on other airlines. Not only does each First Class seat fold down into a complete iie-down bed, but each also has sliding doors to the aisle and a Do Not Disturb button that allow the passenger to have complete privacy, if desired. All seat and TV controls worked perfectly, and inflight wifi service was provided, including air to ground cell phone service (phone service is charged at $7/minute, but it's a nice option to have if you really need to reach someone when you're in the air). While we waited to board, the First Class lounge was beautiful, clean, and comfortable, and served a nice variety of free food and beverages. The flight departed  and arrived just a very few minutes late, but not enough to consider it ""delayed,"" and baggage was delivered promptly to the carousel. The two improvements I would suggest are 1) a thicker mattress pad and pillow, to make sleeping on the seat-folded-down-into-a-bed more comfortable, and 2) cabin temperature was a bit warm for me for sleeping, and I could not find an individual fan to blow on me during the night. Overall, a fabulous experience and one I highly recommend!

Cheapest flight available at the time, but next time I will spend more, and take a different airline. No one speaks English, the food is less than appetizing, and the service was mediocre at best. The headset did not work so the entertainment was useless.

Has not flown Asiana before but would definitely use this airline again.  Terrific service, good in-flight entertainment options and better than average airline food.  Food choices offered included both Korean and Western.  Korean dinner was terrific! Breakfast included standard western fare.

Many flights go through Seoul (Incheon) Airport - if you have a long layover, there are free tour options for 1 hour to 5 hour tours.  We took a four hour tour and it was FAB!  The airport itself offers several nice cultural displays and activities.

On a recent trip from California to Vietnam we flew Asiana Airlines in business class from Los Angeles to Seoul and then a connection to Hanoi.  The flight to Seoul was aboard the Airbus 380- itself a wonderful aircraft.   The in-flight experience was one of the best we have experienced.  The attendants were extremely attentive and the meal choices were truly excellent.  The seats were comfortable with all amenities.  The lounges at both LAX and Seoul were comfortable with ample food and beverage selections.  I wish US airlines could get their act together in the same manner.
We could actually sleep on the overnight flight home.  Asiana still gives enough legroom in economy class to allow comfort on a long, 10-hour flight.  The service was also excellent.

We have been flying with Asiana quite a few times so far, and every time our flights were smooth and easy, the crew always at your ready needs, very nice and amiable , but on the sorry note I would say that for westerners the food is not at par... On a long flight there is a good selection of movie s to choose from, mainly Asians ones....but overall you have a bigger space seat  for your legs and sides than other airlines ,so your flight is so much more comfortable...

Yes the business class had good seats of course but the attendants were not that friendly and I was quite surprised. When coming back, the attendants were more kind and I was in economy! 

I asked for a bottle of water and some mouthwash but they said water could be served only my cups and mouthwash had already run out! Is this what you would say to passangers even though I'm flying on a more expensive flight?

The service is excellent and food was better than other airline's economy meals. It was very clean and they provided extra amenities such as slippers, toothbrushes/toothpaste, moisturizer, etc.. my only complaint is that the chairs are not as comfortable during a 13 hour flight. It wasn't bad, just after 10 hours my lower back started to hurt and on another flight, the recliner was not working. I love the foot pedal that helps elevate your feet, though. I wouldn't mind flying with them again.

A380 from NY to Seoul; A321 from Seoul to Tokyo.  Wonderful service throughout, good inflight entertainment, fairly good food and a comfortable seat on the A380.   On the A380 I highly recommend selecting a seat closest to the window which leaves an arm rest between you and the aisle for more privacy.   The lounge in New York is the Swiss lounge at Terminal 1 which is only adequate and was very crowded when I was there.   The Business lounge in Seoul was very nice with a good food selection and a nice warm environment.  I was particularly impressed with the efficency of the boarding given that the A380 is so large - they station gate agents with signs to form cues for each class and premium classes are afforded their own airbridge which prevents the whole thing from descending into chaos.   A good choice.
Long flight but in Business you get your ""egg"" that can go horizontal and you get real sleep. Meals great, Flight attendants look after you really well.

Flight left on time and the service on board was good. If you are Gold Star Alliance the Asiana Lounge is available to you, but it is barely worth the trek to find it. A Place to sit down is about all it has.

I like this airline, but I never flew economy before on Asians, and the difference is vast. Still, the Korean hospitality and dedication to serve is there, attention to detail is there, but...it feels like many other airlines nothing special

I cannot thank Asiana Airlines enough for their exceptional service. Flying across the world alone with a 2 year old and a 4 month old is no simple task, but they certainly made is easier. They were there to help from start to finish. From the minute I got my boarding passes to walking me to my gate and putting my bags at my seat on the plane. THANK YOU for making my life a little easier during such a stressful time.
The ASIANA BUSINESS CLASS experience to Seoul was much much better than BRITISH AIRWAYS FIRST CLASS for less than half their price.  Only criticism  - the video selections were poor.

А!!!:
We flew from Seoul to Hong Kong in Economy class by the legendary Boeing 747-400, which was over 20 years old. The cabin though was in perfect condition, and clean. Departure was on time, arrival too. Service - at a high level. I will not say that there is something special, there are airlines that offer better service, but I liked everything. The hot meal was good, the flight attendants were courteous. Of course, there was an individual inflight entertainment system. Getting off the plane was fast.

We flew with Asiana again via Sth Korea in September. This airline would have to be one of the best for service,seats/beds & quality of their food. Whilst it takes longer to take this route to Los Angeles it is well worth it. It beats most of the others.

A380 from Los Angeles to Seoul - clean, food quite good, service excellent, cabin attendants' English was poor.  Seat pitch was OK for me (I have long legs), rather thn other carriers where my knees hit the seat ahead. The A380 was not any better than any other type of aircraft, just larger.
I'll fly Asiana again.

The service was  good overall, but not exceptional by any means. The staff of the airline, both cabin crew and airport staff, have a very limited command of English and communicating is difficult unless you speak Korean. The food, although prepared and presented nicely is decidedly Asian with no western dishes available. The Diabetic menu was not appetizing at all (I don't believe any chefs in the Airline industry understand Diabetics and Nutrition).  My wife is Asian, but did not like about 1/2 of the meals.

The seating in the Airbus 359 is very cramped and uncomfortable. The Audio headphones did not work properly on any of the flights. The seats on the Airbus 321 are also uncomfortable. Seating on the Boeing 767  were comfortable but did not have seat back TV's or any entertainment options of any kind.

The website does not explain that the handicap lounge in Inchon is NOT AVAILABLE for passengers on layovers  between flights. It is ONLY available for passengers who are traveling from Korea. Navigating the website is also very difficult and not friendly to any browser other than Internet Explorer (which I and most people dislike).

The ONLY thing Asiana has going for it is low cost..... but the other Airlines are competing strongly and I doubt I will travel with them again.

Asiana Airline is a good rating airline in terms of international survey but the passessger experience is so so. the Crew sometimes is least bother about any medical emergency if any passenger needs help. Firstly some of the crew hardly understand English. may be they know English but want to express that they dont understand. The Food is ok. Aircraft is good. I was in Boeing A330 Aircraft. The takeoff was on time. Food is nice but not excellent. The crew understands more of Korean than English So this might be a problem sometimes. The Entertainment is more of Korean then any regional Language. Overall I give this Airline 4/10.

The service needs improvement. No pre dinner drink service just a mad rush to feed you and turn the lights out.
Movie selection very limited unless you like violence and killing.

The service is inexistent. They don't even offer water. 
The chairs are terrible. They charge a lot for a suitcase.
Honestly its the worst airplane I had ever boarded. 
I know its the cheapest but it does come at a price. I rather pay more and fly with a company that at least pretend to care about passengers than fly with them again.

Pre-seating is always a must when I fly and Asiana did not disappoint as I was seated alone in a row of 3 seats. So that left me plenty of room to lie down for a 4 hour flight.
I do not usually take my meals onboard, hence, I could not rate on their in-flight service. However, the attendants were generally friendly & pleasant.

Comfortable flight.  Smooth check in.  Good lounge facilities.  Boarding was smooth.  The plane (A330-300) was wonderfully clean and well maintained. Seats were comfortable with good leg room for economy.  Inflight entertainment OK, but I would have like more choices.  Service was attentive and attendants spoke excellent English.  The meal choices were only mediocre to my taste.  Flight was perfectly on time.

My first time to fly Asiana.  I was looking forward to experiencing yet another top-rated Asian airline.  It was indeed good, but somehow lacking the warmth and caring of other top-ranked Asian airlines.  The check-in was very smooth and professional.  They use the Eva Air lounge service in Bangkok, which is outstanding.  Boarding was smooth and the plane (A330-300) was impeccably clean.  Seats were comfortable and legroom better than average.  I appreciated they provided a larger sized blanket, which was nice for the overnight flight.  In-flight entertainment choices were rather limited, so I didn't watch any movies or shorts.  My main ""issue"" is that the flight crew lacked warmth and friendliness.  They were perfectly professional, but seemed somewhat uncomfortable dealing with English-speaking customers and lacked attentiveness.  Meal of beef and rice was only OK (not bad, but nothing special).  Flight was perfectly on time.

I am extremely disappointed and dissatisfied with how Asiana Airlines treated my mom and I. I was bringing my dog into London from Osaka via Asiana airlines, as their website suggested, they can bring in the dogs to the passenger seat. Called them prior to buying my flight tickets just to make sure and they said we can purchase tickets for 200 USD and they suggested I raise a request after buying a ticket. After I called them several times, I bought the ticket on Expedia. After I purchased the tickets, I called them to raise a request, then they said I need to buy the cage in advance, in a certain size under their requirement, so I went to buy the cage and required information. Finally, I called them up again to raise a request again, they said actually they realized that they are unable to bring dogs into London and suggested that I should cancel the tickets. My mother called several times and all they said was that the only thing we can do left is to cancel the ticket and bare the cancellation cost(USD300). I am infuriated at how they give WRONG information to customers, make them take an action, and make them pay for Asiana's mistake. They did not apologize to me until I requested them to, and all they kept on saying in the beginning was go cancel via tripadvisor. I cannot describe how angry I am at them. I do NOT want to let my mother family or dog take a trip in that airplane that treats people like this.

I travelled from Seoul to London and back from Paris to Seoul.
You really start appreciating Asiana's seats when you fly with LATAM before boarding Asiana's flight. LATAM is cramped with narrow seats cause of their 3-4-3 seats arrangement. Asiana has 3-3-3 which automatically give you a wider seat. Not that much wider but it feels noticeably better than LATAM (and I guess other airlines using that 3-4-3).
Staff very attentive, but this is Korean culture so I'm not surprised. Even when the flight is at night and the majority of passangers is sleeping, the stewardesses make rounds with water and juice in case someone is thirsty. They do it from time to time. Also, Asiana offers a light snack in=between 2 main meals. 
In comparison to other airlines I flew with, Asiana's seat-screens are way smaller. they should exchange tchem to bigger. Come on, LG is korean, Samsung is Korean...hello?
Overall, pretty nice.

I had 12 hours of layover at Incheon Airport before my trip to the US, and the layover was really welcome because I had a free tour to several places in South Korea for free! Aside from my free tour, Asiana Airlines serves great tasting Korean food. The pillow, blanket, slippers, and toiletries provided also upped the comfort factor. Guests can really freshen up in the toilet, although the comb and toothbrush sets are no longer replenished so make sure to do your thing early so the supplies are still available.

I've been to 39 countries in the last 10 years and have flown a ton of miles on a dozen airlines or more. There are some I hate, there are some I tolerate, there are some I like, and there is only one that I love.  Asiana tops the list. It is soooooo much better than any airline in the US that it is embarrassing. The level of service and attention to detail, the totally professional staff made of nearly perfect flight attendants serving you supersedes anything I have experienced on other airlines, and that includes Korean Airlines which is frequently ranked higher. Admittedly, my experience is in business class and I do not pretend to know anything about the economy cabin. One thing I do know, it is cheaper to fly from Honolulu to Southeast Asia on Asiana in business class - assuming you catch the lower fares calendar and plan ahead - than it is to fly business or first class from Honolulu to the east coast of the US. It's the seats, it's the flight attendants, it's the comfort of the ride, its the cleanliness of the restrooms, the toothbrushes, the combs, the mouthwash, the snacks at any time - noodles, sandwiches. The quality of the food is good but not great.  It's the wine, it's the ginger ale, it's the assistance with connecting flights, and the flexibility in meeting your needs.....they have never said no to any request that I have made, and i have made a lot of requests.  My last comment is that there are a few times in my life that I enjoyed flying so much on an airline that I was sad to deplane after arrival.  That happens to me most of the time when I fly Asiana - over the last 60,000 or so of flying with them over these last three years.

This airline is my second choice after the Korean Air. 

For me the best thing about this airline is that they are part of Star Alliance Club. It seems that Star Alliance is much more useful that other clubs such as Sky Team where Korean Air belongs to. 

All in all, the service is good including food and everything but the entertainment system and other systems seem to be a little outdated meaning they do not really seem to spend too much money on getting the state of the art equipment.  Other than that..   very good choice for short/mid range distance family/business trip.

Mixed feelings about this airline. The main positive is the efficiency of the staff, we had four flights in total over a 2 week period and on every flight the staff were excellent. 
Unfortunately the food was very disappointing, bland and boring. 
The in flight entertainment was equally poor, a very limited selection and the same on every flight, 12 hours is a long time on a plane and entertainment is pretty important.
The flights were generally on time.
I'm not sure if I would fly with asiana again maybe if it was a short flight.
Flying from China to Korea doesn't take too much time. Asiana makes the journey more efficient so we can have more time to enjoy Korea. The Korean style beef with rice is quite delicious.

We took a flight from Beijing to Seoul on a connection to Tokyo. The service was great and we enjoyed great food and in flight entertainment. We were impressed by the airline we had never heard of before and would use them again if we head out to Asia. highly recommend the service and flight.

It was a short connection from Shanghai Pudong to Incheon Seoul.
It was a smooth flight, had enough leg space.

I had the travel to Phuket with my mother and daughter from Tokyo to Phuket (Transfer Inchon). And we had suprise!! My son ride same airplane. He came from USA to Phuket (Transfer Inchon). I asked Asiana Airlines that he sit the next seat of us. Asiana Airlines said ""Sure"". We were exiting and we had very happy vacation.
It is very nice service in the airplane and it is delicious in-flight meals.

Thank you very much, Asiana!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Flied from Inchon, South Korea to Delhi, India. Seats were in good condition but a little old. Had enough leg room. It had a good collection of movies but the charging plugs attached to the seats were not working. Luckily i had some charge left in my cell phone! Food served on board was hot and tasty. Drinks limited. Had a delayed departure ( 2 hrs delay) but the journey was comfortable.

Have been an Asiana flyer for twenty years. On my most recent trip from New York to Korea, business class on the A380, my fabric of my new Max Mara dress got ruined from contact with the velcro on the reclining chair. I provided proof of the dress tear and pictures of the seat that caused the fabric to get destroyed to Asiana customer service, but they are refusing to reimburse me for the torn dress. This is unacceptable service to a loyal Asiana customer who has provided valid proof and reasoning. I trust that I am not the only one who has experienced this problem, even if the problem may not have been voiced to their customer service department for a variety of reasons. I am thoroughly disappointed by this experience and will consider switching airlines for all future flights to Korea.

They threw away my advance choice of seat.

Long flight: A-380.  Worst aircraft.  You need to be a giant to reach the overhead, not enough restrooms, always lines.

Cebu to Incheon: No wi-fi, no electric plug at seat.  Incheon to JFK: Electric plug, no wi-fi.

Entertainment system: a few tired choices.  Take another airline if you want ""5000 channels.""

First meal: choice of ""steak"" or ""spicy beef.""  That's all.  Middle snack: Sandwich, unidentifiable meat, probably synthetic, cheapest cheese.  Last meal: Only chicken.

The seat was lumpy and uncomfortable on the 14 hour flight: still haven't recovered from that.

Flight was delayed, but they called us out of the lounge as if it were on time.  Unconscionable.

Good airline with clean and modern plane. The service level is good and the air stewardess are very friendly and helpful that provided excellent services on my flight. On flight entertainment system is easy to use with good picture quality.

First, if you are flying to Asia from the US, avoid US flagged carriers unless... you can afford Business Class (or someone else is paying your fare). Asiana, like every other asian based carrier I have flown, is really good. Unlike US carriers Asiana, actually treats economy class passengers like paying customers. We recently flew to China, by way of Seoul SK, on Asiana. We flew flight 203 from LA to ICN (Incheon Seoul) and the return flight 204 back to LA. The flight is an A380, so it carries a lot of people and takes a while to load. We were actually about an hour late leaving LA, but the flight was right on time on the return leg. Asiana has economy seats on the upper deck in a 2-4-2 arrangement, due to the curvature of the planes body, and on the main deck which is 3-4-3 on the return. Asiana has a standard 32"" pitch in economy, which is standard for most carriers, although United has 31 on their new 787's. Asiana does not offer an economy plus version. They do charge $100 extra for bulkhead seats that have extra legroom. their new A350's do have an economy plus section for about $100 more with extra legroom(but same seat width of 18""). 

Since Asiana only operates 1 flight a day from LAX to Seoul, checkin can be a bit hectic at LAX. But they had plenty of staff available to answer questions and direct you to the correct counter/line. At Incheon, Asiana has tons of self-checkin terminals. Just scan your passport, and it prints the boarding pass. Then just drop your bags (if checking bags) and proceed to customs. My wife and I each checked a bag, and the attendant who tagged our bags gave us a pass for expedited customs. Using that line took only 2 minutes to have our passports checked, and be security screened. I discovered there are self-checkin terminals at LAX for Asiana, but they are few and not obvious. Returning to LAX, I used the Mobile Passport App from Customs and Immigration. Apparently few new about this app, as there was no one in the line and we cleared customs in 2 minutes! At the baggage carousel, lets just say an A380 carries a lot of bags in addition to passengers, and it took some time for our bags to finally get there.

Their flight attendants are friendly and helpful. During the flights the flight attendants circulate through the cabin offering water or fruit juice.We ordered red wine with our dinner, and when I asked for a second glass, the attendant brought it with a half dozen snack packets. They offer a choice of a Korean meal, or a western meal for dinner shortly after takeoff. And on the la to Seoul leg either a western or Korean breakfast about 2 hours before landing. Since the Seoul to LA leg arrives in the afternoon the second meal was lunch, again wither Korean or western. I opted for the Korean dinner, and it was very tasty. Although Korean food is usually spicy, the meal came with a separate chili sauce, so you could adjust the level of spice and heat. I have heard some complain that the Asiana seats are harder than normal. I am not sure this is true, but, anytime you spend 12 hours in a coach seat your posterior will get tired! 

Overall I believe Asiana is a very good choice for flights to Asia. They are not quite at the level of Singapore or EVA Airlines, but if you normally fly UA, Delta or American, you will be amazed at how well you get treated even in economy. Oh, the price was $847 round trip from LAX to Beijing(via Seoul), and Shanghai to LA(via Seoul) on the return.

The business lounge in Incheon International Airport was quite cozy and nice. The quality of food being served at the lounge was somehow mediocre. Flight attendants are very attentive and well trained to provide quality service. Shop online and pick up in the plane service was really convenient! However, it seems they spend so much time and energy to ""sell"" duty free items.

Having flown a few times with Asiana Airlines recently, this being my first-long haul flight, I have consistently seen excellent customer service, even toward English-speaking passengers. I flew long-haul Heathrow to Seoul, then between Hong Kong and Seoul, and I am looking forward to my flight back to the UK soon.
 The food options were Korean when I was flying from the UK to Seoul, and between Hong Kong and Seoul. There was a western option available in both of my flights between HK and Seoul though. Drink options are plenty, and tea/coffee is served after each meal. It was nice and unexpected that a meal was served on just a 3 hour flight too. The food was tasty, comprising of a side dish, bread and butter, dessert cake, drink, metal cutlery, sauces (e.g. chilli paste for bibimbap) and ceramic bowls containing a meat-veg-rice-type meal. 
The entertainment on my long-haul flight was very dated, and the movie begun where the last person had finished, with no option to rewind! The quality of the screen was limited but I was surprised to see a few hollywood films that were released in the past year or so. I am glad I had netflix films on my tablet for the long-haul, and would recommend you bring options like this if you are big on watching films on flights, especially the 11-12hr ones! There is no wifi onboard any of the flights I had been on, but an option for onboard calls and aeroplane-ground was available for $1.50 or so. The flight between HK and Seoul however, had excellent entertainment, with a better resolution screen, better touchscreen capabilities and the remote you have to control everything was clearly newer. For every flight I was provided with average quality headphones, a blanket and average quality small pillow, and on the long haul flight I was provided slippers. No blindfolds for sleeping were provided however! The headphones use both slots for audio, so using my own earphones meant sound was only coming out of one ear, but this was surprising as it was onboard the newer aircraft. 
Generally, you'll find the decor very beige and not very modern, but I don't mind this so much, and for the main part of the flight the lights are usually dimmed enough to allow passengers to sleep. All of the screens have the option for the ""airshow"" which allows you to track the flight and see weather/time conditions in the place of origin and the destination. Everything was available or repeated in English, and the staff also spoke very good English. 
Overall, I would recommend Asiana Airlines!

The worst flight of my life,this was one leg of a round trip from Sydney, flying London to Seoul,for an Airline that certainly was not the cheapest we could have found,We flew to london with one bag each and on the return we had one extra bag a small carry on with gifts in, and even though with the extra bag we were still under our baggage allowance they wanted to charge AU $230 for the extra bag regardless of weight,(on their web site it is 2 bags each,but that's only in the USA ????, Next Our plane had to be their oldest plane still in service.Firstly and most important for a 10+ hour flight the seats were completely worn out,as soon as I sat, I felt the metal frame work through the cushion.the stewardess and flight manager could offer no solution,they tried swapping the seating from other seat's but they were all the same.The manager agreed the seats were worn out and the solution ended up being he placed six head pillows on mine and my wife's seat to try to lessen the discomfort,Add to this prehistoric entertainment equipment,a screen the size of an Iphone, lousy sound through the headphones and a control box that eats up half of you leg room!,we did not watch a single thing on the flight.The Seoul to Sydney flight was slightly  better but like every flight we took with Asiana it was delayed.The delays were from 1 hour to 4+ hours with no external cause,result=NEVER AGAIN WITH ASIANA

In June of 2017 I had spoken with customer service for Asiana Airlines regarding my disability.  I explained per the ADA I would need special accommodation regarding my health issues and that the boarding crew should be made aware.

On my flight home from Seuol to the USA on September 16th, I was denied boarding at the gate after I mentioned my disability issue to the gate agent and stated it should be noted in their system.   I was then taken to separate room that my GF was not allowed to enter ( she is a native Korean speaker) and my luggage was tossed, including my anti seizure meds. I almost missed my flight and was not given an explanation as to why.

My luggage and meds were not repacked and closed properly, I was just motioned to move on. I had to carry a half open suitcase and medical containers to the boarding area. I asked for a supervisor multiple times and was denied. I had doctors notes in hand, I ended up having a seizure during on the flight home. The in-flight crew was awesome and did their best to help, but regardless the issue happened.
I have filed a complaint with Asiana Air and varied parties and I am not sure what if anything will come of it.

Just wondering who were ddiving on this flight!  When the Captain announced about fasten seat belts as there would be a turbulence, the plane was a bit tilt to the left. I understood that this might happen from the bad weather.  However, when the plane was going to land touching the ground, it was such a loud and Big Bang while landing.  Such an inexperienced captain or pilot! The service and food were great, but would be better if the airline is not stingy to provide a bottle of water to each passengers for this 5 hours flight!!

Great airline and very professional and friendly staff- Asian airlines are always great in services. Ok going back to the review- it was a fairly empty flight- had the whole row to myself and dozed off for an hour or so. Crew are very polite and nice- I like their red apron and of course, the attention to detail is lovely. Before boarding, one Chief attendant waits outside and welcomes you in and he does the same when you leave. I like how they employ both young and older employees- I'm never a big fan of an airline that discriminates against older workers- it is about service and not about age or looks. Duty free items and purchases and bookings are quick and efficient. You can make a pre-order and pay in cash or credit card later. Legroom and seat is comfortable- I wish my flight was longer. One more little detail that I like are the airline's vomit bags- there is a sticky strip where it can be securely placed unlike the ones in Chinese airlines where you have to fold it etc. Comfortable but far too quick- I sometimes wish I could just sit there for a day and not know where to go.

Due to delay by Asiana ,arrived in Seoul at 11.30 pm (not 6.30 PM) for complimentary overnight stay, was told by the smiling  Asiana staff  desk that our transport was no longer available as it was so late,and we would  have  to make our own way to hotel,( which was an hour away) ""they could not organise a taxi  as they just dont do that for just two people"" 
After an exhausting 26 hour travel day ,I just about ""blew it"" I could not believe the lousy customer service after a delay caused by them.We would never ever think about flying with Asiana again.

This was my first time flying with Asiana airlines. My expectations were minimal.  I did read a lot of reviews though.  The flight itself was very good.  We pretty much just ate, watch movie and sleep.  The flight crew was very nice and they look so cute in their uniform.  The only gripe I have is the air inside the plane.  It was hot.  Good thing I brought a fan with me.  I didn't even need to use my blanket 😓

On the way to Thailand we had managed to upgrade the second leg, the 14hour flight from S. Korea to Bangkok.We had a 2 leg trip on the way back too, Bangkok - Incheon, South Korea and Incheon, South Korea - Toronto. We tried to upgrade on the way back too. But Asiana Air informed us they can only upgrade both legs of the journey not just one, so we asked the price of both flights being upgraded? To which we were told, even though they have premium economy and business class seats available, we can only pay for the first part of the trip with Asiana Airmiles (how would I have enough of those if any?), they don't accept cash or credit cards for an upgrade.
I don't know what type of plane it was, but when you sit in the seats your knees touch the back of the other chair. Service was OK although english announcements were rushed and hard to understand.
So when we got to S. Korea we immediately went to Aisiana Airlines Customer Service desk and were quickly sent away, with them saying that this leg is run by Air Canada and we need to speak to them instead. Air Canada tells us we can't upgrade through them because Asiana made the booking. After speaking to manager after manager over the phone the answer was clear. They can see our upgrade history from the way up and can charge us the same for premium economy, but they don't have any seats available. And they have business seats available but they don't know how much to charge us and therefore they would not sell the seats. 
Anyway, not impressed by the lack of help and knowledge of supposedly trained staff who have to deal with international people all the time.
Outstanding in flight comfort and services. Staff was very polite and caring. Good food and beverages. Excellent ambiance.

Yep- love this airline. Again, attention to detail with the polite staff who are very professional and know what customer service is. Chief Attendants waits outside to greet and say goodbye to you. People who stand up while the seat belt sign is still on are very politely reminded by the crew not to- unlike United where the crew screams and treat you like garbage. Full flight -wish it could be longer. Received the duty free items without fuss. Many people travelled with babies and they are well looked after by the crew. Excellent check in and tripods are allowed on board. One little rant: I like the packaging and design + attention on little things- the plastic cover to their food  has the slogan "" Expanding your horizons beautifully- it's more than a gloal network...it's a connection"" accompanied by drawings of international landmarks...nice! It will be great if they can provide English Newspapers and get their flight crew to wear the Hanbok. PS: I wonder what brank of make up the crew uses- their skin looks great

The service and attitude of Asiana's flight attendants crew to Korea was far superior than the American Airlines crew on my flight home.  They are never rude and seek to understand and assist you if you can.  I have not flown international in a while, so I was reminded again why to not choose a window or middle seat.

Really comfortable flight and amazing food (for an airline) if you like Korean dishes. The stop over in Incheon was also fun as there are plenty of food and shopping options on offer. Highly recommended.
I already came in by Asiana from NRT the same morning. I was satiesfied, and wondering that this flight was even better. There is nothing to claim, just to enjoy.

This is my first time to fly from Jakarta to Seoul. I had a comfortable flight, the seat was spacious, the breakfast was good, and they even serve sandwich at night. In-flight entertainment was also good. Although I just found out few days before leaving that they only allow one check-in baggage, I end up put 2 of my luggage as check-in baggage because they allow me :D Overall a good experience.
Staff were very helpful in sorting out my flight with no fuss. It was a pleasure flying with them and I will be using their airline next time.
Comfortable seats, nice food, courteous flight attendants, plenty of different entretainment options.

I always use Asiana Airlines. Their service and facility are very good. 
But at this trip plane is too old, small monitor, not good seat. 
I wish Asiana Airlines have much newest plane soon, and replace with oldest.
Asiana is known for its world class service. The flight attendants were very kind and helpful. On-board entertainment was good enough.

Overall a really great airline.  The staff are attentive, they're more than happy to help you, they don't constantly run into you like a lot of the Asia airlines and the seats and leg room are good.  The Western film selection was a bit limited on the first leg, but from Seoul to San Fran it was comprehensive, and the WiFi on the plane worked amazing, for US $22 for 24 hours this is a great deal for business travellers on a long haul.  Breakfast is not too appealing, porridge or omelet, and the dinner would be much better with salt and pepper, but it's all acceptable on a flight.

I am writing this reply completely incensed and thoroughly angry you made this rather rash and assumptive assessment of my posting. And I even booked this flight through TripAdvisor. Not only are you completely wrong instating I copied and pasted this, but that it contains anything short of my own personal writings and experiences. I demand an immediate apology! Do you think the average person is incapable of writing coherently and concisely enough to be understood? Or that anyone has enough education and intelligence to make such assessments? You have insulted me and I do appreciate it one bit. After providing many other similar reviews to you in the past, I am at a loss why you chose to take such an approach to this particular review. Is it perhaps because you have a relationship with Asiana Airlines, and don't wish to publish such a negative view of their poor services? Whatever your poor judgement, YOU are in error. To prove my point, I have included a copy of my ticket showing I actually took this trip I wrote about. Let's understand one thing, reviews of any and every company, including Trip Advisor can and WILL be done to protect and advise consumers. I await your apology and retraction of your poor choice and bad decision making.

One of the gustatory pleasures of having a long haul flight, even though we had this airlines a few years back due to the FA's hospitality and helpfulness. Our booking agency recommended having a Korean carrier because it was cheaper than our local carrier and Korean standard was much different than you know who. Our agent also had it fixed for my child to have a kids meal as she was not used to having Korean food then, but my husband and I had the feast for our eyes and party in our tummy with the variety of foods that we were served during the flight. We told ourselves that having a stop over in Incheon is not an issue at all because the SK airport is bustling but clean, you will never get bored. You get your money's worth and more
Great experience, friendly service,inded staff, but Asiana needs to upgrade their fleet. To many old planes

Great flight for a great price! The food was delicious (even though there was only one option, unless you requested one in advance), and there were lots of recent movies for the inflight entertainment. I was able to ask for a window seat, and was able to sleep for most of the trip. I would fly Asiana again!
Never bored during 12 hours non-stop flight from US to Seoul. Excellent Services and Entertainment!!!
Double decker airplane. comfortable seats. the food was not up to par  but it was ""decent"" Flight attendants very efficient and courteous..

Flew with Asiana when I moved back home from Japan and because the organization I worked for paid for my flight home (up until a certain price), I decided to try business class for the first time. I have a plethora of back problems so having a lie-flat seat by the window was a huge relief for me. Lots of space and everything was very comfortable. The food was delicious (and the lettuce wraps were so much fun to eat!) and flight attendants were attentive without being too much. They offered an entire menu of food and drinks to choose from and also provided a very filling breakfast before we landed. I would definitely fly with them again!

I have flown Asiana and a couple other international airlines to/from Asia. While I like them all, Asiana is my favorite. Fantastic and friendly service and good food. Domestic airlines (in the US) do not compare to Asiana at all. If you're going to Asia, I highly recommend this airline. It's worth it even if you may save more money on another carrier.

A great airline still focusing on quality customer service. Having the electronic check-in at Incheon airport was interesting, but the queue to then drop the bags off was very long. Staff recognised this and diverted some of us into other counters set-up for Asiana, so overall the check-in process was good. Boarding was smooth and the service in flight is top quality, good choice of food and drinks, staff was attentive with regular water and juice throughout the flight. Would have liked more choices with the in-flight entertainment. Overall, great airline and would highly recommend them for travelling to Asia.

The flight itself was comfortable enough for a 10 hour flight but they definitely need to be more organized.  When boarding, there was just one line (first come first serve basis) except for business or first class.  Then during food service, they ran out of one of the dishes so we really didn't have a choice in our meal.  Lastly, the flight attendants could have been more helpful with putting our luggage in the overhead.  Overall, the flight was average.
Perfect. Nothing to complain. Pretty comfortable. On time. I really enjoyed tracing the flight on the monitor.

Going on our anniversary trip to Hochi Min City from Seoul and the seats were comfortable and the staff was great and was a please to ride on this airline and its not the first time I have been on this airline and its nice to see that the standards of service were great compared to the US brands. I recommend

My flight from LA to Incheon was amazing, mostly due to the lack of people on the plane. This flight was about 2/3 full maybe less and this allowed me to sleep on three seats by myself for a good portion of the flight. The leg room was pretty good sitting next to the window and is average for international flying. The in-flight entertainment was great. It had a good number of movies and recent releases. The food was good. They had two choices one more Korean and one more American. The flight attendants were nice and accommodating. They quickly got me the meal that I slept through. The airline provides slippers which I enjoyed. I would fly Asiana again. It is cheaper than Korean air and still great quality.

For the past 3 years I have been fortunate enough to have gone to Viet Nam. Each time I have flown with Asiana Airlines, I love the great service. I go from LAX to SGN, Ho Chi Minh City (Saigon) and travel up North and fly out of Ha Noi. The food is GREAT, the service is AWESOME!!! They fly into Incheon Airport then then on to Viet Nam. I have been impressed with each of the airports. I love flying, even though it is a LONG flight, the staff makes it really enjoyable!! Thank YOU Asiana Air. _

Reasonable prized, good legroom, very good service, overall recommended. (Note: transfer with China Eastern to Shanghai). If you have a transfer (same day) ask for the free city tour (last one around 3 p.m.!) recommended MeuterMedia

This was our third flight with them in 12 months. The plane for the flight between Japan and Seoul seems to be much nicer than the one for the long haul to Paris. There's a USB to charge your phone that isn't usually found on the longer flights. Overall, the service is good and the meals aren't bad. I prefer the Korean-style option because it seems tastier. The selection of movies is ok and you don't have a choice of when you can watch it because they play on a cycle and you can't pause them. This was the same for our trip to India and to Canada. I guess that's one of the reasons the flights are a little cheaper. We were disappointed to find out that our flight did not qualify for our star alliance points. If we had known ahead of time, we would have joined the Asiana program.

It was only a 4 hour flight but I've taken Asiana  before and it surely beats United or any other U.S. carrier for that matter. The planes are newer, the flight attendants friendlier and the food is eatable. I would take this airline as a preferred airline if given a choice.

Asiana is our pick every time when we go to Asia.  We usually fly economy because we are willing to be uncomfortable for a few hours and save a couple of thousand that we can use for something else when we get there.  Economy on Asiana is better than any other we have found and the service compares favorably with other airlines' first and business classes.  The meals are far better than other airlines and offer a choice of Western or Korean meals.  The staff from baggage check to flight crew are a pleasure to deal with.

Flew the large new Airbus with two levels. On both outbound and inbound flights only a few people in Business Class.  Full flat seats.  I'm 6'2"" so just a smidge too short when full flat. Fair entertainment selection, but enough for the long flight. Excellent food and service. My only issue was there were no personal air vents and I tend to run a little hot, so I got warm when sleeping.

This wasn't my first time flying on Asiana, I flew last year and had a great flight and again this year. The staff are always pleasant and helpful. The plane is always clean and comfortable. The food was good but can use improvement. In flight movies are good, the music selection is not that good, most of the music was asian and not in English. Overall the flight is good and leaves on time.
Airline is always punctual. service and food always good. seats are comfortable. baggage is processed promptly. cabin staff are always polite and impeccably dressed.

Between the airport wait times in the comfortable lounges, the expedited security clearance and the 180 degree, spacious, comfortable bed and amazing service, these flights were absolutely wonderful. Arrived refreshed, showered, no jet lag!!  WORTH EVERY PENNY! Lounges here and overseas stocked with everything from hot/cold food and drink to computers/printers, massage chairs from Brookstone, etc. Showers bathrooms in lounges between flights meant a change into clean clothes and feeling wonderful at final destination. Food was not only delicious - one was given a choice of American or Asian menus. Food provided at customer requested times too. Can't say enough about these flights NY to S. Korea, Vietnam, Cambodia, Thailand .

Flight entertainment was on as the flight was preparing to take off (after safety video of course) and never turn off even as we landed. Some airlines must turn off entertainment as they land and really frustrating to just miss last few minutes of a movie. Service staff was great. Food was not bad.

It is cheaper to fly Asiana for the same route compare to SQ. 
The food served is quite good, and the in-flight entertainment system provided a good selections of movie.
A very well known airline as to be the best kid friendly! Cabin crews are very attentive to passengers traveling with young children.
Flown this Korean airline a few times and service and hostess has been great. Its new A350's are also very comfortable.
A lot of space for legs, comfortable seats, very attentive service and good meal.  Entertainment system was only on back flight.
Smooth check-in, on-time departure, good service with tasty Korean meals. Looking forward to flying Asiana again.Actually flew in October 2012.

The service was good even though it was a short flight (around an hour plus). The options of many flights a day is much welcomed. Only issue was at the Gimpo airport since there were many passengers. Rather a busy airport.

I was on this flight with my family, including 7 months son. Flight attendants were very friendly and cared us during entire flight. It was midnight departure flight, so maybe easier than day flight for my son. However, their baby meal was awesome and bassinet was great. Aircraft was little bit old, but I guess it is still much better than US Airlines.

Whenever I need to fly to Seoul, Korea, this is the airline that I use.  The service is excellent with very attentive flight crews.  The business class chair will allow you to lie down completely flat.  It's not the most comfortable bed, but good enough for me.  The food used to be excellent, but I was disappointed with the quality of the food.  They served good wine during the flight.

The flight to Incheon (ICN) was delayed by 15 mins and we left at 2:15 am.   The flight was smooth and we arrived at almost 8am.  After about 6 hours layover, we continued on our journey to Sapporo.  We spent the hours in the ICN airport by taking a nap and go shopping (this will be another review).  We left ICN for CTS on time and arrived CTS almost on time.  Overall the flight was great.  
Coming back, there was no direct flight from ICN to CEB and we had to stay the night at Seoul (we chose two nights).  The only drawback of this misconnection is we had to apply for visa as we would go out of the airport (although you can stay at the airport for almost 20 hours!!).  Bonus is to be able to visit another mega city.

Check in was a breeze in Manila. The business class lounge in Manila is kind of shabby, consistent with the generally low level of facilities in Manila. The 3-hour flight to Incheon was very comfortable. The business class lounge at Incheon is much larger and nicer, with a variety of available seating arrangements, some with partial privacy. The food available was not too varied. There were fresh salad items that were quite good, and did not change over the 10 hours I was there. Very limited protein options. Lots of cup 'o noodles, which I am personally not willing to eat. The long flight to SFO was wonderful. You can actually lay fully down - well as a 5'4"" man I had no problem laying fully flat. Lots of great entertainment choices. Nice minor amenities. Decent storage space. Each seat in business class has a nice amount of privacy.
Everything was good except the meal, they were poor texture and taste of the meat and rice as well as the dessert. Pls improve asap.

Asiana has always been my go to airline for trips to Seoul. The flights are on time. The food is Korean style bi-bim-bab rice bowls which have alot of vegetables and impossible to mess up even on inflight microwaves. Coach is not spacious but compared to other airlines feels luxurious.
The food is very perfect! And the service is also good. The only few small drawbacks are the choices of movies are not many and the flight attendants English is not very good.

Was switched to this flight when weather cancelled my Cathy Pacific flight.  The aircraft looked to be past its use by date, very worn interior, ancient entertainment system with highly limited selection of movies and the screen barely visible.  Wine selection was not good, managed to get one tiny glass with meal, meals less than inspiring.  Pleasant attentive cabin crew, but I would avoid flying with this airline again given any sort of alternative choice being available.
Asiana is one of my favorite airlines. The service is outstanding. The onboard food is great and they have a great entertainment section.
The service was great, and the seat was comfortable during 13 hour flight from Chicago to South Korea. The only complaint was about the movie selection: they had lack of movie choice.

Asia published promotional fares for the newest member of their fleet, the Airbus 380.  Round trip airfare was very affordable and the quality of service was superb. Boarding procedure was overly and seats have more leg room than average airlines traveling this route.

Incheon International Airport is an added attraction.  They have lounge chairs and free shower as part of their transit amenities. This is a real plus.

The terminal staff and airplane crew were absolutely professional. They were extremely helpful and polite and made sure that I was comfortable and that my needs were met. The food was well prepared and tasty and served in a timely and efficient manner. I thoroughly enjoyed my flight and would highly recommend using this airline in the future.

My wife and I flew in business from NY JFK to Seoul. I had never flown with Asiana before but knew that Asiana had a good reputation. The food and service was excellent. Attendants were quick to respond and professional. I recommend getting the ramen for snack during mid flight. With fully lie flat seats, sleeping was not a problem. My seat was spacious but the one lacking feature was storage space for small personal bag especially in the center seats. The a380 has 1-2-1 configuration and window seats have alternating configurations. The best window seat has easy access to side storage while center seats have barely any. One other small complaint is the lack of privacy screen between the two middle seats. However, I would fly again with Asiana and the overall experience is many times better than on any U.S. airline biz.

We made a connection in Seoul. The flight from LA to Incheon was super smooth with A380. I believe the legroom is larger than Boeing 777, which is a plus for a 12 hour long haul flight. Nice service and above average food. The flight from ICN to Beijing was less comfortable since the legroom and seat are not as large as A380, but I can care less since it was only 1.5 hours.
One of the best airlines that I have ever flown on. Have flown on this airline several times. It is the airline that I prefer over all others.

Asiana is one of the best options for flying from the midwest USA to Asia.  The economy class seats are very spacious and lean back quite far.  Both meals have options for western or Korean style, flight crew are extremely courteous and accommodating.  The planes, being a little older, have plenty of room for stretching your legs (remember the good old days of air travel when people wen't packed in like cattle?!- Asiana's fleet is like that, at least from Chicago to Seoul) which is very, very nice on a 14 hour long haul flight.  Baggage policies are very generous, which is nice, too, because we travel with kids.    10/10 would recommend.

Due to family emergency, I had to book an international flight which will leave in about 8 hours. I was expecting a higher air fare but I got a pretty good deal. Because of the cheap fare, I was expecting that this flight will have a lot of inconveniences but I was wrong. Though the equipment are somewhat dated, the seats were comfortable and the service is excellent! I'll use this airline again.
I was blown away with the service and how new and clean the aircraft was compared to our airlines in America .

Their flight attendants are very attentive to the needs of their customers. They are 
always on the ball and very pleasant. You can tell that they all love their job from the way they respond to the needs of their customers, no matter how petty or small their customers' needs are. I would fly with them again.

ive flown Cathay and Eva air on same route( and know of friends flown Korean Air). Nothing bad but nothing to make me go back either,,esp compared to competitors. Ony alchohol is 1 red and 1 white wine. Food was just ok. movie selections limited..seemed like same options in july as our return flite yesterday late august. 1st time booking my family of 3 where we werent seated together..i didnt even check as just assumed together( and wasnt told otherwise). flite attendant just said likely was no available room when i told him of this situation
superb - lots of space, superb seat, great service, and the catering was as good as many a good restaurant. We will choose to fly Asiana in preference to most other airlines when we can

We decided to fly Asiana based on overall rating and the reputation of the airline. I've flown business class on numerous routes to Asia from US and could' help to compare.
1. Flight was delayed due to ""flight connection"", not clear on the definition, but gate agents kept repeating the message without clear estimated departure time.
2. Seats were comfortable, had power plug options including USB outlets with plenty of lighting for individual reading
3. Entertain screen was good, but selection of movies were limited compared to other international careers.
4. Food taste was good for Korean food items, but bit small amount and left bit hungry compared to other international  careers with class of services.
5. Snacks fir between meals were limited. Some airlines would have it out in the galley area for self service, but this flight didn't have any.
6. Flight crew service was good and responsive, but no proactive question to ask if any water is needed when passengers were not sleeping.  when I rang the button, flight crew was very responsive.
 
Overall good, but can't help being disappointed since I was expecting lot more. But my family enjoyed the flight and service.

Utter chaos.  Boarding time came and went.  No communication whatsoever.  Sign in front of boarding gate read DELAYED, with no updated time.  Flight notification didn't work, obviously.  For a Star Alliance Gold member, I would expect a bit more level of service.  Then, arrival in Seoul (Gimpo), to add to the misery, a remote stand, and bus to the terminal - an extra 25 minutes delay.  NEVER AGAIN, Asiana.  Korean Air - on time, strives for your business, extra care.

I like flying with Asiana. Not really a super preference over other transpacific Asian-based airlines that I fly with, i.e. Cathay, ANA, China airlines, Korean Air, Singapore. It's just that their pricing seems to be more competitive than the others when I'm shopping for fares.

They use a modern Airbus A380-800 on this route. Great seats on the upper level (2-4-2 layout). Quiet plane, great entertainment, delicious food for economy class and decent leg room for an average sized person (5'10"", 170 lbs).

Recommended, but than again to me it's all about the airlines that are using Airbus A380 on anything longer than 10 hour flights;)

I was flying back to Tashkent with this airline and the Uzbeks always bring on WAY too much stuff with them and they also have a lot of hold luggage which means it can take a while to get your bag out the other end but thats not the airline's fault. I have now been on two flights with Asiana and to be honest I found it better than Korean Air, now many of my Korean friends would be quick to argue with that but I found that the Asiana flight attendants were always going up and down the aisles making sure that everyone was ok. They were also very kind and it seemed to be genuine and not fake. The food was also very nice and tasty. As for entertainment their selection amazing (Turkish flights sometimes have like 360 movies to choose from) but I preferred the lower number because I wasn't overwhelmed by the sheer number of movies.

Traveled business class on Asiana from Los Angeles to Delhi with a change of plane in Seoul. From LA to Seoul, it was a Dreamliner. Very comfortable business class seats. Fully reclined. Excellent cabin crew. Paid attention to the  littlest detail. Kept the toilets clean and well stocked with tooth brushes and mouth wash. Entertainment system was good, though felt the choice of movies could be better. Food was excellent. Drinks were all top shelf. After a flight  delay in Seoul, continued to Delhi. Different  plane, seats half reclined. Still wonderful experience. Will travel Asiana again.

Flew in from Seoul to San Francisco. It was one of the worst flights on an old plane, perhaps from 10 years ago. The seat was filthy and uncleaned. We caught lice from sitting on them and were scratching out heads throughout the next few days. 
Very old and poor entertainment system, difficult to use, and the screens had the resolution of very old gameboy game consoles. We did not watch anything as nothing was watchable. 
The food was the only part better than Korean Airlines. 
I was so surprised by this on a flight which I thought would have received particularly special attention, since it is heading to San Francisco /Silicon Valley.
Asiana is heading downhill, fast and their international marketing (esp for online, emailers) is very poorly managed.
I receive another promo email today, and their biggest news is they'll give you a water bottle if you reserve a seat on their smartium economy seat. Child's play. Come on~!

I went to SEA and chose Asiana on purpose due to scheduling, reviews and price.  As a I am 6'2"" and weigh 220, I was hoping that economy would not be too brutal, and it was not.  The staff was super courteous, the aircraft of newer vintage and clean.  I would fly with them again without hesitation.

I write this message because I would like to share with you my experience with Asiana Airlines. It indeed seems to me important to congratulate a service when this one is excellent. I am often using Asiana Airlines on this routing: Incheon - San Francisco - Incheon once a year.
Aircraft used B 777-300 ER.
I was also very impressed by the quality of the service assured by the stewardesses always attentive to all our needs. They were courteous extremely, always loan to do a service and of a breathtaking reactivity! What especially marked me concerning them it is that in spite of their impeccable professionalism.
My only problem is the choices of movies and audio. Asiana will need to upgrade its entertainment system. But rather than that, everything is wonderful.
I love the Korean menu option. 
San Francisco to Seoul Incheon on Asiana's Business Smartium class. Fully-flat 180deg. Seating Asiana Airlines has introduced many years ago the Business Smartium Class, 1 - 2 - 1 giving you a bit of privacy if you select the aisle seats.
great experience. never had that much before with any other airline. very gentle and polite staff and highly professional
The 'Smartium"" flat bed seat really make the difference of this aircraft. Great food selection, great cabin staff, great entertainment selection and comfy flat bed.

JFK-ICN-MNL, HKG-ICN-JFK. Flew on the A380, B747, and B777.

Two long-haul and two short-haul flights with Asiana and everything was smooth. I sat on the upper deck on both of the flights from JFK to ICN and back. I highly recommend the last row on the upper deck as you feel less guilty reclining your seat (the recline was extremely generous) and you get an entire side cabinet all to yourself. Legroom on the A380 was fantastic, and so much more so on the older 747 and 777. Entertainment options across the board was considerably poor, there were only a few recent movies and basically no relevant TV shows. But I was lucky enough that they were actually some content I was still interested in, although not much has changed on the return flight so I literally watched the same movies on the way back.

Despite the poor IFE, what Asiana shines at (and most Asian airlines) is service. The flight attendants are extremely polite, helpful, and friendly. All of my requests were properly and promptly taken care of. On average, my service button was answered within ten seconds. Another thing that they excel at are the meals. All meals on all sectors were simply fantastic. These are meals that I would actually want to eat on the ground. The bibimbap as usual is fantastic, and so are the western meals that they offer. Snacks and drinks in between was available upon request 

Overall, a fantastic option if you're flying to Asia from North America, especially if you can get a seat on the upper deck of the A380. They are a very close second favorite international airline, right after Singapore. Fantastic service, great meals, and usually one of the cheapest options out there make them a no-brainer. Just bring an iPad or a good book for entertainment.

Traveling solo with a toddler is always a daunting experience, but I decided to go ahead and book with Asiana not only for the price, but for the length of total travel also.  Saving a few more hundred dollars in exchange for a 20-hour layover in China was NOT in my plans, especially considering that I had my daughter in tow. 

The flight from Osaka to Incheon was seamless, and even with the short flight, a hot snack was provided and drink service as well.  The CA's frequently went up and down the aisles offering more drinks to those who needed it (definitely a plus, considering that I'm always using LCC's to get around Japan). 

The flight from Incheon to LAX was also similar, in that we had two full meals provided, and plenty of beverage opportunities throughout the flight.  The in-flight entertainment was good selection for both my daughter and I, as well as ample legroom for me to stretch out.  My only gripe, however, is that the bottom of the seats where you rest your bum are a bit flat, and so fatigue can easily kick in if you don't have something to support (extra pillow or rolled up blanket for the lumbar).  Other than that, we had a very pleasant flight going to LAX as well as returning back.  Couldn't be happier, considering the price:time value.  Will definitely consider using this airline in the future!

Our experience flying with Asiana from New York to Vietnam (with a stop in Seoul, Korea) was overall very good: the seats were comfortable, the food was ok and the attendants during the flights were attentive. However, we had one incident that ruined the rest of the experience. During our wait for our connecting flight from Seoul to New York, we had to wait from 5:20 am to 10:30 am. We were asked to check in our carry on before we left from Hanoi to Seoul because the flight was full, so we did not have any jackets to warm us up. Therefore, after unsuccessfully looking for a store to buy some blankets, I approached to Asiana Business Class lounge for help. Upon my request, a hostess brought two blankets but after finding out that I needed to take these blankets out of the business class lounge, she refused to let me borrow them. Because of the language barrier (she spoke very little English), all she kept replying was “sorry”. We understand the business class gets certain perks, but blankets are a basic need for a 5-hour layover. We were deeply dissatisfied with how we were treated in this occasion and made us not enjoy the overall experience.

It seems to me that the airline itself needs to brush up their organization skills.  Our flight got delayed and they told us that more information would be given to us ASAP.  A while later, we saw that they were letting people in without any boarding announcements.

When we sat down, they gave us drinks.  Honestly, I have never seen glasses that small before.  Two sips of OJ and then they took our glasses away.  They had a tendency to stay until we finished our drinks which made us uneasy.

While waiting for the plane to take off, during the delay, they didn't offer us any snacks or more drinks and yet we were in BC.   English is still a challenge to them.  There were times that we didn't know what they were talking about.  

The aircraft was very old and stinky.   And the food was not fresh (see pictures).  The attendants were generally friendly.  

Before boarding, we went to the lounge.  It was huge but very dirty and noisy.  Food was not covered and there were only limited choices of drinks.  It was so funny that you could still experience the shoveling inside the lounge in the food area.

The day that my family is coming home from 3week-long vacation from Incheon to San Francisco, my wife got quite sick. 11-hour journey would have been hell having sick for few hours already. But kind crew members of the Asiana OZ212 made the trip much more tolerable. Especially Cabin Crew Captain Eunyoung Choi stopped by many times asking for her condition and brought medicine, extra pillow, blankets etc. I travel at least once a year on Asiana for the last 7 years. I always marvel at their kindness... Thanks a lot, Asiana

Last time I will fly economy on a long flight, Half was thru the flight the restroom were filthy and stayed that way until we landed.  Now we fly on Airlines whose base is in US or there are some others that we do fly but this airline, we will not fly again.  It was a bargain and I can see why.

I am already building my mileage with Asiana. Despite the incident that had happened years ago at SFO. I still feel that Asiana Airlines gives very good service. I have boarded many times different western airlines but Asiana is one of those asian carriers that provide good flying experience even for economy passengers.  Had a wonderful experience also of getting upgraded to business class (for FREE, since it was a full flight) from ICN-MNL -- as an Asiana Club member (with a considerable amount of mileage--of course).

Over the course of the last month I've flown Asiana (Business Class) four times: LAX-Seoul, Seoul-Ho Chi Minh City, Singapore-Seoul, and Seoul-LAX. 

All in all, Asiana is an excellent airline, with fantastic service and in-flight dining. For the cost, their business class experience is hard to beat. 

I do have some gripes, though: for a modern, sophisticated airline from such a technologically advanced country (South Korea), the lack of in-flight Wifi on all of their international routes is quite disappointing. Especially in 2017—several airlines offered Wifi on international routes over 3 years ago. 

Additionally, the business class equipment itself—from the seats to the amenities kits—leave a little to be desired. They are not quite as modern, well-designed, or luxurious as one would expect. 

Ultimately, however, Asiana offers a great value for the money, and I would recommend it to international travelers who don't mind being without internet connectivity for extended periods of time.

Since I started using Asiana Airlines a few years ago, I wouldnt use any other airline when going for a visit to Cebu, Philippines. Asiana Airlines have good leg room, comfortable chairs. You never go hungry on Asiana Airlines. They serve 2 meals and a snacks for my international long flight. They give free earpiece for the entertainment, a blanket, disposable slippers, eye cover, toothbrush & toothpaste. The flight attendants give exceptional service- They are nice, helpful, friendly, constantly going around asking if you want water,coffee,tea or juice during meals & in between. Asiana Airlines simply THE BEST!

I travelled to seoul many time on business trips and use Asiana Airline along with others but found Asiana best considering customer support, food availability, attendants attitude towards customer and overall cleanliness.
I would recommend this airline for korea travel.

I took a midnight flight from HK to Seoul.
Everything was o.k.
It was a better choice than taking buget airlines.

We have flown many airlines (mostly Star Alliance) all over the world, and it is hard to surprise us anymore.  However, we were really blown away by the amazing service provided by the Asiana flight attendants in Business Class.  They were exceptionally warm and attentive, and it seemed like there were always multiple flight attendants available.

The seats were comfortable and we slept well, and the food and entertainment system were good.  It also seemed like the restrooms were cleaned regularly throughout the flight, which was much appreciated!  The food service (food and wine pairing) on the flight back from Seoul to LAX was unique and the flight attendants were clearly enjoying it as well.

It is easy to see why Asiana gets a 5-Star rating from airlinequality.com!

We always like flying with Asian airlines but Asiana is truly great. They have attentive service and they even serve meals on flights that only last 1,5 hours. They have great entertainment and the cabin crew is extremely friendy. Will fly again with them in a heartbeat.

This was a wonderful flight!  The plane was clean and had comfortable seats.  The flight attendants were very courteous and able to speak English, Chinese, and Korean.  The meals offered during the flights were delicious and filling.  Free movies, games, and music made for a enjoyable flight.  There was no use of wi-fi while in the air, but with the other entertainment it wasn't terribly missed.

We have been boarded to this airline on our 2 consecutive years of visiting the US and we always had a consistent service. Comfortable seats, good food and always a delight to be with the company of beautiful smiling Asian women.

The flight was very smooth. The crew were very welcoming. There was a large legroom compared to other airlines. The food was very good. It was indeed authentic Korean style. You will definitely feel the Korean comfort on board. It was such a nice experiencing.

We spent a month in Asia focusing on budget friendly airlines (not naming any names) so we got very accustomed to being nickel and dimed, crammed, ignored and feeling like an inconvenience to the flight crew.

On our flight to Seoul from Tokyo we were treated to a premium in economy seats. We didn't pay more than a hundred bucks for our flight yet we were treated to ultra wide seats and ample knee room (as a tall, burly man this was a huge asset after cramming myself into Asian sized sardine seats for a month). Each seat was powered with a charging outlet and it's own entertainment system and to top it off WE GOT A HOT MEAL! No begging for peanuts or 4.00 bottle of water, a true honest to god meal served to us minutes after reaching cruising altitude. 

The attendants were beautiful, sweet, impeccably dresses and used their free time to wander the aisles asking customers whether they need anything else. 

I can't even expect this level of service on a trans-pacific flight, yet asiana airlines is able to provide it on one and two hour flights. 100% impressed and I don't know how they do it but will absolutely fly with them again
Good service, attentive staff, on time schedule.  I would wish they had more snack options during the 11+ hour flight.

Came with an Emirates Sliver status : not accepted ! Then couldn't find my Priority Pass card, staff couldn't care less, not even a hint at something anywhere close to ""let's see if we can help and find your record"" ! #BadService ! (The lounge is really average, nothing special about it ...)

The crew on board from Singapore to Incheon n back was superb. Kudos to air hostess who double blanket me when he saw i was feeling to cold. The food serve was also nice with great service. The seat was comfortable and spacious.
Only regret they keep pushing us to do auto check in for 3 times despite asking for help and the check in counter was vacant. The lady keep pushing us until we trll her off to get the manager to follow us to the automated machine and see why we can't check in. The manager confirmed that we cannot check in and finally escorted us to manual check in only after almost 45minutes despite being very early.
The lady manager in charge should have allow us to check in at the counter and insisted we see the lady in charge at the auto check in machine, which he had seen snd also busy attending to others. Hope they will clean this mess and attend to help and not just push us away.

About a year and a half ago, we flew Asiana from ICN to HNL.  We loved the airline then (it was a A330); therefore, we were excited that this segment, it was on the A380.  I must say their service has gone downhill from our last flight.  First of all, the boarding was not smooth in ICN (granted, this was a higher capacity airlines), as they would announce the boarding in unintelligible English so everyone was all over the place.  Once we got on-board, the crew was pleasant but the food was a big disappointment.  Those of us who opted for western food felt that the meat was bland and overcooked.  I had the Korean dish which was not good at all.  Their service was haphazard, where one side of the plane would be served completely and almost done with their meal and the other side just beginning to be served.  Granted it was a full flight, but I think the service was much better last time around.  In-flight entertainment was OK, I thought the selection of western movies were quite limited as compared to other airlines we were on during this trip (EVA, Thai, and even United).  The flight crew were all nice and pleasant, but appeared exhausted and tired was the best way I can describe the experience.  As for food, which used to be their strong point, is now their Achilles heal (at least on this flight).

I've been a big fan of Star Alliance brand and Asiana was one of them and Asiana provided fantastic service for business travelers. Their lounge has been great. 

However recently this airline is going downhill by removing few quality of service to their loyal customers.  In flight service for business class is rather pushed over and following standard routines only rather than providing travel comfort suited to individual customers. They do not come to you unless you call them and it seemed like they are always busy with something but not really were attentive at all compared to other airlines. 

Asiana lounge in ICN is always packed after they have changed their lounge to priority pass compatible.

Overall I'm getting more dissatisfaction than opposite so I'm thinking of switching to Singapore within Star Alliance.

My first international flight experience. The flight was an overnight flight from New York City to Ichion Korea . Take off time was on time. The stewardess were very curtious  and nice. For economy the service was first class. The choice of meals were great and the food good.the flight was smooth as possible. Arrivel time was on time. The roundtrip with Asiana airline's was a wonderful experience. I highly recommend this airline.

Scores well on my list from check in, Boarding, Cabin crews and overall meal quality.
