If they can improve safety through better pilot training, they would get my five stars.

If some flights are very nice and plaisants some personnals at board think they are queen in the plane we need to remember them than without customers they havem't a job, also stay plaisant and quiet with passengers

Very nice first class suites ,with doors to close when you are ready for bed.
The shower suites where nice and air condition ,most of them are to hot and humid.
The lunge in Incheon international airport was was nice treat to shower and to take a nap in between flights.

The pilot's technique was perfect! The take off from Hong Kong International Airport was very stable and it didn't feel like taking off at all. The landing at Incheon International Airport was the same. Usually, there would be a lot of bumping feeling after landing an airport, but the plane landed smoothly as if nothing happened.

Pleasant flight. Staff very attentive. Very quick to accommodate passengers. 
typical flight food but nice.

We booked ""exit aisle"" seats, which give considerable leg space (at a reasonable cost). Staff are friendly and efficient. The plane is pretty much standard and so is the flight, non eventful, as it should be. The only area that is below standard is the food ; particularly the ""pizza in a box"" looked and tasted like cardboard.
overall not bad, the disadvantages part will be their English is very poor. not really understand when they speak English.

My flight was Bangkok to Soul, Soul to Los Angeles.From check in, boarding and the service on board were excellent. The food is really good, especially the coffee. From Bangkok to Soul was an older BOEING 777/200 with an outdated business class.The long flight was then in an A380-800. My first choice airline, if they have a flight to my destination.
I used First Suite of A380. First Suite has an independent flat seat with sliding door and very large TV(check the homepage of asiana airlines). Food and service all are very great.

Flied Asiana Airlines several times.  The service you are provided from the ticket counter to in flight is superb.  It feels they are willing to go above and beyond to ensure you they provide you exceptional services.  My flights are over 20 hours one way so it is imperative that I am comfortable.  They provide you with eye mask, ear plugs and slippers as extras on economy.  The seats are spacious and wide. They also offer many movies and tv shows to watch.  The food they offered was also good and plentiful and if you needed a snack in between meals, they do not hesitate to provide it for you.  Overall, my experiences with Asiana Airlines is exceptional and will continue to fly with them wherever I go.
new air plane with more better space compare other air lines. service and food was excellent. crew were so kind and media service is recent and good quality.

Flew in Asiana's A380 in Business Class on the upper deck, JFK to ICN, with a connection to Asiana B777, from ICN to HAN.  Very comfortable seating/flat bed on both aircraft.  Excellent food with choice of Korean or western cuisine (I tried the Korean - delicious).  Very attentive, cordial service.  Excellent business class lounge facilities at JFK and ICN.

One of my favorite airlines and part of the Star Alliance which allowed me to use United miles for a Business Class seat. The lie flat seats, the great food and attentive service sets this airline miles above any of the US carriers. The cabin was very comfortable and the seat pods had everything you could ask for in storage space, legroom and entertainment system.

Staff- Well mannered, polite, pleasant, friendly and absolutely accommodating. I sat in Economy and was treated like a First Class passenger. They are helpful and don't seem bothered AT ALL. They were dressed neatly and their smiles never faded.
Aircraft- Roomy, seats were actually pretty comfortable even with a bag underneath the seat. Clean, flight attendants clean the areas and the bathrooms pretty regularly. 
Food- Delicious. They offered a varying options from Bibimbop, Congee, Pasta, Chicken and Omelet. I am a picky eater, and I was pleased by the amount of options provided.
Enter and Exit of Aircraft- Smooth. It was orderly and fast. 
Entertainment- Plenty of recent movies on the flights! From Beauty and the Beast to Hidden Figures. They had a great amount of movies.

It was an overnight flight from phuket to Seoul however its comfort and very good service and facility. Get window seat as expected. Airline limited only one luggage loading the rest must hand carry to the cabin head store. Crew was helpful. However very impress with service on the way back when I were stop at custom not allow to carry a bottle of lotion on flight then staff help to loading one more pack. 
During the flight was made us flight-hen due to aircraft was fall in the air pocket which I never experienced this before  however caption was well control and inform of bad weather condition. Finally we arrival home safely. Thanks gods😇

Nothing significant to complain of. Both ground and flight crews were helpful and kind, and the cabin was very clean. Economy class meals for Asiana short-distance had been miserable before, but has improved greatly(JAL or Korean Air is much better, though). In-flight duty free is convenient, and on some wines you can enjoy great discounts (I've purchased one at nearly 70% discounted price compared to market). 
No personal video screen on this flight(available on business class though), which was no problem for me but may be important for some travellers. Also, beer and wine were not available, which was slightly disappointing but acceptable due to short flight time.

We took the red-eye flight at 12:05 am aboard the new A350 aircraft and arrived Seoul at 5:10 am. The aircraft had ample leg room and we were seated very comfortably considering we were in economy. There was in-flight wifi service and each seat had its own entertainment system. The cabin crew were smartly dressed and efficient. The stewardesses on our side of the aircraft spoke English pretty clearly. They kept the washrooms clean and usable. Over-all, the flight was a relaxed one which, despite its early arrival in Seoul, kept us less fatigued and ready to explore the city.
As a disabled traveller my treatment by the airline simply could not have been better. The inflight food in Economy was far better than several other major airlines I have travelled with.

I have booked a flight and look for a very cheap flight since I will be shouldering the expenses. My budget is not to go over PHP50,000. 

Alas! After a lot of searching, I was able to find a flight that suits my budget.  When I search the internet, i started browsing for cheap flights and started to compare all the fares plus I take into considerations as well the dates since there are days that are cheap and there are days that are too expensive. 

Patience is a talent when searching for a cheap flight. 

Hope this helps😀

Gate 29 at incheon International is one of those gates that are hidden, and seem like a mystery gate.  When we found the gate about an hour prior to flight time it was located downstairs, and people were sleeping in all the seats.  There was no real indication of how we would board, where we would wait, nothing.  Even the atmosphere seemed filled with dispar.
When we boarded, each of us with two carry-on bags, we had to walk down a staircase onto the shuttle bus, then carry our luggage up the stairs to the airplane.  I have no idea what would happen if I were not able to lift my luggage for these moves.  If you are having mobility issues I highly recommend you check with the airline to get additional assistance.

This flight was pretty much what one might expect for a 2 1/2 hour economy hop.  The seats were ok, boarding was pretty much  a Crowd push onto the aircraft, and the Korean food we were served was simply ordinary.  One of the things about flying in Asia is that every announcement is given in at least three languages so it seems they go on forever.  This flight was on an Airbus (I think it was the A320) which offers 2/4/2 seating.  My bride and I got a two at the window, which was great.
Immigration and customs required the usual half mile trek, but overall the Korean process was easy.

At first sight one may find that the seats are a bit old and that the chair may not work, however the smile on the Korean stewardess & stewards are very welcoming and they are extremely helpful even though English is not a first language. Helping with passengers with the carry on luggage, assisting in belting up family with kids and one would expect this surely but its the way that its carried out with such politeness and patience! I have flown with them about 3 times now and always think the idea of a BimBimbeap  to have as a meal on a flight is a dream and super delicious as most of this dish served in their country or others are in super hot urns so that its keeps it hot and makes the rice go crisp. Asiana does it in a slighty different style and still just as good! So the end result is if you wanna go for average interiors but great service and pricing then Asiana is it!

I had never flown Asiana before so didn't know what to expect. I hate being stuck in the middle seat, especially for a long flight, but that is what happens to most women when they fly with their husbands. So I was preparing for the worst.

Surprisingly, the flight had so much leg room in economy that I was perfectly comfortable in the middle seat! That's a first, especially since US carriers, at least, have been squashing seats closer together to add to their profits. I will use this carrier whenever I can.

My husband and I were seated in row 74, seats K and J on Asiana's Airbus A380-800 upper deck. After a bad flight to Asia on United from LAX, being on Asiana for the flight back was fantastic. The seats are huge compared to United, and the service was top notch. The upper deck was also great. My husband was also quite happy.

The flight attendants were very neatly dressed and everyone was stylish.  The lady attendants had their nails painted in the uniform color of beige!  The announcements (in English) were had to understand, though with heavy accents.  They need to practice English pronunciation better.  The flight itself was all right.  I had cheap roundtrip tickets ($660), and when I tried to change the date for my return trip, I was to pay $2000 on one day, and $5000 in a few days afterward.  That was horrible.

Flown from Singapore to Dalian via Korea. Have to say I expected a bit more of the Asiana Airline, the staff do hardly speak English and they do think you have to eat what they say if there is a choice than I expect the choice I choose not to be argued about it.
The choice was Beef or Fish and I wanted Fish, the stewardess actually argued with me that I should eat beef instead of Fish.The Entertainment program is a joke, Asiana is good flying inside Korea but not International flights the staff is not trained well enough in Service and Language.I would also say the staff is arrogant.  Not everyone speaks Korean. The Airline also need to keep up the cleanliness, my blanket was dirty and had 3 long black Hairs on the pillow from the previous flight.

The flight was 11.5 hours, the plane was 380, 800, new plane it holds 495
passengers. For a long flight it could not have been better, food, seat comfort,
Leg room were great. Customer service was also great. We also flew the same
airline from from Manila to Seoul. There was a smaller plane, 4.5 hour flight
and the service was great there also.

It was generally a good flight.  Plane left chicago around midnight and landed around 3 am in incheon(leaving at 11:55pm Friday and landed on 3 am sunday).  Essentially it feels like you lost a whole day but it was easier to recover from jet lag.   Food was decent and entertainment screen was really old.  However, service from flight crew were great. Very friendly and professional.

Asiana provides excellent Asian service levels with great attention to the details.  We enjoyed all aspects of this flight including the enclosed suites, food, wine, and quality of staff.  

Although we still prefer a couple of other airlines to Asia, I would not hesitate to fly Asiana over United or American.

The BKK to ICN leg was aweful. Old battered B777 in a 2-3-2 configuration with old business class seats. Food was also terrible coming out of Bangkok. Probably Thai Airways kitchen food.

But a totally different airline from ICN to JFK on the A380. Fantastic business class with super service from the cabin staff. And a 7 course dinner meal served on real china plates that was out of this world. Has got to be one of the best business class services in the sky.

I think OZ is losing sight of their market, or maybe they don't want their existing market. There was always an idea that an Eastern airline would want to encourage westerners by providing western-oriented food choices. By contrast Western airlines could provide anything. OZ is now not providing simple western food. For me, the Korean option is fine so the western doesn't matter. But for people who don't like or want spicy food there used to be a standard of steak in J. Now all the long haul options are spicy, or unusual in some way -see my comments on chicken breast and cheesy potatoes served in maple syrup. Really? On my return flight from NRT the short haul food was fine and the service excellent, and personal. The long haul was good but not as good as it was. The lavatories weren't 100 per cent for example, there was no chocolate, the champagne was warm. No deal breakers but looked to me as though the eye is no longer on the ball

I flew from the Phils to Chicago via Asiana Airlines. It was a good journey except for 2 things. The first one is uncotrollable which is the turbulence but the 2nd one, I do hope they can do something about it - the entertainment part, you will have a minimal choices when it comes to movies unlike the other airlines I flew. That's the only thing that I think they can do something and improve upon. 

The food was great - I am not a Kpop fanatic but I have been to Korea and I loved their food. 

The staff are approachable and helpful. 

Hoping next time I fly via Asiana- it wilk have a lot of choices for entertainment since that's the only thing you can do when you have a 13hrs flight aside from sleeping😀

Ps. Below are the photos of some food that was served.

I have only flown short haul flights with Asiana, between Seoul and Japan and Daegu and Jeju.  Comfortable flights with good service.  The website is, however, rather difficult to use for booking flights.

I have flown Asiana airlines a few times, mostly from Japan to Korea. Those flights we above average, good service, good food, overall a fairly good  experience. This long flight from SFO to INC proved to be too much for the  crew. Being a long flight bathrooms can be a problem and on this flight they were. We were not even halfway and the trash bin was overflowing. The crew was very professional and welcoming but I think they didn't enough people to cover everything. Towards the last two hours of the flight the bathrooms were finally cleaned but by the end of the flight it was a disaster once again.

On the 777 the crew worked hard but didn't really engage with pax. Drinks flowed like thick treacle. For example the dinner was preceded by a cocktail, fine. But when dinner appeared, the cocktail glass went and no offer of wine was given. The crew went out front to prepare each paxs  meal, and brought each back individually, not on the usual tea trolley.  So choices were fixed- if you were offered cheese, that's what you got, not knowing  there was an option of fruit. My wife didn't  want the snack main course, and thus got nothing because nothing was offered.  A let down!
On the 321, personal service, offering of alternatives, charm and a feeling of "" nothing's too much trouble"".
A colleague in Yorkshire got the same feelings- automaton on the long haul, and charm on the short haul.

I received dozens of emails from Asiana begging me to try their new A350. As one of their routes was Seoul-Manila, I decided to take up on their offer and adjusted my upcoming business trip accordingly.

When I showed up at the airport, boom! You’ve guessed it; the aircraft has changed to an A330.

At first, the check-in agent didn’t even bother to tell me the reason. When I asked, she said it was because of some kind of a “connection problem”; they don’t even care. The A330 was in a decrepit condition with grainy screen and seat adjustments that didn’t work properly.

On the return trip, the check-in agent informed me that the flight would be delayed by 15 mintues due to a “connection problem”; we ended up taking off an hour late. 
It was an old B777 and as soon as getting into my seat, I was informed that that IFE system was broken; no real surprise there. I asked about the charging port, and an FA said it would work when we’re airborne. You’ve guessed it; it didn’t. The attendant apologized that she was misinformed. After a mediocre meal, I asked for a cup of Americano, as the menu indicated there was an an espresso machine on board. You’ve guessed it; it didn’t work either.

I fly regularly with Asiana just because my company is one of their corporate customers. However, I believe they are no longer a 5-star airline. The sad thing is that they used to be good; what made them undergo this downward spiral in the past decade or so is anyone’s guess.

I connected in Seoul for the second leg of my trip to L.A.
The aircraft as an A380 and the business class configuration was awesome. The overall space of the individual cubicle is sufficient and the lie flat bed accommodated my 6'2"" frame with ease. The onboard service was great! The staff to passenger ratio was high this allowing for the level of attention I have come to appreciate but not expect in air travel. The food in both presentation and taste was superb. Finally the Asiana lounge deserves the high ranking accorded it.
Overall a wonderful travel experience thanks to Asiana airlines.

I paid $600 plus and I know its an awesome price since we're four in the family...But make sure that you have snacks in your handbag... The flight from LAX to Korea is 13 plus hours, they served food an hour after the take off, and the gap between the next meal is 9 hours, so if you're diabetic flying with them, be ready to bring lil snacks or chocs in your bag coz even though you ask for a can of soda, the flight attendants wont give you any... On the contrary, the flight between Korea to MNL was awesome, great food were served since it's an over 4 hrs flight...Their lounge in Korea Airport was also a plus, free internet, shower, lounging chair, kid's playroom and a decent place to stay for long layovers...Another, upon check-in , I'm not sure if we were served with an unfriendly attendant or it's really the overall airline culture, but I hope they will have more accommodating staff since they offer services...

this is my second time to take a cheap one way flight from Clark to Charlotte my flight is smooth  and my experiences with flight attendants were awesome I like the Korean/Asian Food Selection and both my experiences were on time flight. my connections from New York to Charlotte NC isn't haggard having to fly with Jetblue codeshare with this airline. I will fly with them again . cons: restroom for long flight  at the last 3-5 hours needed to be cleaned. legroom is fine if  your front seater is considerate enough not to do alot of reclining, they got lots of empty seats except with this flight someone stole my 2 empty seats & disgustingly put her feet next to me argh!!!

We flew this airline as a family and were very happy to receive the great assistance at the airport by the check-in staff. The staff was courteous and helpful. We also used the lounge service and it was just one of the best. The in-flight service was great too and the crew quite attentive. Thanks for the great flight Asiana!

We experienced flying via this airline (Boeing 787) with more leg room for you to stretch out.  This airline is one of the biggest I experienced flying which can carry about 700 passengers with al least two (2) baggage aloud - newest and you will not experience bouncing around while it encounters turbulence up to 30,000 feet above the ground.

I tried to make a reservation online through the FlyAsiana.com website, and when I attempted to pay for my ticket, there was an error message. So I tried again, with the same result. I switched to the Asiana iOS app and again saw an error. When I checked my Asiana Club profile on the website, it now showed 2 active reservations and duplicate paid tickets for the same flight. I called Asiana customer service in Los Angeles (where I live), was placed on hold for approximately 20 minutes, and was then told by the representative that I would need to call the Asiana office in CHINA to void the duplicate ticket. Of course, when I attempted to call the China office, they were closed. This lack of quality service is unbelievable. Is anybody at Asiana interested in doing the right thing by one of their customers and fixing this situation without forcing their customer to make international phone calls and waste their time?

I had booked the flight through SkyScanner and got a good (cheap) deal, so my expectations were pretty low to begin with. However, Asiana exceeded all of my expectations and more. We arrive at Sydney airport and the check in counter was a breeze. Although there was a line, all the check in counters were open, so we were moved through pretty quickly. Boarding was seamless and timely, and we had realised that we were possibly given a free upgrade to our own row on the upper deck of the A380. I'm not sure if it was 'Premium Economy', but compared to Qantas, Air New Zealand etc, the seats seemed way wider and comfier than regular economy, and came with complementary blanket, eye mask, pillow, slippers, ear plugs, toothbrush/toothpaste, bottle of water etc. Our row had plenty of side-bin storage which meant not needing to store our small bag underneath our seat. 

We were served two meals and multiple light snacks on the flight. The meals were of tasty quality. Unlimited drinks ranging from soft drinks to wine and beer during the flight, which we ordered any time we felt like by pressing the cabin crew button. Free mixed nuts/bar snacks with each drink. Entertainment system in seat had a wide variety filled with current stuff and classics. I didn't need to touch my ipad the entire flight. 

Staff to Passenger ratio was excellent, and we did not feel neglected or second rate at all, even when they were cleaning up tray tables after meal services. Toilets were great. Even when there was a wait, it was the opportunity to stand up and stretch the legs. 

Disembarking the plane was met with enthusiastic goodbye's and thank you's in Korean and English by the cabin crew. 

Having flown many airlines around the world, Asiana may not yet be quite the BEST in the world, but it is getting close to being up there with Emirates and Etihad etc. I know that it completely exceeded all of my expectations and it was worth every dollar of the great deal. I will 100% fly Asiana again when I return to Seoul.

We were disappointed after having sets in business to discover they had changed aircraft and we did not have seats that stretched parallel to the floor.  Instead this 747 had seats that slanted to the ground.

The service crew was less polite and attentive than on other Asiana flights, so perhaps it was a bad evening.

The check-in agents were late (i.e. we waited for them to arrive at the check in counter) and then very disorganized.  The flight was fair.  They had changed aircraft, and consequently sets, which were not as comfortable as expected.

I find the airline better then an USA Airline. The staff is always friendly and professional. The flight attendant are dressed exteremly proffessional I thin maybe the USA carriers could learn from the international ones. I just wish the seat were moree comfortable and had more legroom.
This was the first time I've flown with Asiana and they were really wonderful. The long flights are hard to find a good airline - and they did a great job!

Compared for instance to Emirates, where the flight attendants do speak English adequately--but don't get along with or speak to each other--and don't work more than the bare minimum, Asiana is a refreshing change.  Here, they all are attractive, cooperate with each other, and are very active and seek to be helpful.  Unfortunately, this is basically one of those ""non English speaking"" airlines.

On the flight to ICN, no wi-fi, no reason explained.  That's a long time to be out of touch!  On ICN-CEB, no electricity at seat, hence of course no wi-fi.  

Plus my reading light did not work.  At least 4 flight attendants involved themselves in this problem.  Mostly, they had crazy ideas, such as ""I will go and reset it"" and turning on the entertainment system.  Finally, when we were close to landing, another one jiggled with the light--and made it work.  I couldn't have done that because I was in the aisle seat, though it was the most logical way to address the problem.

An old Korean man across the way complained to them that my empty Diet Coke can had spilled on his sock.  I told them I had nothing to do with it, but that if he wanted to sue me, that was fine.  I was hoping to fight him in the jetway, but no such luck.

Hassle free transport SFO<>ICN with plenty of food, decent seating, punctual takeoff and landing, well maintained cabin and restrooms, timely boarding, smooth flight on 777, etc.  However, the cabin crew appeared to be verging on manic as it came to performing their job which was off-putting and flight deck announcements could not be heard.  We were really looking forward to trying well-regarded Asiana since our favorite (Singapore Airlines) does not fly directly to Seoul from SFO any longer and we wished to compare.  No comparison.  Singapore beats Asiana by every standard of measurement.

The flight attendants were very classy in appearance and demeanor. Because I have Celiac Disease, I had emailed the airline about 3 weeks before my flight to inquire about gluten free options during my flight.  I had a reply in less than 24 hrs assuring me they would care for me. I had no sooner boarded the plane when the flight attendant greeted me by name so as to know for certain I was the one who needed GF meals. At time of meal service during flights, I was served  a hot and, I must say, rather delicious, GF meal separately. This happened  for all 6 meals during both departure and return flights.

I have to say that the journey was long, but for the price and service this was a good deal. The only complaint is coming from the softness of the seat. The second sector Seoul to Bangkok was 6 hrs 30, and when your back hurt after 2 hrs it is not so good.
Despite this for an Asian carrier, I had quite a lot of room leg. Normally my knees touch the front seat. The service was good, and catering was ok.

Some of the in-seat movie consoles were broken. The food was good and the people were friendly. One of our suitcases never made it on the plane from a connecting airline. That wasn't Asiana's fault. BUT, Asiana gave me a HUGE run around here in Manila. I had to follow up, drive down to the airport twice, write letters, call the offices repeatedly to get any action. Asiana Manila was not able to call internationally to Seattle b/c they didn't have long distance service. The connecting airline located it right away and sent it to Seattle but Asiana denied it and then the luggage was lost for a couple of weeks. After I spent many hours and several weeks, they finally found my luggage.

Flight out to Seoul was very windy so some parts of the flight were bumpy, but nothing extraordinary.
Flight back to Paris was delayed at departure due to heavy air traffic.  But the rest of the flight went perfectly well. 
In-flight food was very tasty and staff were helful when needed.
Space for legs was sufficient even for long legs.  The cover and pillow provided were nice and warm and much appreciated.
I'm sure I'll use this airline again as long as I don't have to go through Paris.  I honestly, truly, dislike that CDG airport !!

We were luckily upgraded to business class for our flight so my overall rating may be off because of that however I was impressed! The seats were huge and reclined to optimize your sleeping. Great in flight entertainment and the food and service was excellent. I would definitely fly Asiana again, however I'd probably want to do business class!

I like my flight with this airline. Served nice food and beverages. Flight attendants also very attentive and supportive.  I slept and they did not make noise in order not to wake me up until serving food. Then when I woke up they asked me what I want and bring separately.
Inflight entertainment and other conditions also were good

Flying biz class in an A-330 is a little bit of heaven, especially when you are dog tired.  The Asiana stewardesses are all a perfect 10......they look and dress impeccably and they always wear a smile.  They provided us with awesome service during the entire 11 hour flight.  US airlines cannot compete.

We were in business class on an Asiana A-330 that was supposed to have comfortable seats per their company info......""This model, developed by the Airbus Corporation, is optimized for operation along long-distance routes and is installed with fully automatic, bed-style premium business class seats with an almost completely horizontal recline and 58 inches between each seat.""
These seats are, in fact, very, very uncomfortable.  The seats are NOT bed-style unless your bed is like an ironing board sloped at a 30 degree angle!  We heard other people complaining about how bad their seats were and how they could not sleep or rest due to how uncomfortable they were.  The biggest reason the seats are terrible is that you feel like you are always sliding down towards the floor since the semi-flat seat slopes at such a noticeable angle, even with the foot rest deployed. These expensive seats made our 5-6 hour red-eye flight to ICN very memorable, for the wrong reason!

What almost made up for the seats were the fabulous flight attendants; they are superb!

Compare with others airlines I took before (Singapore Airlines, Eva Air) which is under star alliance member, Asiana airlines might need some improvement especially for the comfortable of plane. For the Check in service also took slightly longer and I understood that's long queue for too many passenger. Overall is good. Steward is good and nice.

This is one of the few times when I wouldn't have minded if the flight were longer.  The flight was in Asiana's A380.  The cabin crew hit it out of the park with the service: efficient and with the utmost respect and politeness.  They always had a smile.  I went with the Korean meal selections and the dinner was fantastic.  But probably should have gone with another selection for breakfast as the Korean rice porridge was only so so.  The upper deck business class of theA380 comes with its own ""social area"", although I didn't see anyone use it.  One of the bathrooms was also extraordinarily large.  Seating was also very comfortable and did not feel as cramped as the EVA business class seats.  However, I have to give EVA the edge in terms of the flight amenities kit.  EVA give you a Riwona kit whereas Asiana was pretty bland.  But I go back to the Asiana service--it could not have been better.  Congratulations on a fine product, Asiana!

Amazing service. The flight attendants were so kind, accommodating, and super friendly. I forgot to change my meal plan to vegetarian and they went out of their way to accommodate me with and alternative veggie meal. They made sure the food was okay and I was satisfied with it. The flight provides slippers, pillows, and a blanket as well. I had enough leg room and the lavatories were clean.

1st time taking Asiana Airlines from Changi Airport to Incheon Airport. Actually we (two person) are asking a window and aisle seat. Myself is asking for vegetarian and normal meal. Overall the meal is not bad but of course has many room for improvement.
The entertainment selection is not much. I can only view 1/2 the show and the entertainment was cut-off as I think the captain wanted the passengers to have a nice rest.
In term of landing, the pilot is good in the landing.

This was my first International Flight since 1966. I opted for Asiana because they had a direct flight to Seoul. I figured I could do without the hassle of changing flights, especially in another country. 

I paid extra for the bulkhead seats. Only drawback is that you don't have a charger in the bulkhead seats. But that didn't end up mattering because there isn't any wifi. 

The flight to Korea they provided slippers, eye masks and earplugs. We were served a choice of water or mandarin oj throughout the flight. We had 2 meals and a snack. 

Everything was the same on the way back, minus the eye masks and earplugs. There are a multitude of shows, movies, music and other entertainment, but I still missed my wifi.

I would recommend paying extra for the bulkhead seating.  Effective 5/1/2017 this area will now boast slightly more legroom and access to the airport lounge in Incheon.

We flew from London to Seoul then Seoul to Singapore. Both flights were fabulous and the flight attendants were very friendly and welcoming. 
1st time flying with Asiana and as we will be flying to Asia twice a year, we will consider flying this route again.

Great service as was the food selection. We left HK airport and flew to Seoul. From Seoul we transferred planes and continued onto Chicago. Both flights were excellent, as well as service and food. Wonderful selection of entertainment.

Excellent service, but the mileage program is not according to a great airline. The staff are very friendly and well trained to provide excellent service to the passengers. It appears that the aircraft are well maintained and care is taken to maintain the necessary cleanliness for the passengers during the flight. The food is better than several airlines that I have used. However, the mileage program is not good. Does not have adequate benefits for frequent passengers. For this reason, I accumulate my mileage in another program of the same alliance.
Easy check in experience and lots of space and room, food was also serviced complimentary on this short flight, I'm very impressed.
Asiana's superior in-flight cuisine and amenities are still one of the reasons people like me pay full price for all-inclusive amenities.

Outstanding service knowing and providing for my elder family member wheelchair assistant throughout the trip. Layover lounge in Incheon airport was clean, secure, and well organized with helpful staff. At destination in Los Angeles, Asiana agents were also presented at the Immigration check and baggage carousel to assist their customers if needed that I have never seen with other airlines.

This is my 3rd time flying Asiana. I flew for the first time in November 2015,  then in Dec. 2016  and March 2017. All of the flights had great service from LAX to Seoul and to Saigon from the A380, A330, 747 and 777. The flight attendants were always smiling and very attentive. When I asked for a snack I was brought 3 bags. The food was very good in economy and the lavatories were clean. There was toothpaste and mouthwash in the lavatories along with skin toner. Slippers, blankets and plenty of pillows in economy. I look forward to my next trip on Asiana. I wish American carriers could provide such an enjoyable experience. Kudos to Asiana for providing such a great experience.

This was only my third flight overseas and I have never had this level of service, it was like being in first class the whole trip!  We were given two options for every meal, and I think there were 3 or 4 meals, PLUS snacks.  When they weren't serving us the flight attendants were constantly watching to see if there was anything anyone needed!  I have flown first class on domestic flights and this was better!

the flight attendance staff really care about you. they are very focus on your comfort. a lot of detail to attention. the meals are delicious and plenty. The drinks selection amazing. the cabin noise is minimal. The entertainment is great. The plane is nicely decorated. the one we flight had a bathroom with a view.

Round trip check in was fast. Two hour flight each way was trouble free, excellent service, new, clean plane. Sandwich was very acceptable. Flight attendants were first class. Good experience in every way.
This is a good airlines, with good service, comfortable seats, entertainment, and food options. I took both international flights and domestic flights when in South Korea. All flights were on time.

My wife and I have been flying Asiana for more than 10 years now for our annual vacation, and she, on a twice a year take off for the last two years.  It's been a pleasure flying Asiana, the service and comfortability is the number one factor for us, the courteousness and approachable cabin crews are no doubt the best.  These were only some of the things made us happy enjoying and patronizing Asiana Airlines, and, not to forget Asiana Business Lounge, where we had to stay and relax, use the ammenities within, eat and sleep while on a long layover; it won't let you down.

Flew from Seattle to Inchon which included a bus ride up from Portland as part of the Asiana package. Asiana apparently does this to encourage people in Portland to travel with Asiana versus Korean airlines. The ride up and the flight to Korea were fine. The plane was decent and up-to-date and included plugs for electronics like ipads to watch your own movies if you didn't want to watch theirs. The food was good for the first meal but horrible for the second meal. On the return flight, the plane was much older without any power plugs, the video screens were old, small and hard to see; both meals were poor and one of the toilets failed. To top it all, the return bus ride had too many people and too much luggage for the return bus ride. To avoid safety issues with kids on people's laps due to the overload, we offered to rent a car to go back with the expectation that we would be reimbursed (yes, we should have asked about this before but after being up for 18 hours and with a 3 1/2 hour ride left to go, you can understand that this was not foremost in my mind with a daughter and a wife in tow).  Since then, we have got nothing but a run around--no support by the travel agency (Am-Pac Travel in Lakewood, WA), Asiana who contracted the bus service has been of no help and the bus service has simply made excuses.  Go with Korean Airlines or some other provider.

First time flying Asiana Air. Destiny was Japan, layover in Seoul, Korea. Best flight ever.  Left Chicago O’Hare during a snow storm (in March), the plane had to be de-iced. A new one for me.  My seats were all booked by the wing. Could not even feel the take-off. Very smooth. The meals were all Korean and quite tasty. I can eat anything, so my opinion of the food may not be helpful. I am grateful to eat and when in a foreign country, do as the new country does.  They had water, coffee, green tea, beer, red & white wine and soda. We took the midnight flight, we were given pillows, blankets and slippers. The bathrooms were clean and not smelly, equipped with toothbrush and paste, cups to rinse your mouth, and after a 12 hour flight we needed to freshen up. We finally arrived in Korea at 4:00 am for a 4 hour layover. Customs and security went very smoothly. Don’t carry anything in your pockets, easy to remove shoes, have your passport and boarding pass with you and all will go well. I made sure to do my homework on what I can bring to Japan and since I take medication, I contacted the Health Consulate of Japan in regards to my medications. I copied everything, separated the prescriptions into baggies in the original container, along with my ‘OK’ to travel  RX papers from the Japan Health Consulate and all went well. No search, very kind, non-invasive during the x-ray scan. I’d rather security and customs be extra careful on my account. Getting back to the flight. Took off from South Korea to Tokyo Japan. Smooth as can be, taking off and landing. Excellent pilots and stewardesses. Next time I go to Asia, I hope to make Asiana Airlines my go to flight arraignments.  Segoi! **The only bad thing about the flight is that I had an exasperating passenger in front of me who put his chair ALL the way back which left me inconvenienced of trying to retrieve my shoes or anything that dropped. And the couple behind us had an on-going phlemy cough that I could tell that they did not cover their mouth when they coughed. (You can tell when someone covers their mouth) this did not happen, and I was hoping I would not catch anything. So Far So Good. SO, Flyers...please be courteous to your flying passenger companions. You are flying economy and do not own the plane.

This is not my first time flying this airline, so my expectations were really low. I was pleasantly surprised after we boarded flight #222 (A380) in Seoul S. Korea.  The flight attendants were pleasant, the legroom and seat comfort was amazing and the food was eatable. The entertainment system was outstanding. The restrooms were plentiful and always clean. If you are flying economy, the A380 is the best way to go.

Horrible experience from start to finish.  I actually lost confidence in customer service, safety, and ability to resolve the simplest of issues.  Staff cannot make a decision, no supervisors with authority, in-flight meals were inedible, and Smartium Business seat is so narrow and uncomfortable.  A380 Business so understaffed, you are constantly seeing uneaten food passed over your head and around service trays...unsightly!  I felt sorry for the flight attendants...seriously, avoid at all costs.  Asiana....what happened?

We were told not to book with Asiana, but my husband was able to get a great deal and so he booked two tickets instead of one, so I ended up going to Japan with him. The trip was about 14 hours, which is long, but the seats were comfortable and we had a TV screen to watch shows, listen to radio, etc. The movies were recent too! We were given two meals and snacks in between, which was dinner and then breakfast (seeing we got the red eye flight out). The stewardesses were very gracious and bowed to all of us before we took off. Nice start to our trip.

This was the return segment of my recent trip.

The check-in process at the airport was smooth, the staff there were friendly and efficient.

The Asiana Lounge was quite crowded, even though it wasn't small. The way they have arranged the seats made me feel like I was in a classroom. Food selection was acceptable though not fantastic, with 3 hot dishes, salad bar, and snacks. The staff were not prompt in ensuring that there were adequate glasses for drinks, and the shelves for glasses were mostly empty on multiple occasions. I wanted to have a glass of wine but there were no wine glasses (or any other glasses), and I asked the staff about it, and she suggested I use the paper cups (which was provided for water) instead!

I went to the boarding gate about 10 minutes before the stated boarding time, and waited, and waited. By the time the original departure time has passed, we were still sitting and wondering what's going on. Many people approached the service counter and asked about the flight, and apparently the aircraft had some problem that they had to deal with and they were still waiting for the maintenance to complete. However, there was no public announcement, and even the departure status boards still stated that the flight was on time.

Finally, about more than an hour after the original departure time, they put up a notice at the service counter stating that there will be a change of gate and aircraft and a new departure time. But even at this time there was no public announcement! Most people only realized that there was a change after they approached the service counter and looked at the notice.

We eventually boarded our flight about 2 hours after the original departure time (at the new gate)! 

I was pleasantly surprised that they upgrade me to Business Class (I flew Economy on the flight here and was not impressed with the seats and service), and looked forward to a better experience.

Their Business Class seats were more roomy (than economy, and this was expected), but the seats control was not well designed. I wanted to lower the seat back, but that caused not only the seat back to be lowered but also the seat itself to be raised (it's probably the way the internal mechanism worked); I took a while to get used to it.

The service in Business Class was good. The flight attendants were friendly and prompt in their service. In Economy Class (on my trip here), they kept speaking to me in Korean, even though I have already indicated multiple times that I don't understand Korean. Here in Business Class, they managed to remember that I don't speak Korean and started speaking to me in English after the first contact.

The food was great too! The beef steak I had was actually tender and nice.

Entertainment options were still limited. There were about 10 English movies available and they were mostly old ones; only three were recent enough.

Overall, I would say the service was good in Business Class but there were lots of room for improvement in other areas, especially they way they handled delayed flights.

After a long flight from Los Angeles  and a few hour connection in Seoul, when we boarded the airplane we were ready for sleep.  Shortly after take off, the crew took a food order, but were wise enough not to wake me -- and let me sleep until we arrived in Thailand.  Deeply appreciate
From relaxing in the Star Alliance Club, to being seated in comfortable chairs and served with professional dignity, one certainly feels the hospitality of this Korean Airlines.
Fairly good with everything, i will definitely book my flights with Asiana Ailines when i travel with my wife (and soon, with my children and grandchildren!)

I've been flying on another airline from Singapore to Incheon but this time decided to fly Asiana because of tighter budget.

This was an overnight flight, supposed to depart at 10:40pm but they delayed it because the flight from Incheon was delayed.

The boarding announcement in Singapore was done first in Korean and then in English, which was inconvenient, because the Korean version somehow took longer than the English version, and those who understood Korean already acted upon the announcement.

The seats were rather narrow, and the legroom was quite limited. Being an overnight flight, I was unable to sleep at all.

The entertainment options were really limited, mostly older movies.

The flight attendants were cordial enough but not exceptionally friendly.

Overall, I would say you get what you pay for. The flight gets you to your destination with not much extras.

Before we ride on the plane, my husband is already not feeling well. He is diabetic and we did have a late dinner on the plane because the flight was delayed.
After 30 minutes from eating he felt like vomiting and dizzy. I told him to go to the restroom and on the way he fell down but we catch him with the help also of the stewardess. They call a nurse right away while he lying down unconscious. When he recovered and felt better he proceed to the restroom and have an unfortunate event. The Supervisor assist us right away by commanding the stewardess what to get and have everything he needed to change his clothes that they provided from the business class and a lot of hot face towels, because our luggage are all check in. They asked our seat mate to transfer, so my husband can lie down. Supervisor and stewardess were checking on him every now and then.

Having flown business class on several different airlines, I can safely say that Asiana is a level above the rest. 

1 - most options for movies and entertainment
2 - most options for the way the chair moves and reclines
3 - service light to signify service
4 - best food
5 - best lounges and lounge food
6 - on par and the rest of the airlines

I flew a 2-level plane and it was huge and spacious! I got my ticket 12 days before my flight but it wasn't very pricey. Less than $1000 with taxes and terminal fees was a real deal! The flight crew were warm and helpful and they always feed you! You'll never go hungry. Their food was superb!

One the the best airlines to travel from Asia. Comfortable flat seat, but a bit old.  Great food! Good selection of beverages. The service was outstanding with detail. Entertainment could have more selections, but was good!
In-flight entertainment totally are NOT good. In-Flight foods are unacceptable. getting worst from last time....
Riding in an Asiana Airline is like riding in a smooth ride in a Universal Studios amusement ride, it was fun and exciting, and the FA's were very nice, and the food too ...

A long flight is never fun, but I was very comfortable. My husband and I reserved the two seats on the side, so we had our own space. There is a nice storage compartment under the window that gave us extra space. They provided a pillow, blanket, slippers,snacks, meals that were good, headphones and free movies. The toothpaste and toothbrush in the bathroom was appreciated. They left on schedule. 
Tip- keep your boarding pass with you until you sit down in your seat.They checked it in line, at the gate, in the gate and on the plane.

This Airline sell you a ticket but don't tell you what kind of ticket.
I booked a business class flight from Bali to Shanghai via Seoul, and this because I want to use Star Alliance (from witch I was member before) but then I found out I had a non changeable ticket and nobody told me this before, I did not want to go back to Bali but change my flight from Shanghai to Stockholm but NO I had to go back to Bali stay a couple of days there and then take my flight to Stockholm, WHY THEY DONT TELL BEFORE WHAT KIND OF TICKET YOU HAVE; or tell you beware this is a not changeable ticket.
Also here I get points for a Tourist class flight when I booked a business class flight. 
BAD SERVICE !!!
I could have taken a direct flight from Bali to Shanghai but I wanted to fly Star Alliance, bad decision but now I have changed to One World.
Bernie's World Wide Travel Experience.
Inflight service and food was good but the entertainment was pretty old and movies in rotation were difficult to watch. But the ticket price was cheap compared with the other companies.

The fly was ok, they also give a little snak during the fly, my firend didn't feel really well and so they brought some water. I raccomanded this company. The only bad things is that they are not allow with the price of the ticket to bring some suitcases, so in case you traverl with backpack you must booking also the place for you suticases!!
I just notice the stewardess kept on touching and making sure that her hair is always in place.  Its just kind of awkward cause she's also serving food.
Too Eastern in culture for me.  Missed amenities provided by other airlines - complimentary bag of travel toiletries, etc.  Also missed dessert in meal service.  Would not fly with again.
crew very friendly , meals ok , Seoul Airport Wonderful, only down side was the time of arrival into & departure times , after Midnight.

This review is geared more to the new A380 double decker jumbo jet then the airline. I usually fly Asiana when I go to Asia (miles, price etc.). Ok, the plane is big, so keep that in mind when you fly on it. It's like having double the passengers in one plane. Having said that, know what comes with it. Almost double the time getting on and off the plane. Double the time to claim luggage at baggage claim, same for customs and immigration when travelling international. I noticed all the major airlines that fly over the pacific are starting to use this model of aircraft. 
Things I likes about the A380, more space in the seat and leg room (compared the 747 & 777). Entertainment center had a large screen...plenty of movies, each seat had usb charging port and 110/220V charger at the base. Dislikes, the over head bins left and right side of the plane, upper deck were very small! Shameful! If you have a large carry on it won't fit. The lower seat cushions were very thin. I felt they were cheaply made. The 747 & 777 have better seat cushions, but less space. I have always loved the 747, but that's a personal opinion. So when taking Asiana or any plane from the west coast of the U.S. to Asia, check the plane you will be flying on. Both of my flights, inbound and outbound to LAX were delayed due to flight connections. I think (totally speculation on my part) the fight times were delayed was due to so many people being crammed on to one plane, any other connecting flight would hold back the A380. I will have to consider a different airline next time I go to Asia because of the people, flight delays and luggage/customs delays. If you plan on delays, then its ok. Food on the airline was ok.

This was our first time to use Aisiana and it was a great experience. We used four flights during our travels and the level of service, cabin standards, food quality and entertainment was perfectly consistent. I do not mind basic facilities if cleanliness and consistency of experience are met. And in this case they were. The food is better than most airlines with a good variety of dishes on long haul. Some people complain about the lack of entertainment options but really people do you need more than 20 movie options per flight. This would have been a five star review except we were delayed both ways by 20-30 minutes due to cleaning staff being late in turning the plane around between flights. Not sure if this is Asiana issue or not but it did disrupt our flight experience. Lastly, the price of the flights were extremely reasonable for the level of service provided.

Given the airfare we paid for (not really a steal but not the highest rate either), Asiana basically had the lowest rates during that time for the flight we wanted. No big flight delays, food was actually good but the ride itself could have been made more comfortable especially for people who are not typically Asian built. My companions found it especially cramped in the leg room area and if you are seated beside someone hefty then expect him to ""spill over"" a little bit and encroach on your seat space.

Flew a fairly new airplane a Boeing 787, flight left on time, foot space was acceptable, seat comfort quite good, had an isle seat, which I prefer, food was reasonable ok, had diabetic meal, Staff was friendly, entertainment program was ok, was my first flight with Asiana

Check in was OK but not friendly. They asked for my Visa because they did not check my passport and thought I came from a totally different country.
The seat was very uncomfortable. It is a small seat and if you are tall as me (I am 6 foot 4 inches) you are hitting your head once you want to lay down and the upper seat goes down.
Service was sub par as nobody had a smile on their face and if you asked for something you could feel that they did not want to bring you anything.
The worst was the heat on the plane. They ""cooled"" it down for me to 26 degrees C. This is horrible. Last flight with them.

I have almost never given 1-star reviews, and the past time was two years ago. This is to emphasize that Asiana has really earned this low ranking. We flew ICN-JFK.

Asiana was by far the worst of the 8 international first class services we've used. As a quick overview the food was bad, the catering terrible, and the service unbelievably awful, resulting in a long and unpleasant flight which should have been enjoyable.

The first class lounge before the flight was like a low-end business one with mediocre and minimal food, and a loud waiting area above and open to the busy terminal. A bad lounge compared to others, but we were saving our focus for the flight itself so weren't concerned. In retrospect this was the best food of the experience. 

Dinner service is when things starting going downhill quickly. We had preordered meals, which were not at all as described. They were bland and left largely untouched by us but for a cursory taste of each item. This should have been no problem as normally 1st stocks lots of options, but it was not the case here. It seemed like they didn't have any other choices, all the other meals were either 'already ordered' or not on the plane. This is in a small cabin that wasn't even full! It could only have been a case they didn't get the food loaded properly on the plane. They didn't even have cheese...

Six hours before landing (4:30am) when all passengers were sleeping, two of the night staff, eventually joined by a third, made themselves cozy in the empty first class suite immediately in front of us in row 1. For more than an hour they had a loud conversation that included laughing and woke everyone up.

With everyone awake, we started ordering breakfast, which were denied as ""they weren't ready yet"" (first class is supposed to be dine on demand), and asked to wait an hour, which ended up being more than 2. They offered to prepare the 'anytime' items, which for this flight were just Korean soup and ham sandwiches, which we declined. When breakfast eventually came it was better than dinner, but still only a business class level at best.

This is very much a 'first world problem' scenario, but these flights cost over 10k. Most business class experiences are better, and I have even had better food, wine and service on one Air France economy flight. The only way this was first class was the seat with a door, and champagne (but Rothchild, not Dom or Krug). When service was not ignoring the passengers (water was never refilled even once unasked in a 15 hour flight), it was telling us didn't have what was on the menu or preventing us from sleeping.

We flew a roundtrip ICN CTS. Sometimes people write about a tired interior, these planes were totally worn out. Upholstery hanging loose underneath the chairs,hard to find a position inwhoch you didn't hu rt your back, headtest that don't move. Meals of old fashioned economy quality and presentation.
Our return flight was 90 min later than planned, but because it was not possible anymore to change our travel schedule to the airport, we had to hang around with our luggage for 2 hours because they started the check-in also 90 min later, which I consider very bad service

I flew a week ago from Seoul to New Delhi in Business class. The service was good, but the quality of the aircraft, seats, amenities(or rather lack thereof) was extremely poor. The seat semi-reclined, so my feet hung down at an incline which started to hurt after a while. The fabric on the seats was old and worn. The entertainment was worse than most airlines provide in Economy - mostly really old TV shows and very old movies. The food in business class was horrible, so I can only imaging what it would be like in Economy. I don't know how they can compete with other airlines. I would never fly with them again.

On both of my flights from Incheon to L.A. (sat in 49K) and L.A. to Incheon (sat in 55J emergency exit seat), I found each of the flight attendants attractive but not very friendly. On my flight to L.A. the flight attendant rudely tell me to put the shade down with a slight scowl. On my flight to Incheon, I hit the button to get the asked the flight attendant to help me with the screen to watch movies. Since my seat had legroom and there was no screen in front of me, my screen was inside the arm of my chair. She helped me, I said ""thank you"" and her response was a cold one: ""Hit the flight attendant button to turn it off."" Our flight was also an hour late because of ground traffic at LAX. I can't fault Asiana for that and to the pilot's credit, we still arrived on time. I had two meals on the flight. One was excellent (steak) and the other was barely edible. Compared to Korean Air, the flight attendants were just as attractive, but the service wasn't amazing by any stretch of the imagination.

This covers OZ602 and OZ603.  Daily service from Seoul to Sydney and back.  On the way to Sydney there was no water in the sink or toilets of the lavatories in the forward section or economy.  Things happen, i was hoping it was a one off, but 2 weeks later, on my return trip, the same thing.  OK, so no water- let's make a sign to tell people.  The plan has a lot of Chinese people on board but the signs were only in Korean and English and looked unprofessional.  Take off was delayed for 2 hours returning from Sydney, another bonus.  Passengers were given 15 dollar vouchers.

I always enjoy flying on Asiana even in economy they treat you with respect and professionalism unlike some of the American Air Lines. I will continue to fly Asiana every time I travel to and from Luzon.
Older 747, pretty rough around the edges, check in and flight attendants all were good and helpful. Surprised after all the Hype about how good they are that I was not at impressed.

Asiana have promotional price for their tickets, lots of savings compare to if I take other airlines. Inflight food is good (for their korean meal). Their seats is a little of pros and cons. It's not reclincing seats like most other flights but rather is your own seat slide out infront. Good thing is you will not have the situation when the person in front recline too much and it become difficult to move in and out should you need to, but this kind of seat is also bad if you are tall.

As a bonus, there is pretty stewardess to serve you :)

My wife and I just made a short trip to Singapore and we flew out on Asiana Airlines both ways. Route was Tokyo to Seoul to Singapore and reverse route back.

The first leg was delayed taking off due to a late arrival. Since the aircraft was also the second in our outbound trip it was delayed taking off from Seoul being the crew did not make up the time of the delay.

Return trip we were again delayed taking off due to late arrival of the aircraft. This time we changed aircraft in Seoul but even this flight was delayed taking off.

I have flown Asiana just this one time and that is 4 delayed departures and arrivals and that is not at all a good track record!

All aircraft involved in this trip were old and way out dated. Not one had a power outlet to plug in phone or laptop. It had the old style split prong headphone adapter meaning I could not use my own headphones. On the return trip the monitor was an older style smaller screen poorer video quality.

Return trip both aircraft had a box under the seats so this ate up a good chunk of my foot space and is not at all acceptable and on top of the the return aircraft leg room was just down right horrible! I had to pretty much site spread legged just to find any sort of comfort otherwise my knees would have been buried in the back of the passenger in front of me!

Services on the aircraft were also not very good. While the crew was acceptable the services offered were not. Most the time we were only offered tea, coffee or water and occasionally Orange Juice. The longer of the legs (Seoul to Singapore) we did have some soft drink and other juice options. but even state side most airlines offer soft drink and juice options even on shorter flights unless just to short for services. So on 2+ hour flights to have such limited services is not at all good.

Food the shorter legs were not good at all food wise in fact I left half my lunch from the return trip from Seoul to Tokyo as the food was very mushy feeling to it and not very appetizing. Now the longer legs from Seoul to Singapore and reverse leg were much better in regards to the food. These legs were perhaps some of the best I have had on any airline as of late. Hard to believe two legs can be so horrible while the other 2 can be so great!

Also I marked food as Average being one was bad but one was great so I split the difference.

I forgot to mention the transit process when using the free Asiana stopover hotel facility.Be sure to contact Asiana Airlines after you have reserved your ticket to ask them for a transit room. They do not automatically arrange it for you. However, there is no problem. Staff were most helpful in making the booking.

When arriving at Incheon I was told to follow the 'GREEN TRANSIT SIGNS'. You DO NOT need to do this. IF you do you will find yourself in a room zigzagging hundreds of people to take onward flights.

This is what YOU ACTUALLY DO. 
1. Make sure you have a confirming letter from Asiana Airlines acknowledging your free hotel.
2. Line up at Passport Control with your passport and the confirmation letter.
3. ON the incoming information card received on the plane - you will find a question to state your address in Seoul. I put 'Asiana Airlines transit hotel' as you at this stage do not know where you are staying.
4.Give the letter and your passport to the officer. They will accept the detail confirming you will be one night only.
5. Go to the ground floor to the Asiana Transit desk at area F.
6. Staff there will give you a coupon with hotel details and advise whether you are at Incheon or Seoul. If you have to travel to Seoul it is a journey of approx 1 hour.

I will add I was taken to the Royal Seoul Hotel which is very comfortable and include dinner and breakfast. All transfers are included. This is a wonderful offer by Asiana Airlines and very helpful for long distance flights.

It was my first flight using Asiana Airlines.  The take off and landing was smooth and good! Good job for the pilot! 
Although it was good, i still think it's time for Asiana change the aircraft with the new one and for a long flight; entertainment is important.

I chose Asiana Airline over my usual preference as it was listed high on Skytrack. Yes, I did receive a transfer and hotel in Seoul included in the fare which was excellent but, the actual flight was disappointing. 
My seat 10H was just behind the Business class bulkhead at an additional charge. Though the seat was comfortable itself once the business class curtain was drawn the 
area became uncomfortably hot. I often walked to the back of the aircraft purely to 'cool down'. The problem as I see it is that the area above the curtain is blocked so air cannot circulate through the cabin. Consequently, that area becomes quite stifling.

The staff, serve meals and drinks together, but over the long flight between Seoul and London only twice did they walk round with water or juice. Once the food is served and cleared staff disappear. They are proficient but not particularly friendly.
For such long flights the entertainment choice is extremely limited with old movies or documentaries. 
IN Seoul we sat on the tarmac for over 45mins because Chinese airspace was too busy. If Asiana schedule flights for that time why not change it to save the inconvenience.
I am not looking forward to my return flight within the same month as entertainment will not have changed.
The food is certainly edible but there are only 2 choices advised at the time of serving.
As I say I was disappointed and will return to Thai or Singapore Airlines.

I had high expectations with this airline. I had always looked forward to flying with Asiana as I knew they always belonged to the top 10 airlines in the world list. Although, I had smoothest ride to my destination and everything else such as movie selections were at par, I just thought they fell a little short on service and on food choices. Some of the crew weren't as approachable like they didn't want to do their job. Food was delicious but the selection was minimal. Overall, I'd still recommend this to others since there is nothing really negative about this carrier.
A good company with meal on the flight,. Nice and good staff. Goes smooth and easy to check-in. Have also movies you can watch during flight.
Asiana , as always put on and excellent trip . Very good service , food and airport management . One of the best .

Asiana never fails to disappoint. Flight crew did a fantastic job in being friendly and nice. Food was better than edible, drinks and snacks provided from here to there were also great. Smooth take-off and landing, IFE made the ridiculously long flight bearable. Definitely recommending this airline to others.

Asiana airlines food menu not change since one year, they will deliver the food with no break .food quality is standard .movie channels not change .to last minute they want on your seat until the aircraft stop stay on seat.

Asiana was known for great customer service. Seems like cost cutting is taking its toll. Nearly impossible to manage reservations on their website compared to other airlines. Cabin temperature was either too cold or too warm. Food was nearly mediocre. Flight attendants always seemed in a rush and not very attentive. Limited movie selections. Have definitely had better flights on this route with other airlines.

every china trip  I take Asiana airline because flight attendants are considerate and serves great food  with drinks . they always arrives on time and depart on time. so I feel comfortable on the flight.

Our first time with Asiana. Fly to london via overnight in Seoul. Seats were comfortable and a good size for economy. Food was choice of Korean or European style. Transfer from airport to hotel was included. Hotel was Royal in Seoul and 4.5 star. Comfortable and recently refurbished. Dinner and breakfast were also included. Will travel with Asiana again.

Asiana Airlines appeared on my radar due to a very cheap flight that they had for December. The process of purchasing was easy and the issuance of electronic ticket was painless but the day of the flight was very different. 

When I got to LAX, I was happy to easy that they had a kiosk wherein I could print my boarding pass and ticket bags. However, as I was few minutes to finishing up, my passport couldn't be scanned. No one was available to help, unlike the other other kiosks for Eva Air and other airlines. My day kinda turned around because she checked in my 3rd (carry on) bag for free. Then the waiting time began. After about an hour of waiting, we were told to move to another gate. Then 10 minutes into our actual boarding time, we were told the the boarding is delayed by 25 minutes. Then the 25 minutes turned in an hour! This was tough for people like me who had a connecting flight to another country. 

On my return flight, we delayed for an hour initially. Then when I came back to board, we were delayed for another 45 minutes. The food is just okay and the bathrooms didn't run out of essentials. The entertainment choice contained classics and new releases. 

Asiana Airlines won't be my first choice but given the right rate, I won't mind booking with them again.
I felt little bit expensive but not good at service. the food was good and the service was not bad. I felt comfortable during fly.

I've traveled to Asia a few times and a close friend swears by asiana airlines for there frequent flyer program. He Flys 4 times a year and swears there the best for free upgrades etc.  Well this is my take on them.  I'm currently delayed for the fourth time on the last leg of my trip back to the states.  Chicago to Korea then to Thailand and back home is 4 flights and everyone of them delayed by 2hours or more!  No over airlines have or had delays.  I fly a lot and looking at there delay times for the year there not bad so I'll chuck this up to bad luck. 
Let's talk about why you should fly Cathay or Korean air.  Asiana has outdated TV entertainment for when in flight and unlike the other big airlines they have No! USB power plug in, I feel the seats look worn out and dirty.  The food compared to other asia based airlines is subpar.  Will not fly them again with so many better airlines out there

Took my wife and 5 year old son on a long trip. The first time for my son on such a long flight. He behaved well and the flight attendants were super. The meals were god but must say the entertainment programs are weak.

I had never flown Asiana before but I was fortunate to find a deal out of Seattle to Manila via Seoul, Korea.  From check in to boarding everything was on time and easy.  Staff was super friendly and organized, seat and amenities were great too. Would definitely recommend and would fly again!

Check-in : At the Seoul Station ( AREX )
Separate counter for Business Class passengers , but wasn't functional as there wasn't much crowd early in the morning. Staff was courteous.

Security / Immigration : 
Through the designated side entrance for AREX passengers. Immigration was already completed before , at the station , so the entire process took hardly 5 minutes.

Lounge : Asiana Airlines Business Class Lounge 
Wasn't crowded as our last time there. Would suggest sitting on the right hand side section as it's much bigger and quieter. Nothing great about the F&B options though. Avoid the ""raw"" seafood pancakes.

Boarding : 
Separate queue for business class passengers , and then separate aerobridge.

Cabin / Seats :
Very outdated cabin , with angle lie-flat seats arranged in a 2-2-2 fashion. Not so comfortable for a long haul flight , but the good part was that we were the only 4 passengers in the cabin. 

Service :
Good just like all our previous flights

Food & beverage :
Satisfactory , but nothing so great. Surprising yet again to see not even a single vegetarian option on the menu , on a flight to India. Loved the chicken burgers though ( on their order anytime menu ).

In-flight Entertainment : 
Very poor , not even close to their competitors. Avoid if possible.

Arrival :
Immigration at the separate counter for First/Business class passengers. Luggage arrived early thanks to the priority tags.

Service - Awesome! Very attentive
Seats - Comfortable, Angle flat
Food- WOW! They feed you so much that by the time I landed, I couldn't eat another bite!

The only complaint that I have is that Asiana seems to move your seats from what you originally purchased. I don't like that, and this is Business Class! I'm traveling with my mom and my 2 kids (15 & 17) there's a reason why I chose the seats a certain way, I was not happy with that! Even if they changed the model of the airplane that they plan to fly, they should still keep the seats in the same configuration that I originally purchased, instead of moving us around. Example: I originally got seat 2A and 2B & 3A and 3B, so that we have a window and aisle seat, instead they put us as 1A,1B 1C and 1D, so only 1 got window seat, the rest were aisle seats. No warning and no notice, it wasn't until I was checking in did they tell me that they changed my seating arrangements. I purchased my Business class tickets in June and my trip was in December! I gave a big fat ZERO for that!

But! I wouldn't penalize the cabin staff, they were spot on! Great service! Only due to their service would I consider traveling with Asiana again.

Asiana at Incheon airport (Seoul) ONLY have self check-in service for economy. This system splits up group bookings - I flew with 3 other passengers & we were all assigned separate seats. We could not get seats together using the self check-in & had to ask the ""baggage drop off"" staff to reassign our seats. Several other groups of passengers checking in at the same time as us had the same issue as us. 
This is a very inefficient & frustrating check-in system. I would not recommend flying with  Asiana from Incheon until they improve their service.

Check-in : 
Very quick & smooth at the separate counter for Business Class passengers.

Security / Immigration :
Star Alliance Fast-track lane at security , but common queue for all passengers at immigration.

Lounge : ANA Lounge
Nice place. Plenty of seating , thus , does not feel crowded. Do try the Soba noodles at their dedicated counter & seating for Japanese specialities.

Boarding :
Separate queue for Business Class passengers.

Cabin / Seats :
Seats were arranged in a 2-2-2 fashion & angle lie-flat. Good enough for a short flight.

Service 
Good , like all our previous flights.

Food :
As written in my previous review , Asiana serves only beef on its short flights , so we pre-ordered an HNML , which wasn't as good as the one we got on our flight from Seoul , but satisfactory.

Arrival:
No separate queue at immigration for business class passengers , but luggage arrived early ( priority tags ).

Even though the boarding queues were long, they moved quickly because of the multiple entryways to the aircraft.  Attendants were extremely polite and unassuming.  Choices for meals were traditional Korean and a more westernized option (like chicken with pasta.)  Movies and games passed the time away on the 14 hour flight.  Get a neck pillow and the long flight isn't half bad.

Asiana Airlines staff are surly with a dour expressionless personality which is appropriately complemented by their their dark brown uniform and grey / brown decor of their all new A380. What you see is what you get. 

Food onboard was tasteless and served by cabin crew in a manner befitting their character, uniform and interior aircraft colour scheme. 

The inflight entertainment offered a bare minimum of choices and insufficient to entertain for a long haul flight. 

Due to a 5 hour delay departing New York I missed my Seoul to Bangkok connection. The best that was offered was another flight 24 hours later, Asiana claiming that there was not one seat available earlier on their airline or within the Star Alliance network. A quick internet search revealed many available seats, but trying to reason with staff was pointless as they lacked the intelligence to have a grain of compassion. A fellow passenger who uses a wheelchair and travelled business class was treated with the same level of dismissive arrogance by staff who have the personality of a rock. 

Requests for earlier flights to Bangkok were met with robotic responses. Is it any wonder that South Korea has become a world leader in automated systems design, for necessity is the mother of invention. An actual robot would have performed better than what Asiana pass off as service staff. 

Ultimately, 5 hours of delayed departure, 15 hours flight, 24 hours layover in Seoul and a final 5 hours to Bangkok. Total 60 hours and with not so much as a pair of socks offered as compensation. Trying to complain serves no purpose as their response only adds injury to insult. 

Asiana are a disgrace to the full service airline industry and should be expelled from the Star Alliance network. 

There are many many better, and cheaper options available. Do yourself a favour, look elsewhere.
