First time flying this airline, flight was from Los Angeles to Phuket, with a long layover in Seoul (incheon airport). 
From the beginning to the end, we were impress with the customer service, flight attendants very sweet and polite, inflight entertainment vast, we were in economy so I was ready to suffer a long flight with my legs trap, but space, was comfy enough, they even give to everybody, sleepers for the flight, and in the bathrooms you have tooth paste and tooht brushes (first come, fist serve), food was good, and we really enjoy the Korean experience from beginning to the end.We will flight Asiana again :), if this review was helpful please click the bottom below, to let me know.

In one trip on both the outbound and the return flight from Tokyo to Heathrow for Christmas, Asiana has proven themselves an anti-consumer company.

My outbound flight was cancelled a week before travelling, with no option other than to cancel (a week before Christmas when I booked in August) or accept their 14 hour overnight layover, 10:30pm arrival with a 12:30pm next day different airport transfer (Gimpo to Incheon). I slept on a bench because there were no hotels available to book less than a week out from Christmas, and the airline offered no hotel or assistance of any kind.

Then on the way back to Japan Asiana's flight delay meant that I missed the last train from Haneda to go back home in Tachikawa. When I talked to their staff and asked them what I should do she just rudely said, ""no money, we can't help you, sorry, we can't help you."" They offered no compensation and facing a 20,000￥ taxi ride home ($200) I again slept on a bench in the airport...

I've sent a complaint to Asiana and I hope they give me compensation for the awful treatment from their airline. I will never fly with them again. I won't tell you what to do, you can make your own mind up, but as far as I'm concerned this is a terrible airline that doesn't care about their passengers once the money is in their pockets.

I had the worst experience with Asiana Airlines. Even though it was only a 2-hour flight, but I experienced two biggest inconveniences during the flight. First, the in-flight didn't work. The captain said there was a problem with the in-flight entertainment system, and it would be resumed shortly. However, in reality the in-flight entertainment didn't work during the entire flight. On the screen it kept appearing ""segmentation fault"". Moreover, they only provided one type of in-flight meal for all passengers and only served mineral water as beverage. I don't think I will choose Asiana Airlines again for this route.

Lounge : Asiana Airlines Business Class Lounge
Very crowded in the morning. The lounge is divided into 2 sections , but finding a seat in either of them was a struggle. F&B options were quite average.

Boarding : 
Separate queue & aerobridge for Business Class passengers

Cabin / Seats :
Seats arranged in a 2-2-2 fashion with angle lie-flat seats. Comfortable enough for a short flight. Technical problems like screens not working etc. were on this flight as well.

Service : 
Good enough for a short flight.

Food & Beverage : 
Since we don't eat beef , and Asiana serves ONLY beef ( atleast on the short flights ) , we had pre-ordered the HNML , which was good.

Arrival :
No priority lane , etc. Our luggage arrived first , thanks to the priority tags.

This time, I would like to share my experience flying with Asiana Airlines from Jakarta to Los Angeles (CGK-LAX). Their business class from Jakarta-Incheon (CGK-ICN) was more or less ordinary. Nothing impressive but the flight itself was fairly smooth and I didn't experience any flight delay.

Although the aircraft they were using appeared to be quite old but it was well maintained. The drawback was they didn't serve dinner during the route CGK-ICN. However, the plus point flying with Asiana Airlines was the fact that I was able to join (free) city tour once I reached Incheon International Airport. The tour staff very helpful as she guided every one to the immigration and in my case, in less than 20 minutes, I was sitting close to the counter waiting for the group tour to be departed. I did the same exact thing on the returning flight LAX-ICN.

In flight food was acceptable although it was not great. However, I didn't really like selection of in-flight movies since there were not many good movies to watch for compare to the ones in Thai Airways or Singapore Airlines. However, this particular airline has good connecting fights out of Jakarta to many cities in US which makes it a good airline to be considered. But based on recent experience flying with them, I prefer to try out flying with ANA (All Nippon Airways) next time I am flying to US.

Check-in :
At the separate counter for Business Class passengers. The agent at this counter was not as well trained / knowledgeable as her colleagues , and she required assistance after some time from her seniors. But , smooth experience overall.

Lounge :
The airline provides complimentary passes for the Plaza Premium Lounge ( Level 4 ). As written in my previous reviews , this lounge is below average , with poor F&B options. Not a great place to spend time in.

Boarding : 
Separate queue , corridor & aerobridge for Business Class passengers.

Cabin / Seats :
The seats were arranged in a 2-2-2 fashion. There were numerous technical problems : seats not reclining , screens turning blank , remote not working , etc. My brother had to go and sit with someone else , as his seat did not recline despite all efforts made by the cabin crew. Talking about the recline , the angle lie-flat seats can be bothersome after a while.

Service : 
Friendly & courteous cabin crew , who did their best to make us feel comfortable.

Food & beverage :
Good overall. In case you are a vegetarian , please pre-order a meal in advance ( no option on the menu )

In-flight entertainment :
Very boring and old options. Avoid & catch up on sleep.
Always great service and clean environment. Offered me eye mask so that i could sleep better even before i asked for it. It was very considerate and i was moved.

Flight was full due to end of Xmas holiday.   A321 was utilized for this flight.  A large number of passengers carried three or four shopping bags or boxes besides the usual on-board suitcases.  There was a lot of confusion as there was no way to put all the luggages into the overhead compartments whilst some passengers refused or reluctant to lay their belongs under the seats. Probably, airlines should charge fees for carry on luggages intead of check-in luggages.Plane took off more or less on time and arrived on time.  Food was below average.  Have been told that Korean Air offers better food

Positives:
(1) The legroom is fantastic
(2) Staff

Negatives
(1) Terrible food
(2) Poor entertainment choices
(3) Old aircraft with small TV screens

We flew to Asia for vacation with the family.  Booked with Asiana because of price, which we used for the first time.  The equipment was ok, but was showing age.  The on-board entertainment had current titles but the equipment was refusing to react to taps and pushes.  That didn't go over well with the kids.  The food was great, kids meals were astounding.

I want the thank the Asiana flight crew for an incredible and amazing experience on my recent flight from Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam to Seoul, Korea. I have been experiencing air travel for over 38 years in all classes (first, business and economy) and I have to say that Asiana is by far the best.  The attention to detail and quality of service towards the passengers is unmatched. I have flown many of the major airlines and Asiana now tops my list. Well done and thank you for such a memorable flight.

Because flight out of Singapore was delayed and hour, which meant that we would have missed our connecting flight out of Incheon, we were switched to Korean Air.  We were escorted to the Korean Air counter in another terminal.  Asiana staff stayed with us until our bags were checked in and we got our boarding pass.  This was totally unexpected but very much appreciated.  This same level of service was experienced on our Asiana flight out of Incheon to Naha.  Would definitely recommend Asiana to any traveler.

So was a bit apprehensive of using Asiana. When I arrived in Chicago I had a seating issue. I went to Grace the gate agent who said there was nothing she could do. Not a good answer. But to my surprise and her tenacity she was able to get her supervisor to take care of it.. Grace was a pleasure and made my day! Hooray for Grace.
Enquiry
Good food and a pleasant customer experience. The airline staff were professional. I think I really do like Korean food.
After that mediocre review, I had to come back and praise this carrier for my recent flight in Nov '16. Absolutely perfect, and thank you Asiana for the upgrade (ICN-HAN)!

We travelled round-trip from JFK to Vietnam though Seoul, S. Korea on Asiana. We booked them based on schedule and recommendations. The flight from JFK to Seoul was very good, there was good legroom and good entertainment for the 14 -hour leg from JFK to Incheon. The leg from Incheon to Hanoi was notable in that we had several people stand up the whole 4 hour flight, just behind our seats, talking. Cabin stewards just vanished after the meal service. They didn't seem to care.

The return flight from Incheon to JFK was not at all pleasant. Only 4 restrooms for about 150 people, and those were quickly occupied by people who decided to redo makeup, change clothes, or just play. The remaining 4 restrooms in the rear was closed off.  The restrooms got dirty, and nothing was done to correct the problem. Food was notably less impressive this time, and removal of trays and cups took a  long time. The cabin stewards didn't seem to care on this flight, either.

We expected better service from what we had heard about Asiana and were disappointed. The flight from  Incheon to NYC is quite long. Providing good service on such a long flight isn't easy, but it really helps make those hours pass easier. It is too bad that service on the return flight was so poor, especially given the better service we had going out.

Super polite staff. Metal silverware seems to indicate they trust you + have class. Was sleeping & they left a sticker saying to press a button to call for the meal. Asked what I wanted of the 2 choices, then asked if it's ok if they ran out. I said sure, & the flight attendant said thanks for being so understanding. I was able to get the choice I wanted anyway, but the entire trip just felt like being treated as a king.

I got Asiana for round trip to Seoul. My CGK-ICN experience was nice overall. Smooth take off and landing. Unfortunately, they dont provide halal proper meal so I only eat tuna sandwich. The toilet is pretty bad, stinky and unclean. The entertainment was limited. My ICN-CGK is worse. Bad take off bad landing. The meal is sold out. Poor.

all average or more except meal , its poor, stereotype, for the short time flight,
not necessary to serve the meal all ( bread, main, dessert, salad,,,)
just short flight should be with light meal, but valuable, high quality, for B-class.
That served in fact, same contents of E-class meal.
Every time, I just bite and left all, and eat after landing at restaurant in land.

Flight cost is competitive than K-air, it will be good.

My 80 year old mother traveled alone from Chicago, USA to Guangzhou, China with Asiana Airlines. She was able to travel by herself because Asiana Airlines provided wheelchair services and took great care of her. My mother asked me to give positive review online. I am grateful to Asiana!

Asiana airlines may not be on any top 10 airlines list but it is definitely a class above US airlines serving the same route. The seats have ample legroom, the lavatories are clean and cleaned during the flight. Guess what...they offer toothbrushes and mouth washes. Also, they provide you with cabin slippaers! What I like the most about Asiana is the friendly service of the flight attendants and what's important is that they do it with a SMILE! What a bargain given that this Asiana flight costs about 50% less than Delta!!

Reference number, e-ticket number, booking number, all of these are mix and match, but you never know if any will work. Too many digits, even when you use the exact one. Popup configuration must be reconfigured. Finally after hours online, you are not allowed to print a boarding pass because you need to provide your visa number -- for returning to your home country!! Call customer service in the US and be told, ""I don't know why but that's the way it is. Okay, bye now."" The customer's always wrong. Bon voyage if you get on at all. Wish me luck!

Great Air Company, very profissional Staff.
Nice food and very clean. Is a nice choice for Star Alliance members.

Thank you to flight attendant miss Yun-Jin to recommend me to choose Bibimbap at Asiana Airlines OZ 761. I fly at 7 December 20116 from Incheon - Jakarta. Asiana airlines service is very good and definitely recommended airlines. 
by the way, The Bibimbap is delicious choice for sky dinner ! it's only available at Asiana Airlines which fly from Korea. (and served with Kimchi !!)

I've taken Asiana before to go to Philippines but haven't done so in a long time.  I remember liking it before but I read some recent reviews and was worried since the recent reviews weren't that great.  All my flights were on time going there and coming back.  The staff was mostly Korean and were very nice.  They knew decent English and could understand any requests.  The food was ok with most of it being pretty bland.  The movie selection was pretty good with the newer movies available but they weren't on demand like the newer planes.  The bathrooms were pretty clean.  They provided the small amenities like toothbrush, toothpaste, slippers.  They were on the cheap end but nevertheless free to use during the flight.  The price I got to Philippines during Christmas time was unheard of at $440 with tax and airport charges to $710.  It was really a great deal that I have no complaints.  Still a good airline and wouldn't hesitate to take again.

This is a review of Asiana Airlines’ Business Smartium” class on its A380 aircraft from Incheon to LAX with a total flight time of approximately 10 hours.  The same business class product is also deployed on Asiana’s long-haul 777-200 fleet. 

Seats:  The 180 degree fully-flat seats are arranged in a 1-2-1 staggered layout with each seat featuring direct aisle access.  With the staggered layout, the arrangement of the “1” and “2” seats vary from row to row.  So depending on your traveling priorities and whether you are traveling solo or as a couple, you should consult seatguru to find the seat that suits you.  I had a seat close to the window with a shelf between me and the aisle; this is the type of seat which offers the most amount of privacy.  I thought the seat was very comfortable in all positions and  found the width and length of the seat / bed to be adequate (I am 6’1).  The seats, however, may be a little narrower than the reverse herringbone seats found on some other Asian carriers (such as Cathay, EVA and China Airlines).   Being on the upper deck, there are sizable storage cubbies underneath the windows, which is a plus. 

Meals and Services:   The business class was only about 30% full at most, so things felt wide open.  Upon boarding, the pursuer came to introduce herself. The flight attendants were very friendly and attentive throughout the flight. They always had a genuine smile when interacting with the passengers.  Two meals were served on the flight, with a good wine list.  For the first meal, I was looking forward to having bibimbap.  However, the Korean option featured a beef dish instead, which I found to be somewhat disappointing.  It was essentially a big bowl of seasoned white rice with thistle, a few slices of grilled beef and vegetables, and some typical Korean side dishes. As much as like rice, I could not finish that huge bowl of rice.  For the second meal, the Korean porridge option had already run out by the time the flight attendant took my order (I was away from my seat when they started taking orders).  So I settled with a pesto linguini with shrimp dish – not bad but nothing special, a little oily.  During the flight, I ordered a spicy instant ramen – it was presented nicely in a big bowl and came with a couple side dishes – I think I enjoyed the ramen more so than the other regular meals. 

Entertainment:  Prior to my trip, I had heard about Asiana’s entertainment selection being somewhat lacking, and indeed it had a smaller selection of movies, music and TV shows as compared to some other carriers.  Still, it had enough things to keep me occupied while I was awake.  The user interface was good and easy to use, and the screen resolution was good. 

Amenities and Extras:  This is probably the category that I believe is the most lacking   The amenity kit is pretty basic, and Asiana does not offer pajama (which is fine as I brought my own).  However, I was surprised to find the pillow and headsets to be basically “economy-class standard”.  The pillow was very small, and the headset was flimsy and of low quality.  On some other carriers, even premium economy passengers get some type of noise-canceling headsets.  Also, the Asiana A380 seemed pretty austere and there was no walk-up bar or snack spread set up for the flight.  There is a small lounge with a sofa in the very front of the aircraft upper deck, but there is nothing special about it and it was empty when I visited there. 

Summary:   Overall, I had a pleasant flight – comfortable seat, fairly empty flight, nice cabin crew and on-time arrival.  Bu with strong competition from other carriers, Asiana should try to step up its offerings of amenities and the various “little things” that can elevate a good flight to an excellent flight.

This airline was faultless, it was my second trip to Japan, in my first trip I flew with AirFrance which was cramped and particularly unfriendly, Asiana could not be anymore of the polar opposite. 

Seats, were as comfortable as airline seats can get in economy. 

Leg room, now I'm pretty short 5ft5, but the leg room was fantastic in my opinion, I had room to stretch my legs out straight under the seat in front of me! 

In flight entertainment, yes it may not be as modern or responsive than other flights, but it was still great and did what you needed which is to entertain you on a long flight. 

Food, now this I was impressed with, two options usually, Korean or Western, I always opted for Korean, felt very fresh and was also quite tasty! You were given ample amounts of food, and drink throughout the course of the flight. Also my girlfriend is vegetarian and she was given good vegetarian alternatives to the Korean meat options. 

Staff were incredibly friendly and always willing to help you or bring you something if you needed it.

Excited to Try Several OZ Products on my RTW trip, Check in was smooth, security/immigration was a bit slow. Lot's of lounge choices so I tried Singapore Kris Lounge at HKG, a nice offering but nothing Mind Blowing. A bit of a hike to the gate. Once boarding began it went smoothly with Suite Customers taken first. Suits were lovely with the door open and partition up, but awkward with the partition down. I found my next door neighbor a bit off putting. Flight attendants were polite but not overly warm on this flight. Since it's a short middle of the night flight, the meals consisted of an upscale gruel that is popular in Korea and tastes pretty good. Once airborne they got the meal out quickly, got my partition up, and when I was ready closed the door to my suite. It felt a bit too enclosed at first but I was tired and slept well till wake up call prior to landing. Some nice juice and coffee to get the wheels turning. ICN Airport requires walking and lot's of it, so prepare for it in comfortable shoes and patience. All connecting passengers pass though a special screening prior to being let into the main airport. No Premium line and it gets busy...

I found this First Class flight on a Combi B747 to be quite comfortable in terms of personal space but on a rather dated plane and seating design. The video screen was really quite small and non HD with very limited entertainment choices so for a 3+ hours flight, we more or less just rest up.

The services and food were quite good so there is no complaints there. But I would much rather get on a more current model planes like the Airbuses 330.
I fell comfortable and frendly when long time in Asiana Airline flight. Staffs are nice and hard work. The flight always are clean. The food is good and clean. The customers are polite.

Was flying with Asiana this november for the first time. There are several basic things which a good airline has to offer to an average client - modern fleet, hospitality, punctuality and appropriate base airport. Asiana has it all.

We flew with Asiana airline while I was tagging along with my husband business trip in June. The flight attendants were all very friendly and helpful and always smile. The seat was very comfy. The cabin where we sat were very quite (end of aircraft). Most amazing was the foods and foods. That was the first time I tried Korean foods and they taste amazing. We had rice mixed with some veggies and spicy chilly paste. Safe to say that after this flight, I started falling in love with Korean foods and Korean culture :)

If you are a nervous flyer and/or dread those long-haul flights, do yourself a favor and save all those coach miles racked up from credit cards or from economy purchased and upgrade to the front for once.  Skip business class and take the stress out of flying by cocooning yourself into your private suite and let the world roll by under you. 

Asiana still offers a true Asian first class service.  The attention to detail is evident at each point of contact from check-in to deplaning. 

I shuttled into JFK on a cramped Jet Blue connecting flight.  I was able to interline my bags to Bangkok but Jet Blue failed to tag my bags as priority.  Asiana check-in staff in Nee York remedied that oversight. It was important to me as I had immediate need of my bags upon arrival in BKK which I had planned for. 

The one black mark on my Asiana first class experience was the unavailability of a decent airline lounge prior to departure.  At JFK, Asiana uses the Swiss Air lounge which offers few amenities in their business class lounge.  The Swiss Air first class lounge doesn't open until 2pm? Which is after the Asiana departure. 
In flight, I enjoyed enough real estate in my private cabin to stow everything I needed for a comfortable and long flight.  There are small lockers at your seat (which on Emirates holds a mini-bar hint hint Asiana) which are deep and empty so I could stash my books, laptop, travel pillows, Bose headphones, etc.  Asiana provides Bose headsets to go with large screen video system.  The hand-held video control device was annoyingly difficult to use. One needs to be a video gamer to scroll monitor to lock in on desired entertainment options.   A few more choices for movies would n oviZIihi Bonn hbhukjbknn
WIhżfzzf I I in him

The overall was fine but I died of boredom during the 6hrs flight.. The in-flight entertainment wasn't working for me, my seat partner and many others.. 

Kudos to the excellent service and seat comfortness to make up for the lousy entertainment.

Of course Business Class is going to be better than Economy and an Asian carrier is better than the Western competition but when you know your business classes and compare Asiana against Singapore Airlines, Japan Airlines or any of the Middle East carriers, the product is decades behind the competition. 

I flew Tokyo to Sydney via Seoul. I booked it months in advance and was looking out for the new Smartium business class to be scheduled for my flight. I got lucky but it was a bit of a disappointment. Asiana flies some old 777-200, many with a business class from the '90s with a 2-3-2 configuration and sloping seats. Smartium is their new product in a staggered pattern but only randomly on the Sydney route which you'd think is a premium route. Leading up departure, the aircraft changed about 4 times for both my connecting and onward flight. This required a seat change each time.

This is getting into the weeds of detail but if you know your business class, this will mean something:

Lounge - horrendously crowded and not one place to sit. It's the only Star Alliance lounge in Seoul (exc SQ) and also welcomes Emirates and Qatar Airways passengers - way too crowded and a dismal selection of things to eat. Cold spaghetti salad anyone?

Check-in at Narita - waited 15 minutes - only 2 people doing check-in. Not good. 

Smartium business class seat - solo seat and direct aisle access appreciated but this is the standard now for international business class. The seat is very worn out with tape holding bits together for my seat. The cushions are completely worn out; the aircraft is otherwise clean.

Meal - overly elaborate service for very simple food that could be served faster, especially for a night flight. Food is very boring and rather average. I had the 'western' option which was actually a Chinese sweet and sour fish with sun dried tomatoes (?) and fried rice. For some reason, the soup and salad for the western meal weren't available so it was paired with a tofu and strange squid salad from the Korean menu. Breakfast was terrible and were two dried eggs with a pasty sauce.

Amenities - economy pillow and economy blanket - no duvet, no mattress topper. No bottle of water provided.  No Express pass given for business class passengers for Sydney arrival. 

Entertainment - terrible selection of movies, less than 10% of what Singapore Airlines offers. Very poor quality of resolution and size of screen.

The only good thing about the flights were the crew - very service oriented, friendly (if not somewhat robotic) efficient and caring.

Both flights were late with the explanation ""late connections"" which really meant '""late inbound aircraft"". First flight was 1.5 hours late, second was 2 hours late - aircraft had late inbound from PVG.

In summary, Asiana has really got to pull up it's socks. Competing carriers like JAL, ANA and SQ in the region blow away Asiana. I flew Korean last year and found them to be much better but not as good as the aforementioned carriers. The people are the most important part and I was really impressed with the crews but they are working with hardware and catering that could easily be improved.

Asiana, hope you're listening!

Everything was perfect on the flight.  The food was among the best I have had, with fish perfectly cooked.  The attendants were pleasant, very concerned about my experience and cared, unlike on many other carriers.  The seat made me feel like I was in my own compartment.  The only problem was that I had difficulty getting the seat to go into a flat position for sleeping, but an attendant helped me.

Very few western airlines have the grace of Asian airlines when it comes to service. Asiana is no exception. Every detail was paid attention to, so the whole experience is of comfort, relaxation and luxury.Obviously all flights are on time...

Counter people are not real nice! lack of managements. Not helpful staffs! specially assistant need the most. luggage are damages badly. 
the in-flight meals are great!

OMG, what happened ??
Asiana used to be my favorite airline.
Now it's horrible.
Due to code share with Thai air, Singapore air and etc, there are too many people in small plane and there is NO room to do anything. I flew slow season in October.
I get that cost cutting and make bottom line however, coming back from Seoul they had this OLD plane with remote control entertainment. I think that was from 1980 and 1990's.

We has a excellent flight with Asiana , first time we had used this airline , check in was good , we had time to visit the star alliance lounge which was good and not too busy , we were upstairs on the Airbus 380. seating is very good and when the seat is flat you have about 6feet 3 inches to stretch out , service during the flight was excellent and also the food , its the first time I had a beef tenderloin steak that was not over cooked , really it was cooked perfectly . Flight was an hour late due to very busy traffic at LAX . we would use this airline again for sure

The Flight and the Service was as good as any airline I have flown . But the Ground Crew was Not as Nice as Korean .. But The Plane was Very Clean and I had a Great Flight . The Flight Attendants were As good as I have ever had .
Crews are kind and pretty. Especially, the uniform and hair style of women crews is neat. The room between each seat is larger than Jeju Air.

My family took 15-month-old baby for family trip. They tried their best to facilitate bassinet and other accommodations for travel. Giving bassinet was a bit picky, but it was okay to understand. Meal was great. Overall, satisfied.

Went to LA in March via Asiana. What made me book with Asiana was my desire to experience the Korea transit tour during the layover. Check in in Manila was a breeze. Take off was on time. Once on air, meal was served. The whole crew was very pleasant. The Manila-Seoul flight was 3 hrs 55mins.  From Seoul to LA the experience was the same. Flight was on time. This time we were on the A380 which was quite new. Gadget chargers are available on each seat. Inflight entertainment however was quite limited to a few movies. Three full meals and in between snacks were served during the 11 hour flight. Every now and then crew would go around offering drinks. Return flight was great as well. My overall experience with Asiana was very good and the likelihood of me flying with them again is very high. Two 🖒🖒 for Asiana!

The Korean carriers have always been one of my favorites. They maintain a high level of service, exercise efficient departures and landings, and usually provide a good hot meal. Asiana was no different. I was traveling through South Korea with my wife and we went to several locations via Asiana. I was very happy. The price was decent for a major carrier and I was able to use and get points from United since they are partners. The flight from Beijing to Seoul was on-time and we got a hot meal - even though it was only a 2hr flight. I flew from Seoul to Jeju island which is only a 1hr flight and I also got a hot meal. They don't have strict carry-on rules so I was able to get my backpack onboard. That is a huge bonus since most of the budget carriers require me to check it, pay extra, and wait for my bag to come out. And they also offered free in-flight entertainment on a personalized screen from Beijing to Seoul. I watched a recent release movie on the way to Seoul for free. I would very easily chose Asiana again. It's one of my favorites.

Passengers should be aware that a few airlines are changing their policy on baggage.  As economy you are allowed 23kg but be aware, if you have two pieces they will charge you 88,000k won for any second piece checked in. Even if the two pieces are less than 23kg.  This has also happened with Cathay.  Stupid change as this will make passengers take more cabin baggage or chose another airline.

Soon to retire the 777s out of LAX and use the 380s on both flights they serve per day.  Samarium great comfort nevertheless, especially if you get window seats like my wife and i did.  Comfortable sleep as the flight was the 1am departure one.  Food, service all top notch.  I am Aeroplan member and Asiana is one of the airlines that seems to have bus class point seats avail commonly as this is 3rd time I've used them.

The check in process was efficient however boarding was a mess. The made sure first class passengers were on board than it felt more like a free for all. Hong Kong airport is always super organize hence it was interesting when we witnessed it. The flight attendants spoke minimal english and it was extremely hard to communicate. The food served was a generous portion but was not the greatest. The cabin was fantastic and that was the best part of flying on Asiana.

asiana airlines airbus A380. is one of the best asian airlines, their plane is fitted with foot rest for your convenience, toothbrush/toothpaste and comb are readily available, slippers for everyone, even mouthwash...food is of the korean kind and very good. the only thing i wish, is that they have a much wider selection of in-flight movies and programs.

Booked with this airline after recommendation ,this airline was very poor the service was poor the food terrible flight timings not good ,Seoul airport poor ,the only good thing was the aircraft was good and clean ,this airline are trying to be the big boys but are far from that they are a long way away from SINGAPORE AIRLINES and most of the other Asian carriers ,in total we had 4 flights in total and 3 of the flights were delayed  even though one of the layovers was 9 hours at seoul ,all in all this airline has a long way to go to be an average airline ,first thing they must do is teach there staff to speak English or another common language

I had fly from SG-Seoul then Seoul-SG by Asiana. I felt it is the worst experience that I had ever fly to my Korea trip.

Being one of the major flight operator in Korea, I do have some expectation but I am surprise to found out Asiana is really lack of basic customer service.

- The crew at check in counter put on poker face.
- The strictly ONE luggage policy is craps.
- The on-flight food taste horrible
- The crews are like their eye is place on top of their head. Getting a cup of ice water they will give you that face like you are very troublesome. Not only just 1 crew giving me that feeling. Come on we are on a few hours flight... it is common that people will get thirsty. Throughout that few hours flight I only call for 1 drink so I seriously don't think that is very overboard.
- The crew told us in a mean way to unpack our boxes as no box is allow on flight which she can actually tell us in a more polite way. 

Only smiling faces I saw is when we alight the plane, they say thanks & good bye to us (LOL?).

Anyway, I had enough so I guess no more Asiana for me. I would rather pay more.

The In Flight Entertainment is very outdated.  It must be some 10 - 20 years old version/technology.  Although you have your own screen in front of you but unlike the newer version where you can always watch a movie from the very beginning, with this very old technology/version, any movie you wanted watch would already be running, it may be 1/4, 1/3 or 1/2 already shown!

We fly to Asia often and this airline while good, should improve if it wants to compete with Singapore, Cathay and ANA. The A380 is a nice roomy plane but Asiana made no effort to set aside a lounge like Emirates does on their A380. The NY to Seoul flight is long but they only offer two meals. One shortly after takeoff and a second one about an hour before landing.  That leaves a 10 hour gap where no food is served. We asked for a snack and got a bowl of ramen but I think they should have been more open about snack availability. The crew is polite but don't engage with passengers. I think partly because their English is limited. On a long flight it's nice to be able to stretch the legs and engage with crew and fellow passengers. The business class seats were comfortable but the entertainment offerings were weak. Most of the movies were bad and dated. And tehre was a limited selection. The Korean food was good. Too many interruptions about fastening safety belt. The turbulence was minor throughout our r/t journey yet we must have been alerted over a dozen times each way.
Nice to fly on the new A380-800.  Great plane.  The crew was exceptional and very nice.  Great food, 2 meals plus one sandwich half way.  Fun to fly on a new plane.

Took flight Seoul - Beijing.
Asiana flight is what you expect from a good airline but in this flight, I found some of basic stuff lacking.
First of all, my seat belt was broken.
also, there was only water and juice for beverage.
The food wasn't that good either, even for plane food.

I normally fly east to Delhi, but there are so many pitfalls attached to itineraries by the major airlines. Basically, cheap fares with an overnight wait, although fun, runs up your travel costs.  Or those inexpensive flights with an unexpected 30 minute stop in an eastern european city which will require a transit visa (not fun and could be really expensive if not careful, they lost my biz).

 I was intrigued by Asiana and flying west through Seoul would be a new adventure.  For me experiencing and seeing something new, even a new airport, makes the trip more enjoyable.  I booked my flight which was quite easy, I checked in online and was able to change my seat without additional cost.  Price included 2 checked in bags.  Easy quick check in at the airport, very sweet and polite gal at the counter.  Boarding was on time, professional and friendly.  Very nice welcome aboard and was impressed with the interior scheme.  My seat was comfortable with adequate room for economy.  
I was very tired and wanted to catch up on some sleep and barely fastened my seat belt before falling asleep.  I awoke as food carts were making their way.  The plane was full and very quiet.  I checked out the entertainment as I had my meal choice of bibimbap (really good) and it was adequate.  I went back to sleep and was able to sleep undisturbed for several hours.  I felt great on waking, the cabin lights were dimmed and was very comfortable.  There were individual tubes of mouthwash in the restroom which was a nice touch (for economy) after so many hours.
The stewardesses were very professional, friendly and extremely well dressed.  Service was with a smile and their English was appreciated.  I really enjoyed this flight!
The stop was about 2.5 hours (perfect) at Incheon, a beautiful airport, and if you want Vuitton, Cartier and a huge amount of makeup and perfume stores, this is the perfect place for you.  After going through intl transfer security, which was uneventful, my connecting gate to Delhi was close, but decided to stretch my legs and got a good walk.  Not a huge assortment of shops, as each wing was cookie cuttered to the other wing.  But, enough food and shopping to make it interesting.  There are smoking rooms and nice play areas for children.  Also airport sleeping facilities and quite a few airline clubs.
Boarded my next flight for Delhi and again, a very nice experience overall with plenty of time and quiet to sleep.  My bags showed up and the airline attendant at baggage claim was attentive and professional.
I look forward to my return trip with Asiana!

This flight crew is not friendly in the sky since I am a frequent flyer member I usually book on this airline, but this time I noticed the flight attendant more friendly if you are Korean than any other national the service given to their own country fellow are extremely attending any request quickly given them, I ask for ginger ale the flight attendant immediately saying we run out imagine big plane and long flight , not only that I see someone asking the same my request a Korean national immediately the request granted, when the flight attendant noticed me I am looking at her she give a dirty look. 

Flight attendant on this flight need go back for orientation do not discriminate any other national I am the same human being also no matter what nationality you are.

I will not recommend this airlines very prejudice flight crew and discrimination to other national are not acceptable.

I will not fly again on this airlines Asiana , Korean airlines are more friendly.

I took booth airbus 380 and 777 by Asiana airline, much conformtable seats and bigger leg spaces. Foods and service were excellent! On airbus380, there 83 rows on lower level comparing with Lufthansa' 99 rows, big difference!

Asiana is a good airline serving Korea.  The check in went smoothly.  Remember to check in early on mobile 48 hours before flight.  If not you will end up in the back like we did.  Only 24 hour check in going or coming from the USA.  The food in the plane was average but edible.  Boarding is caos like any boarding of airplanes no matter how much airlines try to organize things.

Lots of leg room & seats are wider. Great customer service including the flight stewardess. Except for the food which is not that tasty, I was overall impressed. I will not mind flying again in this airline.

Horrible to fly from 1 am to 6 am arrival in Seoul with no bed seat!
Korean Air has beds on all their redeye flights on the same route.
Dont fly Asiana on this route if at all possible.  Korean Air has new cabins with flat beds.  HORRIBLE!  WILL NEVER SPEND THAT MONEY AGAIN FOR SUBPAR EQUIPMENT!!

Very long flight from NYC to Seoul (later from Seoul to Tashkent). Fortunately had 2 (or even 3) seats to myself as the flight was more than half empty. In that way, was a very comfortable flight. Overall, Asiana doesn't have the standard of Singapore, Thai or Cathay, but is solid and decent. One drawback: most flight attendants didn't speak very good english. Enough to get by, but not for a real conversation.

Disappointing. The plane was fairly new and standard, but the service and food was uneven and mostly not up to the standards of other international-non-US- airlines flying to Japan. Little irritating things like too many announcements during sleep time, limited menus for meals and limited English speaking attendants made the trip just average.

Having been bumped off my original flight I booked this one as I needed to be I Tokyo the next day. The flight was running two hours late so not a good start. However the aircraft was fairly comfortable. Service was very good. I have to say the food was just average. Seats were ok for a short flight but after 11 hours it was getting a bit uncomfortable. I had a connecting flight to Tokyo which  a shelf as we were so late getting in. That said this was a credible alternative out of London.

First time flying with this airline. Not disappointed. The attendants were very responsive. In flight food and entertainment very good. Seats mostly comfortable... only downside was that that they might be a bit more padded since the flights are long. Otherwise, very pleased with our choice to fly Asiana.

We booked a codeshare flight which was operated by Asiana on the leg from Sydney to Seoul.

We have flown with a few different airlines and I can honestly say this flight was amongst the best we have taken. 

The cabin crew were very friendly, the seats in economy had better room and comfort than the QANTAS flight back from Hong Kong the following month. 

The food was of good quality, didn't feel let down by the quantity either.

All things considered we will not hesitate to use this airline again, including as an alternative for visiting the UK instead of via Dubai with other airlines.

The business class is arranged in 1-2-1 fashion.   Seat partitions are high enough to offer good privacy for each seat, giving the passenger good private space and separation from other passenger.   the seats are comfortable,  sitting upright or lie flat.   The entertainment has enough latest movie to keep one interested through the entire flight.    The screen is a bit dated,  difficult to view during full light situation, but, during darkness, the screen back lit is sufficient for good viewing. 

The dining selection are fine, above average, and the service is good as always on the Asiana airline.    Overall,  Asiana's business class is above most.   The seats maybe a bit old, but, the service and the hardware still would make Asiana above average.   Good flight.

The seats are extremely comfortable, the flight attendants were wonderful with service. Service was fast and easy also had great on board food. Pre-Flight drinks were also available. Overall one of the best experiences ever (on a plane).

I have flown with Asiana many times. The airplane is extremely clean. The food is not bad. The flight attendants are extremely professional and kind compared to airlines in North America. They're also very beautiful.

Not so great..food is not that great running out of their selection therefore you have no choice but to eat whatever's the left over on their selection. In-flight entertainment is not clear (static). Both flights (from/to) were delayed. Travel with my sister and they can't find her reservation and gave her seat assignment to somebody else, we went to customer service who is useless...

From the check in, too the flight attendance to the food, to the seats more than enough space and very comfortable this flight on the A380, amazing plane, Asiana it's one of the top 3 airlines no question about it.

Asiana airlines is excellent, from the moment you arrive at the airport, check into the flight, food and drinks amazing, everyone had a smile, and it was a very great experience, the A380 amazing plane

Check in was very easy even though my children's new passports wouldn't scan on the self check in desks, but help was at hand and problems solve in minutes.  I would of given the airline full marks if it wasn't delay for over 2 hours , suppose to depart at 20.50 pm but didn't depart till 23.00 pm or so when we arrive at our destination late so got stuck in the local rush hour traffic, lost our afternoon. overall the flight was very comfortable, plenty of leg rooms, food was excellent even my kids enjoyed them, also this was my kids first time fling they really enjoyed it. Beverage wise there plenty to choose from and the crew was very friendly and very helpful, we all had wet towels to refresh as we got to the right altitude and all had pair of sleeper so of goes our shoes, many airlines use to provide this but now all cut back.. Thumps up to Asiana Airlines.  I had doubts at first as my other first Airline choice was Korean Air, Asiana  Airline proofed me wrong.  The return flight was better no delays.  The South Koreans are very different in customer service, they are very good at it, even the ground crew outside the plane would line up and bowe and wave goodbye before the plane taxi to take off, remember to look out the window, you see them.

The plane leg room is more spacious than most airline. Air bus A330. The screen size for entertainment is big.
As Asiana is part of the Star Alliance. I get my profile , preference meal and gold status populated onto the  check in portal. Got my special meal on flight. 

However some areas of comments: 
1. Flight didnt take off on  time as flight landed later than scheduled
2. The guy behind me was tapping onto the large touch screen entertainment system so hard that I can hardly sleep during this  red eye flights. 
3. Online check in with boarding pass print was not available at this flight

I have flown Asiana a number of times in the past and I am always satisfied.  The staff is courteous and efficient.  The aircraft has ample leg room.  I don't care for the food; but airline food is rarely very good.

1. Bad check in desk procedure.
2. Never do consider comfortable way for their valuable client
    (include star alliance gold member)
3. Make their guest feel bad about their boarding procedure.
4. Bad enough lounge service

Include this flight...Asiana turn into LCC...due to their president will...So, I strongly recommend to person who will have plan to use this airline, near future...Better do cancel your schedule with this airline.

Flying Asiana to Korea is quite an experience, service is as best as it can be, food is delicious and abundant, seat is very comfortable, the second floor of the A380 is the quietest place you can be on the air, bathrooms are spacious, and there is even a lounge at the front of the cabin that unfortunately is not used at any part of the flight, the only con that i found was that there is not enough movies in English, other airlines like ANA, Singapore, Turkish, United have a lot more options

A long flight, continuing on to Danang in Vietnam, also with Asiana, but it couldn't have been better for a good-value economy flight.  It's a joy to be back on an Asian airline, in this case Korean, with surprisingly good food both Asian and Western, good wines, and efficient service, a bit on the formal side compared to the casual attitude on all US airlines.  Caught up with some quite recent movies.  The plane was new and clean and, something you don't always see, the bathrooms were kept clean until the very end.  On deplaning all the attendants focused on thanking each passenger, not chatting to each other as is often the case!

The flight crew was amazing. They walked around throughout the flight ensuring that all passengers were comfortable and their requests fulfilled. Arriving at Incheon and then  Manila was a hassle-free experience. The same can be said for the return flights to Incheon and Los Angeles. My wife and I will certainly fly with Asiana again. The airfare was also amazing affordable, especially when I consider how everyone at Asiana made us feel very comfortable.

Nobody speaks English!  NO customer service!  If you join their miles after the fact, you don't get credit!  Worthless! I guess you get what you pay for!  Cheap airlines, cheap service.  We need more competitors.  There was a child in the flight who CRIED the whole 14 hours!  Talk about no sleep or rest?  The airlines should consider putting all the kids together!  That way, they can all cry together, let the adults get rest.  I guess they don't think that far.

We travel a lot and this is our first time with Asiana Airlines. Had we known we would have be flying with them sooner. Asiana was picked because of the Clark International Airport destination. Flying to Manila and then trying to get out of Manila is pure insanity with the traffic. Clark International is a great alternative and we were very pleased that that connection existed in the Philippines. 
The seats on the aircraft are really comfortable and roomy. I abhore airline food but in this case I will make the exception because of the selection of Korean foods that was offered. I have to commend the airlines for the amenities it offers on the flight. Slippers, combs, toothbrushes in the restroom etc. I've been on very long flight and the rest room are what they are from beginning to the end of the flight. In the case of Asiana Airlines personnel kept the facility clean and stocked. My wife and I had no qualms about using the facility because of this fact. Keep up the good work and you can count on me being a loyal customer.

Long leg of the flight was about 14 hours longs, pretty gruelling nearing the end of the flight especially if you're really trying to sleep and aren't used to sleeping sitting up. I really recommend bringing a good quality neck pillow, but the headrests are pretty maneuverable which will support your head pretty well, but if you're a restless flyer like me, a neck pillow will do you wonders. Besides not really being able to sleep, everything else about the airline was pretty pleasant. There was plenty of free food to eat, pretty much a full course meal with both korean and american foods - you had an option. We were pretty surprised with the amount of food we were given during our flight. There was a main entree with a drink, and usually a few additional snacks or side dishes. There was a variety of movies and shows to watch, games to play and music to listen to. The lineups for the washroom were a bit long at times so if you frequently use the washroom, request an aisle seat and wait for the line to lull. Overall, we had a very pleasant flight with Asiana, will fly again. :)

Let me start off by saying that I do not like flying. I get extremely nervous for the smallest of flights so when we booked our trip to Thailand, the 22+ hours of being in the sky was enough to make me physically ill. That being said, the moment we stepped aboard our plane I felt way more at ease. The attendants were friendly and spoke English very well. We were fed constantly and all drinks were free, the entire flight! We were given blankets, pillows and slippers and I believe head phones as well. The seats were comfortable enough and the leg room was decent. Asiana has plenty of entertainment to keep you occupied during the long haul with many just released movies. I would fly Asiana Airlines again in a second and highly recommend them to anyone heading to Asia!
Great space, great aircraft, really amazing service.  From the moment I stepped on the aircraft I felt the crew was very attentive.

Asiana limit to 1 language per person with a weight 23kg Over limit will charge USD 50. Excess language per piece is USD 120. Check in staff was not helpful enough, my aunt was being charge due to counter staff never give us chance to repack our things cause there is 2 language which is only 12kg. She is very upset and she will never take asiana anymore even though she is a member of them

I think Asian airlines have a plus, and this is service. In Asiana, service is excellent, the flight attendants are courteous, always smiling and ready to help.
Food was very good also with a choice between Korean and International cuisine. Choice of wines was clever, there was a french one, an australian one and a California one. 
The only down side is the poor selection of inflight entertainment.  Very poor choice of movies. It is even surprising considering the quality of all the rest.
I have take the flight OZ750 from hkg-ICN , it was amazing. The cabin crew were so nice and helpful.Also the girls are so beautiful.

Asiana always gives me pleasant trip.
All employee  are very kind.
flight is very clean and kind service.  All provided food is great to me.  drinking is also very easy reachable.

Economy will aways be a challenge due to the compact seating and the fidgety chiildren especially on a 11 hour flight, flight schedule was changed by 2 hours however we were told a day in advance so this was not a problem on arrival at the gate they provided additional snacks and water. I have never seen an airline do this before and is most welcome. 
food on board is good, with a Korean and Western option and is better than I have seen in economy on other airlines.
In flight entertainment provided a number of new films and classics allowing the time to be broken up into stages: film, lunch, sleep, film, dinner, making the 11hours less arduous.
Great Airline travels many times and they have always sought to keep customers happy. previously they had already organised alternative flights with Korean Air when due to an unexpected technical fault.
My Airline of choice to Korea.

Travelled in Asiana first time between Yuzhno and Incheon which was handled by A321 aircraft. A good alternative to Arora between these two locations. The service was excellent in both business and economy (travelled both in different trips). The in flight entertainment allows to spend the 3 hours on board. Food served was good.

Enjoyed our flights round-trip to Tokyo through Seoul.  Good experience with the airline, everyone pleasant.  Meal service good, choice of western or Asian meals.  Beverage service a bit skimpy.  Amenities better than expected for economy - slippers, headphones, blanket & pillow, toothbrushes, combs, mouthwash.  Would be 5 star if the website worked decently.  Brought a dog with us on returning  flight (our sons) and it was an easy experience, dog did fine.   Would fly Asiana again.

I had very bad experience although i had very good experience before. we stayed 45 minutes simply in a queue in airport. there were about 10 windows but only 4-5 ladies while on the other side there were lots of counters for ELITE members! once onboard they served ""chicken rice"" without a piece of meat. i said that it is not fair to call it like this. there was no russian language in entertainment system. i overall i disappointed!

It was my second time to experience Asiana Airlines - same average experience from my first time and from the other many flights I've experienced. Nothing extraordinary. Service and food as expected. Not on the negative side, it is just I am desiring for something new and surprising to make my experience a remarkable one.

One more thing, hoping also one day to see all flight crew smiling most of the times whatever's the circumstance and even if the passenger's request might be a bit absurd. I only see the crew smile usually when boarding the disembarking the plane.

Compare with most airlines flying the Toronto to Hong Kong route, Asiana stood head and shoulder above the rest. From the first step into the cabin to final arrival, service had been great through out. However, most impressive was the airline food! Top notch ingredients, selection, taste....etc through and through. Very comfortable seats with superb on-board entertainment. Washroom was kept immaculately clean. Airport lounge at Seoul air[port was very impressive

Asiana airlines is amazing. The service staff is polite and very attentive. We were served a light meal as the flight was only 3 hours but you lose an hour once you land. It was unusual to take a railed shuttle to the baggage area but it was nice. Keeping the two terminals separate you didn't feel the mass confusion. Check into Beijing was very easy as well. Very well organized.

I chose the transit flight from Fukuoka to Bangkok. Asiana has a kinda strict luggage rule, you can only carry one luggage of maximum 23 kg comparing to 30 kg and 2 luggages of Thai Air. The airplane from Incheon to Bangkok was maybe A380 something which has 2 floors, and it was not full so I got to sit 2 seats, really comfy. The entertainment does not offer much but still enough for my 5 hour flight. The food is bad in my opinion because I couldn't eat anything. They offered a bentou for flight from Fukuoka to Incheon and bimbibap (mixed rice) for Incheon to Bangkok. The great thing of Asiana is that, when I flew back from Bangkok, my flight was delayed so they automatically transfered me to Thai Air and they gave me the premium lane card so I didn't need to queue for passport control anything. The fact that they handled it so smooth made me feel relaxing. And I was worried about my luggage as I would fly 2 airlines but then they arrived normally.

I saw great reviews for this airlines on their JFK-ICN (New York - Seoul) flight.  It was great.  Even on economy, legroom was adequate. Seat were not as confortable, but for a 14 hrs flight wasn't terrible.  In flight entertainment was great.  Many options to choose from.  Washroom and general areas looked clean.

Flight attendants never stop service during the entire flight of 11 hours. When talking with passengers, all attendants drop to their knees in a very respectful manners, rarely seen in many other airlines. Food selection was fine if you are not picky. I found the Sea Bass to be one of the best airline dish I ever had at 35K ft. One of the attendant even did an oral survey on how passengers rate their trip near the end of the flight. When I told her that the trip was enjoyable and the service was superb. Her face beamed with a beautiful smile and true satisfaction. Wonderful airlines.

Family Reunion - Treated us with smiles and very courteously. They even bow to you before each take off, when giving instructions, just in case the plane crashes from 30,000 + feet in air and happened to survive. The food was good and customized to the route we were taking. So no hamburgers. The airport in Incheon was clean and expansive. The signage was in Korean and English. We stayed there for six hours lounging and visiting areas of the airport. The entertainment onboard was average but worked fine. The seats were somewhat comfortable and probably could use a little more space on the sides. Overall, a good experience.

This airline always offers excellent service and the food in Economy class is so much better than other airlines. It is always a pleasure flying with them and service has always been good. Free alcohol on international flights and a good choice of wine too. The newer planes offers good seating and enough space for the legs.

Over the years , I have flown on many airlines, Asiana is undoubtedly one of the best. They were recently voted the airline with the best economy class and this is well deserved. They have a fleet of modern Boeing and Airbus aircraft including the double decker A380. 
The aircraft cabins are clean, comfortable and well cared for. Even Economy has adequate leg room and modern, self selection in-flight entertainment options. A mixture of Asian and Western food are available on the flight and I have found the quality consistently good regardless of the direction flown. The flight attendants are very helpful, friendly and do whatever they can to make long haul flights as comfortable as possible. Delays are rare and when there are delays they tend to be short. Flight ticket costs are very reasonable and tend to be at the lower end of the scale but don't let this put you off as the standards are very high. Highly recommend this airline for anyone flying to / from Asia.

The business class 'pod' seats are poorly designed and in my opinion the worst of major airlines flying the trans-pacific routes. The major complaint is the 'knee knocker' hinge of the folding table. Given the narrow leg room, my knee constantly is in contact with the hinge and thus I am forced to side somewhat askew and that posture affects my back during the long flight. I am both a tall and large person.

I've flown this route twice. It's a long haul across the Pacific (14 hours),  but there are spots where you can stretch. The attendants are cheerful and helpful, as are the gate staff. These flights were much more enjoyable than my recent flights on US flagged carriers. The next time I head back to the Philippines I'll be riding with Asiana.
Service that matches Cathay or Singapore Air at mid range prices. Very attentive staff and punctual arrivals and departures. Nice biz lounge in ultra modern and efficient Seoul / Incheon airport too.

The flight more than 10 hours is tough, but Asiana's stewardesses have created very comfortable atmosphere! I really enjoyed that time: very attentive and friendly, always smiling))
Elegant and sophisticated, charming girls! I am very grateful for high-professional service!!! Strongly recommend to all - try Asiana Airlines!)))

I have travelled a lot in the past decades, but never experience such an airline treating the passengers in such arrogant ways.
Some 20 minutes after the plane took off, a flight attendant would like to check my son's meal with me while I was fallen asleep. The crew waken me up by her lips ""whistling"". I was wondering whether she dose not speak basic English such as 'Excuse me'?
On the way for a 6 hour flight, it apparently the crews were not willing to supply more water except 1time when the meal was served, another was about 1 hour before landing. Both times, they gave each passenger only about a quarter of a cup water.

We flew from London to Sydney via Seoul in Jan 2015. 

The service and entertainment are very good with this airline. How ever I was a little bit disappointed with the food options - I think it is because I am a fussy eater though!!

Because our lay over in Seoul was for more than 12hrs the airline arranged a complimentary hotel room for us. We were taken from the airport by minibus to downtown Seoul - they hotel we had was amazing! We even got to see a bit of Seoul! 

Would use again and would recommend

Comfortable planes, good seats, fine meals, friendly personnel, cots for baby's and very careful staff for little children.
Book in time and reasonably priced, both in economy as in business.
We did outbound in economy and return in business. Both categories same comments.
Airport lounges also well equipped and OK. Special the one in Seoul was great.
Included in the price a 1 night stay in fine hotel in Seoul.

I was very impressed with the crew and the plane. The pilot made the flight exceptionally pleasant and the food served was fantastic! I flew economy, but kept looking around, at first, wondering if they had upgraded me! Seats were comfortable with in flight movies and music. Crew was super attentive and polite. Really an pleasant and wonderful LONG flight. The plane was clean and felt totally safe on this flight. If I ever get the chance to fly with them again...I will, in a heartbeat!

We rode SFO-SGN by way of Inchon, in whatever they call economy class.  Seats were comfortable (I'm 6'4"" 240#) and the entertainment screen offered maps, info, TV, and movies.  The service was excellent.  They rarely sat down, constantly circulating with drinks, snacks, 2 hot meals, and a sandwich on the trans-pacific leg.  Made a long flight comfortable and pleasant from start to finish.

I am top tier elite flyer in all three major airline alliances.
Asiana Airlines to me is one of the best airlines when it comes to service.  The FAs bend backwards to be helpful and very proactive and friendly. FAs rush to the toilets to clean after every passenger.  Jackets are taken as soon as you arrive at your seat. 

Unfortunately Asiana is struggling financially and Asiana is not refurbishing its planes..  
The good news is. Their newly delivered Airbus 380 is very good - in their 1-2-1 layout in business class.  

I hope once their new Airbus 350 fleet arrives from 2017 they will take the opportunity to modernize their fleet and for their hardware to match their outstanding software/service.

This flight has 2 legs, Bangkok to Seoul (around 5 hours) and Seoul to LA (around 12 hours). At the first leg, I had opportunity to free upgrade to first class (but service and menu were same as business class). Huge private space with big monitor. I enjoyed Korean food. Extensive wine list (including ice wine!!!), plenty of drinks including cocktail, premium tea, Illy coffee. Snack is a bit disappointed. Service from aircrews were very nice. Business seat was also good. It is OK for my long leg (my height is 186 cm). Asiana is reasonable price, service, food, drink, and seat were great.
Very attentive and caring staff, always there to help as needed and handled all request efficiently and with a smile.

Chose this airline to fly instead of Chinese airlines which would have been more direct and less expensive. Food was average and the aircraft we were on 330 were old and tv screens were small. Compared to Emirates that we frequently use for long haul or Singapore Airlines, this was a disappointment.

Flew from London to Sydney changing at Asian's main hub at Seoul Incheon.  
We booked 8 months in advance via Expedia which did not go well after Asiana cancelled the onward flight from Seoul to Sydney, changing it to alternate days. After a week of stress aggravation we finally got them to agree to change all our outbound flights to a day earlier, or we would have missed the main event we were going to Sydney for. 
Fortunately our experience once we arrived at Heathrow T2 was the complete opposite. Everything went like clockwork on all 4 legs of the journey, flights reasonably punctual, check in well organised, Incheon Airport was a good for a transit. The real stars were the cabin crew who were polite, helpful and immaculate, keeping us well supplied with drinks and food through the flight. Food choices were western and Korean we mostly ate the latter, which were tasty with the exception of one dish which contained a pack of aromatic leaf wraps. 
Legroom in economy was surprisingly good on both their A330 and B777, ideal for an 11 hour flight. 
We were the minority of western travellers we did not find our fellow Korean passengers friendly. Also some of the cabin announcements in English were barely understandable.
The two daytime flights back were largely in blackout I would prefer to look out and get some daylight.   The entertainment system was not state of the art but there were some good films.  
We would consider flying Asiana again.

I fly with an oxygen concentrator on United all the time. Had to leave battery in SGN airport they say can pick it when I return. 

Was asked to change my seat. I did but felt like was in cage where they placed me...when I expressed that  I went to my original seat. 

Helpful with bag said would  put in closet but removed pin I had placed by zipper problem ...then another  stewardess came grab tab and pulled zipper apart...so had to tape bag...thank goodness I always carry tape. 

Temperature on plan to warm.

This was the cheapest flight we could find, but I was a little apprehensive because my wife once flown on another airline from Korea and they only serve Korean food. But on Asiana they give you a western meal option. Going to Honolulu, I had a stopover in Incheon then a return trip going on the same route. 4 flights in different airplanes and the food are all good.  The seats are comfortable. Excellent entertainment option. The flight attendants are excellent. Several can speak English. It think they have more flight attendants than other airlines. Or are they moving faster than other attendants? I really appreciate that they give you metal tableware rather than plastic disposable ones.

I had flown several different airlines ( about 17 of them ) and this is another added airline to my flight experience. I must say flying Asiana Airlines proved to be noteworthy. I had a very pleasant flight experience flying from Seoul to Seattle. The staff  ( flight  attendants ) were very helpful and polite and the overall service was very good. The meals served was also very good. You were given a choice of Korean or Western meal. I was extremely pleased by the service of I had on board Asiana airlines and would not mind flying this airline again. I would give it a 4 star out of 5 star service!

The flight personnel go out of their way to help the Handicap to family's with small children. The flight crew has always been very kind upon request for a snack to a glass of water. The food is ok for airline food. This Airlines is one of the best I have flown overseas.  I have been flying Asiana Airlines for many years and so this review is for all the flights combined

I was hesitant to try Asiana at first, but since it was on sale, I booked it. The flight attendants were courteous and always offered refreshments. The food didn't disappoint me too. I opted to book for the upper deck economy seats on the flight to JFK. It was my first time to ride the A380 too. I find it more convenient to reserve seats on the upper deck for more room and storage on the side, plus boarding is easier, since there are fewer seats. Overall, I would fly Asiana for long haul flights especially when visiting the US.

My first time flying with Asiana Airlines and it left great impression. The service was good. And probably because it was not peak season, I got a good price. 
I loved the in flight entertainment service. Lots of choice

Check In - 5 Star

Priority Handling on Baggage - 2 Star  They have different tiers even for priority baggage.  You can be the highest tier member but if you're on economy, don't expect your bags anytime soon.

Lounge - 5 Star (Their lounge is one of the best in the world)

At Gate - 3 Star (What's the point in having lines if it's not regulated.  They take premium cabin, elite members, and regular economy customers at the same time)  It's a nightmare.

In-Flight - 3 Star.  (This plane had a power plug and USB port in all rows.  But they didn't all work for everyone.)
 - In-Flight entertainment was very limited.
 - If you need wifi, look elsewhere.
 - Food quality has gone down.
 - Beverage refresh rate and selections has gone down.

Cabin Crew - 5 Star.  They are efficient, friendly, patient, and literally speak every there language.  So communications and getting help is not an issue.

Cabin Conditions - 3 Star.  It was hot then really cold and then hot again.  Seats were worn out.  Window shades were stuck.

Elite Status - 1 Star.  There really are no benefits for this program now.  No upgrades, and no real priority anything.  You just get a cool looking card and bag tags.  If you take Star Alliance, you may be better off exploring other airline's programs, as I am going to be cutting my losses here soon and exploring other programs as well.

You write one good review for them, they keep sending you surveys.  You give them one bad review, they don't send you anymore surveys at all.  They used to thank you and recognize your membership level.  They don't have that anymore either!

Considering their quality and services went down, they are more expensive than their competitors with less to offer.  If you can find a roundtrip ticket from the US to Asia with them for less than $1100 for economy, then go ahead and book it.  However, their average prices are usually $1500-$1800 for a roundtrip ticket, where United or Singapore are between $750-$1100 with much more amenities.  If you fly Asian from SFO, they are always the cheapest.  But like I said, if they are more than $1100, I'd fly with someone else.  Many of their competitors are cheaper and offer more.

They REALLY need to upgrade their planes and re-train their staff.  The mother company Asiana is a Korean company.  How is it that their staff, regardless of where they are in the world, speaks NO Korean OR English?!?  Check-In was a nightmare.  

The cabin was dirty and crowded.  There were odors coming from the seating and carpeting.  The carpeting was coming off.  In a tough economy, they need to increase their level of services, not downgrade.  I thought the objective of companies was to retain their customers and get new ones.  Well they are losing out now...Asiana has gotten VERY cheap.  Apparently, as of this month, they don't even offer drinks like soda and juices (on an international flight!!!).  They only have water and tea now?  

They have no power or USB plugs...media screens don't work and no wifi.  (really shows how little they care about customer satisfaction and amenities.)

You can be the highest tier member (which I am) in their airline mileage program but you don't get much (no upgrades or priority services in the airport.)  You get your priority baggage and boarding...but they have many categories for that too...so if you are not on a premium cabin...those don't mean much either.

By the way, the plane was very loud and rocky.  During take off and landing...I swear to god I thought the plane was gonna fall apart or explode...they really need to upgrade their equipment and get their planes checked out.

In my opinion they are no longer a 5 star airline...they've been 2 star for many years now.

Only thing still good here...their friendly and efficient flight attendants.

This started out at a different airport from what I was used to.  I think it was their older main one.  However, the service was excellent.  The staff was knowledgeable and friendly and efficient.  Check-in was painless and a breeze.

The plane was a bit older, but the flight attendants were very professional and efficient.  Staff was very responsive.  The legroom was much better, and the cabin cleanliness was better than some of their other planes.

The food was good, and cabin temperature was nice as well.  

Take off and landing was smooth.

The front desk/check in counter people are not as friendly as they used to be.  Everything was very robotic.  The plane was outdated, and they are getting cheap with their services.  Food quality and amenities went down.  (By the way, I am one of the highest tier members for their mileage program)  I switched to Asiana for their countless awards and great services...but I question my airline loyalties once again.  If it wasn't for the great flight attendant staff on-board, I would've given a 1 star.

Many of the other airlines are really stepping up the quality, unlike these guys who are going backwards.  Cabin quality looks really old.  In some seats there are stains and odor.  There is not enough leg space.  In this particular aircraft, there were no charging or USB ports.  Most of the in-flight entertainment (what entertainment?) screens were broken and not working.  And considering they are supposed to be a 5 star airline, there is no wifi for connectivity.

A good flight the service was exceptional and I loved the headphones instead of earbuds to listen to the movie and videos. The meal was definitely a joy it appeared to be home country food well prepared and very warm . I took this flight took get around a cat fight Vietnam and China are now having so it was a 10 hour detour just to get to Hong Kong. The seats and entertainment was excellent .

Stood in line for almost an hour at Auckland airport to check in -was a lot faster on return flight from Gold coast although our flight left over half an hour late. Seats are not great, planes could do with a facelift. Staff ok, improvements could be made. The one meal I had (chicken) was horrible, all dried out. The positive is that the prices are fantastic.

Appalling communication, notifying after departure for the airport. On arrival, I was told the flight WAS departing on time when the boards said there was a 4 hour delay. There were no announcements so I went into the departures area to be told there was yet another delay. There was 'compensation' consisting of a small box with chicken in sauce and masses of sticky white rice with some chopped peppers. We eventually boarded almost 5 hours after expected departure time. There was no proper announcement so people just queued at a gate. On board, a very bored-sounding hostess apologised as if WE were at fault, and rattled through the safety aspects so quickly it was inaudible. Given the aircraft was delayed due to some maintenance issue, that might have been crucial. Food offerings were poor. There was some warbled message about not consuming items not purchased on the plane but what the hell they could do about it if you did beats me. Air Asia in Malaysia operates a good schedule and has far higher standards of service. Air Asia Indonesia is downright sloppy. Fly Garuda for higher standards or Lion for more frequent, though basic, offerings. 

If this is posted under Asiana Airlines, my apologies. Perhaps you could make sure TripAdvisor lists Air Asia to allow a review of it! No facility was provided on the website to request it.

What a fabulous experience! Considering the flight was loooooong Asiana made it as comfortable as possible! The meals were absolutely delicious like in the olden days of US airlines complete with silverware and multi courses in economy class! The seats are wide and leg room fabulous. The movies offered were great and you could load them onto your private play list. All airlines personnel were kind, professional and so very polite. Would do it all over again! Thank you!
