The public relation officer on the check in counter in Tianjin attending to my problem is woeful and poorly trained. I was not allowed to board this flight because I missed my earlier flight from Incheon to Tianjin due to late arrival of the aircraft. I was told as a result of that, the remainder of my flights were cancelled including further flights beyond Incheon. This was never explained to me at Incheon when I missed my flight, if they had I would have asked my office to fix it.
Instead the gentleman who refused to assist me keep stating its not the fault of the airline my ticket was cancelled and told me rather rudely I could either buy another ticket with them or fly another airline. At this point another Korean gentlemen, a more senior staff came to my assistance and explained to me their procedure, apologise for their failure to point out to me their failings in Incheon, led me to their ticketing counter and assisted me in getting a new ticket issued to allow me to continue my journey.
Asiana Air is a service provider and staff needs to be properly trained to handle situations as nobody wants to be stucked in a airport through no fault of theirs and the airline try to washed their hands off it. 
My entire experience at the check in was very disappointing to the point I have to raise my voice many times and I'm glad a good senior ambassador of the airline came along, and it ended well. I would like to thank this elderly Korean gentleman for doing a good job

This was a really good flight. The plane left exactly as per the schedule and arrived in Seoul on time. The flight staff were very accommodating and looked after us well. We had a baby with us and the flight attendants ensured that she was well looked after. Slippers, blankets and eye masks were supplied. Food was a choice of Korean or western food.

Airbus A380 flight from JFK. Very quiet upstairs. Sleeper seats. Korean hospitality was superb. Very attentive cabin staff.
Meals average for airline food but good choice of mains or snacks at any time. Nice wines.
Asiana tends to keep the cabin quite warm and if you are sleeping it can get a bit uncomfortable. I fly on this route with Asiana quite a lot and I always have to ask the staff to turn down the temperature a bit.
Excellent flight, comfortable seat and very helpful ground and flight crew. Meal served during flight was delicious. Highly recommended.

My first experience with Asiana was perfect. The flights were on time, the flight attendants were extremely friendly, and the Korean option of the food even included fresh Kimchi. Just perfect. Even a long stop-over in Incheon is absolutely endurable since the airport offers a lot to entertain oneself. I'll be back.

It was my mom's first time experience flying to Korea and i choose Asiana.
The seat was comfortable and the service was great. For the menu they served korean food and casual/neutral food too, so don't be afraid that you can't eat.

Travelling with Asiana Air is always a joy. The whole process from booking through check-in and the actual flight went without a hitch.

Cabin service always attentive and efficient. Everything done with the minimum of fuss.

Business does give more room - I must admit.

First rate.

one of the best airlines to fly across the pacific if you are flying to asia.  no mistake.  service on board is great; cabin crew are very polite and courteous.  and that's on economy.  i flew on the same airline a couple of years ago on business class,  and i was really impressed with the on board service.  highly recommended.  very attentive. (i fell asleep and when i woke up, i had a blanket on me!) wow! and i keep on bragging about asiana to my friends and relative after that flight.  now, anyone that ask me about flying on asiana, i just tell them, go for it.  you won't make any mistake flying asiana.  one exception tho - check in counter staff was a little bit curt.

We flew from the Philippines with Asiana to Seoul , we had unfortunately a longer stopover than previously estimated since a problem occurred with the plane from Seoulmto Los Angeles, But we had the great idea to splurge for Asiana Executive Lounge for the both of us, we had really a great time , from Breakfast to Lunch to tea time, that's right, that is how long was our stopover, but we did showered, relaxed, feed ourselves at the buffet, etc...then our flight to L A was very fine, courteous staff, plenty of movies to entertain, relative comfort and space with the seats, my wife slept, I watched movies, cannot sleep....overall we like Asiana, EXCEPT FOT THE FOOD, HONESTLY....

My wife and I flew Asiana to visit out daughter and son-in-law's family in Korea.  We booked the flights through Aisana but United was the partner for the USA legs.  First, we were pleasantly surprised to learn that Asiana gives you two free checked bags each; and, that fact passes through to United.  We did not have to pay for the bags on the USA legs.  We had a 777 for the flight to Korea and a late model Airbus for the flight back.  Asiana's flights were well-staffed with many flight attendants.  I think that I counted upwards of 20 of them getting on the return flight, which was the larger Airbus.  The entertainment options were excellent, with many movies, music, and games available at each seat.  Each seat also had its own USB outlet so that you didn't run down your devices on the long flights.  Leg room in economy for my wife and I (we're short) was fine.  I found the seat cushion to be very hard on both flights and I was in significant discomfort from it.  You may want to bring a foam pad to be safe, if you tend to find seat firmness an issue.  Asiana kept us well fed, with a western and korean option on the full meals.  There were multiple snacks served and they came around with beverages repeatedly.  That said, I found the beverages a challenge.  They don't bring out a full beverage cart like U.S. airlines do.  The flight attendants came around with a tray of glasses of water, juice, and sometimes soda.  That said, the relatively small glasses were only half full so it really wasn't enough to drink.  You will want to ensure you bring bottled water with you.  They serve wine with the meals, again, small glasses, half full.  There was no opportunity to purchase a full serving of wine / liquor, or to get a full cup of coffee.  I have trouble sleeping on planes and would have liked a scotch or two to help me nod off.  Before the flight back, I specifically asked of the gate attendants if there was an option to buy a drink but couldn't make myself understood and all I got was a duty free catalog.  They do have beer available for free, but it is fairly warm.  They serve coffee and tea with the full meals but, once again, it is a very small cup only partially filled.  I don't mean to belabor the beverage service but since it is different than USA flights I want others to be forewarned.  All in all we found Asiana to be a very capable airline and I wouldn't hesitate to fly them again, but I would bring a seat cushion the next time!

I usually take this flight every 2 mo back and forth to Asia,It's been 10 yrs.The menu do not change very much,so I can't enjoy the food served,also after I am done with the meal, I left to the lavatory,came back to my seat and the dishes were still on my seat table,not pick up by stewardess.I see stewardess pour water from 1.5L bottle to 0.5L bottle for customers that needs water refill,I personally think that is an unsanitary practice,and could cause the spray of diseases.I spoke to the staff,but did not think anything would change.The flight was smooth and steady.The lavatory floor was sticky and wet.

I was dreading it! 11 hours in a plane. The longest I'd ever done before was 4 hours. Make sure you get a direct flight. I did. Get an aisle seat they said. More difficult because I messed up the check in at Heathrow T2. But I was lucky. I sat next to a Korean professor who spoke excellent English which passed the time well. And as instructed by my doctor I got up every couple of hours to stretch and walk about. The seats were right at the back which meant a lot of jet noise. Thanks brother for lending me your noise cancelling headphones (indispensible!). The food was quite edible. (Choice between Korean and European - I chose Korean). Incheon airport is so easy to navigate. Beats Heathrow by a zillion miles. OK. I've got nothing to compare it with but Asiana got me there without too much difficulty. And because I flew low season, the price was comfortable too.

Flying to Aus with GrandMa can be an ordeal but the srevice on the flights was excellent.
Good food and lie flat seats on the first leg Lhr to Seoul- 777; second leg was the older style seats but still very comfortable and a roomy cabin

What a great experience! The flight attendants were so nice and the food was really good too (for airplane food). The seats were comfortable and there were no delays. Asiana is so organized I would recommend it to anyone.  
I think part of my 'excellent' rating was that I was flying to Seoul to start teaching English and then I was flying home. The destination definitely helps with the travel experience.

It's the best choice to fly to Korea by Asiana Airlines. Very good service. Staffs & flight attendants were very helpful, kind and friendly. A380 - Upper Deck is great. You will get more storage on the side to keep your stuffs. Please select ""Bibimbap"" for your meal. In-flight entertainments are variety. I love it.
Great airline, service, comfort....nothing bad to say. If you have a chance to fly business on this airline you will remember it as it is much better than north American airlines!

We flew Asiana as part of our Honeymoon trip.  It was tough to find routes from HNL to SYD so we had to go 10 hours to Seoul and then 10 hours Seoul to SYD.  The business class service is excellent. Better than business class service on other carriers.  The service was flawless and the food/beverage offerings were excellent.  The business lounge in Seoul was well appointed, clean and had good snacks, etc.  I found the shower room to be somewhat small, but getting a shower during 20 hours of travel was critical so overall that was great.

Getting ready for a 12 hour flight from London to Seoul, greeted by the very charming Korean hostesses, the first item I’m offered is a lovely pair of slippers, perfect. This is very quickly followed with a drink.

I found the seating comfortable, with good access to charge my phone or plug in my Ipad Etc

Looking through the magazine which is in English, sorting out my films for the long journey, a really excellent choice of films to sort all ages, some of the very latest, and some old classics, also have the bonus of stopping the film at any time and re-starting were I left off, also a good choice of games to play.

The menu: Choice of Korean or Western food all I found very tasty, with a good choice of starters, mains and desert, in fact they do keep offering plenty of food and drink.
On long haul flights I keep my alcohol down to a minimum, and not being a good sleeper on planes notice that it must be every 15 minutes or so a hostess comes around with trays of fresh water or fresh orange squash.

On one trip I purchased a cheap ladies watch, sadly after a month or so it stopped working, after Emailing the airline a replacement was quickly sent to me (with a free gift) with no quibble.

I’m a frequent visitor to Korea and would only fly Asiana.

Asiana is a great airline.  Check in, boarding and seating was great.  Our seats had a lot of legroom compared with Korean and Hawaiian.  The flight crew was super friendly and efficient.  The food and beverages were really good. 
They treat everyone like first class passengers.  
It was a great experience

I recommend Asiana over the other airlines to Asia.
Cheaper than Korean air on most flights but more legroom and better service

New planes, spacious, excellent service.
only thing, not on time....
But in general a very good experience

Most uncomfortable flight ever, seats were very uncomfortable and there is no leg room if you are average to tall height. Would not fly long distance with them again. I would fly in and out of Brisbane withThai Airways to Bangkok and on to Phuket.

Very sweet polite, accommodating,  pleasant staff ,  willing to get you any beverage you needed and I am an avid tea drinker.  What I appreciated most is they appeared genuinely  concerned you had everything you needed to be comfortable.  This was a definite plus on a long haul flight  and of of course their impeccable outfits.  Bright, cheery and well put together! A ray of sunshine! They are very smartly dressed and exude professionalism.  Food was lovely.  Definitely would fly again.

Good things first. 
The economy class seats are spacious and for a guy like me( 6 feet 1 inches) there was ample leg room. Also the staff was very friendly and cordial . They were always ready to help with a smile on their face( I have encountered horrible staff in some of the other airlines). 
The most important thing for me was  that only Asiana(code share with Air India) operated direct flight between Delhi and Seoul. So that was one of the main reasons I selected this flight.

Bad things.
Food was aweful specially the vegetarian food. I ordered vegetarian hindu meal. It  was very basic. Some of the domestic airlines within India( vistara etc.) serve way better food on shorter routes. Even the entertainment systems were of  low quality.  The movies and other show were being broadcasted to all systems via single source.. So even if I wanted to pause and take a nap, it wasnt possible . Also I agree with other reviewers that Korean passengers seem to get better service( probably because of language thing).

Overall I had okish experience with Asiana. Will  fly again with them if I plan to go to  Korea  :)

The staff were friendly everyone from checking in at the counter to disembarking at LAX. The flight attendants are very attentive and friendly. The only complaint are the earphones they are terrible for hearing a moving cutting in and out. I suggest better quality! Great service!

I am very happy with the service of Asiana Airlines. It is not my first time flying with Asiana but it is the first time I had a layover in Korea. The service is really good. The economy seats have a comfortable leg room. The meals were good. The crew were nice. I just hope they can maintain the cleanliness of the restrooms during a long flight. It would probably be better if it can be cleaned more often throughout a long flight. Especially, before and after meals. But overall, the service is good. And because of this experience, I would definitely fly with them again.

Note: I am an Asiana frequent flyer club member, but I do shop around when making bookings. I found Asiana almost always offer a competitive price, which is another primary consideration aside from safety record of the airline.

For this particular flight, it's a typical Asiana economy service. A very efficient and helpful check-in desk at the airport. It was a full flight, but the cabin crews direct and assist passengers boarding the aircraft. Cabin crews were friendly, courteous, and extremely helpful. IMHO impeccable.

Take off, landing and flight were smooth; kudos to the cockpit crews. I actually can hear what the pilot was saying when he was making announcements. Some other airline, no offense, but I have a problem understanding what was said.

Food, they have a choice of either Korean food or a more western food. I like the Korean version more than their Western food. I think it's tastier than the standard airline meal. I had the bibimbap, if you don't like spicy food, go easy on the chili paste. 

Entertainment, I like their balance selection of movies. Both Hollywood and Korean movies, from various genres. I think there is something for everyone.

The in-flight games were not impressive, though. If you are traveling with kids, stick with the iPads. 

Overall I like this airline; it's one of my fave. if you are flying off or to Incheon, or Incheon is your hub of travel. Consider this airline.

I have been flying with Asiana airline since 2005. Good service, never really had any experience with delay, friendly staff, and upgrade to business class time to time. I fly Asiana because it's a part of star alliance group and I fly with Thai airline and Singapore airline quite a lot so it helps me to add up the mileage as well. Call centre is fast and very helpful too.

Cabin crews were indeed excellent, they were at all time in stand-by mode to assist passenger.

The downside from the flight was they ran out passenger toiletries kit, they were extremely apologetic about this though.

A flight likes this affirms the decline of Asiana Airlines from premium status. The plane is an ancient Boeing 767, maybe 30 years old, with little for in-air entertainment on a 5-hour flight... tiny and unclear in-seat screens with only about 4 movies on a UI from the days of Sega. Overhead storage is small and didn't fit my roller luggage with wheels in unlike most airplanes this size. Food is unsatisfying. I have flown this route several times and it is delayed 80% of the time by 20-60 minutes. Service is fine and leg room is good, so I was able to take a decent nap in the window seat. However, for what you pay this flight isn't worth it... Korean Air offers a much nicer experience while Vietnam Airlines offers similar service at a lower price.

This was actually the first flight with my 8-months daughter. Despite being a frequent flyer, this exact flight was nervous from the very beginning because not knowing how such a small child would act in the aircraft :)

The check-in was perfect, we arrived just 20 minutes before the counter closed. Our seats were chosen in advance and we had a very first row in economy. While purchasing our tickets we asked Asiana to provide a baby basinet, baby food and etc. Airline provided everything. Baby basinets are quite comfortable, so our baby really enjoyed sleeping during 60% of whole flight.

The aircraft was A321 which is good for 2-3 hours flights. More over, Asiana's A321 equipped with personal AVOD (audio/video on request) system that is not very common for a short-to-medium haul aircraft. This is a huge positive point. Food was also great (even hot meal was provided). 

The only minus is that Asiana is always having some delays from KHV (from 30 min. to 1 hour) which affects arrival time to ICN and makes your connection time less than expected. 

In general, Asiana is good airline for flying with infants. Seats, basinets, baby food - all were provided for free even in economy. Ticket price was also the best from all options.

Recommended!

We took the night flight from India to Los Angeles via Seoul OZ768. We sat for awhile on the plane. The plane controls the total plane temperature. There are no individual air vents. My husband began turning red and needed direct air. He has had heat stroke before and we have to watch his body temperature. I explained this to the stewardess that they better drop the whole plane temperature, other people were uncomfortable too. She didn't bring us ice or cold towels to bring down his body temperature. I had to fan my husband.
It was hard to get the stewardess' help because they were busy for quite awhile bowing to some big wig in the first row. The bowing is part of the culture, but we needed help with a health heat issue. Due to the air vents situation, we can't fly Asiana again.

We booked our return flights to Bali from Sydney with Asiana premium flatbed. It was incredibly comfortable and the service was attentive and very helpfull. The blanket and cushions were luxurios and the price difference to other airlines for economy was minor.
 We enjoyed the well pointed lounge in Denpasar airport , which for a 1 am flight was relaxing. I hope they don't suspend this service in September , it's a winner !

Ponctual flights, very polite personnel, good food and service onboard. We took this company to fly to Bali through Seoul (40 hours total) and it definitely helped to have a nice flight experience.
Only negative point is the lack of cleaning during the flight. 
Seats are comfortable and there is enough space between 2 seats to travel without much suffering
Great flight enjoyed experience, crew are helpful. Partner with Emirates for those links you don't want to go back to Dubai for

When checking flights I always check layover times and Asiana seems to have the shortest when traveling from New York to Vietnam and their prices are the same or less than other airlines.  The staff is friendly and the inflight service is good.  Definitely recommend checking them out for your next Asian flight.

Pros:
- very good and attentive staff
- really good food
- one of my top favourite carriers
- direct flight
- has late night flights

Cons:
- Price is also rather expensive (buy during sale periods)
- they have recently changed to 1 PIECE, 23KG baggage allowance even for within Asia

My flights were satisfactory & good overall , except for 1 hour delay from Manila & 30 minutes delay from Seoul to LAX. The admirable attributes are the announcements with reasons for delays ( connections ) posted at the gates both times.

I flew with Asiana Airline for a short haul flight 3h. The staff was really warm and helpful, the service very good and the meal as well. In economy class everything was perfect,  I imagine how could it be in business class... I bet: a five star hospitality!

Very nice and helpful crew, Beautiful planes, good piloting, and very comfy.
Lots of extras even in Economy. It was like first class would be on any other airline. Superb food, seating, facilities, and people

Seat comfort and leg room was fine, but I'm short legged.  Entertainment was very good, with a good selection of movies and music.  Music tracks repeat after about 2 hours, a bad deal for a 10 hour plus flight.  Flight attendants are friendly and attentive.  Food, some of the best I've experienced while flying.  Another benefit, flight connections at Seoul Incheon.  Simply put, the best airport terminal I've ever seen.

This was by far the most wonderful flight my husband and I have taken. First class is a private suite with a duvet covered bed and amazing food. We had an ounce of Osetra caviar each! Just one course of the meal. This was first class all the way. It's a really long flight and we were really able to sleep.

This was my first trip to Korea in 38 yrs and first time flying with Asiana Airlines. I can't say how nice they made our 13 hr flight so nice and smooth. I have to say not only was the flight smooth sailing but there flight attendants are 5 star all the way around. Airline plane food is not of the greatest but even the food was good! We were on the double decker plane and got seats on the top floor, had plenty of room and the overall trip was very comfortable.  I will definitely be flying with Asiana again!

I was taking a long trip from Los Angeles to SE Asia (multiple ports), and to and from LAX. I had never heard of Asiana Airlines before (first time flying to this part of the world) and was pleasantly surprised over and over. The flight attendants were some of the nicest I'd ever seen and the in-flight conveniences (blankets, pillows, slippers) were very cozy. They even showed a video offering tips on how to stretch and stay comfortable on those long flights. For most of the meals, you had the option to pick a western-style meal or a Korean meal. The western-style meals weren't very good, but the Korean meals were delicious! I will definitely fly Asiana again the next time I'm headed to that side of the world.

We chose this flight to complete our recent trip to Japan mainly for scheduling convenience. We had never used Asiana previously, and weren't sure what to expect. Online reviews were positive, so we picked a route from Narita to San Francisco by way of Seoul. 

We were very pleased with all aspects of the flight. Check-in was smooth. Food was excellent, especially the Korean lunch I had on the first leg of the flight. Transit in Seoul was quick and efficient, with only a short security line to deal with. 

All of the attendants spoke excellent English as well as several other languages, not all of which I recognized.

The seats, etc., were what one would expect in Business Class these days. The cost on Asiana was 1/2 the cost of the nonstop flight on United, well worth the slight extra time for the transfer.

I highly recommend Asiana, and I am happy to find another way to get from California to Asia.

Was very impressed with everything, flight, food, entertainment.  I usually used Korean Air, however found Asiana on same level with  lower price.  Also, for layover, airport in Seoul is one of the best

What a freakin' nightmare this was. It started when my flight from Lansing, MI to Chicago was so late I missed my first flight (where I was confirmed 1st Class). Whenever I went up to the counter I was never recognized as a 1K flyer. I would think the gate people would want to know who their flyers are but it appears they could care less. I was confirmed at the last minute on a later flight. It was bad enough that I went from a confirmed first class seat to coach, but when I was put in a middle seat, it was a nightmare for me. I had no choice. What bothered me is that had they recognized me as a 1K when I first checked in at the gate, they would have been able to get me a better seat. They were just ""too busy."" When they were selling food, they were going to charge me for the snack box when as a 1K it's supposed to be complimentary. It showed on the plane too that they simply did not care one iota about a flyers elite status. The flight attendants just did their job with no show of any joy whatsoever. One of the worst res and worst flight's I ever took. It really, really sucked.

I found the flight attendants very impertinent and rude...smiling but not warm. Their command of English was rudimentary at best which is scary not only for overall safety but it is the international airline language!

I'd ordered vegetarian meals which were AWFUL. When I asked for another meal, they said they had nothing else (at all) available. This is nonsense; I worked with the airlines (on the ground) in the past and I know they always have extra food. I was hungry almost the entire way to Cambodia (two very long flights via Seoul, South Korea). 

On arrival to the airport in Phnom Penh, I approached an Asiana rep & cancelled the vegetarian means for the return flights. On route back, however, we were delivered not only the veg. meals BUT THE EXACT SAME DISGUSTING SLOP we were served on the way. I tried to explain that we had cancelled these and asked her to bring us the regular menu but the flight attendant looked annoyed and as if she didn't understand me. I was hungry all the way back to JFK!

NOT a great feeling. I was hungry AND mad (not a good combination).

And the seat size SUCKED. Legroom was terrible. 

They never serviced the bathrooms; they were filthy and disgusting too.

In short, I really would NEVER fly this South Korean-based airline ever again.

Both Korean airlines do a fine job of keeping you well fed, entertained, and comfortable.  Their new A380   is terrific.  The flight attendants perfectly kept and attentive. Press the call button and they are there in a flash.  Food is generally good but not as good as Korean. I have flown on them probably 10-12 times.

Even in Economy you are treated very well. The restrooms are very clean and well stocked with tooth brushes,toothpaste and facial toner.
The food always amazing as well as personal inflight entertainment.

I used this airline twice to go from LAX to Siem Reap, Cambodia in February and March 2015. By going through their website, I was able to not only get a good price, but also choose an aisle seat for both parts of the 17 hour flight. Compared to the US airlines I've been on, I found the food to be first-rate and the stewards very attentive and gracious. I love Korean movies and dramas, so I found the entertainment choices very diverting and enjoyable.

The second time, I was able to put off my return flight for a year, and then let it expire, since I have no intention of going back to the US.
Smiling team, good food, selection of entertainment movies and TV could be better. Right on time will fly with them again.

I flew on their A380 and I must say, this is one of the best flights I have ever been on.  I have rode First Class in their 747 which is great, but there is nothing like First on the A380.  You have basically your own suite with closing door.  There is more room than you know what to do with and even a space for someone to come in and sit and visit.  The food and drink was off the chart great and the service was even better.  I did not want to get off the plane.

I fly Asiana 20 years ago and felt the were a very good airline. Just recently flew from JFK to BKK on Asiana and was very impressed by the airlines improvement. First the A380-800 Asiana uses is a great Airliner even though it is ""Airbus!"" Only kidding. The plane is gargantuan and great to fly on. It is reminiscent of the Pan Am 747 transcon days. The only control at your seat in economy that is not available or I couldn't find it was the airflow control on the overhead console. There was one for the light but none for the airflow. Truthfully it really wasn't needed as the cabin was very comfortable.
Asiana was professional all around and I would fly it to Asia on every trip except the Aircraft do not have WI-fi on board and there is no information on when it will be installed?
So as much as I loved the flight going 12-14 hours in the digital age is unnecessary and unthinkable especially with everyone having an mobile devises. Other than that there is great service plenty of food and beverages. I was served two meals and snacks on all
legs (1 meal ICN-BKK and back). The flight attendants are polite and never rude or angry looking like their American rivals. No worry about it being a foreign airline on announcements they are given in a minimum of 3 languages. Also I know an airline cannot predict weather a turbulence but Asiana did a great job avoiding it. all legs were practically turbulence free even when an announcement was given of possible turbulence.

I like Asiana Airlines a great deal. The food and personal service in business class is great, if not a little mechanical in delivery. I have flown incheon-sydney route quite a few times, on time departures are an opportunity to improve on to be honest, so dont plan to jump off the plane and make it to the office on time for a days work. I learned the hard way unfortunately. Ive rated seat comfort low as the planes on this route have old business class seats that are not lay flat and dig into you a bit. Korea Air have upped the anty on this route introducing an A380 in peak season. Id switch but quite high up the Star Alliance program which has its benefits.

Have flown to VietNam multiple times and found Asiana to be a very comfortable, clean airline.  The flight attendants were attentive and the restrooms were spotless, not only when we departed but they were maintained throughout the flight.  With personal toothbrushes and foil packets of mouthwash.  The restrooms were very roomy also.

The seating is reasonably spacious for an economy cabin. The attendants are polite and friendly and speak adequate English. The food is more Korean than international and the choices are limited. The entertainment too is basic for international travellers but all in all a good airline.

Best and prompt service.  Entertainment video  equipment is great.  Movie choices are excellent. Meals are great.  Flight attendants do really ATTEND to you.  FORGET other airlines operate in America....  try Asiana and you can feel the difference in service and overall flying experience.

Old 777 with bed that was not flat.  Service was as expected, nothing to write home about.  Was a bit disappointed that they didn't move the passenger beside me to an empty row considering the cabin was mostly empty.
the A380 upstairs was just so quiet.  Flat bed was really flat, I slept like a log.  Food was OK, movie selection was OK

My wife and I left ORD early morning for our flight to ICN. The flight left on time and first and business class were first to board.. We were greeted by the staff and provided with an amenity bag. A menu and wine list was also provided.  The attendent took our meal order as we were preparing for take off. Shortly after take off a beverage was affected followed by our meal.  Both of our meals were well prepared and  very tasty.  We than planed to sleep for the long flight to Incheon. The seats were comfortable, however they were not flat or 180 recline so not as comfortable for sleeping. A complaint is no noise cancelling earphones were provided as we usually get in business an other carriers.  The staff were top notch and extremely polite. One of the best flight attendant crews we have experienced.  I woul definitely consider flying with Asiana again.

I've flown to the Philippines three times in the last three years--the first time on United Airlines and promised myself never again on United (flight cancelled, bad service etc., etc.). So the second time I decided to try a different airline and decided to try to fly the new Airbus A380 which Asiana had just put into service. I flew with them on the A380 in economy class in the upper deck and found the experience sooo much better than United. Nicer and bigger seat, better food, better entertainment system and the service from flight attendants was over the top. The next year I decided I'd try them again but in business class--their prices for business class were much less than all other airlines to Manila. They say once you fly business class you can never go back to economy class---I'm finding that to be so true!  I did fly the Boeing 777 in business class to Inchon and from there to Manila.  What a new and great experience for me! A lay flat bed, all kinds of room, a regular menu with choices of different foods and drinks and the flight attendant introduced herself to me as being the one serving and taking care of me during our 13 hour flight to Korea.  All the flight attendants on my flights on Asiana spoke very good English--no problems there.  The food was above average but nothing spectacular but I did have some good choices, and having regular silverware and flatware instead of plastic trays and forks was nice also.  Being able to lay down fully and sleep on the flight was such a blessing--no jet lag here!  The airport in Inchon is one of the best airports I've ever been too--easy to get through and navigate and clean and all signage is in Korean and English--and all shops and restaurants take US dollars but change will be given in Korean money.  I've already booked my next flight to Manila on Asiana for this coming year in business class again as the price was again very good and the flight I took before on the Boeing 777 has been replaced by the A380 so I'm looking forward to flying Asiana again!

Cabin was very dated and dirty. Seats old, no lumber support, chunky and uncomfortable arm-rests restrict space. Broken lop-sided tray table on both flights! TV screen first generation, tiny, grainy and dark. Only 4 choice of new release movies. My friends headphone jack didn't work. The solution was an offer to change seats to the last row next to the galley and toilets. Big box under window seat for video system which takes up a third of leg room. Very stingy beverage service. No offer of replenishment, have to call each time. Refused further alcoholic beverage upon the third very small pour of red wine (a quarter of a cup) amounting to about 200ml in total. Crew told me I would be refused service due to ""Must be able to evacuate the aircraft"" The tone was sarcastic and condescending. Perhaps it's because I was the only Caucasian on the flight (At least that I could see) I've never experienced such a situation before. I think it's more to do with poor service, cost cutting and/or laziness. The whole experience was extremely disappointing and I'll never fly this airline again. On previous trips to Korea I've taken Singapore Airlines. There's simply no comparison!

I travelled 4 segments on Asiana on a recent packaged tour (Hong Kong - Incheon - Jeju and back).   Last time I flew Asiana was about 9 years ago (plane old, noisy, faulty cargo door).   This time I found it pleasant - I felt the seat pitch was an inch or inch and a half longer than CX which mattered because I am tall.   The food was quite edible, and they had REAL metallic cutlery.  The cabin crew were nice and all spoke decent English.  The only complaint was the entertainment - the selections were meagre - but my flight was only 3 hours long.  For a short haul/regional flight this was one of the better ones in recent memory.

We flew Asiana from LA to Manila in the summer. We have heard much about how great Asiana Airlines is and so had high expectations. The service and the food was fine, nothing exceptional though. The food was okay. They served bibimbap twice. They ran out of the chicken quickly. It was also an older aircraft so that amenities were not up-to-date though sufficient. The best thing about our flight was the skill of the pilot. Our plane was diverted to another airport in the Philippines due to bad weather in Manila. We refueled and after a little while headed for the Manila airport. We could not land so the pilot circled the air until we got the clearance to land. Though there was turbulence in the skies, the bumpy moments were few. When we finally landed, the plane smoothly touched the ground. It was a testament to the pilot's skills. Communication between the flight crew and passengers could be improved, especially during moments when unusual situations were happening. We pooled information with other passengers to figure out what was happening. At the end of the day, the skill and professionalism of the pilots were notable - they had the safety of the passengers in mind when they decided to divert the plane to another airport.

My first flight with Asiana was uneventful and that is a good thing. Economy seats are reasonably spacious and I am 189cm. Still squashed when they put their seats back though.

The service is on the poor side if you don't speak Korean.  Difficult to get more than one half filled cup of wine. The Korean nationals seemed to get much better service and obviously the food is better suited to them. I suggest you eat before you travel.  
I would travel with them.again as they are better than their competition KAL.

I used this airline for first time recently and the overhall quality is average.

Pro:
- Very good food, with two options at the same time.

Cons:
- Very bad entertainment system, the worst so far in the Star Alliance
- Unconfortable seats
- The lounge at ICN is terrible: basically is not a Lounge, the diversity of amenities is very low

I used this airline just because is the only airline of the Star Alliance servicing ROR from FRA. However, I will avoid it in the future.

Small hint: on some routes Asiana uses a 3class A380 aircraft but operates 2class. So you can book a business class ticket and enjoy the first class cabin with businee class treats. one of these routes is ICN-HKG. You just have to browse the seat map and reserve a seat in the first floor, which is First class seating. 
Service off course was a breeze as always ....

This was the 2nd time I flew Asiana.  I'm not flying American based airlines after I experience excellent customer service such as Asiana.   The food was good and the service was excellent.  The flight attendants were nice and friendly.  Unlike their American counterpart where the flight attendants were mean and crabby especially to the older Asian passengers that don't speak English.   Asiana flight attendants take the time to understand and some of them speak other Asian language such as Tagalog.

Way back 2015, I had a flight from Manila to Norfolfk, Virginia.

This is a review for CONNECTION FLIGHT (Manila to Incheon / Incheon to Chicago via Asiana Airlines and I was connectd w/ a local carrier from Chicago to Norfolk, VA)

For an 12 hour flight (I guess)
I booked on an economy

Legroom - Very Spacious!
Seat Comfort - It's comfy and I slept a lot!
In-flight Entertainment - Wide range of movies!
Customer Service - THEY HAVE A LOT OF INTERPRETERS AMAZING.
Value for Money - at first when I payed, I was really sad because It cost me really huge but when I had my flight experience w/ them, It was really worth it!
Cleanliness - Yes It's squeaky clean
Check In and Boarding - FAST they even assisted us to our connecting  flight
F and B - Legit Korean Food on Air wow!

We had excellent customer service at the ticketing booth and while boarding the plane. We were SO shocked at the insane legroom we had on our flight. We had more room on this plane in regular economy than we have had on any Delta or United flight where we paid for premium economy. The flight attendants were very friendly. They gave our daughter a cute little puzzle and a special meal (including spaghetti, cookies, yogurt, juice, and a Dove chocolate bar!). Our ticketing agent in Seoul also moved us up from the back of the plane to a bulkhead row in the front for no extra charge. The food was so-so but it was only a 2 hour flight. We would definitely fly with Asiana again. Not to mention the ticket prices were insanely cheap! For the dates we flew, Asiana was almost $100 cheaper per ticket than any other airline.

Not so terrible although the flight was completely full both directions. Had an economy window seat which made it very difficult to use the restroom. Entertainment was a little dated (slightly old B777-200 aircraft) but the food and cabin service was perfectly adequate. Flight was on time but it was a long walk from the gate to immigration in the new Terminal 2 building. The seat might have been a little more comfortable but it's difficult to imagine how . . . and the ticket could have been a bit cheaper - paid 162,000 yen return for early July.

After using Asiana 7 times to SE Asia, I finally was forced by price to use their own website to book my next trip - WHAT A DISASTER! The airline told me that my cr card was refused, so I made a second attempt at booking, but with the same negative result. I then called my cr card bank to find out more info, only to find out that indeed both charges went through, and I now owed Asiana over $1600. After 2 days of frustration and hard work, the situation was resolved, but is this any way for a 5* carrier to treat a loyal customer?

Making this long haul flight I was impressed with the customer service I received from check in until landing. The on board staff were attentive and friendly making this a most enjoyable flight. The Star Alliance lounge in LAX added to the experience.

There were several legs to this trip, none of which departed on time.  Thankfully, the layover between flights was long enough that it didn't matter but it would have been nice to get to my destination sooner since I had someone waiting for me there.  But in particular, the longest leg, JFK-ICN, which was flown on an A-380, was not pleasant, mostly because the seats on that plane are the most uncomfortable I have ever experienced.  It was impossible to sit for more than an hour or two without being in agony, and this was a fourteen hour flight!  The leg from ICN to MNL was on a 777 and the seats were WAY more comfortable.  But the A-380...torture.  I mean, it's a great plane, very stable, goes through turbulence with hardly a bounce or jolt, but THOSE SEATS...the other annoying thing was that the entertainment system kept crashing.  Happened three times, each one leaving us staring at the seat back in front of us for 15 to 20 minutes.  But hey....the food was pretty good.  ;-)

I recently used miles for one way travel from Korea to LA on Asiana. I was in seat 1A. Overall the plane was amazingly quiet and spacious. Flight was bout 14 hours. Food was good but was presented in a very Formal presentation. I could have done with a little more casual meal. The caviar course was 40 minutes!! Anyway the amenities and crew were great. I cannot recommend the 380 any higher. It was amazing.

Nice staff. Food is good. The touch screen in TV is not sensitive enough. Also, some passengers bring too much hand-carry luggages and put in the overhead cabinet. Other passengers have no room to put their luggages.

This time, my wife and I flew from Osaka to Qingdao with Asiana. Although we had to transfer at Seoul, Korea, our flights on business class were quite comfortable and relaxing. Compared with other airlines, I found the meal is just so so. Since the flight time is limited, we could not enjoy much the entertainment program.

Good airline, professional ground services, on-time and some positive surprises: a lot of space between the seats (even in economy) and two complete hot meals (whereas a lot of airlines would have opted for one hot meal and a snack).
Their customer service is the worst in the world. I called them multiple times, their representative's accent is worst. Don't ever go through this flight, better off go on Cathay.
My route of my trip was delayed ,from JFK via Seoul to Bkk because of the connecting flight,cabin crew couldn't answer anything but the service in flight was good.

Asiana is a wonderful airline. The flight attendants are very considerate, courteous and friendly. The plane is clean and the seats are comfortable (for an airplane). The food is pretty good overall. I have no huge complaints about this airline. I prefer this airline over Canadian and US airlines.
great food, nice attendants, a lot of space and smooth ride. and when you stop over in korea, they have free city tour in seoul. really a great value for the money

short flight with Asiana, they provide cold meal both from Icn and Kix. service is really good and everything is nice, but every time when i fly with Asiana, i always think that they need to improve their entertainments system.. can't really enjoy it.

dont take thisflight the angle flats seats are terrible,the food and drinks are fine book from lax and get lie flat seats or book from new york for better comord same price or same amount of air miles

Ho chi minh, Kota kinabalu, Weihai, Cebu, Palau, Fukuoka, etc. 
This airlines was my favorite one. The price was a little higher than small airlines, but all was good. Except number of destination, the Asiana airline didn't yield against rival company in Korea. I wish more destination.

We flew from TPE to ICN with HL7792 used on OZ712 of Asiana Airlines.

With 150 EUR per person, this was the most expensive flight on our east asia round trip. However, for several other so-called ""low cost"" carriers, we still paid 100 bucks and were rewarded with an abysmal experience.

The website provided an online check in (in my native language! german), which was a bit cumbersome in usage, but got the job done. I did not find any option to download the boarding cards into iOS Wallet.

The 7-year-old A330 looked okay from the outside. The interior design was like a journey back in time, and reminded me of the 90s. Check out the photos and judge for yourself.
The interior was quite  ""spacy"": There was plenty of legroom. The overhead lockers were a little smaller than usual. The seat configuration was only 2-3-2, which made the aisles quite wide.

The food was good, and included in the price of the flight. There was no in-seat Entertainment, only overhead monitors.

The crew was very nice, and capable of a slighly better-than-average-in-asia english. When the seatbelt signs were turned on during cruise flight, the performed a little choreography, walking through the cabin in a 2-2-group with the exact same step and all in the same voice constantly asking to fasten seatbelt, return to seat, put up tray table.

We would certainly fly Asiana again, as the experience was quite nice in total.

Asiana is one of the few airlines in the world that's really enjoyable to fly. Asiana is also one of the few carriers that's still rather classy! My last trip to Vietnam on Asiana (March 2016) was no exception, it was wonderful. While no airline in the world is perfect, Asiana makes very few mistakes. My hint to the flying public is to purchase your Asiana ticket as early as possible, because there is a limited number of those inexpensive ones. 

I think I have flown on most of Asiana's fleet to date, and I have to say that my favorite plane is the OZ 744, while my least favorite would be the OZ 788. This is the airline with the friendliest flight attendants and the roomiest economy class.

The first time I flew this airline was in 2009. It was a family trip with my mom, and we had never heard of this airline - so we really didn't know what to expect. We had flown Singapore Airlines and Cathay Pacific in Business Class, and so were accustomed to premiere service and planes.

Wow. We were treated like royalty. And the food was UNBELIEVABLE. Seven years and more than 30 flights later, I can say that this airline has consistently delivered top notch service and food on every single flight I have taken. The new Airbus 380 from Los Angeles to Seoul is especially fantastic.

My only complaint is that the food in the Incheon business lounge is completely subpar. And I use the term 'food' loosely as instant noodles and cheese sauce from a jar to accompany your Nacho chips - the staple of their business lounge - is not what I would expect from an airline of this calibre. Also, the massage chairs could use a refurbishment - the pleather covering is worn out and ripped on many of the chairs. Other than those two points - it is a nice lounge with excellent internet access and lots of comfy seating.

As I have a Priority Pass, I just go to that lounge for the food - and return to the Asiana Lounge for the ambiance. But I would love to see a better food selection in the lounge to match on-board food - which is amazing.
First time using Asiana Airlines and I'm very satisfied with their services. Very friendly and attentive staff.

I flew from LAX to MNL stopping over at ICN (Korea), May 16-20. The Business class was very nice and comfortable; especially service attitudes of the flight attendants were above the other carriers. However, I want to make a comment about the lounges in ICN (the stop over in Korea). The business lounge was crowded and noisy to say the least. The seats were not so comfortable, and the food was mediocre. only good thing that I can say is FAST INTERNET! The first class lounge was also mediocre in that the food was not much better and seats were not much different from the regular business lounge. Other than fast internet, only other thing I can recommend is their disposable shaver - which was very nice.

We have been flying with this airline for since 2008.  We loved to fly with this airline because of kindness of staff and pilot safely flying with minimal air pockets.  Also last time we fly (2015), I've got free plane ticket to the Manila.  We will still keep on flying with this airline in the future.

My flight was on time, free of any delays and done well with any special diet requests. The food was tasty, good presentation and nice selection of spirits/drinks. Little things count also ie. eye shades, slippers and toothbrushes in the restroom. They were very prompt to return with the beverage cart outside of the scheduled meal time.
I will for sure seek out travel on Asiana in the future.

Have tried Asiana Airlines to Seoul for twice. First experience was not really good as the flight to and flow has delayed for about an hour, despite the delay, I must say 'Well done crew', the crew service is excellent, was bringing my handicapped dad for the trip and they take extremely care of him. Second experience with them was just last month. Everything goes smoothly, no delays and crew service is as usual good. Will definitely fly with them again the next time I visit Korea or even on other long haul sector.

Impressive all round - the cabin crew are very responsive and attentive, on time departure and slightly early arrival.  I slept quite well in the sleeper seats.  Altogether a pleasant flight and that does not happen too often these days.  The small lounge area in the business class section is a nice touch.

Asiana Airlines is part of the Star Alliance network, along with United Airlines. We booked an award flight through United and were placed on Asiana flights for two of our international connections. I was a little nervous to book with Star Alliance as I've had several negative experiences with United, but we had miles to burn so we did. I'm so glad! The service at Asiana from check in to landing was absolutely top notch! If I ever go anywhere in Asia again, it will be with Asiana!

We did not know about this airline before. Everything, from staff to service, food, inflight entertainment and seats, was impressive and made our trip one to remember. I have absolute no problem to recommend this airline. We will fly with them again.

My girlfriend and I took the 12:20am redeye flight from LAX to ICN, but our actual destination was KIX (Osaka) so - take my word for it - flying 5 hours from IAD to LAX, 13 hours to Korea, and another 1.5 hours to Japan made for a TORTUROUS time.  I did not sleep a wink on the flight to ICN, as I was in an aisle seat and I'm a light sleeper (bad combination).  Since I flew Asiana there and back, I'll summarize pros and cons:
Pros:
-Economy seats are decent size (I'm 5'11'' with long legs)
-Frequent meals, drinks, and snacks
-Friendly, attentive, AND attractive flight attendants
-In-flight entertainment saved the trip, as I watched movies back-to-back-to-back
Cons:
-Perpetually long line to use the restroom (LAX to ICN routes)
-Frequent interruptions/announcements in Korean started to wear on my nerves, as I ATTEMPTED to sleep
-Seats do not recline much and - when they do recline - it ends up encroaching in your space
-Food was NOT as good as some reviewers indicated. I've eaten REAL Korean food and REAL Japanese food.  The in-flight meal bordered on edible and decent.
Summary: If you can afford Business or First, do it.  Your legs, arms, back, and butt will thank you.
Great service and attentive, well trained and well-meaning attendants.  Always a positive experience.  The crew on Asiana flights always take the time to make you feel welcome.

I can never forget the Korean meal provided on flight, it's the best flight meal I've had. KBBQ served together with several kinds of vegetables, and some side dishes. The seat is also comfortable. The screen is a bit small and has low resolution.

This was my first time traveling with this airlines, always flew Korean Air for some reason, the seats were comfortable, the food was very good but what impressed me the most was the professionalism and friendliness of the flight attendants, they were amazing, they were anticipating every passenger's next move, so you didn't have to worry about anything at all. They had pens for your immigration forms, they helped so much and so efficiently, Korean Air has the slogan ""excellence in flight"" but after flying with Asiana, I think this is just common for Korean carriers. It was a great flight.

Great food - check.  Comfortable business class seats - check.  Nice lounge - check.  Outstanding professional service - check.  

This was the most enjoyable flight I've ever had.  It was my first time traveling to Asia, the flight was more than 12 hours, and I wanted to make sure I was comfortable.  Their business smartium seats made a world of difference.  Being able to lie down on such a long flight made traveling this distance a piece of cake.  The movie choices were surprisingly good and I got to see movies that were on my bucket list. 

The flight attendants were impeccable in their manners.  The food actually tasted great!  That's a first for me.  The LAX and Seoul business class lounges are well appointed and offer decent food and coffee.  They also provide rooms for showering.  I preferred the LAX lounge over the Seoul one as the latter was much more crowded when I was there.

I hope I can fly with Asiana again soon!

Friendly, helpful and efficient service in clean and comfortable aircraft. Had a lengthy stopover at Incheon Airport, Seoul, Korea which is an excellent airport with great amenities. I would recommend this airline without hesitation!

Flew as a couple - a very expensive flight but the business class was worth it for the 14 hours journey.
Service is very good and even though no status holder with the airline alliance the service is fine and personalized.
Seats are very conformable and the 2 inner seat give a feeling of having your own cabin... (seat 14 E &F)
The return flight was a bit more hectic as they were a lot of kids and these don't like to sleep obviously  
No wifi though

The staff were very warm and friendly, very accommodating.
Evident that they try their best to answer to our every request.
The looked snappy and neat in their uniforms and appear to be always composed.

Loved their food, couldn't even remember a time when I was not NOT eating or drinking.
Their steaks were very tender and juicy and their veggies were cooked just right.

In-flight entertainment is superb! From music to movies, these were accurately categorized and indexed for better navigation.

Extra service was that they let us stay in a hotel near the airport for our 10-hr layover in Incheon - complete with a private room, a hot shower, and sumptuous lunch - all for Free!  Got the chance to explore the neighborhood while waiting for the van to pick us up and take us back to the airport.

Loved my experience with Asiana - would love to fly with them again. :)

This was our first Asiana Airlines (AA) flights. We traveled often with the Korean Airlines (KAL), and were nervous about AA services.  AA offered excellent price for our travel destination, hence we purchased tickets.  AA has definitely a horrible website, which does not seem to respond to any simple passenger requests (seat selections, looking up reservations as a guest, managing your reservations etc). Luckily the AA in flight service and quality was as good as the KAL. Food was decent and flight attendants were courteous and professional. We had no good entertainment menu from Manila to Seattle flight. It is a long flight. We slept, so this was no big deal. However one issue bothered all of us during our transit at the beautiful Incheon International Airport.

Security Staff for Transit Passengers are miserable! The female staff working there have no English or have very poor English, and they are extremely demanding and forceful ( mostly pushing),  and if you do not understand their poor English with Korean accents, some are Extremely Rude- Shame on them! Such a nice airport, such ridiculous service! After all this is the International Airport.  South Korea's population is estimated to be over 50 million (2015), can't the hire people speaks in decent English and a little bit polite. Shame on them!

Following Aeroflot cancelling my flight at the last minute, I was transferred onto a Asiana flight. What lovely helpful people both at the airport and on the flight. They knew I had a 10 hour wait between flights and arranged food or me both at the airport and on the plane. Highly recommend could not fault at all

I flew ICN-VIE today, changing in LHR ... the itenerary gave me just an hour layover in LHR (which is the absolute minimum according to their own rule). The flight was great, but there was traffic in both ICN and LHR, so i missed my connection to Vienna. What i really liked was, I was met by a British guy with my name on a sign right at the door exiting the plane who told me I won't make the flight anymore, but he will help me get a hotel and rebook. I asked if this would also happen if I flew economy and he said Asiana does that for every customer. I think this is wonderful!

I flew to Manila from LAX via Incheon and the total experience has always been great. I love that the choice of food is either Korean or Western. Sometimes I feel like one or the other. The flight attendants are always helpful and kind. The entertainment console is excellent as I watched over 3 movies during my 12 hour flight.
Overall good airline, food is good (for airplane food), good price on a ticket. I just seem to always get the 5 hour or more layover.
Korean company, using 737 for this route. staff very polite and helpfull. only one alternative for food selection.

Great experience flying Business Class Asiana. Very kind and polite staff, accommodating to every request. Food options a bit limited for people with certain allergies, but they helped me the best they could. Disappointed that the amenity kit was only from BKK back to LA, but bathroom stocked with ample amenities.

The seats were comfortable, the food was plentiful but the American movie had poor quality so was not able to watch it.  But the information screen kept us updated on where we were, how fast we were going, how cold it was outside, etc.

Got a very cheap flight ticket with Asiana. Nevertheless when we arrived early at the airport they instantly booked us on an earlier flight free of charge and with unmatched friendlieness.
When this flight was delayed 10min they advised passangers 30min ahead of the possible delay and offered free dinks and sandwiches for all passangers free of charge at the gate.
The gatepurser walked up to all passangers around the gate to apologise in person for the possible delay and the staff apologized again at boarding the aircraft.
Plane was very new and perfectly clean. Lot of legroom and comfortable. 
Inflight food an drink with flighttime not more than 35min!!!
Bit of delay was fully compensated by the crew and the groundstaff at PUS and FUK.
Example of East Asian perfection and friendlyness. Exeptional performance as never seen before with any other airline.

I've flown Asian Airlines a total of 6 times. It's safe to say I trust them and will continue to use them!
Their in-flight entertainment is always great with a wide selection of new releases, old favourites, and worldwide movies.
The seats are comfortable and as spacious as economy can get. Economy in general is not very great, but I've never been too uncomfortable, even when seated in between 2 strangers for 10 hours. 
The food is always a pleasant surprise. They usually always have a western or Korean option to choose from and I've tried most of them in my time and ave loved them all! Even the little snack they bring around are great. 
The service is always nice, the flight attendants always welcoming, polite, and cheerful. There are times I've had to wait for food or a drink but they never forget me
Asiana has always been on time, which is very important to me, being on a 10 hour flight. 
I am grateful for their great service and adding unexpected good memories to my holidays!

This was a short flight from Osaka to Seoul and took about 1 hour and 45 minutes. The departure was on time and the attendants were very efficient helping the passengers to put up their purchases into the overhead compartments. Many hands make light work! 

I managed to watch an entire movie through the flight and the movie was not interrupted and closed upon landing, which sort of normally happen with other airlines. So, that was a plus!

While the meal was nothing to trumpet about, it was well prepared and I had ample coffee (and tea) throughout the service period. First time flying with Asiana and will certainly do so again.

Great Korean hospitality on board.  Staff are respectful, non-intrusive and cordial. You feel pampered at all times. Good selection of meals, western and Asian, great variety of wines. The seats are not as reclining as other airlines in this class, but I had never flown a A321 before and one cannot complain for a short 4-5 hours flight.  The only drawback is the flight schedule that get you to your Palau hotel at 4.30am - classic red-eye flights and you spend the first day recovering. But Palau is worth the trouble!

flew from Bangkok to phuket Thailand, this 'budget' airline out performed
tickets were reasonable, every thing was on time, stewardesses were friendly
and beautiful

Topnotch from check-in to landing. Airport staff and flight attendance were extremely considerate, organized and very attentive. In-flight food and drink service excellent as well. Our flight was late leaving due to a late connecting flight from another airport.
The crew were very nice and smiling all the time. The food was great and healthy. The seats were comfortable enough to expect an airline seat. They were on time.

Have been using Asiana Airlines coming from Seattle to Manila and have used the free option to change our going home date.  This time over the rules seem to have change and the airline seems to only have very specific dates and times you can change over too.  We were trying for any date during the last week in March only to be told the only option we had is the 2nd of April.  The agent stated it was the CLASS of Ticket we purchased.  Which is the same class we have always used so this made no sense.  I checked online and found I could purchase a ticket on any of the flights during our requested week.  Takes to the agent agin and found out we could possibly pay $400 pr/per and maybe get the flight we wanted.  We are now scheduled for the March 2nd and may reconsider ever using Asiana again.  We came over due to Moms health and hospital stay so money got tight.

Exceptional value for money compared to other airlines on this route but great service throughout.  The Cabin crew could not have been more helpful and attentive. The food was very good, the in flight entertainment was varied enough for most interests and the chair was very comfortable.  I would have no hesitation recommending Asiana to friends and colleagues.

the best experience of my life!! amazing food, amazing people. this is one of my top 1 airlines . than you!! The flight was delay so they pay to change my connecting flight in LA .  the service was amazing. no doubt ill travel in this airline when im in Asia,.

On a trip from Brisbane to Vancouver and back, booked through an on-line site; L4L.  Fare was around twice premium economy - all flights worked.  Airlines included Singapore, Thai, Air Canada and Asian Airlines.  Singapore and Thai were, as expected very good.  Air Canada was one standard below- food average, separate pods, tv had faults, cabin crew tried hard but lacked the service mentality of the Asian Airlines.  Asiana Air was a class above Singapore and Thai for service, comfort, food, friendly cabin crew - everything was perfect.

When you also in economy want to have an upgraded experience, then Asiana Airlines is a valuable option. Very comfortable seating, personal intern entertainment program, which in many other airlines, is only at business class. Our 3 hours flight swiftly passed away and we received a meal with 3 different choice options and for what you can expect from an airplane meal, of excellent quality. Crew was very gentle and helpful and I was really positively surprised to see the Captain doing his inspection round in the plane, a custom, which I thought, already belonged to the ""good old days"" !

This flight while long was comfortable and the food was pretty good but not great as one would imagine in coach these days. I have flown other airlines to the Asian sector, and would say Singapore airlines and Cathay are a step above.. i chose this airline mostly on price as they were hundreds $$ less for similar time flying.

For a 2 hour flight from Seoul, Korea to Narita, Japan I did not expect too many frills, but to not even have any form of seat entertainment (even in Business Class) was rather surprising.  The plane was an Airbus A320.  Bring a book or headphones to listen to your iPad/iPhone or other source of entertainment.  Overall, Asiana was acceptable and I would fly them again.

This is my first International flight to Hong Kong.  The service on this airline is exceptional throughout the entire flight.  The food was delicious and they offered free in-flight entertainment with unlimited movies.  I was also thrilled to ride on the A380 - this plane is HUGE and it was a thrill to be able to fly in this double-decker plane.  I have never heard of Asiana before, but I would not hesitate to fly them again.

Going there was a lot of room, nearly everyone had a row of 3 seats for themselves.  The food was amazing and simply the best Ive ever had on an airline.  Also, dozens of current movies available on demand...a great flight.

Coming back there were only 2 empty seats...movie selection still great...but had no choice for either meal...and those two meals sucked!  Fruit was old, salads wilted...and beef porage?  Really?  Each time was told, sorry sir we are out of everything except ""xyz""..is that OK?   NO!

Staff were always friendly.

Only other complaint is why does the pilot even try to speak in English?  Heard the pilot or co pilot probably 1/2 dozen times each flight...never understood even one word.

12 hr lay over in Korea on return flight always ask for the free tour or hotel and food...Asiana does a great job providing this.

Seats were comfy and good amount of leg room as we are both tall. Two seats together so good not to be stuck in the middle of a three seat figuration. Food was ok, but I don't have expectations these days when flying to have a decent feed anyway. Entertainment. Eg movies etc was nothing new or exciting. Service good.

Asiana is just the best airline that I've flown. I traveled with my family from Bangkok to New York City with connecting OZ222 at Inchoen International Airport. When we arrived ICN we went to the lounge which provided us a very warmed welcome after a whole night out of our home. The WiFi in the lounge was very fast, nice bathroom to shower, various kind of drinks, food is average since we didn't have much appetite. When it came to the boarding time, we queued in a separate line as we flew business class. The Asiana staffs were very careful on checking U.S. Visa for all passengers, especially passengers who connected the flight. Even our family member is American and showed them U.S. Passport , they still ask him for his U.S. Visa.(unexpected, but it's fine hahaha) They boarded us following the class of service, unfortunately we noticed that there were other passengers from different class came in at the same time which block our stair case since our seats are on upper deck. The seats on business class of Asian A380 are total flatbed with safety belt like belt in the car. I love it. The minus point is the cabinet for window seat is very difficult to open. The inflight entertainment was great. There were many movies, songs, TV series and even the information of the destination available. Blankets were provided. The best that I have to mention was the food. Passengers could choose either western, asian or Korean menu as they like. There was also alternative choices to choose such as ramen, I tried it and found out that it taste wonderful with a big portion. The flight attendants were very cautious. They came by quite often just to see whether anyone needs assistant. In the front of upper deck stands the private lounge for both first class and business class passengers to relax and it has separate lavatory available. Flight attendants keep lavatory clean. The toiletry in lavatory was great, many items are available such as toothbrush set,comb, hand gel, moisturiser and eu de toilet. I love it. We were welcome with Champaign and hot towel. Once flight attendants served meal, they served them in a proper way  like in the restaurant. This is a perfect way to dine. When we arrived at JFK, our suitcases came out very quick. I certainly would like to recommend Asiana Airline to everyone.

This was a great flight, although long.  Fly Business class and definitely recommend
 on such a long flight. The service was great.  I won't use an American carrier again unless I have to.  International carriers are so much better, and I am a multi-million mile flyer on an American carrier.

Attentive staff, comfortable seat and bed. We sat in the middle row with 2 adjoining seats that face slightly inward. For single travelers most of the middle row seat face slightly outward for more privacy. The plane cabin was noticeably quieter than others I have flown which was a large plus for an 11 hr flight. The food was better than expected - great Norwegian gravlax appetizer. It was my first time flying Asiana - nice experience.

I travelled on Asiana Airlines with some friends in September 2015 on our holiday to Japan. They operate a great service, all four flights we used (Heathrow to Incheon, Incheon to Tokyo, Osaka to Incheon, Incheon to Heathrow) were on time, really nice food on them all, the entertainment system was good on them all but the first leg of our trip. The only problem I had was all the flights were so hot, we were sweating so much!

The staff on board were great too. Nothing was too much trouble, even when the lights were off at night. 

Good value too, we paid around £600 for all our flights.

The service on this airline is extremely good! I was constantly offered water and juice - I loved the food, and the entertainment was good, if a little old. For the price i paid, i got a stopover in Seoul included. I would fly Asiana over Etihad any day - just for the service in the cabin.

Imagine this - you are sitting in business class for the first time in your life having spent thousands of dollars on a ticket expecting top class service. The menu displays two types of meals, Korean or Western.  I decide on the Western. After take-off and once service begins a cabin crew apologizes that with regard to the Western menu - they have no appetizers on board.  Ok - the aircraft has just taken off and you don't have a complete menu as in the brochure. I can accept that. When it comes to the end of the meal I spy on the serving tray either fresh fruit or a cheese plate as the choices available.  I'm served last and see one cheese plate remaining. Good!  I'll have that. I ask for the cheese plate and the lady says ""It's not free"".  I think she meant ""it's not available""  Oh okay!  Did I want the fresh fruit?  No thanks, I'll go without. Would have liked that last cheese plate on your tray but if I can't have it I won't argue.  Ten minutes later she returns with the cheese plate and says ""The captain doesn't want it!!!!""   What ?  I was shocked that paid employees of the airline, no matter what their rank, are treated with more deference than the people who pay their salaries.  And this is business class.  Obviously customer service is not highly regarded with this airline.   I could go on further about their lousy business class lounge at Incheon airport where the best of the cuisine is hot 2 minute noodles - but I want.   The only advantage of this business class ticket which took me through to Istanbul and returned from Frankfurt is that you get to check in a bit quicker.  Immigration lines still what they are for economy class.  And as for the seat well I can't really criticise the airline for that.  I can't sleep in my own bed at home so how could I possibly sleep better laying and a flat bed on an aircraft?  Business class NOT worth it.  Just an exclusive perk for travelling executives.

quite a pleasant flight - food was OK, nothing to write home about, but not bad. The reclining seat is somewhat short for someone 6'4"", but that tends to be the norm. Be careful where you put your iphone/ipad. Mine had an argument with the motors in the chair and lost - big time. Flight was pleasant and on time, service was great.

I have flown many Airlines and this was the BEST! I boarded; my seat in Economy was HUGE and totally reclined and for a 12+ hour trip this was heaven.I was brought slippers,blanket and a pillow. Then wonderful Japanese food and sake~everything was gratis.I could watch anything I wanted on the programming and could start and stop it at my convenience.I can not recommend this airline enough.

Service from JFK Airport in New York to Seoul's Incheon Airport is made on the new A380-800, a fantastic airliner. Asiana provides very good service, staff well trained and polite, as in most of the asian airlines. One of the best features of this plane is the level of noise, extremely lower than in all other big aircrafts. The new Business Smartium Class layout is very comfortable, as all seats have direct access to the aisle. Excellent flight experience in one of the best companies.

Really nice experience, great food and service. I felt like I had a little more leg room on Asiana than on Cathay Pacific, which is my preferred airline to fly to Asia. Entertainment package and TV screen were great for economy class. An outlet to charge laptops on all seats was a surprising touch. Would definitely consider to fly with them again.

I flew from JFK to HKG via ICN on a very modern Airbus A380 on the first leg and Boeing 777-200 on the second leg. Definitely like A380 more and more, I flew them with the Emirates, too;)

I fly Asiana Airline every time i visit Philippines, and I have always enjoyed my long layover in Seoul, because I have a choice to take a day city tour or to take a rest in the hotel for free provided by Asiana airline.  The service is excellent

This is the most unprofessional and worst overall airline I have ever flown in over 30 years of being on this earth.  My family and I have traveled the US and globe on multiple different carriers.  Asiana takes the cake at being the worst for the following issue:  

They lost my luggage on my way to SE Asian country.  The luggage ended up in China.....and was there for 3 weeks.  Mind you I was back in the US after 12 days, so another 9 days my luggage stayed lost.  The customer service reps did not want to compensate me for my lost luggage or cover my extra laundry bills because I had only one small duffel bag of clothes that was continually washed in order to keep clothes on my back.  Their customer service was entirely lackluster and lost themselves in what to do about the issue.  The LAX manager used emotional bullying tactics in an attempt not to cover my laundry bills and share ""how much he cared"".  I don't buy anything their customer service or this airlines says and will be sharing this horror story with as many of my friend, business contacts and colleagues as possible. I am still in process of them sending me my reimbursement and this event started over 6 weeks ago.  Totally unsatisfactory.

Asiana is my favorite airline.  They have the best frequent flyer program.  Being a Diamond Plus member, I use them often and get a lot of benefits for being a loyal customer (Priority boarding and luggage retrieval, lounge access, bonus miles, etc...)  As usual, the service was great on this flight!  I highly recommend Asiana Airlines.

From start to finish on our long flight was brilliant.  the cabin crew where very friendly and helpful.  the leg room was very spacious, entertainment was great and had lots to choose from inc. games, films and music.  i don't usually like plane food but this was very nice and there was a choice to.  I would defiantly fly with Asiana again, made the long journey enjoyable.
